Reviews.Title: “Too many kids and dirty room”
Reviews.Author: mikesanfrancisco61
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at Honua Kai since it opened, several times a year. The condos are, without a doubt, far superior to many other condos on Maui, but there are issues. Over the years there are more and more families with lots of kids. The pools are packed with screaming kids and parents that let the kids continue to scream. Honua Kai needs to designate one pool for adults, just like many other hotels in Hawaii have done. The hotel is loosing people that are truly looking for a vacation without kids. Why do you have to take your kids with you everywhere? When paying high nightly rates I don't want kids screaming at every pool. The unit I had was not cleaned properly. Beer bottles and cigarettes on the lanai, dirty tub, shower, and sinks, grease on the kitchen cabinets, razor container in the shower, dirty utensils and plates, the dishwasher had a very smell and never clearn dishes properly, and still there was more. The hotel did correct the problem to my satisfaction, but the issue should never had been there upon checkin. Don't know if the hotel is under new management but conditions have continued to declined. The kid issue needs to be resolved. Aslo, the hotel has not finished the spa and there are two ugly digs which many units view. This has been this way for five years. Good luck Honua Kai.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: Jenny C
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room 402 in the Hokulani building which is a 3 bedroom, 3 bath. It was gorgeous. From the beautiful bathrooms, to the fully stocked high-end kitchen, to the absolutely stunning view from the lanai, it was perfect. All staff that we encountered went out of their way to say hello and offer help in any way they could. Duke's food was pretty good but their drinks were not great. I'd recommend buying booze and juice from costco and making your own cocktails. I had read other reviews mentioning a smell from the water treatment plant. While we could definitely smell it from the road, we never smelled it in our unit or on the lanai. The market, while pricey, had many specialty items to choose from. One of our group has Celiac Disease and this market offered her many gluten-free options. Definitely try the gelato. It was one of the highlights of our trip!! My only complaint about the whole trip was the weather. It rained and was extremely windy almost all of the 7 days we were there. I'm not sure if this is normal for this part of the island but it is something to consider. We still managed to have a great time and can't say enough good things about the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Honua Kai”
Reviews.Author: SouthAnchorage
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed here for 12 days and really enjoyed our time. We loved the size of our 2 bdrm condo. Great view of the ocean from the ninth floor. The pools were a lot of fun. We rented through Kaanapali beach rentals, and they were great to deal with. We ate a Duke's 3-4 times and enjoyed the selection of fish there. Four of us completed the padi certification course with Kevin Maratea during our stay. He is a great instructor, we did the skills in the pool and the open instruction in the ocean in front of the Honua Kai. Great reef. Great entry into the ocean about 50 yards south of the resort - much less rocky.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing is too much trouble”
Reviews.Author: simone5252
Reviews.Content: My husband and i came to Honua Kai for our 25th Wedding anniversary. we found the staff to be very friendly and nothing was too much trouble. The concierge was fantastic thanks to Laurel we did some fantastic day trips. The hotel itself we found to be of a great standard. The rooms where cleaned well everyday. I was a little worried after reading some unhappy reviews in regards to bad cleanliness. This however was not the case for us. I would like to thank all the staff for their fantastic service. I definitely will return someday

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL RESORT! Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Rachel B
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Honua Kai with my family this past week. This hotel is by far the most beautiful resort I have ever stayed in! We rented a three bedroom ocean front suite. It had the most beautiful view, and each room had an equally comparable view. The resort itself is beautiful. It is located right on the beach, but has enough pools to entertain you for weeks! Duke's (the restaurant on the resort) is great for drinks, but wouldn't recommend it for food unless you're willing to spend a lot. We found that one of our favorite restaurants was the Aloha Mixed Plate, (down the road on Front St.) which despite its appearance from the front, has a beautiful view and great food! This resort is well worth the money. The staff is kind, helpful and incredibly accommodating. The market inside the resort is great, but definitely pricey! The only issue we had with the resort was that there was A LOT of little kids. It's a great place for family, but if you're looking for quaint adult pools with no kids, I wouldn't recommend this. However, the beach was fairly quiet and there is plenty of room to distance yourself and relax. Overall, I would absolutely recommend this place to ANYONE traveling to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Two Years in a Row”
Reviews.Author: jondska
Reviews.Content: We first visited Honua Kai in 2011 and loved it so much we had to go back again this year. We rented through the resort so it does get expensive, but we had a fantastic 7th floor, 2 bedroom condo with an incredible view of Molokai and Lanai. We spent a lot of time on the expansive lanai watching whales spouting and breaching continuously and enjoying the beauty of this area. I especially enjoyed watching the sun illuminating the islands while having coffee. What a great way to start the day. The rooms and the grounds are beautiful and it is nice Having Duke's restaurant in front with the view of the beach while you are dining. The pools and beach are also amazing. We enjoyed grilling on the Viking grills and dining on the lanai. There are lots of small children running around but not so much that it detracts from the experience. My kids, ages 18 and 23 didn't seem to mind at all. The wind is a factor here but you can get away from it if you want by moving to a more protected beach down the line. We all agree that it is the nicest place we have ever vacationed and would recommend it to anyone wanting a memorable Hawaiian vacation. The only negative is having to leave...

Reviews.Title: “2 WEEKS TOO MUCH”
Reviews.Author: Cucu28
Reviews.Content: Honeymoon here was Ok. We honestly expected a lot more for what we paid for this place. Let me start by saying this place is new but everything is dirty when you look close ( seems to be the Hawaiian way) THE GOOD 1- full kitchen 2- washer & dryer 3- beautiful pool area 4- BBQ area 5-very friendly staff THE BAD 1- the front of the resort smelled like sewer for 14 days 2- THE Beach is small , eroded , full of rocks & windy 3- The entire resort anywhere you go is like a wind tunnel, blasting winds and draft felt everywhere 4- Our partial ocean view was so at from ocean all you heard was the roar of cars, motorcycles, sirens all night we could not enjoy a peaceful night. 5-The pool although is nice and all is freezing and for that reason no one was using it. 6-The BBQ area- 3 out of 4 grills did not turn on or heat up, the one that worked took about 45 min to heat up and was filthy 7-HOUSEKEEPING CLEANED THE ROOM WITH DIRTY RAGS & DIRTY MOPS LEFT DIRT STREAKS ALL OVER BATHROOM THAT YOU CAN ACTUALLY SEE WITH YOUR NAKED EYE ( so we didn't have them clean often since all they did was push the dirt around) 8-LOCATION IS FAR FAR FAR FROM ANYTHING RELATED TO MAUI AND WILL TAKE YOU MINIMAL 30-45 MIN TO GET ANYWHERE 9- BED WAS VERY UNCOMFORTABLE AND SHEETS DID NOT FIT BED. 10- no room service after 9PM ( nothing even on weekends) OVERALL I WOULD NOT VISIT MAUI OR STAY AT THIS RESORT OR REFER ANYONE HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Best place in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: hunted466
Reviews.Content: I took my folks to Maui for thir 50th anniversary. We were booked next door and had the fortunate experience of being moved to Honua Kai. Upon arrival the staff was incredible. After a long day of travel and being told we had no rooms in our original hotel we were treated like royaty here. We were given 2-2 bedroom suites (1100 sq ft and 300 sq ft lanai) overlooking the pool and ocean with a great view of Molokai. Whale watching from the huge lanai was amazing! Full kitchen with top-grade stainless Bosch appliances, in-room washer/dryer, 3 plasma screen TVs, indoor dining table and another on the lanai. The folding sliding doors to the lanai really are fantastic to let the ocean air in the entire room. All cleaning supplies were in a very nice hand weaved storage box that we were told was ours to take home. The beds were like sleeping on clouds. Duke's is great. Outstanding food and drinks. A little spendy but you're at a 5 star resort on Maui so what do you expect? The place is a true gem. We loved it so much that we are going back again with several couples in Sept and have the room 3 floors below our previous. Don't even hesitate. If you want the best, you just found it!

Reviews.Title: “Our return visit”
Reviews.Author: smuie
Reviews.Content: We loved it so much last year that we returned again this year. We rented a 2 bedroom from vrbo. The owners were great. I do think that the Honua Kai is the best on Kaanapali. It is a fantastic place. It was windy two of the days we were there but there isn't anything anyone can do about that. We've stayed at the Ritz in Kapalua and almost gotten blown away as well. My only compliant this year is that the big pool was freezing cold. To their defense, it had rained the whole week before and it was windy so maybe that was a contributing factor. I called the desk to ask them to heat it -- the next day it was tolerable, but it still needed some of the chill taken off. Can't say enough good things about this place -- watched whales from the lanai everyday. Our owners provided beach chairs, sand toys, boogie boards so not having beach service just wasn't really an issue for us. Our unit was close to the pool and beach and we didn't mind carrying their great Tommy Bahama beach chairs down. I hope to return again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Best in 65”
Reviews.Author: TennessseeReese
Reviews.Content: Greatest place we have ever stayed, if only the streets were gold, we would have thought that we were in Heavan. Everyone from staff and neighbors were like family. It doesn't get any better than this. We will return.............!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel...can't wait to go again next year!”
Reviews.Author: natmac16
Reviews.Content: We just came back from 12 wonderful days at the Honua Kai. My husband, myself and 6yr old daughter went and had a wonderful time. We stayed in a one bedroom in the Konea building and had a partial ocean view. We rented our room through www.kaanapalibeachrentals.com, great service and great rates. Main office was across the street and very easy to get keys (we arrived after hours). I was aware before that we would not have daily maid service, which was fine with us. The bed is comfy and my daughter loved the pull out sofa. The in-suite laundry was a bonus! Ample towels and beach towels, lots of pool toys in the closet. Great pools and loads of beach chairs. The beach itself has great waves but lots of coral, water shoes is suggested. Duke's Beach Bar is really good....try the Duke's lemonade - Yum! There is a gym in both the Konea & Hukalani buildings but not really air conditioned! The Aina Market (very expensive) is located in the hukalani building where you can get specialty coffees, ice cream, basic supplies in a pinch -EXPENSIVE- go across the street to Times Market. Also, you have to try Paradisio Pizza...so good. Dec-May is whale season - so awesome to see these animals! Our next trip back we will be doing a helicopter tour! Excellent price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, just wow.”
Reviews.Author: mforr002
Reviews.Content: I was blown away by the enormous rooms, full kitchen, washer-dryers, lavish bath, and giant lanai. I could live there. Everything from the grounds to the service were impeccable. It was conveniently across the street from a supermarket, making shopping easy. Many folks took advantage of this and the resort grills to have a cook-out by the pool. The on-site restaurant, Duke's, was delicious and pretty reasonably priced -- we ate at least one breakfast, lunch, and dinner there. Duke's looks out over the beach for a great atmosphere -- just make a reservation during peak hours or expect an hour wait. The gourmet shop, Aina, was also great for sandwiches and coffee and various Hawaiian sundries (convenient, but pricey). I will recommend this resort to anyone I know going to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Wedding”
Reviews.Author: Ramona K
Reviews.Content: We came to Maui to get married and were recommended this place by a colleague at my work. We rented a one bedroom condo and I have to say it is beautiful! Very happy with our condo. I read some reviews by others about the lack of cleaning service, but we have not had that experience during our stay here. The sheets on our bed were even changed twice the first week and we always have enough supplies (laundry soap, dishwasher soapy, etc). We are at the beginning of our second week here. The kitchen is very well stocked and the condo is very spacious. If you have small kids this is a great place for families. My son is 13.5 and there were very few kids his age, which was too bad. I wish I had taken him here when he was younger. It's a fantastic place for little kids with the waterfall pool and water slide. The only complaint we have is not related to the resort at all - the wind. It is very windy on this side of Maui as others have mentioned in previous reviews. We were told that this is normal for this area. For that reason I wouldn't come back to this part of Maui. It is simply too windy - you feel like you are going to literally blow away at times. It's ridiculously windy and you couldn't enjoy the pool or beach area nearly as much because of it. If it weren't for the wind we would definitely come back here though. Thankfully we could use our lanai quite a bit since we were sheltered by cement walls on our lanai - ours was more towards the building while the ones beside us on the right stuck out more and had no cement walls on either side of the ends of the lanai. We've had a couple of breakfasts out there and a couple of dinners. I've been able to sun out there as well because the morning sun was always there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, Poor Location”
Reviews.Author: mrandmrsp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HK from March 1 to 8. We had a 2 bedroom suite facing the garden / ocean in the Konea tower. We rented privatly through an owner on VRBO. Check in / out was very simple and the private rental was no concern. Positives: - Suites have EVERYTHING you would need and more on a 1-2 week vacation - Plenty of space in the suite and on the grounds (multiple pools, BBQ's, Beach space etc). - Patios are large - Everything is brand new(ish) in the suite and on the grounds - Family environment Negatives - Distance to 'the action' of Whalers Village / Kaanapali (35 minute walk / 5 minute drive) - Cost to park ($10 day), Cost of Resort fee ($25 day) - WIND (was windy 3 of the 7 days) - Coral in shallow water (diffucult to snorkel, enter water) - Family environment (can be both good and bad) We've read many reviews about the wind at the resort but didnt quite buy into the idea until our second day, thinking the reviews must have been due to the time of year. The wind however, was nearly unbearable for 3 days. Near Blackrock by Whalers Village, the wind was minimal. Next trip to Maui, we'll return to the Whalers Village area of Maui. Honua Kai is simply too far away from the nice boardwalk, restaraunts / bars and wonderful beach that all lie in/around Whalers Village.

Reviews.Title: “Honua Kai, Lahaina, Maui, Unit 450 three bedroom ocean front”
Reviews.Author: CindySueOhio
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to Maui many times now. When my best friend asked about a trip to Hawaii, I knew just where our group should stay, Honua Kai. After a little research on Tripadvisor.com and vrbo.com â€“ we found that Evelyn and Anthony have wonderful ratings and lovely accommodations. There were seven of us in our group and the accommodations worked perfectly. There are three bedrooms, three bathrooms and a wonderful queen sleeper. Two of the rooms are en suite. There is plenty of closet space. Our vacationer who slept on the queen sleeper used one of the master bedroom closets, conveniently located right inside that suite. Evelyn and Anthony have filled this condo with so much care that you feel it. The kitchen had everything we required, there is a lovely theatre couch that we fought over and plenty of space for seven happy campers to make themselves comfortable. The lanai was a favorite spot. We found ourselves congregating there every morning and evening to watch the whales and to discuss our day. Dukes is located right at the Honua Kai and made it convenient for eating. They also serve meals around the pool and we took advantage of that as well. Hula Pie - enough said. For our merry group it was great convenience to go up to the condo and fix drinks and take them back out to the pool, so we were very appreciative of the blender. During our planning stage, Evelyn and Anthony were very receptive to any inquiries we had about the condo, parking, arrangements for activities or any questions we came up with. They were wonderfully helpful. A couple of our favorites: the master bathroomâ€¦.. it is so soothing, the splendid art work throughout the condo, the wonderful big kitchen and that huge lanai where we practically lived and the number code entry that made it great for our big group to come in and out easily. Evelyn and Anthony also provided mid-week towel replacement and a general clean up of the condoâ€¦.. nice! We know that when we return to Hawaii, and our group is ready now, lol, that we will be in touch with Evelyn and Anthony to share their piece of Paradise in Paradise. Thank you! The above would be our review to vrbo - we have nothing but good to say about our accomodations and this resort - it was simply lovely. While in Maui we also took a whale watching tour with Safari, highly recommend them - it was everything our last whale watching trip wasn't - meaning we saw a pod of whales and got some lovely pictures. We also went to the Old Lahaini Luai, sitting in the chairs not the ground area, and found that to be fantastic - we highly recommend it. We stood in line and ate at the Gazebo, a great experience, the pancakes are fantastic and they even provided a rainbow! My husband and I drove upcountry and found Hula Lodge - what wonderful plantings and views - we will check that out more on our next visit. There is so much more, I need to do a proper trip report. Safe travel to you all!

Reviews.Title: “Great place-But beware of the wind”
Reviews.Author: MrBodeen
Reviews.Content: I have stayed on Maui during the 1st week of March now for 16 years in a row. I'm used to staying in Kaanapali but the crowds were forcing me to look elsewhere. We chose to go a liitle farther north this year to Honokowai and stay at the Honua Kai. We found this property to be very spacious, and less crowded than the hotels along Kaanapali Beach. The staff was more than friendly. Everyone goes out of their way to say hi, and offer a hand when needed. The rooms are immaculate, and the maid service is prompt. We got a one bedroom ocean view room and I have to say that I was a little disappointed in the view. The view of the ocean was very partial to say the least. You have to stand on one side of the lanai to see any bit of water. Building could have been constructed a little better to offer more of a view than the adjacent building. Aina market in the hotel is a great ammenity as is the fact that the Times Market is directly across the street if you are in need of groceries. Dukes Restaurant on location has great food and the bartenders are super. The only drawbacks are the fact the if you are looking for a honeymoon type of resort, this is not it. Kids are everywhere. It is more of a family style condo than a romantic retreat. Remember this also. This is a very windy property. I had a lounge chair blow across the lawn and hit me. It is usually always raining in the West Maui Mountains and the rain very often blows across the property. This does not happen in the hotels at Kaanapali as much as it does in Honokowai. We had 30 mph winds at the Honua Kai and walked down closer to Black Rock and had no wind at all. The beach in front of the hotel has a reef in front of it. Very rough waves and not as gentle as the beach at Kaanapali. Overall I like the Honua Kai but have to say that I may be returning to Kaanapali next year just for the mere fact that the weather is nicer and the surf is much calmer.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for family”
Reviews.Author: tuckiesaskatoon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in February with our 2 sons aged 11 and 7. The resort itself is beautiful. It is very well maintained and the staff are incredibly helpful and friendly. Our room was a one bedroom plus den partial ocean view. The room had everything we need including a kitchen 3 beds and a huge lanai which was perfect for eating breakfast and dinner on. Our kids absolutely loved the many pools there. We rented a couple of boogie boards and sand chairs from the resort, sure beats dragging all of that stuff on a plane. The beach in front of the hotel is amazing. The sand is beautiful and there is an assortment of areas that range from reasonable size surf, to calm water where the kids can play in. There are some areas that are rocky (coral) but a lot of areas that are smooth underneath. Grab some snorkel gear and just off the shore is some impressive snorkelling. Dukes restaurant is great. The service is amazing the food is great, and it is beachside. The resort itself is a short drive from the Kaanapali beach resort area, and Whalers village. It is also a short drive to the main part of Lahaina. Across the street from the resort is a good grocery store offering everything you need including "beverages". I have read complaints about the smell of sewage in other posts, but it really wasn't a problem. Apparently the sewage plant is across the highway and down the road. I think we may have caught a wiff of it for a few minutes one afternoon, but if this is a worry to you I would ignore it as it really was not an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Love it here”
Reviews.Author: Susan Z
Reviews.Content: Love staying at the Honua Kai. We stayed for 1 week in February 2101 and wished it could have been longer. The hotel is so clean. We stayed in a one bedroom. We love having the full kitchen. We stayed on the ground floor which has it's advantages and disadvantages. We liked not waiting for an elevator but we felt that we lost privacy while sitting on the patio. We walked to the grocery store and to Snorkel Bob's. Check out Snorkel Bob's before you plan any excursions or even if you want to go to a great beach and swim and snorkel as they know everything! The pool at Honua Kai is very busy with lots of families and even more kids. It is hard to get a chair by the pool unless you are up very early as people save chairs using towel although this is apparently not allowed according to their policies. Love Dukes and we didn't have a bad meal there, from breakfast to dinner. Snorkelled right in font of the hotel and saw lots of fish and turtles. Check out Mala restaurant in Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “At Home In Paradise.”
Reviews.Author: Mashadeca
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Honua Kai for 10 days and had a wonderful time. We did stay through a private owner, so we were not charged resort fees and did not have maid service. The place is very nice. The rooms were very large and comfortable. The veiws are breathtaking! We watched whales everyday from our balcony! We were on the 8th floor and found it to be very quiet. We didn't notice any bad smell while we were there. The tradewinds, in the afternoon, made it so that we had to shut the glass doors for an hour or so. There were enough pools so that we did not feel crowded. We traveled with Grandparents and two teens, so we found that there was something for every age group. FYI...the place is not an adult only style place. If you are looking for no kids around....then you will not like Honua Kai. The beach was lovely! Yes, there is a reef right off the beach. For our family, that was wonderful!!! We found sandy spots and went in and snorkeled 25-50 feet off the beach many times. We saw lots of fish, eels and turtles in the water. We could also hear the whales while under the water. The reef was SO convenient...no driving...no boats...no fees....just get in and swim!!! If you are looking to swim only, then walk down the beach and jump in. Just south of the hotel the area gets more sandy. The only problem we had was that the air condition went out for 3 of the 10 nights. That made sleeping difficult. We were encouraged not to use the screens when it was windy, instead just leave the glass doors open. We were told that bugs would not be a problem. We did this and woke up with bugs bits. We then had to sleep with the room closed up and it got hot. Overall, We would stay at the Honua Kai again. The place is great! It was exactly what we were looking for. Oceanfront, roomy, clean, beach and reef right outside. We weren't there to party or to be on a romantic escape. We went to have a family vacation that was full of ocean/nature activities...and we got exactly want we wanted!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation on Maui!”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany W
Reviews.Content: Loved having a condo versus a hotel room. It was great having a fridge, microwave, oven, etc. However, there's not a lot of storage in the condos so keep that in mind when packing. The market was REALLY expensive, 3.50 for a USA Today paper, $8 for a smoothie! I pretty much stayed away from the market. But Duke's restaurant was great. Good food, pretty reasonable prices, great view of the ocean. The pool area was nice but the chairs aren't very comfortable. The staff that we came in contact with were all great, especially Randy, the valet guy. The other reviews are right, there are a lot of kids but that didn't really bother us. Would definitely come back to Honua Kai!

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation”
Reviews.Author: Justin v
Reviews.Content: This was a very fun place to stay. Pool and beach areas are very nice! Katie Wilson that manages the activities area was the best! She helped us with everything. My kids are still asking about her. Kevin Maratea, the dive master on site was the best too. My wife and I really enjoyed diving with him. I would recommend Honua Kai to anyone and make sure you meet Katie and Kevin. Both great people.

Reviews.Title: “2 Bedroom Great for family or 2 Couples”
Reviews.Author: Chris_Pones
Reviews.Content: We rented a 2 bedroom with partial ocean views through Harris Hawaii real estate. They gaurentee the actual room you are renting which is good. Gave us a much better price than online booking. The agent "Brooke" met us at the hotel which was nice and easy. They offer the units as more of a long term vacation rental than a hotel. The rooms are obviously brand new and the 2 bedroom unit we had was perfect for us. Great bedrooms with 42" Tv's in each. 2 huge bathrooms with double basins which is always good. Bath and Shower Seperate. Our unit was supplied with absolutely everything from Martini glasses, ice buckets, pots and pans, beach towels .. ect. Dukes restraunt and bar is perfect for the resort and fits well. The shopping centre and banks across the road also make it really easy. Its just a short drive to Lahina to do some shopping or go out for a meal. The gym in the complex is also very new with a great selection of cardio equipment. The weights section is a little on the low end with 50 pounds being the largest dumbbell and only 1 bench. Mornings were busy but not over crowded. The beach off the resort is nice however nothing amazing. The resort pools and area's are a really great design. They offer a good blend of open area's and more private area's. I think anyone could find a spot they are happy with around the pool. Only downfall is that there is not a swim up bar. They general rule is the drinks should be bought from dukes bar if you are swimming around the pool. Exception is the BBQ area's. However after buying 1 round of drinks (which is kind of annoying as you have to get out of the water and go to the bar area), we filled up plastic water bottles with drinks and ice. This was alot easy as we could just fill up while we were still in the pool and spa's. We were fairly discrete about it and nobody seemed to mind at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location in Kaanapali”
Reviews.Author: OrcasIslandDream
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in a 1 bedroom condo. The units have a well equipped kitchen which we used for every meal during our stay. I found the service at Honua Kai to be lacking, hence the four stars. When checking in the front desk didn't have a smile for us and while we were there housekeeping came so late, about 3:30, that we didn't use the service as we were back in the room preparing for the second half of the day. Finally, and this is not the fault of the resort and didn't affect the rating, if possible do not get a unit facing the front of the resort. We reserved a Mountain View, one bedroom unit. I did because it was more affordable; however, the resort is close to a busy road and there is traffic noise at all times. Although we were on the 8th floor, I still found the noise distracting and not what I am looking for when vacationing in Hawaii. If we were to return I would reserve a different room catagory and then verify at check-in that it was not facing the road.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Jyllian
Reviews.Content: A lot of families, but overall a great stay. The service around the pool was " ok". Could be better but the rooms were excellent! The view from room was great unlike what other reviewers said. We were very happy overall and would recommend. There is a grocery store right across the street for picking up necessities. Tip the room cleaning service every day and you will get what you want :-).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and facilities.”
Reviews.Author: ianbnet
Reviews.Content: Lovely location, even booked up didn't feel too full, and great restaurant. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: Cmonletzgo
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 stayed at Honua Kai for 7nights in April 2010. We had a 2bd/2ba ocean view unit on the 5th floor with 500+sqft lanai that looks out to the pool and ocean beyond. The place is only a few years old, very clean, nicely furnished with high end appliances - we felt like home, especially my gourmet chef of a husband! The pool was great and so as the multitude of hot tubs around the property. The beach right in front of the property is quite rocky once you're in the water and isn't suitable for swimming, but still a perfect beach for walks, even at night. We enjoyed our stay at Honua Kai, the staff were courteous and helpful. Dukes seemed to be always busy when we were there, so we never took advantage of it The one complain that my husband did have was that their BBQ grills (which was all over the property) were dirty and not maintained. Other than that, this place is heaven on earth and we wish we could afford to stay here every year.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Aventure - Scuba was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Bikeray
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in the Honua Kai resort with a gorgeous ocean view. We saw many whales playing but that was secondary to getting dive certified with Kevin Maretea - dive master on-site for 5-Star Scuba. Katie Wilson, the shack manager got us in a class that Kevin had just started - before we knew it - we were in the ocean doing 4 dives over 2 days! Kevin was exceptional taking plenty of time to make sure we were comfortable under the water with all the new skills he showed us. He made the dives very exciting as we got to see things we never would have by just snorkeling. Highly recommend them if you want to get certified!

Reviews.Title: “Must depend on the time of year - beware of smell”
Reviews.Author: Basketball44
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly new property. My wife and I stayed their for two nights and were very happy with the room. Well appointed and we had a nice view of the ocean - although that ocean/beach is pretty far away from the actual rooms. The smell from the sewage treatment plant is horrible at times. You don't smell it all the time, but when it comes through - watch out. The location of the property is also very windy compared to the hotels that are on Kaanapali Beach. Honua Kai is actually on Kaanapali' North Beach. Dining is limited to Dukes. If you want to eat somewhere else, you need to get in your car or walk about 30-45 minutes to Whalers Village (which is a great place). When I come to a vacation resort, I want everything right there and available. This property does not have the variety of services available at the property. And... Where is he spa. It might be done by now, but they advertise as a resort and spa and there was no spa. Like I said, nice rooms (they are fairly new), but other issues that cannot be overcome by a nice room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: Veronica K
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in November 2011 after staying at the Wynn in Las Vegas, while it was no comparision to the Wynn, it was a wonderful hotel. I loved that we had a full kitchen, we had peanut butter and jelly sandwiches every day for lunch. We made pizzas, reheated food from the night before. We watched Blu Ray movies all day. We also loved the washer dryer! It was a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Louise L
Reviews.Content: Me and my friends spent allot of time planing our Hawaii-trip and we a specially spent allot of time looking up hotel and resort options for our three week trip. For our week in Maui we wanted a resort with a great location, close beach and pool access and a room of good standard and that offered a kitchen. Honua Kai offered all of this and more. The units are being kept in great shape and the standard is very high. It's very clear that the organization surrounding Honua Kai is running a tight ship and focus has been put on the right areas. The service is great and the staff is genuinely nice. I've been working in the travel industry for over 10 years and you become a bit jaded when you travel allot, both for business and pleasure. But this resort impressed me and I will definitely recommend it both professionally and privately. I only have one thing to complain about and that is the $25 a day resort fee that they charge. I have no problem with a resort fee but it's a bit rich when you on top of the $25 a day have to pay for beach chairs and umbrellas if you want them on the beach. That should be included in the resort fee. With all that said, I highly recommend the Honua Kai resort and I will try to make my way back sooner then later :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location. Perfect place!”
Reviews.Author: BobbiBooey
Reviews.Content: Called from NY to ask for ground floor, central location. They delivered! Our "partial oceanfront" turned out to be HH 0145 steps to pool, beach, gourmet shop, valet. No schlepping- just perfect the condos are just as depicted- new, clean, in great condition with full wall of opening lanai glass doors! Valets and all staff are helpful and sincere... Aloha spirit! Rental car is a must on Maui no matter where you stay, so this location is perfect: snorkeling, boogie boarding and swimming right in front. Best part, we never had a crowd even on Feb break! Research a lot before booking any boat trips as the winds are torturous! Todd at Maui Wave Riders is awesome and helped us surf, though we were pitiful without him! Polynesian Village Luau is the best night out! Maui Zipline in Wailuku was awesome with Alex, Robert and Vinny:) Me, husband and kids aged 11, 10 & 5 had a magical time in Maui!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort!”
Reviews.Author: sandradee54
Reviews.Content: We chose Honua Kai for our vacation after seeing the property while walking the beachwalk last year. The grounds are lovely and having Dukes House restaurant on the property is so convenient. Our 1 bedroom suite was modern and clean. The staff was courteous and helpful. I was somewhat apprehensive after reading reviews about the wind and sewer smell and can honestly say that we experienced some of each, but it was not enough that I would discourage staying there. If there is one complaint we had it was the road noise (we had a "mountain view" room). We enjoyed the convenice of the nearby Times Market, the Fish Market and the farmers market. This resort seems to be popular with families with young children and there is no designated adult only pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LynandDavid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Honua Kai for 9 nights with our two adult sons. We were in room 818 in the Konea Tower. The room was very nice. Modern, clean and spacious with two bathrooms, a full kitchen and washing machine and dryer. The large lanai was particularly nice. Although it was too hot in the mornings it was extremely pleasant in the afternoons and early evenings. We ate dinner on the balcony most nights. Whales: 818 has partial ocean views but the sea is too far away for whale watching even with binoculars. We were there in peak whale season and saw lots of whales, in the distance, when we were down at the beach. We also did a whale watching tour which was just fantastic. The person at the tour desk recommended that we go on a smaller boat rather than with one of the larger operators which turned out to be extremely good advice. When whales approached the boat everyone (there were six people on the tour altogether) was able to get a great view rather than just those people who were lucky enough to be seated on the side the whales came up to. The name of the company we went with was UFO Parasailing and I would highly recommend them. Car and parking: It is definitely worth having a car if you are at Honua Kai. There is an excellent supermarket across from the resort and the on-sight restaurant Duke's is very good but it is a bit of a distance to pretty much anything else. There is a free shuttle that takes you to Whaler's Village where there are shops and restaurants and several other resorts in the area. We booked through Kaanapali Beach Properties and they made a big thing of the fact that we had to pay separately for parking - $10 a day. Their e-mail instructions were very clear that when we arrived the first thing we had to do on arrival was arrange resort parking for the full lenght of our stay at the front desk. Because we arrived very late at night we followed these instructions without being able to assess the parking situation for ourselves but the next morning it was pretty clear that what we had paid for was underground parking and we could have parked the whole time for free in the open air car parks. Snorkelling: The beach immediately in front of the resort was okay for seeing fish but there is very little live coral. However about 5 minutes walk or swim away the beach in front the next resort down going in the direction of Whalers' Village is much more interesting and further along still, at Black Rock the snorkelling is just great, although it did get quite crowded. My son and I snorkelled right around the point and saw loads of fish, several turtles and a white tipped reef shark. You need to be a confident swimmer to go around the point but with fins on the current wasn't really an issue. Black Rock is probably about half an hour's stroll from Honua Kai but I'm reasonably sure the free shuttle bus goes there. There is limited beach parking at the Sheraton, about six places, so if you arrive very early you might get lucky and be able to park. All in all we had a fantastic time at Honua Kai and i would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Honua Kai Outstanding Property”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie D
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Honua Kai Resort for the past few years and have found the property to be excellent. The units are new, clean and have 2 master suites. We just got home from a 10 day stay and just had to give a shout out to Katie at the pool/activities station. She was so friendly and very helpful. She made our stay so much better. We loved talking to her and she gave us some very good information. Thanks for being the best.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort Would Definitely Return!”
Reviews.Author: Naper2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 6 nights mid February at the resort. We loved it! The resort is first class and very well maintained. We were in a 1 bedroom unit in the Kona building with a partial ocean view. I would strongly recommend getting at least the partial ocean view. Our view of the ocean was between 2 hotels but we could still see the water. I would not have wanted a pool facing room as I like more privacy when we're on the lanai. Dukes was very good. Had several meals there and the food & service was great. There were quite a few kids but we were able to find quiet spots by the pool. We had no trouble getting chairs. I would recommend to management that they make at least one pool adults only. They have plenty of pools and could easily do this. The workout room had many machines and free weights. They do have room service but the menu is very limited. We rented through the hotel and had daily maid service which we liked. On vacation I lilke the room cleaned and towels changed. Many rent through owners and I don't think they get that service. Many readers said that they it's a sprawling complex and can be a long walk to the pool. I would highly recommend checking out which doors, especially in the parking garage, are the most convenient for you. I saw many people doing circles looking for the main elevators while there are many different elevators that could be closer. We stayed at the Grand Hyatt on Kauai after this and were very disappointed in that room after staying at the Honua Kai.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Property!”
Reviews.Author: GinnyAlamo
Reviews.Content: My husband, our son, my mother and I spent four short nights at Honua Kai. We were in a two-bedroom/two and a half bathroom oceanfront room (Room 301) in the Konea building. We rented through a property management company and not directly through the resort but did have to pay a $10 per day parking fee. Our corner, oceanfront unit was spectacular! We couldn't have been happier! The room had two master bedrooms each with a king bed and a full bath complete with a shower, tub and double sinks. Since we rented through an agency, we didn't have to deal with the pool/beach towel issues that others mention. We also did not have daily maid service. The unit has its own washer and dryer and full kitchen too. Our particular unit had its own private gas bbq, wet bar and outside refrigerator on the balcony. We also had a table with six chairs, two lounge chairs and another chair with a small table. The units' sliding glass doors open completely allowing for an indoor/outdoor feel! As others have mentioned, since this is primarily a family resort, there are a LOT of children at this resort. If you're looking for a quiet, poolside place, this is not your place. If you don't mind well-behaved kids, it's a spectacular place. Our only complaint was that the tap water is reconstituted sea water and has a foul taste for drinking. We did purchase bottled water and go into the indoor parking garage to get ice each day. Other than that, absolutely ZERO complaints! Wonderful vacation, wonderful property, wonderful unit, pleasant staff! We'll definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “A quality but condo property”
Reviews.Author: mdl38
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Honau Kai Hokulani building. After MANY visits to Maui, this was by far the cleanest and newest property we have stayed at. Just to mention a few things that didn't work for us. Lounge chairs are very low to the ground, and not good for seniors. There is nothing in the unit as far as spices, condiments or ANYTHING...fridge everything was bare and expensive to buy. You also need a car as everything including the bus is 15 minute walk ...minimum. Beds are adequate but not highend, and if you have allergies everything including couch pillows are feather down. Dukes was expensive, and the one meal we ate there was far not that great...very generic and tasteless. Drinks were watered down unless you had wine/beer. Ania deli was expensive and very gourment. $13 for a sandwich! $8 for a smoothie...ouch. $3 for a bottle of coke. Staff was good and great to work with if you needed anything. I would probably not stay at this property again unless with family and big group...not much here. But great value for a group.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms- location very isolated- staff uninterested and rude”
Reviews.Author: aussie_traveller30
Reviews.Content: We had a 4 night stay in February at Honua Kai. We arrived at 11a.m and check-in is not until 4. The concierge saw us arrive with lots of bags and walked the other way.. After waiting for him, and helping him put our bags away, he expected a tip. At check-in, we were told we were early- which we already knew- hence putting our stuff into storage. We then asked if at all possible we could get a room a little earlier- and he said he would try and should be able to and will call us. At 3.40pm- 20 mins before Check-In- we went back to the reception and the room was ready. We were not called- but told how lucky we were to be allowed to check-in early.. 20 MINUTES!! How Rude!! The rooms are great- we stayed in a 2 bedroom, ocean view.. We had hoped it would be more of an ocean view then waht we got- the rooms are very unprivate and all look over each other. Facilities in the room are perfect. Great kitchen and washing facilities. Nice bathrooms with Aveda products. Disappointing to stay at a 'Resort & Spa' that doesn't have a Spa- and doesn't know when they will.. We felt quite isolated as you really need to drive everywhere for lunch/dinner- unless you prepare it in your room. The pools were ok. I would recommend this hotel for the rooms only. Service and facilities let the place down.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LSlycord
Reviews.Content: Here right now with my husband and two children. It is a beautiful hotel. We are in a studio with an oceanview. I would probably argue the oceanview...we are on the second floor and therefore don't have our own balcony...it is shared with probably 6 other units. To see the ocean, I need to stand and walk to the edge away from our condo. We booked through Costco Travel and didn't have any information about our room number until we got here. But the price was good. Having said that, this place is nice. Saw whales from the balcony on our first morning here. Gorgeous sunsets. Cooking is easy in the fully equipped kitchen. Times Market is a full grocery store just across the street. Makes it easy to have sandwiches for lunch and cereal or donuts for breakfast. And could cook a full meal if you wanted to. The towel cards are easy to use. You can take your beach towels down to the beach or to any of the pools. You get the towel cards at check-in. Go to the pool shack and they will take your cards in exchange for the towels. When you return them, you get your cards back. Don't lose the cards or they will charge you $25 each. Would stay here again...just in a higher unit!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Views and Beach”
Reviews.Author: CapeCodTravler
Reviews.Content: This was a great final week for us in Hawaii. The resort is beautiful and the pools are great. Our room was on the 8th floor and had a great view of everything. It was directly above the lobby so we faced the water and had great views. We had whale watches everyday from our apartment so be sure to bring binoculars during the whale season. The only drawback was the sun in the after noon. The deck got too hot to sit on some afternoons. We also got busted by the towel police as we had left a towel on the deck to dry - a no no that we discovered by a terse note left under our door by security (they need to change their message here.) There is a great market across the street that has everything so stock up for breakfasts or lunch. We did get spoiled here and tended to eat out all our meals rather than cook. We enjoyed many breakfasts and lunches at the onsite Dukes who gets you back with a free Hula Pie on your next visit. Excellent snorkeling right out front and up the beach. Also great paddle boarding but you have to rent this down the beach at the Weston. The consierge can arrange most anything. We really relaxed at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic resort!”
Reviews.Author: SkiKeystone
Reviews.Content: My parents, 2 year old and I just returned from a week stay at Honua Kai. The place is amazing! The 3 pools and play areas were perfect for our family. I can't wait to go back again. It was so relaxing and the views were insane. We saw whales each day that we were there just by looking our the windows of our 10th floor condo. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever”
Reviews.Author: clearlyimagenius
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely beautiful! Our room was exceptionally decorated and very comfortable. From the lobby you can turn your head one way and see the mountains or turn your head the other way to see the ocean. The pools are fantastic - my husband and I had a lot of fun on the water slide. It's nice to have the Aina market on site, but the Times market is less than a mile away as well and a lot cheaper. Cheap local eats nearby at HONOKOWAI OKAZUYA & DELI - delish!

Reviews.Title: “great resort”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: Swimming pools, full service kitchen, two bed rooms each with their own bathroom all made our stay awesome. Enjoyed the location and being close to all the main tourist stops in the north end Overall great place otherwise and highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found”
Reviews.Author: Doug M
Reviews.Content: This place is fantastic. Excellent service and very competent and friendly staff. A special kudos to Kevin Maratea of 5 Star Scuba for his instruction,enthusiasm,and knowledge enabling this neophyte's dream of finally going scuba diving come true..A quick but thorough crash course in the pool led to an incredible dive right off the resort beach where the coral reefs reveiled an amazing array of fish and endless marine animals. He took great photos of my first dive and now I have a new hobby. Katie Wilson at the poolside service centre made us feel welcome from the first to last Aloha. Always helpful and full of suggestions. The grounds and the pools are beautifully laid out and well maintained. We hate to hate to have to leave the resort, but we will be back for sure. Doug and Val

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, Excellent Value!”
Reviews.Author: FloridaVacations4u
Reviews.Content: We've spent a lot of time on Maui over the years -- this resort is a wonderful addition to the choices available in Ka'anapali. By far the nicest suites and best value on the west side of the island. We stayed in a Studio on the 5th floor with a direct ocean view. The Studio in this property is larger than many of the 1 bedrooms we've had in other properties. There is a full glass wall that retracts completely, opening onto a spacious, private lanai. Multiple gorgeous pools with fun beachside dining at Duke's. Comfortable, 20 min. stroll along the beachside boardwalk to Whaler's Village with shopping and lots of dining options. You will find us here the next time we need a place to stay on our favorite island!

Reviews.Title: “would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: wardyp
Reviews.Content: Booked after reading Tripadvisor reviews and was happy with choice. We had a 2 bedroom apartment on the 5th floor, with ocean views. Sun all day and very quiet. Well appointed with brand new furnishings and fittings. Great coffee in cafe and fairly close to supermarket. You need a hire car to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice. Just pretty nice.”
Reviews.Author: ChiLiz05
Reviews.Content: All of the reviews prior to mine are correct. It's a new property, feels clean, and looks nice. The rooms have full, upgraded kitchens, and big bathrooms. They have Aveda bath products. We loved being able to do laundry the night before we left. The lanai's are wonderful to wake up and have coffee outside. Beach is beautiful. (coral right on shore really does cut up feet...beware!) And now the cons: 1. $25 resort fee daily. For what? We self-parked, used the internet a little, and why would you go to the fitness center when you have a beautiful beach and boardwalk to exercise on? Usually you get a newspaper too included in this fee (in other resorts) but not here. In fact, in the store, the New York Times and Wall Street had extra fees and were a day behind because of the cost to ship them. 2. Speaking of fitness centers, I was kind of excited to attend a fun class on the beach or something, but I did not see anything organized. Not really any other events either. 3. I thought the front desk staff was not kind or accomodating at all. I spoke with three different people for several things and they were just "meh." I also did not get anything I asked for. 4. Market was expensive, but nice to have for coffee and snacks. $7 for salsa? Whoa. I guess it's expected. 5. KIDS. I love kids, but there were a ton of them. Of course, I understand why parents would bring kids here. There is a full kitchen in each room and space to breathe. However, they were everywhere, making lots of noise. There should be an adults only pool or space. I didn't want to get in pool because they were everywhere. We were on our honeymoon and we felt really out of place because there were so many families and older couples. (grandparents) 6. They only change bedsheets every three days. I completely agree with being eco-friendly, but I think we should get the option and can designate if we want fresh sheets or not. We came back pretty dirty some days and I am the kind of person who sleeps better being clean. 7. Big resorts means lots of walking to get to pool or beach. 8. In terms of location, Lahaina is far from the Road to Hana and Haleakala, so make sure you're aware of that. Try Wailea if location is a factor. 9. Duke's was good! Happy Hour was fun. 10. We had a partial ocean view studio on floor 2. We shared a big balcony with the rest of the second floor and at first, I did not like this. We had to walk out on the shared space to see the ocean and other people were around. I would have liked to be secluded on our own balcony. I asked to switch and the desk said they were not accomodating switches at this time. Kind of a bummer but better than facing the mountains for sure. Overall, good value for money, and right on beautiful beach. The beach is what we came for, and we got it. :)

Reviews.Title: “This is NOT Ka'anapali”
Reviews.Author: Ronniecc
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Ka'anapali Alii (which was fantastic but much more expensive) on our first trip and looked forward to this trip back to Kaanipali. Although this resort is beautiful, it is off the beaten path with not as much to do. I guess you could walk to Whaler's Village, but it's a long walk. Duke's is great, and if it weren't so expensive, we would have gone more often. It is convenient having a grocery store right across the street. There are also some hole-in-the-wall restaurants nearby, including a fantastic takeout place (forgot the name). The pools were pretty but too cold for me, even in the 80Â° weather. The pool has no chairs, just chaise lounges that were uncomfortable, so we didn't spend time at the pool. We were happier at the beach in sand chairs. The condo was impersonal and stark but nice. Unfortunately, the description didn't mention the down pillows, comforter and throw pillows that pretty much ruined my week. The condo furniture, like the chaise lounges, was designed for taller people and I couldn't find a comfortable place to sit. t don't know if it's this resort of the time of year, but it was much too windy for me. We wouldn't return to the Honua Kai, but this time of year is fantastic because of the whales.

Reviews.Title: “Best resort and staff on island”
Reviews.Author: goose1976
Reviews.Content: From the first moment we pulled up to the curb island life on maui began. The staff took care of everything for us...bags to the room...seamless check in process...giant patio (we learned it is called a lanai) bay doors open and let that warm island air relax your soul. Special requests? No problem! Cut yourself on the coral? Friendly, knowledgeable med staff will clean you right up. Best trip advisors to help plan our activities and just a warm,sincere staff to make you feel welcomed. i will return!

Reviews.Title: “Not a Hotel or Resort”
Reviews.Author: beachgoer003
Reviews.Content: I'll start this review by saying that Honua Kai is not a Hotel or a Resort. It's amazing that they charge a $25.00 resort fee, because this place is merely a Condominium Complex. I've read the numerous other reviews on this place, and most of them are spot on. The rooms are nice, because they are new, but everything else goes downhill. Here's my list of complaints: 1. Horrible Raw Sewage smell 2. Cockroaches 3. Too many small children that intrude on everyone else's enjoyment 4. Balcony Chairs make horrible noises to units beneath - it could wake the dead!!! 5. Uncomfortable pool chairs that feel like you are lying on cement & not enough chairs to accomodate the amount of rooms at the place. This place is a condominium complex, so trying to get "Quality Service" is not going to happen. Most of the units have been sold to private owners who rent the units out either through Honua Kai or other rental companies. The place itself held on to a handful of units so they could make some extra money, but in in the end, this place is NOT A HOTEL or RESORT, it is individually owned condominiums. So don't expect to get good Service or Amenities, because it just isn't going to happen. They shouldn't be advertising it as a Luxury Resort, because it is just plain false advertising. In the end, if you have numerous small children under the age of 6, don't mind the wonderful stench of raw sewage, and can view cockroaches as a tropical enjoyment, this is your place. Otherwise, I would recommend looking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: jbmWyoming
Reviews.Content: I wish I could give it 4.5 stars. My family of 5 stayed here in a two-bedroom unit. We rented through vrbo and the owner was extremely helpful pre-trip with suggestions and everything went off without a problem. We had stayed in Honolulu for 5 days prior and flew here for a 6 night stay in Maui. My husband and I had seen this property on a previous trip and thought it would be perfect for our family. The unit was a corner unit with a huge lanai with a partial ocean-view and also a view of the mountains. The landscaping around the property was nice, with streams and rocks. The unit was nicely decorated with nice furniture, linens and mattresses. The pull-out couch actually had a comfortable mattress. The kitchen is beautiful, but small with not a lot of storage or cooking counter space so if you were here for a long stay and you wanted to cook I could see this being a problem. Our kids (11, 12, 14) really loved the pools. They aren't disney-type pools with lots of slides but there is a lazy-type river and lots of spots to find a chair and privacy. We loved Dukes restaurant on site and had eaten at the one in Honolulu. The bartenders were very friendly and it was nice to be able to grab a drink at the pool and also ocean-front. It was extremely windy during our time there -- so much so that our kids really didn't like going to the beach. Once you got into the ocean it was ok, but sitting on the beach was not an option because the sand literally whipped your face. I'm sure it's not like this all the time, but we were disappointed because one of the reasons we chose this resort was for the beach. The service was ok inside the resort. No one went out of their way to check on us or be super-friendly but they weren't rude either. The gormet shop was a good place to pick up lunch or snacks for the room but there is also a grocery store across the street. Whalers Village is just down the street for even more restaurant and shopping options so the location is terrific. Just wish it wasn't so windy on our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Everything for everyone..”
Reviews.Author: CanadaGirl
Reviews.Content: In my opinion, the Honua Kai has everything for everyone. We traveled from Jan 22-Feb 1. The staff were friendly and helpful and always greeted you when you were seen. The room was spectacular with Bosch appliances and flat screen TV's. We really felt like we had moved in to 'home' for the 10days we were there. The beds were a little piece of heaven. The grounds are beautiful with a different pool for whatever 'activity' you want to do. A lazy river, a waterside, a shallower pool with waterfall caves, hot tubs everywhere, etc.. The view of the ocean is spectacular. We went during the whaling season and just sitting on the beach there is non stop activity as the whales come so close to shore you can capture them with your camera. Having Dukes on site was a such a treat. The food was great, the ambiance unbeatable and the staff were friendly & enthusiastic about what they do.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: Lovethebeach2012
Reviews.Content: We stayed there from jan 28-feb 8 2012 This resort is a very beautiful,clean resort. We were there for our wedding/ honeymoon. We did not get married at the resort but spent most of our time at the resort. We loved our studio room. It came with everything we needed. Our lanai was the best. The doors open right up so it was nice and relaxing there. We had a partial ocean view on the third floor and we could sit out there and watch whales. We had no issues with wind at all on our lanai. The mornings were great to sit out there for a nice cup of coffee. The beach at times was windy but it is on a ocean so it is expected. Right out front of the resort there is a coral reef so bring fins or water shoes for snorkeling. If you walk just south it is much better. The duke's restaurant is great. Good service and great food. Make reservations for dinner because it does book up quite fast. There is a very nice beach walk that takes you to black rock. You have to make a detour through the Sheraton and then the beach walk continues to Whalers Village. There is a few restaurants there and quite a few shops. We did our shopping in Lahaina which is very nice. I will definitely go back to this resort. It was very very relaxing. The bed was comfy. The room was very sound proof( we didn't hear anyone) the air conditioner was so quiet as well. We had no problems with kids running around. It was nice seeing the kids there having so much fun. There was just the two us and found it very peaceful. Great place for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our Expectations in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: thestubesyvr
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about Honua Kai from the moment we arrived. Everyone was so friendly and helpful from the front desk to the valet to the concierge where we booked some tours. Our 2-bedroom unit was beyond what we were expecting. I couldnâ€™t get over the size...it was huge. The furniture was all modern and very nice. I loved the granite counter tops and the stainless steel Bosch appliances. I also appreciated having a washer and dryer for bathing suits and t-shirts. The kitchen was very well appointed with nice dishes and cutlery and it had everything we needed including corkscrew, chopping knifes, etc. The beds were very comfortable with good quality linens. I also really liked the living room glass doors that open up completely onto the lanai creating a wonderful indoor/outdoor space. The pool area was gorgeous...an aquatic playground for sure!!! Several pools and really well designed with lots of little private areas to enjoy. The beach was gorgeous, great for swimming and also some very good snorkelling. We did go to Dukeâ€™s Beach House restaurant on site which was excellent each time. The seafood risotto was delicious as was the HULA PIE that our table shared. The only complaint I have is that we didnâ€™t book a longer stay. 5 days was not long enough and next time it will be longer. Honua Kai is really a wonderful place and I highly recommend it to anyone who is looking for a Maui vacation that has it all.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: C P
Reviews.Content: This place is really nice! It has great pool areas, access to the beach and Dukes is on the property, which is a great place to eat (Happy hour is perfect for lunch). I don't know about the other rooms but our condo was excellent. It was very clean, had a comfy bed, great decor, nice tv and a wrap around lanai that was beautiful. We wished we would've spent our entire 2 week vacation there. We also went through Harris Properties to get the location and Jennifer was the person who helped us...she was great as well. It is definitely a little pricey but the place was so comfortable and nice, it was worth every penny. Not to mention it had a great full kitchen and everything was up to date. Staff was very nice too.

Reviews.Title: “great stay here”
Reviews.Author: missmadison
Reviews.Content: we traveled here 1/29-2/5 with another couple. Condo was great - we booked a 2 bedroom ocean view through the resort, plenty of room for 2 couples, nice kitchen (though the lack of a garbage disposal was surprising). We were in Konea tower 739- on the interior with one of L-shaped lanai's, which was wonderful for watching the ocean (and the whales). We spent a lot of time just sitting out there enjoying the view. Having the full kitchen was great since we could eat there a lot and enjoy the view. Definitely glad we paid the $$ for oceanview. The L shaped lanai also had the benefit of being able to find shade any time of day while sitting out there. I was worried about the wind after reading the other reviews on here, that may just be luck on when you go, but the wind was not an issue for us - never noticed it on the lanai. The beach was breezy all the time, but nice. Weather was perfect while we were there - 80 and sunny every day kids - quite a few kids here, but it didn't bother me. we have 2 under 5 at home so maybe I'm just used to the noise?? being up on the 7th floor, we didn't really hear them outside (and the sound proofing in the condos is great - I never heard noise from another room when we were inside, even though the place was pretty full). we didn't spend much time the pool area, so that may have helped also. The pool closest in to the Konea tower usually seemed pretty kid-free when we walked by. the beach - we had great snorkeling just south of the resort one day, and then 2 days later the water was too cloudy with sand to see anything. It is rocky right off shore with a pretty steep dropoff, but still nice for walking along the edge in the water. We walked down to black rock a few times as well. Ate at Duke's twice and was impressed - very good food and a spectacular location. the resort fee kind of sucks, but the wireless connection was very good for us, indoors and out.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: melstreit
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very relaxing and the grounds are very pretty. I loved that there were plenty of chairs available at the pools. The room was amazing and well-stocked with all of the kitchen essentials you could ever need. It's great to have the full kitchen if you want to save some money and eat a few meals in. The only reason I'm not giving a 5 out of 5 rating was my partial ocean view room. I could see the ocean from the balcony, if I stood at the very end of it. There was no partial ocean view at all from inside the room. The only other negative is the amount of children. I don't hate kids, but I agree with other reviewers. Since there are so many pools, at least one of them should be adults only. The pool becomes less relaxing with all of the kids and strollers around. I was especially annoyed that there were always young kids in the hot tubs! But overall, loved the experience there and would highly recommend to others. It's a little further down the beach than a lot of the resorts, so just keep in mind it's a little bit of a walk (or you can drive) down to Whaler's Village and other activities.

Reviews.Title: “Wish they had "adult" only area”
Reviews.Author: tdandmd
Reviews.Content: This is more like 3.5, but with a few little changes, I'd give them a 5. The rooms are gorgeous! Quality finishes in every room. Fully stocked with supplies - all the way down to martini shakers. Love the fact that the rooms have a washer and dryer so that you can pack less and take home clean clothes. Fitness room is high quality. Grounds are beautiful. Completely nonsmoking, which works for me. However ... with multiple pools (I believe there are technically five) of varying excitement levels (waterslide, bridges, etc.) why can't just one of them be adult only? We stayed here last year and loved it, but this year the ratio was literally 3 - 1 child to adult. It was nonstop Marco Polo and dive sticks and cannonballs. In all fairness, the kids are happy and they are happy sounds, but we didn't bring kids and really were looking for naps by the pool, cocktails, etc. The mention of cocktails brings up another plus and minus. They could use better (more frequent) cocktail and food service around the pool, but having Duke's there is a huge plus! We would love to make this an annual stop for us, but we will not be back until they get some family and adult separate space.

Reviews.Title: “*Almost* perfect...”
Reviews.Author: braddqq
Reviews.Content: Pros: -Awesome in-room appliances, everything could have been brand new for all I knew. -Cleanest room I've ever stayed in, at any hotel, ever. -Great location on the beach, everyone is very nice, responsive, helpful -Pools are nice, Dukes restaurant is great -One BR's are much cheaper than any other similar resort Cons: -WAY too many kids. Everywhere you look, kids screaming, babies in diapers, might as well been staying at a day care center. I understand this might? be everywhere, but they need an adult only area to keep people's sanities -Mountain View rooms feel like you might as well be in the middle of Nebraska in terms of the feeling of where you are. View are a couple brown mountains, highway and construction on the right. Point is, go ahead and splurge and get an ocean view room, its just really a boring view. -$25 daily resort fees: I don't need the internet (have a hot spot), valet, gym, etc. But I need to pay for it anyway - does that sound fair?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Dive Instructor - Wonderful property”
Reviews.Author: Eric S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a "studio" OV which was more like a one bedroom, very high end, excellent staff and up-keep. But what set our experience apart was our dive instructor Kevin Maratea at 5 star scuba right at the resort. As a certified diver I've experienced many instructor/dive masters (Mexico, Australia, Belize, etc.) but none were as good as Kevin. It was my wife's first time and he made the entire experience fun, easy going, and safe. She's totally hooked and it all because of the way Kevin explained the gear and the techniques of safe and fun SCUBA diving. If you are even thinking about trying SCUBA for the first time and you are in Maui, go have a chat with Kevin at 5 star scuba. The pictures were great too thanks to Abby for capturing the images that will last a lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, high-end suites”
Reviews.Author: dsj22
Reviews.Content: A great family stay in Kaanapali. Our 3 bedroom condo was spacious, quiet and had a full kitchen with professional appliances. Multiple pools with waterfalls and a slide kept the kids happy while the hot tubs and BBQ areas satisfied the grown ups. Nice market on site was handy and long boardwalk made for great morning walks.

Reviews.Title: “I hate resort fee's”
Reviews.Author: deartori
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great. Staff was great. Duke's is pretty good, but expensive. Ask to sit at the bar tables, it is a different menu but half the price, ambiance is great. Room 842 was good for being a resort view. We did have a partial ocean view which went a long way with me,as it is whale watching season and you can watch the whale spouts from the balcony, which is fabulous! 842 does have an annoying humming off and on, above it all day long which I have no idea what it is since the roof is the only thing above it, maybe a fan or something, would not stay in this unit again for this reason. My big complaint, which is the only thing that kept me from making this a 5 star is the fact that you pay a $25 resort fee but you still have to pay $10 to have a lounge chair placed at the beach for you. There are no chairs on the beach and the only ones you can get are rentals! $10 for the day, nominal but extremely annoying as an umbrella is additional and you already have to pay the $25 resort fee Lots of families with young kids, fine with me. Always able to find chairs at the pool. Reef right outside the hotel along the beach, easy for snorkeling right out your door. Not a great beach for kids that want to play in the water, ok for playing in the sand. Nor a real lazy river, wold love a real one that went through the whole resort. Wifi, no problem. Let me know if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Honua Kai is a great condo resort..”
Reviews.Author: Teri S
Reviews.Content: It is NOT a hotel, though it does have many of the amenities of a resort hotel. We rented a beautiful 6th floor ocean view studio from VRBO. We got so much more for our money than we would have at any hotel and we do recommend this particular studio, the owners are wonderful! VRBO Listing #283602 is 623 in Hokulani Tower, owned and nicely managed by Joe and Rhonda Devane. They gave us very personalized professional service. Our experience with them was 5 stars and my review reflects only that, not necessarily the entire resort. We do find Honua Kai to be a nice mix of beautiful condo space with resort amenities. Our interior and lanai were lovely as are all of the units. The view from our angled interior courtyard room was very good. We had everything we needed or wanted. We enjoyed snorkeling, sunsets on the beach, Dukes for pool service, happy hours and dinners, the pools and hot tubs, Aina Market and even the convenient parking. We did find that the outdoor furniture at the pool and on the lanai was not especially comfortable. Being a condo resort, we could order drinks or snacks at the pool or make our own and bring them down. We enjoyed both. Joe and Rhonda provided beach chairs, towels and boogie boards, and also a nice welcome package of Champaign, Hawiian coffee and chocolates. We really appreciated the late check out on our last day. We will definitely return. Do not hesitate to rent this studio from vrbo.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: km35
Reviews.Content: Visited in July 2011 after a 4 day stay in Oahu. The Hawaiian islands are absolutely fantastic and Maui in particular was a blast. The Honua Kai was a lovely hotel/apartment with lovely pools, excellent service and a handy albeit expensive grocery store downstairs. The guest BBQ area was a nice touch but often crowded. The hotel is somewhat out the way meaning a car is essential if you wish to go to lanai or whalers village. The sewage smell complaints are perhaps valid but more if you are in the whalers village area and to be honest only if you are driving past on the main road. We never had any issues in what was a fantastic holiday and a very nice hote -If you are a scuba diver check out ed robinsons dive centre whilst on the island - first class!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Will_travel_for_fun9
Reviews.Content: We are completing a 10 day stay in Maui today, and all 9 nights were at the Honua Kai. It is very tough leaving...... The common themes of the many other reviews are true. Beautiful and new complex, great appliances and top notch furnishings. I will point out some things that were a bit ambiguous before our visit. 1. There were some reviewers that thought the beach was poor. I disagree. If you walk 100-200ft to the left (towards the westin) their is great sandy entry. Saw many families enjoying the water. You don't need water shoes in my opinion. The off shore snorkeling was incredible. 2. The wind issue.....was a no issue for us. Usually very calm until around noon, then the wind picks up. I would say without the wind it would be uncomfortably hot. Spent many evenings out on the lanai without issue. 3. The amount of children. Was a bit concerned with this as we were traveling as a couple. I think most condo like complexes attract families because of convenience. So there are many young families, but I did not find this to hamper my enjoyment. 4. The "sewer smell". Never happened to us. Overall, fantastic vacation. We will definitely return to the Honua Kai and Maui. Best side trip was sunrise at Haleakala and the sliding sands hike (unreal!). A must do, even with the early wake up. Try to get an ocean view on a higher floor (5 and up). Its really nice to enjoy the site and sound of the ocean as you are starting or finishing your day. Aloha.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons, Depends what you like”
Reviews.Author: SnowTraveller
Reviews.Content: Our family visited for several weeks in January and overall, it was a satisfactory stay, not five-star but alright. Start with the CONS: -Weird smells. On our first evening in Maui, there was a really nasty smell just as we drove into the Kaanapali region. Very sulphur-y, sewery. After talking to other travelers, there is apparently a smell in Maui, Kannapali area called the VOG..seriously, that's what it's called- or they were pulling our leg. It's basically volcano gas. This could have been the cause of some of the smell. However, there was an occasional, recurring sewer smell in the area and the hotel region, maybe also due to the nearby water treatment plant. If you don't like gross, vomit-y smells, you may want to do some research before booking this place. -South part of hotel is next to an unattractive, weedy, seemingly deserted construction lot. There are a few pieces of large construction equipment parked on the lot but there was no construction activity during our stay. Really shabby view on that part of the building.
