Avoid being located there or negotiate a very low rate. -Location is far from the main and more attractive activity areas. We ended up driving to Whalers village every second night to walk on the very attractive boardwalk and visit the shops. We paid the parking fees at Whalers Village if we didn't make enough purchases to have validated parking. -Air conditioning inconsistent from room to room. There is one control. The bedroom was freezing cold and the living room was still too warm. The unit had two excellent ceiling fans and we kept them on all the time and used the air conditioning sparingly. However, if you like the air cond on all the time, make sure your room has properly working equipment. -Outrageous fee to park in the Honua Kai Parkade. Ten bucks per day. Here are the PROS: -Well equipped kitchen. Terrific appliances. Had every utensil we needed and we cooked a lot due to having small children with us. -Washer and dryer in unit was super convenient. These appliances are the vent-less variety so the dryer takes a long time to dry a load. We ran the laundry at night. You would be annoyed if you wanted to do a quick load in the morning. Having our own washer and dryer was key for us and our young family. -Suite was modern and nicely decorated. The majority of accommodation in Maui is very dated. If you like new, book a new place like this one or a freshly renovated condo. -Staff was pleasant. We booked our unit through the condo rentals at KaanapaliBeachRentals.com so we were technically not hotel guests and did not have maid service. However, when we met any staff in the hotel, we were always greeted pleasantly. Overall, we will probably visit Maui sometime in the future- or try another island; depending on flights available from our town. If in Maui, we would stay at a different place. Either directly located in the Whalers Village boardwalk or perhaps try the Kihei area which is located closer to the airport and the major large stores like Costco, Walmart and so forth.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best”
Reviews.Author: Loves2Travel222
Reviews.Content: As a veteran of 31 vacations in Hawaii I have a pretty good base for comparison. The Honua Kai is my all time favorite. It is nice and it is new (the first is a must and the second is a preference for me.) Even the smallest room on the property has a lovely bedroom, large living room / dining room / kitchen combo, and large bathroom. There is also a washer / dryer in each room. Of special note is the quality of the building materials. From the interior doors to the back splash tile in the kitchen to the top end appliances, all appear to have been selected with quality as the first objective - often a rarity in hotel construction. The grounds of the hotel are lovely. Its beach is near perfect. The location is excellent. Honua Kai is on the extreme north end of Kaanapali Beach. It is away from the crowds that often pack into the Hyatt to Sheraton stretch of Kaanapali. But the shops and restaurants of the Whalers Village are just a very short drive or long walk away. A highlight of Honua Kai's location is the stretch of beach front trees just south of the hotel. They are spaced in such a way that they form little semi private "rooms." My husband and I bought two beach chairs, some bottles of wine, and picnic supplies at Walmart. Almost every day of our vacation we "camped" out in the shade of these trees and watched the waves and the whales.....beach vacations don't get any better than that. My only recommendation if choosing to stay at the Honua Kai is that you book a room with the garden, mountain, or ocean views. The resort view rooms actually overlook the parking lot and a field (these rooms need to be renamed asap.) One more tip for a great stay at Honua Kai....thanks to the excellent kitchen facility in each room, be sure to have a few meals on your balcony. The Honua Kai balconies are surprisingly large and well furnished. Amanda Stone Now on Twitter - https://twitter.com/#!/TravelToDoLists And on Amazon Kindle - Hawaii To Do List

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for our anniversary”
Reviews.Author: NelleJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Honua Kai in the Kona tower in January. We had booked a studio partial ocean view. We were upgraded to a one-bedroom. We were aware that "partial" ocean view might be only a postage stamp size view. No ocean looking straight out, but what a great surprise to fine a Great ocean view from our balcony. It was sunny, it was warm, there were palm trees. Sitting on the balcony was a pleasure. The unit was clean. Full very nice kitchen. Lots of space. Grounds were lovely to walk in. Right next to the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Hawiian Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: DrBrittT
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Honua Kai resort. We were welcomed by the bellman immediately upon pulling up to the front gate and our bags were quickly unloaded from our car and brought to our room. After traveling for 15 hours this was wonderful. We we arrived, our one bedroom condo was in pristine condition - clean and wonderfully decorated. We felt like we were in a home - not in a hotel room. We quickly went downstairs and learned the Dukes restaurant was still open as we were STARVING. We sat on the outdoor patio and sipped on some celebratory mai tai's and had excellent fish tacos. The perfect first night arrival in Hawaii! The next morning we checked out the pools which were numerous and very naturistic ;). The pool chairs around the pools do fill up quickly in the monring but we learned to go down early and set out towels to hold our seats. The only down side of the whole experience was the amount of children at the resort. It seemed like 70% of the people there had 1-2 children under the age of 5. The pool was swarming with kids. It would have been nice if there was an area for "adults" only. Overall we had a wonderful time and would go back to this resort in a heartbeat. The front desk staff was very friendly and gave us advice on places to eat, shop, see etc. We were very sad to leave. After 2 days home...I'm ready to go back :)

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: tTacy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two bedroom suite on the third floor of K tower facing the mountains, for 10 days. The balcony was large and we often ate breakfast here but the traffic noise from the highway was loud and spoiled the ambiance. Ithe kitchen was surprisingly well equipped and very clean. All the pools and hot tubs are fine but they should have an adults only pool as there were lots of children here having fun but making lots of noise which I find disturbing to my relaxation. Lounges were abundant but not hard and unucomfortable. They are only inches from the ground so somewhat difficult to get in and out of if your knees and/or hips are arthritic. We used two towels to make ourselves more comfortable on the lounges. We did not lie on the beach as there is no shade provided......no umbrellas or anything. This was disappointing as we prefer the beach. The location ig ideal with a great boardwalk that goes for miles. There is a large grocery store across the road from the resort which supplies everything. We did stop at Costco on the way to stock up. The resort has a recycling program but it is not advertised and we had to ask about it. Every guest should be made aware of this. If we stay here again, I would stay in an ocean view room.

Reviews.Title: “Great place at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Brian B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Honua Kai resort in January 2012 and had a great time. It's well situated for whale watching on the west coast of Maui. Nice condos with excellent appliances and a nice layout.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at Honua Kai”
Reviews.Author: cajundiver
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a stay at Honua Kai and was very happy with the accommodations and the property overall. We booked directly with the property and this review will address amenities for that type of reservation. I am not sure what is included if you book with an ower. We were fortunate to have a week of great weather so the wind that other posters have mentioned wasn't a problem for us. It was quite windy the last day but it was nice to have the cooling breeze on the balcony and didn't bother us at all. We had an ocean view studio on the 8th floor of the Konea tower (821) and had a great view. The little time we spent in the room we were whale watching from the lanai. I would like to mention to the ladies that the bath products were all Aveda and replenished often (shampoo, conditioner, body wash, hand soap and lotion). Also, we were given a starter kit with dishwasher detergent, washing power, bounce and hand towels. Coffee is also provided. There is a hair dryer in the room that works great (better than mine at home!) There is an iron and full size ironing board. Just beware if you plan to wash clothes it takes a very long time for them to dry. The view from room 821 was great. I walked around the resort and found that I preferred the pool area in the Konea tower, but you are free to use either one. Duke's and Anini on site were great and Anini had some really neat local gourmet food and salts and such. We got everything we needed for the "Road to Hana" day there including a soft side cooler (about $10 but reusable and worth the price). The pools are very nice and we could always find a spot off by ourselves. The beach directly in front was nice. We didn't go in the water but it was more suited for snorkeling and diving than swimming. Also, for the divers they offer a guided shore dive daily (for extra cost). Just a note about the smell of the sewage plant nearby, we smelled it coming to and leaving the resort but never inside. We were facing the ocean and I would think that the rooms facing the mountains might get a whiff of it. I would try for an inside facing condo. We had maid service daily that removed trash, washed dishes, made bed and replenished bath towels and supplies. After a few days the linens were changed also. There is covered parking underground and above ground parking. Valet is also available and is included in the $25 resort fee. If you plan to head out for excursions before 6:00 am you should park your own car because valet is not available until then. Also, do not plan on getting a late check out. Most hotels I have stayed in allowed this but we were told no and other people I overheard enquiring at the front desk were also told no. Overall we would stay here and found the value hard to beat by Maui standard. One last note, stop and have the cucumber water in the lobby. I am now addicted!

Reviews.Title: “Great pool,beach,rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Jess H
Reviews.Content: This place is pretty sweet. We had 3 couples, 2 babies and a teenager share a 3 bedroom suite and there was was plenty of room. They had a crib waiting when we got there. The rooms are modern and well appointed. Cleaning staff scrubs the place every day including any dishes we missed. We had no trouble getting beach chairs around the pool. The pools and hot tubs are well maintained. The beach right in front of the resort has nice sand and awesome snorkelling with tons of fish and coral. What I really liked about it though is they didn't sweat the small stuff. For example, we walked around with our own drinks a couple times that they seen and they never said anything. Played music (reasonable volume) and visited till 11 on the balcony, no problem. The ocean view is incredible and the whales were literally 150 yards offshore wich was epic. My wife and I had a lot of fun with our friends, but so did our 3 yr old little girl. Before we came I was skeptical with the price of this place but, it was worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing - Simply Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Peter A
Reviews.Content: We had a great 2 bedroom Ocean View on the second floor. The rooms are VERY large and well appointed. The service is also excellent, from the cleaning staff, front desk to the valet parking. We WILL return! The beach and pools were all very nice, and we really enjoyed sitting on the patio at Duke's for a truly memorable evening. Incredibly child friendly! Katie at the Pool shack was Fantastic! Go to Lahaina! Play in the Waves! Watch the whales! Say Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel on Mauii!!! No doubt about that!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rose r
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the best hotel's i've ever been to. The service is excellent, the cleanliness is superb, and the room's are absolutely amazing! The ocean view is unbeatable and so breathtaking!! You have top quality appliances in the rooms such as: fully loaded kitchen, washer, dryer, etc. I usually do not rate any hotel but this hotel I couldn't believe to see it only got a 4.5 it really deserves a 5!!

Reviews.Title: “Honua Kai very nice option for Maui”
Reviews.Author: Ted_Fez
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Honua Kai during the week between Christmas and New Year 2011. The relatively new property is very nice, with several pools and nice beach front. The building and grounds are also very nice. We stayed on the 8th floor of the Konea Tower and had a beautiful one-bedroom condo with a nice mountain view. The bed was very good, as was the ventilation system. The condo had a kitchen which was somewhat functional, though seemingly designed for people that don't do much cooking. For such an expensive condo, one would have thought a garbage disposal would be included. There were two large flat panel televisions. The ventilation system worked well and the whole condo opened up through a series of sliding patio doors that ran the entire width of the condo. There was a garbage shoot just a few feet away from our front door. One can walk across the street to a large grocery store, which makes things very convenient. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and found the condo to be quiet and comfortable. Our only negative comment about the resort is that there was not a good place for adults to swim seriously, as the main pool was always occupied by kids splashing around.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome resort!”
Reviews.Author: Brianne H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I honeymooned here and we could not have asked for a better place. It had everything we needed. Because it was our honeymoon they upgraded us from a mountain view to a partial ocean view. The rooms were large and stocked with everything we needed. Everything from dish towels to laundry detergent. The maid service was awesome...we had left some dishes in the sink, planning to wash them but when we got back and the maid had already cleaned them. The beach was absolutely beautiful and wasn't crowded at all. We enjoyed every minute we were there and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, except for the sewage smell”
Reviews.Author: Marcel L
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights in January 2012 in a partial ocean view suite (406) in the Konea tower. The room itself is amazing, one of the nicest I've stayed in while on vacation, it's basically a really nice (and big) 1 bedroom apartment with all the amenities of home (kitchen, full bathroom with his/her sinks, washer & dryer). The pool area is also very nice, lots of chairs and shady spots if you need them, if you want a padded chair there is a charge ($30 a day) and you can rent chairs and snorkel gear for the beach (chair was $10 each and snorkel gear was 15 for the day). The restaurant on the property (Dukes) was very good, we had fish and it was very fresh and well prepared. Having said all that.. WE WILL NOT BE BACK.. the smell of sewage was very strong at times, mostly at night when we had shade on our patio and wanted to enjoy the cooler evening temperatures, it was not a constant stench, but we did smell it every day.. not really a nice way to spend your time in Hawaii. If you're concerned about the smell based on other reviews I would strongly recommend a different hotel, unless you have a full ocean view suite you're pretty much guaranteed to smell sewage while you're here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort!”
Reviews.Author: HCB1899
Reviews.Content: We loved our room. Very big with everything you could ask for; washer/dryer, full kitchen. The living room is nice and comfortable. The patio is huge! Location is excellent, near two supermarkets (one right across the street within walking distance. Safeway about a 2-5 minute drive.). Staff is friendly and available. The resort fee covers valet parking and towels for the beach or pool. The wi-fi is fast, or was at least for us. We had trouble connecting but the hotel tech line answered immediately on first ring and solved it within seconds. Pool crowded with children, but we think that because we don't have any. Families would love it. We thought the beds too soft, but again, we do not like soft beds. Would definitely stay here again and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent family friendly property”
Reviews.Author: sunflower12
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 BR unit. The master BR and bath were very spacious. There was also a large lanai. The kitchen was fully equipped with dishes, pans, dish soap etc. The outside property was beautiful, several nice pools. Would highly recommend this for families travelling together. It has a more high end feel, while still being family friendly. The only downsides are that the fitness facility is lacking but still adequate, and that they charge you for coffee after you finish their first free bag

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: monicaWollongong
Reviews.Content: We loved our accommodation. The room was beautifully furnished, all quality inclusions. Its in a great location, on a great beach with the beach pathway running out front. Great supermarket across the road, very cheap alcohol. Dukes restaurant was fantastic. Cant really fault this hotel. Its worth getting an ocean view room, but on the upper floors only.

Reviews.Title: “Great property for families.”
Reviews.Author: marktysdal
Reviews.Content: Overall this facility was excellent for families and those wanting access to Maui's Ka'anapalli coast. Location and amenities were very good. Fitness facility is only feature that could have been improved.

Reviews.Title: “A trip to remember”
Reviews.Author: rainb0wbright
Reviews.Content: The property is beautiful, my room was amazing, the location is great, really great customer service. I picked this hotel because their room count was significantly smaller than some of the other hotels around. The room I stayed in had a full kitchen (even a blender), and washer and dryer which ended up saving us so much money so we could keep snack and food in the hotel rather than eating out. We ate at Dukes during their happy hour and it was great, and of course got some drinks from there to enjoy at the pool. We also got some sandwiches, coffee, and gelato from the small store in the lobby. Their beach was perfect and you can rent chairs and umbrellas if you would like. The location was a bit windy, but I was not sure if it the location on the island of if the island is always windy. The only downside is that their spa was not finished when I had visited; the concierge was kind enough to arrange for me to go to their neighbor hotel which was a short walk, and I had great service and a discount. While there, we went sport fishing with Start Me Up Sportfishing (4 hour trip, fun, did not catch anything), took the trip to Lanai with Trinity (fun, recommended and set up through concierge desk) and drove around the west side of the island (scary roads), and went to Haleakala National Park (really beautiful). The hotel is in the perfect location to do all of these things! Highly recommend! Defiantly a place I hope to return to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: JPDBC
Reviews.Content: We spent a few weeks in a lovely one bedroom condominium at the new resort. The layouts were nice and the suites re very well furnished. The pool area is terrific with separate pools for younger families to enjoy. Dukes and the nice Deli and market are two bonuses. The units are expensive but well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT TIME”
Reviews.Author: dlnormedic
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying here and are very much enjoying our stay. The pools are great and there is always a chair to sit. The beach is nice and the service is good. Would stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms but poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: jb8000
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice for total of 29 nights. Holukalani tower better...closer to better pools. Rooms are very very nice, identical in both towers, upscale but customer service poor. Pros: great rooms, good prices for the size u get Con: poor customer service. (especially at dukes the only restaurant on property...also no room delivery, room service etc. Pools not heated. Occasional sewage smell If they got better service at dukes, heated pools and went out of their way a bit to make you feel special, it would be amazing, but they don't. I have chosen honua Kai because I need the extra room

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: kenkat1230
Reviews.Content: Well equiped large units,Convenient location, well maintained grounds, amenities make for a excellent choice

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: PickyInVancouver
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in October of 2011 and really enjoyed it. There were actually 6 of us (3 couples) sharing a 2 bedroom unit. Honua Kai was highly recommended to us and we were told that a 2 bedroom with the pull out couch would be more than enough room... and it was. The rooms are absolutely enormous and our view was spectacular. The resort is brand new so everything is first class. The pool... or pools as I should say were great and having Dukes right on site was a nice luxury to have. They also have a whole bank of BBQs which makes cooking up your own meals fun and social. I really don't have anything bad to say about this resort but there were 2 things that you should know before you are going... 1. This is not a resort for young people travelling with friends looking to party, we are not partiers by any means but we were given 2 noise warnings... once at exactly 10:01pm (quiet time is 10pm) and once, believe it or not, at 10:30am while we were having breakfast on our deck! The staff were very polite about it and maybe the people we had living underneath our unit were just really picky but it was a bit extreme. If you are planning on being in your room, doors shut by 10 then this is a great place for you. But if you have really young children who can be a bit loud in the morning or if you want to play cards on your deck and enjoy the ocean air after 10pm I would recommend another place. Also it should be noted that Dukes closes early in the evening too so if you want to go for a drink at 9 or 10 you can't go there. 2. The other issue I had is the pull out couch is unbelievably uncomfortable... I'd actually go as far to say the floor is better. So if you are travelling with kids, or trying to do it on the cheap, don't be the person that gets stuck on the pull-out. The other thing I will say is spend the money on a unit with an ocean view... the back units look out onto the street, which isn't pretty at all, and we were really glad we spent the extra cash as the sunsets every night on the deck was totally worth it. I'd definitely recommend this place to couples, seniors, or people looking for a quiet and deluxe vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Trip ~ lovely resort”
Reviews.Author: SBSuz
Reviews.Content: The true test of a good resort if how they handle things when there is a problem. We arrived to a big problem - the owner of the condo we were booked into was still there and not planning to leave. Needless to say, I wasn't a happy with my 2 small children in tow and exhausted from a long plane ride - with no room at 5pm. The manager was very professional and came to talk to me about the situation. We went out to the pool while they worked on a solution and within an hour I received a call on my celphone and a wonderful room. Once we were moved in, the manager called to make sure everything was satisfactory and offered a hotel credit which we used to at Duke's for dinner. I appreciated the call and personal attention. The resort is beautiful. The grounds are well maintained, the units are like new and the staff is very friendly. My kids loved all the pools. There are plenty of great spots for young children to play - always a concern with a toddler. The wading pools were perfect and well planned with private spaces and many little lagoon areas. My older son loved the water slide. I am sure he went down it at least 50 times. I was a little concerned about the wind after reading a few reviews, but we didn't have that experience. The beach in front of the resort is nice for kids and sunset walks. Be careful if you walk out past a few steps though, there is a lot of coral. My brother-in-law stepped out a little too far and did injure his foot. All in all, everyone in our group of 19 had a great week at the Honua Kai. We have stayed at a few places on the islands over the years and this was our most successful trip. We hope to return for another stay soon. ..One last thing, the beds are very comfortable. Always a big plus for me, as an uncomfortable bed can ruin a good trip. Even my 5 year old noticed how comfy they were.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Drumstick123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at Honua Kai resort for 10 days and loved every minute of it! The resort is beautiful, well maintained, and staff is helpful and courteous. The bed was great, the resort has pool and hot tubs galore, and a beautiful beach just steps away. The specialty store was handy, and Duke's Beach House is the best for a great breakfast, lunch or oceanside dinner. Make sure to try the Hula Pie. Nobody can resist that Hawaiian treat!!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for our anniversary trip!”
Reviews.Author: OnthegofromIdaho
Reviews.Content: We selected Honua Kai for our return to Maui 30 years since our honeymoon. We weren't sure if we wanted the privacy of a condo or the amenities of a resort. We felt we found the perfect combination at Honua Kai. We selected the studio with the ocean view. It had a perfect vista of the resort, pools and ocean. What a treat to watch whales playing just offshore during our breakfast on the lanai. The rooms are extremely well decorated with a luxurious but casual feel. We enjoyed the kitchen and the spaciousness of the room and the bed was especially comfortable. The various pool areas were great and of course we also enjoyed the beach too. We frequented the on-sight bar and restaurant almost daily, as well as the store for quick purchases. There is a grocery store across the main road from the resort which was convenient too. The resort booked a whale-watching excursion for us and that worked out just fine. The only downside was that we had a handicapped accessible bathroom so there was no bathtub, but when we inquired, we found out our only other option was a room that didn't have such a nice a view...and we loved our view. We thought the location, the service, the amenities and the value made this resort a perfect choice for a family vacation or a romantic second honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Not for couples”
Reviews.Author: KHinGF
Reviews.Content: In celebration of our 20th wedding anniversary, we decided to go to Maui. Having never been before, I relied entirely upon online searches. We were looking for a nice, up-to-date property in a good location. For the time of year, the consensus seemed to be to stay on the west side to avoid higher winds and more rain showers. I wanted a place with a spa. The name "Hanua Kai Resort and SPA" drew me in right away. I also searched "adult only" Maui resorts. Hanua Kai came up, not claiming to be adult only, but saying that although kids were welcome on the resort, there is an adults only pool to escape to. After checking in and exploring the resort, it was obvious there was no spa and kids were welcome on very square inch of the resort. Huge disappointment to feel the need to escape the resort every day and every night. Rooms were super nice and super clean. Water/sewage treatment across the street is most offensive at night. If you are looking for a nice place to take the kids, this is a good fit. If you re planning a couples getaway or friends getaway, do not consider this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Maui.”
Reviews.Author: Tkliewer
Reviews.Content: Visited Honua Kai twice - July 2010 and 2011. Wonderful both times. Condo units are extremely nice. Views of ocean are great. Close to Lahaina, so, lots of restaurants; however, with a close grocery store, we were able to cook in the condo without problem. Pools are great. Ocean at the resort has wonderful reef so lots to see including sea turtles. Having been on south and north Maui, we really enjoyed this resort this most and will plan on returning.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort”
Reviews.Author: rxforfun
Reviews.Content: This was one of the nicest resorts we have ever stayed in. Rooms were spectacular with new appliances and all the conveniences of a luxury resort. Grounds and pools were outstanding. Staff and service spectacular! Glass doors to lanai open up fully giving condo a feel of openness. Beds were extremely comfortable - had the best sleeps in years. Everything is extremely soundproof. We never heard any other guests. So glad we stayed here!!

Reviews.Title: “Great newer property in Maui”
Reviews.Author: lapwing66
Reviews.Content: Our friends recommended this newer property and we GREATLY appreciated the newer, updated construction and interior decor. We were in the 2nd tower next to the vacant lot which will become the 3rd. We had an interior view, north facing on the 7th floor - top of our part of the tower, but parts of the building are taller. If we returned, would go to the south facing side of the tower to get the sunset. Each tower is laid out in a straight "u", not graduating. This means that one side stares directly into the opposite side, so privacy is not a feature. Fine for vacation, but would get old if we owned. We were happy to get this unit ( from VRBO, managed by Harris Property, not Honua Kai), but it was a little tight with 2 boys on the pullout sofa in the living room. The lanai was large and with the folding window doors adding tremendously to our living space. The trade winds are not a joke, however, and some days, would blow so hard that you had to keep the picture window/doors closed to keep your belongings. Many times we grilled on the lawn, at the property's built-in gas grills and found this fun and communal, meeting many families from Chicago and Canada, this trip. Lovely property. Only downside was the surf. This side of Black Rock has shallow coral, so kids NEED to WEAR water socks to prevent cutting up their feet. Snorkeling was good, but better a little south in front of Westin - our gal at the surf shop sent us there, and it is a quick walk. Boogie Boarding waves were fun. The Ka'anapali beach walk was great for running and connecting to Ka'anapali south of Black Rock. They call the area north of Black Rock at teh Sheraton Upper Ka'anapali, and the area south of Black Rock, Lower Ka'anapali. It was fairly wet during Xmas week, when we were there, so we would get in the car to find sunshine - go SOUTH! We were in Wailea and it was sunny and great! You can usually get parking at the beach access lots, marked with blue road signs. One day, Lower Ka'anapali's beach parking was all taken by 10:00 - bummer! It was whale watching season and we could see blow spouts of water off in the distance but would have needed a whale watching tour to see them up close. Our catamaran captain said the best place for the moms and pups was south of Ka'anapali, near the Maalea harbor. Great trip and lovely accommodations!

Reviews.Title: “Great Condo Rental”
Reviews.Author: Marklaw
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the newer tower at the Honua Kai - what a terrific condo. Fourth floor, two bedrooms, two baths, immense wrap-around balcony with a view of the ocean and a neighboring island. Two of the walls are glass, which opens completely. At night we just closed the screens and left the glass doors open, it was such nice weather. Our particular condo had a fully equipped kitchen and the owners also provided boogie boards, beach chairs, beach towels, all linens, paper goods and a great many other items. The grounds are well maintained and the staff is very friendly. This was a terrific vacation - I had never been to Hawaii before. It was a pleasure staying at the Honua Kai.

Reviews.Title: “BEAU-TI-FUL”
Reviews.Author: SHIRLEY R
Reviews.Content: This resort is very beautiful and wasn't overly crowded when we were there. It is so easy to rent a car and hang out here even if you only have one week. I felt like I was staying in a very high end condo and have never been so relaxed! I thought the 24 dollar resort fee was odd until I realized that meant free underground parking, housekeeping and wifi internet that always worked perfectly. They even provide your soap etc for your fully stocked kitchen and washer and drier. Even our cheaper garden view was lovely. We went in October and paid about 1600 each for flight and hotel for 9 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: 2ayearOntario
Reviews.Content: Our first time in Hawaii. Beautiful property. Our accomodations were wonderful. We had a two bedroom, two bath room. Plenty of room! Super clean! Walking distance to the super market. We had a wonderful time. Would stay longer if we could. Definately not disappointed. I would recommend this property to all my friends. My kids still talk about this property.

Reviews.Title: “Dec 2012”
Reviews.Author: Chris S
Reviews.Content: My two daughters, 1 and 3 years old, and my wife and I stayed at the Honua Kai for a week during Christmas. The rooms, service and pool setting are all top quality. We enjoyed playing in the pool and at the great beach right out front during the day and eating at Dukes restaurant in the evening. The crabnut wontons are awesome! The kids loved the pool and they also have a family fun center so we could go out at night for a peaceful dinner. I give the Honua Kai two thumbs up for people looking for a fun and relaxing trip to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Condo!”
Reviews.Author: SharonB25
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 (kids aged 23, 20 and 13) stayed in a 2BR condo from December 28th til January 4th. We loved our condo! It had a 'resort view' which was mostly of the West maui mountains but we had a small slice of ocean that we could see too. We loved the lanai and how the wall of glass doors opened up all the way so it seemed the lanai was just an extension of the family room! Excellent furnishings and ammenities. Great pool area, beautiful beach. We did not cook but plenty of outdoor grills available and kitchen was very well appointed! We mostly had our breakfast in the condo (cereal) and ate lunch and dinner out. The resort had free valet parking which was a treat! The bathrooms were huge and beautiful, towels plentiful. Great place!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Family Hawaiian Vacation”
Reviews.Author: sunnyskidays
Reviews.Content: We spend five nights staying at Honua Kai in August, 2011 (arranged through Kaanapali Beach Rentals), on the second leg of our 2-week, 3 island Hawaiian vacation. We stayed in #413, a 2 BR oceanview unit with huge wrap-around lanai. The condo was quite lovely and accommodated my family of five nicely. Kaanapali Beach Rentals were great to work with, and I appreciated being able to choose a particular unit ahead of time so I knew exactly what we were getting. The whole complex was beautiful, with gorgeous landscape, fabulous pools and a great beach for swimming, snorkelling or walking. The beds were comfortable (with the exception of the sofa bed....however we found a foam mattress in one of the bedroom closets and put this on top of the sofabed mattress for extra cushioning and this seemed to solve the problem). We ate a couple of times at Dukes restaurant on site, with great options for both adults and kids. Do yourself a favour and do NOT MISS the Hula Pie (one piece was often large enough for the whole family to share). Of our accommodations on the three different Hawaiian islands, this stay at Honua Kai felt the most like a hotel, due to the onsite restaurant and the hotel-style pools. My youngest kids enjoyed the water slide and waterfalls in the largest pool. There is a gourmet market onsite with take-out options, alcohol and some basic groceries. Across the street is a full grocery store. We had an underground parking spot... very handy. One of the fantastic features of this condo was the foldable glass walls in the living room that you open and fold (like an accordion) then you can pull screens across so you have a completely open feel to the room and take advantage of the ocean breezes. The one thing to mention, however, is that with curtains open, and lights on at night, you can see directly into the condo units across from you (as they can see into your condo) as all the buildings are in a "C" formation. If you want privacy, the curtains can be pulled shut, of course. During our stay we drove the Road to Hana in our rental minivan. Be sure to check out the Garden of Eden Aboretum & Botanical Garden along the way. There is a $15 admission charge but it is well worth it. There are numerous interesting plants/flowers to see (all labelled with descriptions), and some unbeatable views out to the ocean and of waterfalls within this nature reserve. You may recognize Keopuka Rock from the opening scene of Jurassic Park . Also, it is a nice rest from all the driving along the windy road (especially if any of your group are prone to car-sickness!!). The following day we took surfing lessons from Maui Wave Riders -- a definite highlight of our two week trip for everyone in the family. That evening we attended the Drums of the Pacific Luau at the Hyatt. Food was good, & the show was fantastic. My kids especially enjoyed the fire-knife-dancer. We spent some time shopping at Whaler's Village, ate at the Hula Grill and spent time snorkelling at the beach and playing in the pools on our two remaining days. If we return to Maui we would definitely consider staying again at Honua Kai.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: ernurseEdmonton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Honua Kai Dec-Jan in a one bedroom suite with 2 teenagers. Hotel very clean, beautifully landscaped, pools nice, Duke's restaurant great! Proximity to beach wonderful! Nothing bad to say about it. If I had to say one thing I wished we could of stayed longer. We didn't know the resort offered free activities until the end of our trip. Grab an activities newsletter from the front desk - yoga, pilates, dancing lessons, scuba, bingo etc, etc. Walked to Whalers Village, Black rock, snorkelled right out front of property. Rented paddle boards from the Westin a few hotels down the way. We will return. Only thing is we were disappointed on New Year's Eve...there was nothing going on. Restaurant closed at 1000 I think!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, not that great.”
Reviews.Author: Kay1630
Reviews.Content: We were very dissapointed with our 14 night stay at this resort. We did not get the view we had reserved and the quality of the resort was terrible. We ended up paying $524.00 per night for a total of 14 nights...This resort is way over priced for the value!! The room was decent, but very small for a 1 bedroom. The kitchen does not come with scissors, a frying pan or dish clothes and dish towels. They give you paper towel, but it is kind of hard to dry dishes with that! Our shower also wasn't working and we never had A/C for 4 days because of a technical problem. You have to pay a mandatory $25/day resort fee, which is to cover housekeeping. The housekeeping at this resort is by far the worst I have ever seen...Most days they never even came to our room and we were ALWAYS out of toilet paper and clean towels. Most evenings when we would get back to our room we would have to call the front desk to get something that housekeeping forgot to re-stock. After being there for 1 whole week they finally vacumned our carpets which were getting quite filthy! There is a restaurant "Duke's" on this resort, which was very good, but other than that you have to drive if you want a meal out. The ocean/beach at this resort is the terrible..lots of rocks and very rough...The beaches along Front Street are much better!! We were not at all impressed with this resort and would never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Good, and Ok”
Reviews.Author: tooka
Reviews.Content: This is our 5th year in Maui and first time at Honua Kai. I too much like everyone else did my research and then some. We decided to book via a management company rather than the hotel. This saved us $250 per night for our 10 night and we were guaranteed an exact room number. We had the opportunity to look at pictures of the room and knew exactly what we were getting. The resort is great. Brand new, across the street (walking distance ) from Times Market (you DO NOT need to stop at costco). Love Aina Market on the premises. Great for your morning coffee, mid day snacks or a quick lunch (panini, wraps & sandwiches). Duke's is great too. But much like a few other reviewers, I found some of the servers to be very rude. And during busy times, the servers were disorganized. The pools are great. My 3yr old had a blast as did my 10 month old. The Lazy River pool is really good for babies. The water is warmer & the poor is generally less crowded. The grounds are beautiful. The beach is nice but not as nice as the beach at Sheraton down the road. There is coral so watch out when walking into the ocean. There is a beach walk that takes you all the way to Whaler's Village. Its a great walk day/evening/night (a little dark when the sun goes down). Its a nice path and I enjoyed walking to & from the Village. Our room was AMAZING. Room 209 in Hokulani Tower is one of the best in its category at the resort. Close to the elevator (yes 2nd floor but we had strollers & the stairs were hard to find and very unclean when I did locate them). The view was wonderful. Room is fully stocked. If you plan on doing lots of laundry like me with 2 boys, buy your own detergent. The detergent in the room is so so. The showers are great, seriously, its like a mini spa break. Be aware that the garbage shoot is located on the 2nd & 10th floor ONLY. We didn't know that & lucked out to be on the 2nd floor. I think this was an important thing for me. I really cant imagine having to drag my garbage on an elevator. I think the one surprising thing for me was that none of the entrance doors to the buildings were automatic or have the option of being automatic. This was a bit of a challenge with a full hand or strollers. The wind: well yes, it was windy even on hot sunny days. To the point that when my son came out of the water he was shivering. Is that reason enough not to go back to Honua kai? Well for us no. But it is winddddyyyy. Wailea is sunny and less windy, but honestly at this point of our lives, with 2 young kids, we need an apartment type of hotel. I like newer buildings & appliances. I looked at a couple of hotel apartments in Wailea or Kihei, but either they were not on the beach or just too old & awful or adult oriented or had very small pools or were just too expensive during the holidays ($1700/nite for a 2br). SO, am I compromising by choosing to return to Honua Kai? No, I don't think so. Overall, we really enjoyed our selves & recommend Honua Kai to everyone, especially families with children. Also, I rented tons of baby equipment & toys (car seats, high chair, nice wooden crib, baby monitor, strollers....) from Easy Travel www.easytravelhi.com They were wonderful. Everything clean & like new. It was all set up prior to our arrival. car seats at car rental location! Free delivery & pickup. SOOOOO nice. They can even do your shopping for you & have the fridge stocked before you arrive. And as always we visited Lahaina Grill just off of Front street. We LOOOVEEEE this restaurant. Go, enjoy Maui.

Reviews.Title: “All you need”
Reviews.Author: seikokai
Reviews.Content: We booked this property through a private owner and were delighted with the result. Booking privately resulted in a lower rate for our room without the need to pay the daily resort fee of $25 (that said, we did need to pay for our parking which is normally included in the resort's daily fee). Our room was well appointed and contained everything a family on vacation requires. The property is relatively new and everything is still in top shape. Good beach access, very close to a decent supermarket, adequate albeit not large fitness room, and a great pool and bbq area made for a very nice stay. The rating for the "service" category below has been left blank as we didn't need to use the concierge service once during the trip. The front desk is available to those who have booked privately. Check in/out was quick and easy.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic condo option in Maui”
Reviews.Author: 40Rouge
Reviews.Content: We spent Christmas week at the Honua Kai and it was fantastic. It's a great place to vacation if you're looking for a private condo instead of a hotel resort. PROS: nice units with great bathrooms and kitchens, across the street from a grocery, great amenities, lots of awesome pools, a central location to Lahaina, Kaanapali, and Kapalua resorts, Duke's restaurant is awesome. - CONS: a small beach which can seem detached from the room, a lot of kids running around, the complex as a whole is massive, only one restaurant on property. OVERALL: a great option for a condo. Great for families. For more of a resort feel with things in walking distance, maybe look at the Kapaanali resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: TripLover113
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Honua for our first visit to Maui. A friend had recommended it and we were not let down by their recommendation. We would definitely stay there again on a return trip to Maui! CONDOS: We stayed in a studio ocean-view. It was the perfect size for my mother and I and when we arrived it was clean and well-prepared. We loved the fact that the doors to the balcony open up all the way so that you can gets tons of fresh air if desired. The kitchen was nice and included everything we needed for our stay. The bathroom was lovely -- nice shower and bath, large sink area, etc. The one thing that wasn't ideal was the view. We could see the ocean from our balcony, but because the studio was across the courtyard and the pools from the beach, you're definitely not right up by the ocean. Still a relaxing view though. STAFF: The staff were all very pleasant and helpful. The only problem we had with them during our stay was when we got up in the wee hours of the morning to travel to Haleakala and the valet was not there to get our car for us!! We had even asked multiple times the day before to make sure someone was going to be there. We still don't know if he was away from the desk for 20 minutes to smoke, grab food, use the restroom, etc., but it was annoying being told that someone would be there and then having to wait for 20 minutes to get our car. FOOD: We never ate at the restaurant but it looked lovely. We did, however, get food from the cafÃ© once or twice. Obviously, it was all extremely expensive but it was quite good and a quick way to grab a bite to eat. We found it better to drive into town to the grocery store and just buy food to make from there. BEACH: The beach was lovely, but there isn't a TON of room to relax on it since the strip of sand isn't terrible large. Plus, the places that you can sit out there are on a slope so that's not terribly comfortable. It's a lovely setting though and we even saw turtles and whales right from the beach! POOLS: The pools were lovely. We went in January so it wasn't terrible crowded and not hard to find a pool chair. I could see it being more of a problem when it was more crowded. OVERALL: A lovely stay that we would love visiting again!!

Reviews.Title: “Super Resort-y”
Reviews.Author: Julia F
Reviews.Content: This was our first experience traveling at this type of property, we are usually the smaller cottage type travelers (and usually frequent the Big Island or Oâ€™ahu) but with a new baby and the combination of another family, this was a great option. We stayed over the Thanksgiving week in a two bedroom suite. Heads-up, it was SUPER WINDY and the beach is rocky so any water time for the kids was at the pool, and even then it was chilly. But hey, it was November. We did find more success (no wind) so we could paddle board when we ventured out to Puamana Beach and Launui Poko and better baby-in-the-water time at â€˜Baby Beachâ€™ closer to Lahina. When asking about local food options the concierge, while helpful, seemed to direct us to places for â€˜touristsâ€™ which was annoying. We ended up hitting up the Foodland and Fish Market instead. We were dinged a couple of times for having things on the lani. They talk about the lani being an extension of the living space and I do understand why they donâ€™t want them all â€˜junked upâ€™ but it felt a little off-putting and sterile, like we really couldnâ€™t LIVE there. Obviously someone was annoyed by the 'clutter' - a few toys and drying bathing suits on chairs tucked under the table. AND - it felt creepy to know we were being watched. There are washer dryers but no simple clothes racks or retractable lines in the bathrooms which would offer a great alternative instead of dinging guests. All the kids were on different schedules so it was nice to have the option for some to be napping and others to be out doing stuff. There are a lot of beautiful common spaces but they didnâ€™t seem to get much use, maybe due to there being no shade? It would have been nice to be able to enjoy the grounds and not have to bake in the sun. We hit up Dukes a few times and they were great at accommodating our large party. The Thanksgiving dinner was good. We had better luck with fish we bought and cooked ourselves â€“ it was fresher. The kitchens were well appointed and the rooms/beds were EXCELLENT. No problems with noise from the halls or other rooms. Because of the kids and needing some gear, we went with the recommendation of the concierge and used akamaimothers.com - they were FANTASTIC! Beach toys and high chair/bouncy chair! We also rented the beach package (2 folding chairs, snorkel gear, cooler and umbrella) from Honua Kai and bareley used it since we didn't use the property beach. When we ventured out to the other beaches we sat on our own travel towels and found natural shade. Probably didn't need to spend the extra $100 for that. Overall it was a relaxing, modern and well appointed place to have a large family gathering with small children. Be prepared for a little disconnect and plan to get out and about if you want to NOT feel isolated from the place you are visiting. We were only traveling from the mainland and have been to Hawaii A LOT. This property did not have the same â€œAloha, E komo maiâ€� feel that we have experienced elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: 49north1970
Reviews.Content: Just a brief review for all. Spent the holidays at Honua and really enjoyed ourselves. The resort is like an upscale apartment. There are no lobby bars or gift shops which I like. there is Dukes on the beach which is great. Had some issues with our room and even during peak season they accomodated a room change. Staff are as good as you get in any 5 star. For people that want to be waited on this is probably not the place. This is more of a nice apartment/hotel atmosphere rather than a Four Seasons or Fairmont. That being said there is service by the pool....this is definetely a family type resort and great for all ages. Would highly recommend this hotel for couples, families, anyone wanting to chill out. You dont need a car but would highly recommend. The only negative is you sometimes get a woft of the sewage treatment plant at night but you will get that anywhere in N Kanapalli or however you spell it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Family Resort, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Bowles_D
Reviews.Content: The Honua Kai is Kaanapaliâ€™s newest massive beachfront condo/hotel resort located about 5 minutes north of Lahaina and 10 minutes south of Kapalua Golf Resort, and hits a home run in almost every aspect. Two giant towers frame a massive pool/garden complex that includes a BBQ facility, â€œlazy riverâ€�, gardens, waterfalls, and enough green space to allow a small army to catch their share of the dayâ€™s rays. There are two ways to book accommodations â€“ right through the resort itself just as if youâ€™re booking a suite at a hotel, or through a property management company specializing in vacation rental properties. You will pay more by booking directly through the resort; however, booking through the resort also includes amenities like maid service. If you book through a property developer all you pay for is the accommodation â€“ â€œextrasâ€� like a cleaning service come at a hefty premium. We did book through a property manager, and the inconvenience of having to wash towels a couple of times through the week was of small concern considering the money we saved. I canâ€™t speak categorically for every single unit in the resort, but my belief is that this is a condominium-style complex rather than a traditional hotel. Size of the accommodations range from a relatively cozy studio suite and the largest units come with several bedrooms and more than one bathroom, and are capable of accommodating large families. All come with fully-equipped kitchens, five Bosch appliances, full bathroom, a sitting room, and a balcony. The price of a unit obviously depends upon its size and the view. Some of the larger â€œpremiumâ€� accommodations also have their own BBQ grills right on their patios or balconies. Check-in was no more or no less onerous than checking in to a regular hotel; however, each tower had its own check-in desk. Determine whether youâ€™re booked in to Konea or Hokulani , and proceed to the check-in at that tower. Underground parking is included in the rate â€“ at least, it was for our booking. There is no restaurant in the complex per se, but Dukeâ€™s Beach House is located on the property next to the beach, and a small deli-style market is located in the Hokulani tower. The food is excellent, but both are pricey â€“ the kinds of prices that a resort can charge a captive market. However, there is a market directly across the street, and a Safeway at the north end of Lahaina. To put it in perspective â€“ we paid $85 for breakfast for four at Dukeâ€™s. Following the breakfast we went to Safeway and spent $65 for groceries that enabled us to cook breakfast for ourselves for the next six mornings. I can understand not wanting to cook while on vacation, but this was a no-brainer for us. We could make breakfast and clean up in a half hour, while breakfast at Dukeâ€™s took almost an hour by the time we walked to the restaurant, ordered and ate the meal, and then walked back to the suite. And it cost us about 1/5 what it would have to eat at Dukeâ€™s every morning. Each tower has its own small but well-equipped fitness centre â€“ no complaints there at all. The beach activity centre also looked very popular, although we didnâ€™t avail ourselves of its services. To conclude, the Honua Kai is very well located for enjoying the Lahaina-Kapalua corridor. Restaurants and amenities abound all over the area. The beach is large and clean with great views out over Lanai. No matter your budget, youâ€™re sure to find a comfortable unit here that will suit your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Full host of amenities, kids”
Reviews.Author: ihatepavelbure
Reviews.Content: This resort's beautiful grounds has easy access to a beautiful beach and is replete with amenities including a huge workout center, great beachfront restaurant, complimentary valet and about as many pool areas as Minnesota has lakes. We particularly enjoyed the full kitchen and the sliding doors to the lanai which slide completely open to remove any barrier between indoor and outdoor spaces. As a result of all of these amenities, the resort is popular with guests travelling with children and this could be a pro or con for you, depending on your family. Because we are an adult couple without kids, the noise coming from the pools outside our room (and we were on the 7th floor) detracted a bit from the gorgeous and peaceful ocean vista. That said, the view certainly is beautiful and we saw numerous humpbacks breaching offshore from the lanai. The staff were friendly and helpful. Concierge assisted us in dinner and boat reservations without problems.

Reviews.Title: “A SWEET GEM”
Reviews.Author: Cass111
Reviews.Content: As a single traveler, this location is great. You will have alot of families and couples together, but the staff really try to make you feel like you are at home. I enjoyed all of the six days that I was at Honua Kai.The hotel/condo is in a good location, you can walk to other hotels on the boardwalk and there is a grocery store across the street from the condo. I truely had a great experience here! The beach is wonderful! The hotel is well taken care of, and clean. As a single traveler I felt safe at the hotel. Enjoy your vacation at a place that will make you feel like you are at home.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort with easy access to many Island activities.”
Reviews.Author: Vicky D
Reviews.Content: This is a newer resort and had all the modern amenities. It is wonderful for families of all ages. That being said, it is not a place for you if you like a smaller feel with quiet and solitude. The pools are woven through the beach side of the property. There are plenty of hot tubs so there is not much crowding. Staff is helpful yet not pushy. Rooms had just the right touch of Island decor- tastefully done. We were able to cook many meals thanks to 4 BBQs. There are rocks at the beach so get yourself some reef shoes. Once you get out about 50 feet, the snorkleing is great with paddle boarding towards the north and a beach walk to black rock in the south.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property but wind issues!”
Reviews.Author: RtravelG
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Honua Kai with my family for a week in late December. The rooms are very nice - contemporary, clean and well-maintained... though I would have appreciated a few more Hawaiian touches. The resort grounds and pool area are beautiful (but the beach is too rocky to fully enjoy). Having the fantastic Duke's restaurant on property is another advantage. There are a lot of things I liked about Honua Kai, but there's one thing preventing me from recommending it - the WIND! There were very strong winds almost every day of our trip, which made sitting by the pool and swimming far from enjoyable. Just a few miles south on Kaanapali Beach, the wind wasn't nearly as bad. We ventured to the Wailea area for a few days and there was no wind at all. Overall: Besides the wind, Honua Kai is a great place to stay. Perhaps the wind is only an issue during the fall/winter months? But based on this experience and the wind factor alone, I cannot recommend Honua Kai nor would I probably stay there in the future. One more thing - Internet access/wifi is included as part of the daily resort fee, but connection is spotty and it's painfully slow.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: PTT01
Reviews.Content: We went on our honeymoon in June/July 2011. We had high expectations because of the price. Ended up staying 10 nights so we took advantage twice of the "stay 4 nights get 1 night free" deal. Where can we begin. Honua Kai was fantastic... Modern, Clean, Very well taken care of. We had an ocean-view studio, which was perfect for a couple. You are tucked on the inside of the U shape looking out at the Ocean. Every room comes with a nice patio with a very cool/modern screen or solid door. The room was immaculate. The service was excellent. We felt pampered. The cleaning crew came in every day and made it look like we had just arrived. You couldn't hear any of your neighbors. The pools were fantastic. 3 of them. And yes, there are families, but it's not one of those places where there are kids all over the place and you can't get any peace and quiet. Quite the opposite. There was an occasional kid in the pool but it was soooo peaceful. Pool chairs and umbrellas were plentiful, as well as poolside service (drinks all day, haha) from Duke's restaurant. Duke's is a great place. Solid Hawaiian food right at your hotel. Great sunset views. Friendly staff. We ended up their after coming home from dinner (dined there twice) and had appetizers and drinks almost every night. They also have a helpful concierge guy who can help you plan any adventure you need - surfing, scuba-diving, bike riding down the mountain, anything... Location was great - close to Lahaina but not in the city. The beach was nice sand - don't expect waves though. The water is crystal clear and you can see fish RIGHT next to the hotel on the beach if you have a snorkel or goggles!!! Look - I know its cheesy to give 5 stars for every category, but I kind of had to. We couldn't find fault.... TOTALLY WORTH THE PRICE. I just wish I could do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it so much that we became owners”
Reviews.Author: melhoff25
Reviews.Content: newest place in Ka'anapalii and the builders really cut zero corners. beautiful property and rooms are brand new with some of them not even sold yet. staff has always been very accommodating and the location is pretty unbeatable, with a path that leads right into lahaina around blackrock. Also great snorkeling in the mornings right off of the beach. have stayed all over Maui, in Wailea and other places in ka'anapalii, but no other property offers the combination of room size, location and luxury that Honua Kai does

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Vacation for Extended Family of 14!”
Reviews.Author: KacieRenee
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to Maui for Christmas this year and booked our stay at the Honua Kai. Upon arrival, we were not disappointed! The buildings are beautiful and the staff is FANTASTIC! We were on the ground level which meant we had a patio, patio furniture, and a lawn! Inside, there are TVs in every room, a full kitchen (with dishwasher), laundry room, shower and tub, and large, wonderful beds! There's even a long dining room table. They provide all your soaps, shampoos, dish detergent, laundry soap, dryer sheets, etc. There are so many pools at the hotel - a water slide, shallow rock pool, multiple jacuzzis, cabanas, barbeques, etc. beyond the pools, there is a large grassy area and then the beach! It really is a prime location. There is also a restaurant, Duke's, with amazing food and a beautiful view. Our experience with the front desk personnel was beyond fantastic. They always had a smile on their faces and were willing to help you with anything! All around an incredible place.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Honeymoon, Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DesertCanyoneer
Reviews.Content: Honua Kai far exceeded our expectations. We honeymooned in Maui and spent 9 nights at Honua Kai in unit HH0424 in the HH building. The staff and service are excellent. Each day the room service would freshen up our room and leave personalized notes and well wishes for the day which my wife and I thought was very unique and thoughtful. They also ensured we had plenty of complimentary shampoo, conditioner, lotion, soap, body wash, and dishwasher/laundry detergent. The room was great and the suite amenities (full kitchen w/ appliances and cook/serving ware plus washer/drier unit) cut down on luggage and saved us a ton of money and time spent eating out. As an aside, we found that it would be cheaper to buy groceries at the Safeway in Lahaina/Kaanapali than at Walmart or Costco (at least for two people) as long as you have/sign up for a frequent shopper card (free). Back at the Honua Kai, the grills available, though slightly away from the main lobby, are great and convenient. There is an amazingly friendly black/white cat that loves to hang out (not beg) around the grill. The cost relative to other high end hotels (Westin, etc.) is low and value higher in our minds. The grounds are immaculate. The snorkelling right off the adjacent beach and headed south is great as well as the short 20 minute walk to the famed Black Rock did not disappoint. We had a one-bed mountain view suite and it was great waking up to the sunrise over West Maui Mountain. As a note, some people may find the din of traffic slightly annoying on the east side rooms as these face the main highway passing through West Maui but they are at least 200 yards away and were not a bother to us. Also, contrary to most hotels, the rooms next to the elevator corridors were as quiet as other rooms would be many doors away. There is a $25/night service charge that included internet, parking, and other amenities. We never had a problem with internet access or parking. As many other reviews mention, wind is somewhat constant here, but we found it pleasant for the most part and I would expect other customers/reviewers who found this a bother should have already read about weather patterns in Maui from guidebooks and expected it. Without a doubt, my wife and I will absolutely stay at Honua Kai on our next trip to Maui without even considering other options.

Reviews.Title: “My honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: RustyCanuck
Reviews.Content: Spent my honeymoon here, well one week of it. What a great place. Very much like a condo, they have barbq for you to use! The restaurant, The Duke, is really good, but a bit pricey. Rooms are big and well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “I could complain but why bother...? too much was fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: dew192
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and our 2 kids (aged 3.5 and 1) stayed at Honua Kai Dec. 3-13. We booked Unit 545 through VRBO, property managed by Maui Blue Properties. Booking - we saved a bundle going through VRBO. Seems like the only difference is that we didn't get daily cleaning service. The Maui Blue folks were great to work with, super responsive and helpful. The property manager met us onsite, got us settled and offered other assistance. The Unit was stocked with beach chairs and toys and all the necessities like dishsoap, dishwasher soap and laundry detergant, cleaning products/vacuum, broom, etc. Cupboards even had spices, oils, etc. so we didn't need to buy any of that. And they arranged a pack n play for my daughter. The Unit - 545 is a 2 bedroom, 2 full bath unit with an amazing ocean view. It looked just like the photos. High quality and spacious (no fish eye camera shots to make it look bigger). Nicely decorated, loved the kitchen, comfy beds, etc. It was close to the elevator which made it easier to head back for forgotten items! The resort - absolutely stunning. Beautiful property. We used all the pools but with our little kids mainly stuck to the really shallow one which my 1.5 yr old could play in on her own (with me right next to her of course :)), and the sand bottom one next to the fountains. The hot tubs were also a huge hit - not too hot for kids with the bubbles off. We had coffee at the market every morning. After the first day they remembered our names and orders. The kids helped feed the Koi fish most mornings. We ate several times at Dukes - awesome location and reasonably priced with a large enough menu that you weren't eating the same things each time. They were also very family friendly (e.g. when my daughter dumped her macaroni on her self and the floor each time, they didn't bat an eye). Beach - so great to be right on a gorgeous beach. We used the pools more than the beach but made a beach visit most days. It is pretty quiet right out front of the resort unlike other resorts. And the boardwalk was great! Staff - everyone was friendly and polite. No issues at all. There was too much that was wonderful about this property to complain about it. Almost every day my husband and I said "When we come back next year...". If I WAS going to comment on anything it would be this: 1. the dryer took ages - but really this is not a big deal. I would just turn it on before we went out and it would be done when we got back. 2.yes, its windy but this isn't specific to Honua Kai. The whole part of the island is like this. Again, no biggie. In fact, it kept us a bit cooler on the hot days. Neither of these things would prevent us from going back or recommending it to friends. All in all this is a very reasonably priced resort for the amount and quality of what you get. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “We love this place”
Reviews.Author: JKCROSBY
Reviews.Content: My husband and I both really loved this place and will go back again. Everyone was very friendly from the bell captains to the maintence personnel, they were all super! As for the resort, the details were first class and very clean. We were in an efficiancy (#823) and was high enough to see over the other parts of the building to Moliki as well as a great ocean view. The room was super clean and first class. We left the wall of windows (AKA the patio doors) open all night to hear the ocean but closed the screen wall so no bugs. The room includes a large bath with a large seperate tub from the large shower, washer/dryer with large entryway. Full kitchen with granite countertops, island, nice tiled backsplash - this is super so you can have everything from cold drinks on hand to being able to prepare a full meal. The resort location was great, in the mix but not on the busy Kannapoli beach.

Reviews.Title: “Once you stay here it will be hard to go anyplace else.”
Reviews.Author: LindyfromCanada
Reviews.Content: If you like the convenience of a deluxe full kitchen, laundry, huge bathroom in a suite located on an oceanfront site with different pools and areas around the pools, nice hot tubs and a great restaurant on site, this is the place for you. Not cheap, but if you like to make your own breakfast and dinner or barbeque on the supplied barbeques, you can save enough dollars to make up for the extra cost. The resort fee is $25/day non negotiable on top of the rate you are paying. The Times supermarket a short 10 min. walk across the street has everything you need. A 1 bedroom also has a pull out couch in the living room so it makes it nice for a family or a cozy place for 2 couples. You'll have to toss a coin for who gets the deluxe bedroom! The entire front of the unit is a glass accordian wall which opens the suite completely to the large patio which has a large dining table and chairs and usually a couple of patio chairs as well. Staff were very friendly and accommodating when we experienced a problem with our a/c. We were upgraded to an even bigger suite located closer to the oceanfront.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: Oli0612
Reviews.Content: We booked a resort view 1-bedroom suite. The first room they gave us was facing a new construction site next door. I wouldn't mind a park, a garden, walkpaths, but a construction? NO. So I called them and asked for another room. They gave me a room in the other building, so walked there and checked it out. It was on the ground floor, but at least it looks at a little pool and big grass area. So we took it, but they didn't offer any help for our luggages to move to the other building and only gave a small apology for the 1st room's view. The front lady sounded like she doesn't know the some rooms look at a construction site (which I don't really believe). The room itself was big. Ours was the 1-bedroom, but we had 1.5 living room, with 3 tvs. The bathroom was big. It kind of reminds me of the suites in Las Vegas. The resort rooms are actually on sale, so when you arrive, you feel like you're going into an apartment suite with the full kitchen. A few complaint was the shower and the A/C. Apparently hot water runs out (I know its Hawaii, but that doesn't mean people don't shower in hot water). And you can't adjust the A/C, can't change temperature, can't turn it on/off. We called front desk for help at night, but they said their technician is gone for the day. Shouldn't they have people on site at all times? The pool was nice, the resort ground was very peaceful. a minute or so to the beach. excellent sunset views. But for the price I paid, I was expecting a little bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and will return!”
Reviews.Author: klynns24
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel for our first trip (wedding-moon)to Maui. The location was perfect, the setting was even more beautiful than the pictures. We stayed in a studio, which was perfect for us. It was a huge room with spectacular views of the ocean and the property. The kitchen was gorgeous and so was the bathroom. The only complaint I had with the room, was the floors were dirty. But this was to be expected being near a beach. We just kept on our flip flops and washed our feet before bed, otherwise your feet would be black from the carpet and floor. Housekeeping was great, and so were the staff. The valet guys gave great recommendations for places to go for places to eat, and shop. They know great places for local farmers markets, so don't be afraid to ask! There was always room at the pools during the day. The hottubs were always crowded with kids, so that may be a turnoff for some. The pool kiosk closes early, so if you want towels or other beach gear go before 5pm. Personally, we didn't use the hottubs for that reason, but it wasn't a deal breaker. Duke's was a bonus for those days we didn't want to leave the resort. We're planning on going back in September!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property!”
Reviews.Author: hms16
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my recent stay and WOW what a beautiful hotel! The service, location, facilities, etc... were all wonderful! I choose this based on the comments here on Tripadvisor and let me tell you that you will not be disappointed! We spent out first 5 nights at Honua Kai and loved every moment of it and are already talking about when we will go back. I have stayed at other Kaanapalli area hotels and this hotel has the best and most thought out landscaping and grounds! We walked to other hotels and looked at others in the area and we kept saying that the Honua Kai was the best one. First off like I already mentioned the grounds..... WOW.... very lush and tropical and beautifully planned. So many pools to chose from. The beautiful water falls thru out the pool, hidden gem hot tubs and then the water slide. I loved the design instead of other hotels where everyone sits around the pool and sees one other this is all curvy with so many choices to sit and different views to look at! Second the lanais are too die for! By far some of the biggest lanai's we saw. The Westin Kaanapalli Villas are next to the HOnua Kai and those lanai's are tiny.... they even had one that barely 2 people could sit on. The hOnua Kai lanai's expand the entire length of the living room and to top it off they completely slide wide open on both sides and brings the outdoors in. There is a dining table with 4 chairs, 2 sitting chairs and a table and still plenty of space. And the banister was all glass so nothing blocks your awesome view! Third loved that the property was big yet they managed to make it feel initimate and not huge. Some hotels it feels like it takes 20 minutes to walk from the pool to your room.... here it did not yet the grounds are huge. A major plus with the 2 towers was that each tower had their own parking garage with close parking to the elevators (if you do not want to use valet). Now for the rooms..... beautiful! We had a 1 bedroom Oceanview room and it was just lovely! The kitchen was beautiful and fully stocked, the bedrooms were very nice and the beds very comfy! As for the bathrooms they are huge! The only negative I have is that there is not enough closet space or dresser space... I ended up using the closet in the living room area while my husband used the one in the bedroom. After our 6 days I was sad to leave and head over to Wailea.... even wanted to cancel our hotel there and stay the remaining part of the stay at the Honua Kai! You will not be disappointed if you chose this hotel. I know from other reviews I was leery on the kid situation as I was traveling with my husband to celebrate our 5 year anniversary.... yes there were so kids but I di dnot find it bad at all! If you do not like it they have an adult pool so no worries! I would also suggest if you want to bring your own cocktails down to the pool no one frowns upon it.... just keep it in a cooler bag and make sure to pick up some plastic cups!! There is a Safeway grocery store about 3 miles from the hotel you can stock up on beer, wine, cocktails! Another suggesstion.... the hotel has grills you can use. Go down the street to The Fish Market and pick up some fresh fish (caught that day) and grill them for a nice dinner at the resort and eat on your lanai or at the beach. Also the coffee they put in the rooms is to die for!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Condo Resort”
Reviews.Author: cbpalla
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom condo. The condo is new so it is fresh and clean with modern amenities. The beach is right out front and so are the pools. Full high-end open kitchen with granite counters, Bosch fridge, microwave, range, dishwasher, double sink, washer/dryer. There is a large dining room table that we used for our computers. Lots of outlets. Pull out sofa, chair, two 32" TV's with lots of channels. Large balcony with large table and chairs. There is a $25 fee each day that includes parking, wifi, beach towels, fitness room, etc. There is an amazing deli called Aina in the hotel, and Dukes Restaurant on the beach is so fun! Staff are very friendly. We were there in December so the weather was very windy all the time, lots of clouds and some rain. Close to Lahaina but 40 minute drive to anywhere else like Macy's, Costco, Wailea. Lots of golf courses nearby. We would stay there again if we wanted a relaxing trip but prefer Waikiki for more action and guaranteed sun. This hotel is similar to Trump Waikiki - excellent!

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: simonweird
Reviews.Content: probably my favorite hotel in the world. full kitchens. Friendly staff and maids. Loved it. Clean. Beautiful. Multiple pools. Fantastic snorkeling right off the beach. Lazy river needs more of a current and to be a complete circle, but i am a lazy river snob.

Reviews.Title: “very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: kittiesnest
Reviews.Content: For our first trip to Hawaii, I heavily relied on Tripadvisor reviews to find where we wanted to stay. Since Honua Kai was #1 for Lahiana, it was our choice. Got a great deal through Costco travel for a 1 bedroom partial ocean view condo. One snag we experienced is we booked a "1 bedroom" but ended up getting a "studio" instead. Not sure if the mix-up was Costco's fault or Honua Kai's, but since it was just my husband and myself traveling it was not a big deal. We stayed in room 231 in the Konea tower.
