We requested a higher up floor but they claimed this was the best they could do. We could (barely) see the ocean peaking through the palm trees in the view but it was still a WAY better view than the "mountain" (aka, sewage plant) view. The good: EXCELLENT place to stay, the room was very clean, modern and well done. We had maid service every day to replace towels and clean a bit, they changed the sheets every 3 days. Everyday they brought more laundry and dish detergents if you needed them as well as more coffee. Location was pretty good but not ideal. I did not experience the "cold spots" other reviewers complained about. It would be better to be further south, more towards black rock. Didn't go in the pools, they were packed with children. If I had kids I would DEF return here as having laundry and a kitchen would be ideal. The beach was lovely, beautiful views. VERY rocky, do not enter water without water shoes or snorkel fins. We did snorkel off of the beach here and and saw many sea turtles. Spinner dolphins were hanging out more south down at Black Rock (they travel in pods of HUNDREDS, if you see spinner dolphins you will see LOTS of spinner dolphins). Dukes was pretty good. I enjoyed dining early and getting the $25 tasting menu. One tip: I ordered my filet "medium" and it came "well", so maybe order "Medium rare" if you want a real medium. The Hula Pie is awesome! Skip the risotto. My husband fell inlove with the Maui brewing company bikini blonde ale. The girls who are the hostesses are TERRIBLE but ignore them... once you get past those young d-bags the servers are nice. The bad: smokers!!!! This is a NON-SMOKING resort, why do smokers have to ruin it??? Despite this being a strict non-smoking place we had smokers in the room next door to us who chain smoked on their balcony. THIS IS NOT ALLOWED. If by chance you are trapped next to a smoker, complain often. The resort will ask them to stop and tell them it's not allowed (and allegedly, hit them with hefty $$$ cleaning fees for smoking) but the smokers generally put their cigs out when the management is there and then light up again as soon as they leave. I know smokers have the right to smoke, but not at a non-smoking resort. Hawaiian law dictates smokers must be 30' away from a public building to light up. PLEASE, if you are a smoker stay someplace that actually allows it instead of subjecting non-smokers to the health impacts of your cigarettes. Yes, I am a balcony over but I can smell your cigarette smoke like you are 2' away from me. It is disgusting. The turds in room 229 and their smoking ruined the last 3 days we spent here as we could not enjoy our own balcony. All in all, we had a lovely stay (minus the smokers) and we would probably stay here again. We would ONLY book partial ocean or ocean views though, they are worth the extra money.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: TravelbyV
Reviews.Content: While visiting Maui for the first time last week we stayed at the Honua Kai. Let me tell you this place exceeded my expectations. It was clean, accommodations were beautiful and were well maintained, and the place was equipped with whatever we wanted to do. The pools are great for kids and kids at heart, the beach is right there with beautiful sunsets. Duke's is a wonderful restaurant- great food, and fun happy hour. The rooms are nice and having a kitchen was wonderful- fully equipped! We made a great fish taco lunch one day and had breakfast everyday in our hotel. A grocery store is nearby- within walking distance for food. And please go to the concierge at the hotel with any requests for excursions or places to eat. Those people know their stuff and you will not be disappointed with their recommendations! We used them for all of our activities and enjoyed every one they recommended! We couldn't have chosen a better place! Stay here you will love it!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding resort. Will come back”
Reviews.Author: Bays1234vacation
Reviews.Content: We stayed here mid dec and were blown away with this resort. All complaints about smell, service, house keeping etc are from people who expect a full service hotel. This is a condo resort and should be considered it before coming. It is windy but so is the entire island. Rooms and pools are amazing. Entire layout and gym etc is great. Huge balcony to relax. We stayed in a 2 bedroom mountain view and loved it. We will be back. It is a resort for family vacations and not for single and couples. Lots of children. All we could think about was how much fun our 8 month old boy will have here in a few years.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: Jjnelson22
Reviews.Content: Place is very nice. The rooms are very nice. Dukes is a great place to eat, and it's right on the property. The beach is a little rocky to swim, but if you walk down about 100 yards it's a little better. The pools are great. Great place if you are bringing kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMommyOK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a week's vacation in Maui and stayed at Honua Kai. We stayed in a 1 bedroom overlooking the pool and with a decent view of the ocean. Since it was just the two of us we had more than enough room. Probably could have done a studio and been fine. After reading some of the reviews I was nervous about the staff but had nothing but positive experiences with everyone who worked at the hotel. The activity concierge was very helpful in booking us on a whale watching excursion and giving us tips on doing our own trip to Hana. Also she pointed us to the Westin next door to try out snuba before we booked a trip. I also have to say the valet team was terrific! We loved having both Dukes and 'Aina Market as options for eating or to pick up food etc. We did run to the grocery store across the street so that we could make breakfast and coffee before going out for the day. We kept our doors open a lot if we were in the room and ate out on the balcony. We didn't ever go to the pool but did rent lounge chairs from the hotel and enjoy the beach! I also loved having the beach walk right in front of the hotel. The only issue is they don't currently have a spa but believe they are getting one in the future?

Reviews.Title: “Very nice people, nice rooms, nice pool area”
Reviews.Author: Girlnamedjulie
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from a week long vacation at the Honua Kai I am torn at what to say. The service was great, everyone person we encountered was very polite and very helpful and courteous. The rooms, lobby and gardens are very very clean and really beautiful. We had a Studio Ocean View and a 2 Bedroom Resort View. The studio was very nice and we had an awesome view of the entire pool area, Dukes, and the ocean. Gorgeous. The room was clean and really very nice with washer/dryer/jet tub/shower, very nice tile work, and most everything you would need in the kitchen to make meals, drinks. The hotel even provides, dish soap, paper towels, coffee and filters, laundry detergent, bounce, shampoo, lotion, conditioner from Aveda, and great hair dryers (really, you don't need to bring yours~) The lanai was furnished with enough chair space and tables for 6 of us. The 2 bedroom was very nice, very clean, and had the same ammenities but it came with WIND and when I say wind really it is like a hurricane, there is no way anyone could have sat out on the lanai as you could barely even open the door without blowing away. The whole resort was absolutely gorgeous with a GREAT pool area (especially if you have kids, they would think they had died and gone to heaven) several pools, perfect temp, slides, water falls, kids water toys, lots of chairs and umbrellas. The beach in front of the hotel is awesome and you can walk either way for miles either on the beach or the beach walk. This resort only has Dukes restaurant or Aina Marketplace (which is a small type store/deli) the Aina Marketplace has exceptionally good and fresh wraps, sandwiches, pizza, coffee's, ice cream, etc the service was GREAT and the food was even better. Dukes was less than impressive (we actually picked this resort because it had a Dukes, as we LOVE Dukes on Waikiki) we were very disappointed, the food was fine but expensive for what you received and the service could use improvement putting it nicely. These are the only two places on site. There is a grocery store that has everything right across the street. This is a beautiful resort at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “My first condo experience, and I loved it (thanksgiving week)”
Reviews.Author: fanatix
Reviews.Content: We decided to try a condo this time in Maui primarily to have a washer/dryer in our unit, but also to save on eating out. After reading reviews on Trip Advisor, I started searching around for the best place to rent - tihs was August. We had already booked airline tickets for Thanksgiving week. I wanted a very nice 1 bedroom place with a reasonable price in Ka'anapali. I finally decided on Honua Kai. But, then I found i difficult to find a 1 bedroom unit! I finally found a studio for a very reasonable price through Harris Realty for the 3 of us - 2 adults and one 7 year old. Melissa of Harris Hawaii Property Management (www.harrishawaii.com) was very professional and easy to deal with, and answered all my questions before I booked my unit - #221 Konea Tower. BTW, their rates were less expensive than going through Honua Kai direct. The only additional fee we had to pay was for parking ($10/day). We arrived in the evening, and Brooke, from Harris Hawaii, greeted us as soon as we got out of the car (I called him 15 minutes earlier, and he gave us some info about the resort, and then took us upstairs to our unit and made sure we were all set before leaving. Now, this unit is nestled in the corner of the south inside part of the Tower, and it has a nice view of the courtyard and there is an ocean view as well! I loved this unit! The lanai was my favorite part. The glass folding lanai doors allow you to open them completely, or you can just open the door on the far right. These doors were wonderful! They also had a screen, but we never used the screen - we simply pulled the light curtain closed to keep the little nats out. I sat out there on the lanai every morning with my husband for our breakfast and we also ate out there in the evening. It was on the shady side, which made it quite comfortable. The washer/dryer in the unit was so WONDERFUL to have on vacation - no more trying to wash clothes in the sink! The beach at Honua Kai is quite short from the top of the beach to the water, and there were not a lot of people using it. It did get deep quite fast (10 feet or so), so not great for young children. But, it was very beautiful. We used the pool more, and one of them (at the Konea Tower) was heated. My family really enjoyed the pool! The only thing missing was a bar to order drinks from! We also visited the other tower and the little store they have on the first floor, which was pricey. We ate at Duke's Restaurant the first night we arrived, but were unimpressed. It was expensive and the food was very par. The Times Grocery Market was directly across from the resort, and you can easily walk there (but alas, we always took the car, since we bought more than what we could carry) and we loved the convenience. It's actually about 100 yards away, as there is a parking lot and an empty field that you have to walk past to get to the market. There's also a few other little shops there as well. The gym in the Konea Tower was nice, except it did get crowded at times. My husband thought it was too warm in the gym, especially with more people in it, but I was fine. I used it just once. There were only 3 treadmills, and these were used the whole time I was there. They had free weights, other aerobic equipment, as well as standard gym equipment. The grounds of the Honua Kai were well manicured and gave a very nice resort feel to the entire place. They had a large fire pit at the Konea Tower. The other tower had a nice fishpond. There is a concierge available, but I didn't really use them, except to ask a favor, which the concierge gladly did for me. There is also a front desk person, but I only interacted with him to pay for my parking at the beginning of my stay. There were a few minor negatives about Honua Kai, but these are not related to the specific unit we rented. First, the BBQs were sometimes very difficult to start. Sometimes, it wouldn't start at all. They cleaned the BBQs every day, but they were very difficult to light. We came across this problem both nights we wanted to BBQ. Other people around us were also unable to light the BBQ as well. Also, the Bosch dishwasher is noisy, compared to the dishwasher we have at home (all units have the same appliances). Considering we had a studio, it was more obvious to us. During this time, we did experience more windy conditions at the beach than what we expected. But, this seemed to be prevalent in the Whaler's Village area as well. We went up north to Kapula and it was REALLY WINDY there - glad we did not stay up there! Overall, I really enjoyed this condo experience. I see this place more as a hybrid. It has a resort feel, but the units are condos. This made for a very good experience, since we were so used to staying at hotel resorts. This place is very new - opened around 2010, and many units are still being sold, and we enjoyed having brand new everything all around us. The place was also quiet. There didn't seem to be many people around, and really the most people we ever saw were at the Duke's Restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Tonae at the Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: Niki M
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from the Honua Kai over the Thanksgiving Holiday. At check in I met Tonae and he knows what customer service means. He was very polite and kind and always greeted us with a warm smile. I also had the experience in meeting the General Manager Steven rose who was great also! With people like Tonae and a beautiful spot like the Honua Kai we will definately be returning and renting the 2 bedroom and 3 bedroom condos we enjoyed so greatly! l

Reviews.Title: “awesome...”
Reviews.Author: stss
Reviews.Content: This place is really great. Stayed in 2 bedroom and it was 2 FULL rooms and baths, one had a bathtub. Very very nice. Everything was new and well-kept. Like other people say it is ridiculously windy and somewhat more than other places nearby. But the view is great, the grounds are great. I'd love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Johnalise
Reviews.Content: Wow, could not ask for a nicer room. Very big, new and clean. Big, soft, comfortable bed, sofa bed, 2 huge TV's with 50 channels, fantastic kitchen and laundry and nice bathroom. The resort facilities and pool is lovely. The only criticism I'd have is similar to other reviews - that for some reason the location is much colder, windier and rains more than everywhere else 2 km on either side. It's bizarre. If only the resort could move locations, it'd be the perfect quintessential place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury 5 star condo resort which is perfect for the right clientele”
Reviews.Author: JourneyHouseTravel
Reviews.Content: We were in the 3 bedroom ocean view. The condo was really nice. All Viking appliances, a sound system we could put our i-pods on that played music throughout, big bathrooms, nice big lanai, comfy bedsâ€¦..It was all very nice. The views are awesome. We could see a couple other islands from the room. The resort had a restaurant called Dukes. It was good tropical style food. I really liked their breakfast and they also did pool service. They had a mahi mahi sandwich that was super yummy. It was kind of expensive but really not as bad as I thought. The resort also had a coffee shop that had groceries and paninis and salads that was pretty good. The resort had grills that some people used at night. The coffee shop sold New York Strip steaks and mahi mahi that you could grill out there. There was usually lots of people out there grilling so sometimes you had to wait. The resort rented snorkel equipment for $35 for the week. You could swim out and snorkel right in front of the resort. I would bring water shoes with. The reef is close so you can touch and I wish I would have had water shoes for when I wanted to put my feet down. There was 0 nightlife so this is more for the families with kids that dont need any nightlife. We made our own, playing cards on the balcony but got told we were too loud. :) Parking was easy and when you went to the grochery store, the bell hop would carry your grocheries up to the condo for you. I didnt know how I was going to manage that by myself. It was about 2 minutes from Whalers Village. Good restaurants and shopping down there. All in the all, it was a very nice trip. I was with my friends and all their kids so it was perfect but if it was just my husband and I then I would have picked somewhere else. Oh and it's not a "resort and SPA" ....there is no spa. They make appointments for you next door at the Westin Villas...... The spa at the Westin Villas was nice, but nothing to write home about. (ie theres not hot tub or plunge pools in the waiting area or snacks. There's just nice lounge chairs and a steam room)

Reviews.Title: “Coldest spot in Maui”
Reviews.Author: SimiSarah
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this in hopes that other travelers who are looking for a quintessential hot Hawaiian vacation are not disappointed as we are after staying at the Honua Kai. After spending a week RIGHT ON THE BEACH IN KIHEI FOR THE SAME DAILY RATE as the Honua Kai, we were beyond disappointed to find that our fancy resort was situated in what seems to be the only cold spot in Maui. It's is always windy here and on days when it's calm and sunny in Lahaini or Kihei, it's windy and sometimes raining here. The resort itself is nice and the rooms are very well decorated and I don't have any complaints about the resort itself. I just wanted to advise other travelers so that they know what they're getting when they come here. We are traveling with friends who have never been to Maui and and they are SO bummed that it isn't hot here. They didn't rent a car because all they wanted to do was lounge by the pool or at the beach but it's too cold so they ended up renting a car to go to other beaches in the area. It's a lot of money to spend to not get what you want so if you want a warm spot, this isn't your place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property, but not for couples IMO”
Reviews.Author: ddscorp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Honua Kai on our honeymoon for 10 days from Nov. 14 through Nov. 23 2011. The room was nice and clean and the grounds were well kept. We were satisfied with the accomidations once we were moved from the original room they gave us. We paid for an ocean view and we were put in a rear parking lot view, which we immediately complained about and were moved to an upgraded 2 bedroom suite from a 1 bedroom. This didn't make much sense to me being there were only 2 of us, but it was nice. My biggest complaint would be the wind. It is very windy on that part of the Island. Everyday it was just wind, wind and more wind nonstop. I'm talking activity cancelling wind. Yes, activities we booked like the zipline were cancelled, then rescheduled, then cancelled again due to wind. I didn't notice any adult pool as advertised, there were children in every pool. I think this is more geared toward families and/or a couple with small children. No nightlife at all. Seemed at 9pm to 9:30 everynight someone pulled the plug out and it was just silent. So quiet one day an elderly man, 60's I'd say; spoke to me and said, "This place is quiet, I been here 2 days and I I feel like I'm in a hospital". If you want silence then this is your place! In all we wouldn't recommend for couples. I would say families or if you have small children this would be a great spot for you. Also, it is a good walk down the path to get to anything like the main strip and such but they do have a nice wood plank path to walk on.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely love the Honua Kai!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany T
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay at the Honua Kai in November. It rain a little the Honua Kai but other part was totally sunny. However, I will still choose to stay at the Honua Kai. We are on our one year aniversary and they gave us a bottle of champaine with glases, which was nice. Maid service was great, they even wash our dishes, which I dont expect them to. Our room faces the mountain view, 8th floor but we were able to see the ocean so we got the best of both world. I can always see rainbow every morning that I wake up. Huge lanai and having a washer and dryer in the unit was a total plus. I was able to do landry every day without walking out side of our room. Food at the Duke was very reasonable in comparison to the the restaurants at the Sheraton. My husband and I got food pison from eating at the Leilani's On The Beach, so beware dont eat medium or rare steak. It will ruin your trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: KazInVan604
Reviews.Content: Was here a week in mid-November, 2011. Newest resort property on Maui, everything is new and clean. Great property, though getting up the coast but still close to Lahaina. Beach here isn't great, but Black Rock is very close and easy to get to. Overall, a very good stay. Would definitely come back here. Full condo unit with full-size fridge, oven/range, dish washer, large granite counter. Good to make some breakfast or a packed lunch for the afternoon. You get the occasional smell from the waste water processing facility nearby, but you mostly just smell it as you drive in and not when you are by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Dick T
Reviews.Content: We had a marvelous time at the Honua Kai. Stayed at the Konea building on the 9th floor in a 3 bedroom condo which was beatiful with amazing views. Luxurios accomodations which exceeded my expectations. Great staff and beautiful grounds. Looked at some of the other properties nearby.... this was definitely the best! I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Konea Tower”
Reviews.Author: wairRwe
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay at a two bedroom condo rather than spend astronomical costs for two separate hotel rooms in Maui. Honua Kai presented a beautiful opportunity for the newest set of condos in Maui and they were beautiful. The two bedroom condo had iews of the ocean, large patios with doors that pushed back and opened the lanai so that the breezes could come in. Granite counters, stainless steel appliances, Bosch washer and dryers in teh unit. Beach towels, boogie boards, beach mats, all were in the unit. Three televisions, one in the living room and one in each bedroom. Beach access and you can walk a long long way. Beautiful sunsets. Concierge services are great! Would visit this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property”
Reviews.Author: ocncapt
Reviews.Content: We recently arrived back after spending 8 nights in an oceanfront 3 bedroom at the Honua Kai. This property is great fro families. The property grounds are beautiful and well maintained. We rented through VRBO and were extremely happy with the unit #450. We had a BBQ on our own private Lanai as well as a big 8 person table on the Lania. Furnishing were upscale. The pools were all well maintained and our 4 year old grand-daughter loved them. The property is convenient to Lahaina and Kanapali beaches. The beach in front of the hotel is nice as well. We had Dinner at Dukes and the food was wonderful. (Try the Seafood Risotto).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort for Families”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTraveler097
Reviews.Content: Our rooms were very well kept up (looks just like the pictures) and the staff was friendly and helpful. The beds were luxurious and we had absolutely everything we needed in the condo - including beach equipment! The only complaint was that the elevators were frequently out of order and the stairs are not located near them so it was rather inconvenient. The pools are beautiful and there are plenty to choose from so they don't get crowded. We were amazed at the number of hot tubs - it was a wonderful outdoor relation area. We would highly recommend these condos to families. We rented through Kaanapali Beach Rentals and were highly satisfied with the amenities they provided (these would vary by rental company/owner).

Reviews.Title: “Not as great as expected!”
Reviews.Author: jlsboyz
Reviews.Content: After much research and I mean I am a perfectionist when it comes to choosing the right place to stay. We have 4 children so we immediately had to eliminate the hotels and go with the condo style places. When you pull up to the Honua Kai it is not as grand as an entrance as expected. It seems as if their neighbors began to build but didn't finish so there is this big green fence as you pull in. Valet guys were great, good service. You can self park which is included in the daily resort fee of $25.00. Front desk was so, so service. I felt like I was bugging them when I called or stopped by. The back of the grounds are beautiful. The lanais are all glass which makes for great views. I felt like their main goals may have been to sell their condos, so "guests" did not seem like a priority. The condos were beautiful, great furniture. Housekeeping SUCKED! The first day they skipped us all together and then I found out that they only do a "modified" housekeeping daily then a deep cleaning every 3rd day. I would have rented from VRBO if I had know this. Part of what I wanted was housekeeping on my vacation. They never cleaned the bathtubs or the showers, which were full of sand from our beach outings. The appliances were "top of the line" but never worked quite right. This included both the dishwasher and the dryer (it never fully dried). They came out to fix them, but kinda just gave up (another part of the appeal was the washer/dryer). The pool... Was beautiful, but not so great if you want to hang out and watch the kids. There were too many little areas and little pools. For our needs it would of been better to have one big pool. No relaxing there. Also, I never got any poolside service and you are not supposed to bring your own drinks so...? Beach... was a great sandy beach with snorkeling. The little market... Fabulous! With great coffee, tea and desert also great service. Dukes... Good food, hostesses kinda snooty. Maybe it was all our children that turned her off.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag.”
Reviews.Author: plainsrefugee
Reviews.Content: There is a lot to recommend the Honua Kai. The staff is courteous and efficient. The grounds, common areas, and suites are all well maintained. Because, as dollarb noted, this place consists of condominia they hope to sell, the suites are very large; ours had two bedrooms, two baths, a nice kitchen and living area, a fine balcony, and a washer and dryer. Finally, it features a nice beach. On the other hand, there were a number of annoyances. The bed had a crater in the middle, perhaps in tribute to Hawaii's volcanic past. An "amenity fee" of $25 dollars a day is charged, but the amenities are few and far between. It doesn't include use of the business center to check your e-mail, beach umbrellas, or in-room coffee once your free pack is gone. Maybe I'm strange, but when I hear I'm going to receive "amenities" I expect at least as many extras as I get at the average Super 8. Oh, we did have one unexpected amenity--an industrial dryer down the hall that ran day and night attempting to dry out a wall behind a ripped-out baseboard.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but a little removed”
Reviews.Author: dollarb
Reviews.Content: This is a condominium hotel that was built for sale purposes. As such, it is a much larger and superior accomodation ( several rooms) that would be found at other resorts. The hotel, grounds and staff were all excellent. There are a few minor downsides to this property in my opinion. First, it is a little distant from the other attractions in the area; Whalers Village, the surfing and scuba beach rental kiosks, etc. It was at least a fifteen minute walk to the Sheraton and the area near the diving rocks. Second, this hotel shuts down at about 12 AM. If you arrive after this time we found that there was no one to valet vehicles and the front desk was empty. The $25 per day resort fee included several items that are sometimes included in other resort room prices, One exception was the complimetary dishwasher soap and laundry starter package. Hardly worth $25 per day, in my opinion. Finally, the pool towel card system can create guest anxiety. Lose a towel or a towel card and pay $25. Overall, though a great place.

Reviews.Title: “A whole new reason to visit Lahaina”
Reviews.Author: napanapa_3
Reviews.Content: We just found a whole new reason to visit Lahaina, Maui. After staying in Wailea for years, we discovered Honua Kai Resort & Spa in Lahaina. Gorgeous property with exquisitely furnished rooms and the finest amenities. The views are unparalleled and the service is unmatched. Everything you could want is right at your fingertips. We vacationed with another couple and were thoroughly delighted to see that both bedrooms and baths were the same - no need to flip a coin for the best bedroom. Easily the perfect vacation spot both for adults and families.

Reviews.Title: “Better than you imagine”
Reviews.Author: Matt U
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort, fantastic room. Staff was unbelievably great. No expense spared at this resort. Won't be able to return soon enough. If you go to Maui this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Families and Friends”
Reviews.Author: mblnparadise
Reviews.Content: Airport to Resort 45 minutes and very easy. The suites are large and high end with all Bosch Appliances and beds are great. Make sure you get on the fourth floor or above if you want a view and ask!! for ocean view. The beach is right there and the water is just right. We went all around the island and saw as many fish and sea life snorkling right at the resort.This resort is great for families, with 1,2 and 3 bedrooms with full kitchens and Flat screen TV's.The restaurant dukes is right at the resort and the food and service was very good. If you need to save money the rooms have full kitchens and there is a Costco near the airport. Basil Tomatoes restaurant had a early bird special everything 50% off and the food was great and nice view.Parking is under the resort. Lahaina is about 2 miles away and is easy to find. There is a lot of shopping and great food there. There are lots of children at this resort so if you want a more romantic or adult resort this is not the place, other wise very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: Jody D
Reviews.Content: We took a much needed family vacation in October and truly enjoyed the Honua Kai Resort. The rooms are spacious and beautiful. We stayed in a two bedroom/two bathroom suite and it was more than enough room for our family of four. The windows and sliding doors were excellent...very expansive and the balcony was quite large, we had several meals outside. The bathrooms were large and elegant. A full dining room table made family meals and game time very pleasant.The kitchen was well stocked with all you need for cooking (except a pizza cutter :-) The in-room laundry was very convenient and the hotel supplies laundry and fabric softener. I wish I had packed much less....it was so convenient to do the laundry in the room! There is a Costco right next to the airport and a supermarket across the street from the hotel. We stocked up before our arrival and were able to dine in our room. The grounds were beautiful and well maintained. The beach is walking is close and nice, but the beaches are better off to the left from the hotel. We snorkeled on beach in front of the Westin and saw beautiful fish and sea turtles. You can rent snorkels and beach supplies on the hotel grounds. Dukes restaurant is on the premises as well as room service...both are adequate, but not amazing. The hotel is about 5 miles or so from Lahaina...very convenient, but not too close. Okay, a few things that were annoying. The staff, for the most part, are very kind, but not overly helpful. We encountered two staff members who were more interested in their chat and mocking us than being helpful, but they were not the norm. The cleaning staff was not especially good at their jobs, but they were quick. The hotel adheres to the policy of changing sheets, towles, etc. on the third day and if you wanted towels refreshed to put the used towels in the tub and they would be taken and replaced, well, they were taken, but not replaced. The few times I needed items not left by the housekeeping staff, I called the front desk and they were brought within 10 minutes. I've seen a few people post about the smell from the water treatment plant and it was noticeable from time to time, but not a lot and not horrendous. My biggest complaint was that I had booked an ocean view room and I did have an ocean view, but only from the balcony. Regardless, the view of the resort was beautiful and from the balcony the ocean was gorgeous. The few negatives were very minor and did not deter from our stay. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation”
Reviews.Author: taylormi
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at Honua Kai for 10 days in May. We arrived very late because of flight delays and were given a room on the second floor of the newest building. In the morning I realized this was not the greatest option since the patio doors open up to a shared veranda. This was not great for our 3-year-old since he can get away fast. I went down to the front desk, explained our situation and asked if there were any other rooms that might be better. The exceptionally nice lady said there was a room on the 5th floor of the other building which is a little older. I went and looked at it and LOVED it. We had a two bedroom suite with a HUGE private veranda. Seriously, it was amazing. I spent a lot of time on the veranda. The view faced the mountains and a conveniently-located grocery store. We loved the pool and spent most of our days either there or at the beach just over a small bridge. We loved Dukes restaurant located on the property and ate there several times. My wife loved the the Aloha Pie. It was nice being able to order food and drinks from Dukes and have it billed to your room...so convenient! Everyone we dealt with, from guest services to our dive master (Tim from Tiny Bubbles), were wonderful and so accommodating. This was a dream vacation that we will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: DaddiOmali
Reviews.Content: We stayed ten nights at the Honua Kai and what a fantastic vacation. The Hotel is new only a year old . The building is immaculate with multiple pools to serve familyâ€™s and couples. The service is exemplary with employees going over the top to help you. This is a condo hotel and the price is high but worth it. The best part for us was the ability to go snorkeling right off the beach. Incredible sea life awaits you just minute walk. We saw sea turtles and array of beautiful fish. If snorkeling is not your thing, there are sandy areas for kids to play in the ocean. You can rent snorkels, chairs and other beach items from the hotel. If you just want to relax and eat at the hotel then you donâ€™t have to go far. Dukes is a great restaurant with three different menus. The have live music with a dÃ©cor that suits the theme of Hawaii . If you donâ€™t want to eat out and cook yourself , the hotel offers free use of barbeques which we use half the time during our stay. There is a grocery store just minutes away that has a very good selection of food. The security was excellent. Once the sun goes down, security monitors the grounds. Overall , this was a very good vacation. However, it did not come cheap. I would definitely return .

Reviews.Title: “So glad we stayed here”
Reviews.Author: daniel s
Reviews.Content: We booked with costco and to say the least those people go way beyond anything I would have ever expected. From the very start they were as pleasent and helpful as possible. Our original trip was with the hyatt and all the way up to five days before, that was the plan. Reading the reviews and all the bad comments about the construction had me very concerned.Costco called me to allert me of this and we opted to change to the Honua Kai. Can't begin to say how glad we were that we did the switch. Upon arrival the folks here were awsome. Check in was a breeze and even recieved an upgrade without asking. Free valet and they brought all our luggage up immediatly. The two bedroom suite we are in was very clean,bathrooms nice size,and the bed was very comfy. Grounds are very well kept. Beach was nice size but there was some coral,not all sand,but this is hawaii!Juat get some beach shoes and all is well. We ate at several places but to be honest the resturant here named Dukes was probably the best meal we had on the island. We did attend the luau at the Hyatt and while it was not a bad show and meal looking over the grounds and the construction I don't believe we could have made a better choice.Even without the constr. I would have much rather stayed here at Honua Kai.The fact that it is nowhere near as big makes the resort so much more personal.Whatever you need it seems to be taken care of immediatly. If we are fortunate enough to come back in the future we will definetly stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Nat9Toronto
Reviews.Content: We loved this resort. The pools are beautiful! There was some construction going on but we asked to be moved to a different part of the hotel which the front desk did. The rooms were really nice. Valet parking is not necessary at this hotel as the parking lot if right in front of the lobby. We really enjoyed our stay here...no issues!

Reviews.Title: “Maui”
Reviews.Author: r0s3
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week with 4 couples. The grounds and property were pristene. The room was spacious and fully equiped. Dukes was fantastic. We reserved ocean view rooms. We asked for them to be adjacent rooms and to be able to take advantage of the view. Our only complaint is that we were given 2nd floor rooms (not able to see through the trees) that were not adjacent. This may have been understandable until we heard that they were only 40% full and we could see the number of empty rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms, pretty grounds”
Reviews.Author: Bobbi2100
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay with another couple at the this resort in a oceanfront 3-bedroom suite. Grounds were pretty. View spectacular. Did not like the odor from the water treatment plant across the road which was a bit strong at times. Great snorkeling at nearby Black Rock. Enjoyed Duke's Restaurant on the grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful for group - but not great beach”
Reviews.Author: AmyPP
Reviews.Content: We went with our 2 grown daughters. We wanted a place with a kitchen. We booked through Alaska Airlines. This place is absolutely fantastic. We weren't in an ocean view unit, in fact we had a slightly obstructed view at all. But the appointments in the unit are incredible. Flat screen tv's in each BR and the living room. Beautiful kitchen, washer/dryer. Elegant bathrooms. Crazy high-tech glass wall-doors out to the amazing deck. Grounds are lovely, but the beach is small. But it's easy to walk down the beach boardwalk to better beaches.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, great pool and beach area!”
Reviews.Author: AlyssaMatt10
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from a week-long stay at the Honua Kai Resort. We had gotten a 3 bed/3 bath condo for 3 couples, which was the perfect amount of space for our group. The kitchen had everything we needed from everyday dinnerware to a blender for our margaritas! All of the furniture, appliances, and fixtures were very luxurious looking and seemed brand new. There is a workout facility which we used once and has a few treadmills, several elliptical machines, and a decent variety of weight machines. The pool area was very spread out and there were always plenty of lounge chairs available (granted it was October and slower season). The beach was also very long and not crowded at all. It was pretty rocky in most areas in the water, however, so you had to be careful when walking out in the ocean to swim. Duke's Restaurant was right by the pool and was great for drinks or food while hanging out at the pool. The location of the resort was very close (~10 min) to the major restaurants/shopping area of Lahaina. There is a Safeway in Lahaina where we got groceries on the way in from the airport, and there is also a grocery store right across from the resort, which was convenient for a few things we needed later in the week. Overall, a great location and beautiful resort. Would definitely recommend for a family or even a couple traveling by themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place - a few nit picky things”
Reviews.Author: happy123Bc
Reviews.Content: We booked through the resort and not by owner. The added housekeeping service was worth it. Overall the place was very nice. I would probably book here again. We rented a one bedroom mountain view on the 8th floor of Konea. We had a small view of the ocean if we positioned the chairs right. I liked this tower and would ask for it again. Complaints and pros: the bathtub stopper was broken. We had them come fix it and they showed up within 5 minutes of calling. They semi-fixed it. Having a bath was not really a relaxing one because the hot water runs out 1/2 way through. Normally, I would not care, but this particular day I had a very bad headache. Water was freezing. Dryer was crappy. Semi dried the clothing. Housekeeping was excellent. They replenished supplies even when not needed. Hotel staff was amazing. If they see you they make sure they greet you. I was impressed. Pool service as noted by other people is lacking. When you want a drink you have to find the waitress most of the time. Location was good and bad. Because of parking in Kaanapali and Napili you need to get up early to find a parking spot if you want to get a free one without too much walking. If we wanted to go to those areas we were out around 8:00-8:30 am which meant we had to wake up and go/ not that relaxing. The one day we waited until 9 we had to walk a LONG way to Black Rock with our things and on the way back it was very hot carrying beach gear and a child. The beach outside the resort is great IF the waves are small. Walk a little ways and there is no coral. Very peaceful because there are less people. I did notice the wind and when it was windy we did not enjoy the pool. However there were many days that it was not windy. On the windy days, it was windy at other places too. We noticed the smell that others mention. It did not ruin our stay at all. I think it probably smells at all the hotels along this stretch. Overall I liked the condo we found on Kauai much more but I think for Maui this is a 10.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort! Will definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: Snippr
Reviews.Content: This resort is brand new with all the finest amenities. It is family-friendly but not too crowded. There are so many pools and activities to choose from that we didn't need to leave the resort. It has its own private sandy beach and is accessible to all the great restaurants in Lahaina. We loved staying here and will definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice yet not Overwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: Kevin L
Reviews.Content: As the #1 hotel in Lahaina, I expected a bit more but I would stay again. The hotel is fairly new, the room was clean, and I enjoyed our 10 night stay. I few observations - good and bad - please read all. PROS: - Ideal location, 5 miles to majority of great restaurants - Great value on a per night basis for a nice hotel anywhere - Great to have full kitchen, laundry, and separate bedroom - Beautiful manicured beach and grounds - Quiet location, comfy bed - Maid service loaded and unloaded dishwasher most days, always had enough toiletries, and towels - Duke's Restaurant on-site did not dissapoint - Some great service providers: Erin/Hali at Duke's pool side, Ben the bellman, Jake at Maui Conceirge, and Karen/Lynn :) at Aina Gourmet were great. CONS: - Its referred to as a Hotel and Spa - there is no spa on-site - These are condos with contracted management services - service is good, not great, in some areas. To be called #1, the frontdesk needs to work lots harder. - There is no laundry/dry cleaning service on-site - Bathroom was small, very average, dont be fooled by large bathroom photos - Bathroom shower could have been much much cleaner - everyday - Housekeeping comes early - most days before 8:30am HST - The location is windy, which might bother some people, this is noted in another review. I - No acknowledgement our honeymoon although noted/confirmed during our reservation - No turndown service - Room was often musty/dry - Sufur smell noted many days outside - not sure if this was a sewerage plant indicated by one reviewer or island related Overall, we spent 10 nights/11 days at Honua Kai in a 1 bedroom moutain view suite. It is a very nice hotel. Personally, I think it is MUCH nicer than many of the hotels in the area as most of the area hotels are old and very dated. While I would recommend the hotel...especially for the price point, I do wish I wasnt fooled by the photos of huge rooms / elaborate views. The average room is nice not spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel five stars plus”
Reviews.Author: civic248
Reviews.Content: We booked a two bedroom suite and the room is more than we can ask for. The surroundings are immaculate and the service is great! The beach, pool, staff, rooms, etc is top notch! Cant wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hawaiian getaway”
Reviews.Author: Kim T
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, high end resort. Lots of amenities, very friendly staff, great location and gorgeous rooms! We shared a 3 bedroom condo with our kids and another family member and we all had lots of room. The best part was the full glass wall that we could open each morning and have breakfast on the lanai overlooking the beautifully landscaped resort. All of the staff were VERY friendly & helpful. Our room was wonderful. Spacious rooms, King size beds (which were actually very comfortable) in each of the 3 rooms (2 with en-suit bathrooms) full kitchen with granite counter tops and beautiful bathrooms/walk in closets. I could have easily spent a whole summer here! Only drawback was the price, but sharing a 3 bedroom with another family or two, the price wasn't bad considering the location:) And just an FYI there is NO SPA on premises. I guess they have that planned for future construction - so you'll have to go next door to the Weston Spa. We would definitely recommend this resort though.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: RenfieldPonsford
Reviews.Content: The only place to stay in Maui. Its not cheap but it is superb on every level - the attention to detail and work done here is first class in every respect.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and well manicured”
Reviews.Author: KevinZ
Reviews.Content: Rooms and grounds are spotless. Very nice atmosphere walking around the property any time of the day. Stop at Costco or Safeway and purchase beverages and food. You can get a 6 pk of beer for $6 instead of 1 for six at Duke's. It'll save you a lot of money and you have everything you need to prepare a good meal in your room. Barbecue grills are available and are well used by guests. Staff was very helpful and friendly. The new our family name right after check-in and always addressed us with a greeting when we walked by the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great but we won't be back.....”
Reviews.Author: Behindthescenes2
Reviews.Content: First of all, this place is beautiful. The room is spacious and has every amenity you need especially for an 11 day trip away from home. The landscaping is lush. The concierge services are excellent. Check in and front desk staff great. Bellman and housekeeping friendly and professional. The cons are significant enough that we won't be coming back. The smell of the sewage treatment plant across the street is significant. Strong enough that you cannot keep the beautiful doors open with the winds blowing in....we asked to move was accommodated immediately. Only to find the winds and the strong sewage smell. The pools are beautiful but lots of children and no lap pool. No alcoholic beverages at pool except for Dukes Restaurant staff who come by maybe once during a 2 hour pool time. The BBQ grill area is so appealing in looks but no longer than 30 minutes, no alcohol, no dining...so what's the point? The beach is very, very small and during the Beach Walk (which is great) we noticed there are a LOT better beach scenes and activities than what is offered here. The resort has no spa; however, you do get 15% discount at other spas when concierge at resort makes reservation. We won't be back here because the cons outweigh the cons.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice place to stay, but was expecting more.....”
Reviews.Author: Misty9577
Reviews.Content: Okay, so I have read numerous reviews of alot of places to stay in Hawaii, especially Maui, to get good info about where to stay this trip. I have previously stayed in Maui before, at the Makena Resort, and also at Hale Mahina with extended family. After much research, my sister and I decided to stay at Honua Kai. I have to say that the start of my vacation was not great, as our flight had been delayed by 10 hours, so when we got to HK it was about 1 am local time, we got checked in and basically went to the room and crashed. The next day when we actually got a look at our room, it had some really odd features, most notably the lack of a shower door or curtain, and no tub. It didnt take me long to figure out that we had been put in a handicapped room, probably wouldnt have been a big deal except I like to relax in a hot bath when on vacation, so we went down and asked about changing rooms. I honestly did not think it would be an issue, as so many other travellers raved about being upgraded to a better room without even asking, but apparently they take issue with booking outside of their own website, because I got the impression that I was causing them an inconvenience to be moved to another room similar to my own. Now, be aware that I am no fool, I checked in advance on multiple sites, including their own, for availability for the entire length of my stay to see if they still had any vacancies, and they most definitely did on every site checked, so I knew that it should not be an issue to change rooms. At first we were offered a mountain view room, which would've been okay if thats what I reserved, but I paid extra for the partial oceanview, so I declined. At this point they informed me that they were completely booked, which I knew was a lie, but they magically came up with another room that was the same as we booked, but it had very little view, and a community style lanai, I am wondering now if it was possible a model they use to show potential buyers, as the setup was different as well. After a little more fuss, and about 2 hours of our time, we finally were sent to the Konea tower, where we got a room that we should have been in the entire time, about the same view as the original room, just with the bathtub and enclosed shower I wanted. Finally we were able to unpack and unwind. I have to say that this resort is beautiful. The grounds are meticulously maintained, and the rooms were very nice, and the lanai had wonderful folding doors that allowed the breeze to come in. I dont really have any complaints about the rooms, except for all the appliances are H.E., and they definitely have an odd scent to them, probably because of the recycled water used. The dishwasher, washer, and dryer all took a ridiculous amount of time to run, and were not as quiet as I had thought they would be for newer appliances. When booking this resort, my only hangup was the description of the beach fronting the hotel. I have heard many different descriptions, and also have read Maui Revealed multiple times, and was worried about not having a good place to swim. My sister even called the resort to inquire about what the nearshore waters were like. We went out one morning to check it out, and unfortunately we couldnt get past the rocky shore. Let me tell you, for some folks it may not be a big deal, but for me, the only thing I want out of my beach is a sandy bottom. This was not the place for it. If you do stay here, and want to use this beach, you absolutely MUST purchase a pair of river shoes, or reef shoes as they are better known. I guess I was spoiled by Maluaka Beach in south Maui when staying at Makena Resort, it has crystal clear waters and a padded sandy bottom. We did try to walk down past the Westin Villas to see about the south end of North Kaanapali beach, but it didnt seem much better. The beach was pretty much all I was after in choosing an area to stay, my sister was all about the room and resort, and HK was picked number 1 on here, so she convinced me to stay here. I agreed mostly because there is alot more action up this way compared to south Maui, especially Wailea, and we figured it would be better to stay here instead of driving back and forth, but we ended up driving down to Keawakapu every morning for the beach. For anybody that wants to do some snorkeling though, HK is probably an ideal place, as there seemed to be alot of coral in the nearshore waters. I would probably consider staying here again, it was a nice resort, just not an ideal beach for my liking. I loved Dukes on the resort, the beachside tacos were outstanding, its worth the money! I guess after reading other reviews, I had a different idea about how the resort and its employees would be, most of the stay was great, it just got off to a rocky start. There were many employees who were super friendly and helpful. others not at all, a mixed bag, I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Don't look elsewhere , This is it !!!”
Reviews.Author: jsharron1
Reviews.Content: I spent hours looking for a place to stay on Maui after our week long cruise of the islands. My husband and I enjoyed the cruise, but would of stayed at Honua Kai for 2 weeks instead. We rented from a owner through a real estate company which was cheaper than the condo's website. We stayed in studio #537 in the Konea building. What can I say. It was very clean (except for a couple of stains on the carpet) The King bed was very comfortable, slept good every night. Beautiful appliances, everything you needed and yes it took forever to dry anything in the dryer. Would we stay here again ? YES YES YES. The grounds were beautiful and lots of pools and hot tubs. Duke's restaurant right there and also right behind the condo was a TIMES grocery store (walking distance). It had Hot Ready Made Meals there too. I can't say enough about the Honua Kai, Stay Here. The only negative thing I can say about the studio we stayed in, was that there were no beach towels and when taking a bath in there beautiful soaking tub , I would run out of hot water, but we still give this resort 5 out 5 stars

Reviews.Title: “2nd time even better!”
Reviews.Author: tjoneser
Reviews.Content: Last time we went to Maui we stayed at Honua Kai but only for 2 nights (we moved to the Westin Villas b/c HK was sold out all the other nights). We booked a 1 bedroom ocean view room, instead of the partial ocean last time, it was only a bit more. When we got into the room, they had upgraded us to a 2 bedroom (I think b/c they weren't as busy, we went in October), which was awesome for us and our 2 kids. We had a very roomy living room and 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, full kitchen and laundry. I must say, for a stay longer than a few days with kids, having a kitchen is the way to go. And Honua Kai is just perfect for us. it's affordable, the grounds are nice, plenty of pool action and the beach nearby is great (a little bit of reef but if you walk around you will find sandier spots). We also loved how our living room lanai glass doors opened up the whole way, so we had a nice indoor/outdoor situation going, we kept it open practically the whole time, it was lovely. Service was great and very friendly, and if you want to eat, it's connected to Duke's. It's not the Four Seasons (which we also stayed for the last three nights on this trip) but if you need a kitchen, i'd say this is as close as you are going to get. I think the Spa is not open yet either so that will be nice next time we go back. Last time there was a sewage smell but I never smelled it this time. I'd definitely recommend for families!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Therese C
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. Everyone was extremely friendly whether you were needing something or just in passing. We couldn't get over how great the snorkeling was right in front of the property. The fish and coral here was better than the place we were taken to on our paid snorkel trip. It was nice that you could rent the gear here. The conciere was very helpful and booked the best trips that fit our needs, based on what we wanted to do while we were there. Very clean and the beds were great. Dukes was a great place for all meals.

Reviews.Title: “6 YR. Anniversary trip AWESOME!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marley M
Reviews.Content: This resort is by far the best on the island. My husband and I saw the resort being built 5 yrs ago. We had a horrible experience at Maui Kai"DON'T STAY!!!" We ended up at Honua Kai, faith defiantly brought us here. The designers & builders nailed it dead on.The staff really like there jobs and enjoy what they do. They always went out of their way to make us happy. This resort is the only place we will be staying in MAUI!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: AdamKosick
Reviews.Content: Everything was awesome. Things were new and fresh. The valet service was awesome and even explained our room. We had freinds from another resort stop by and they loved it too. Pools were great and the beach is awesome. The consierge was really helpful too and had very accurate information. Be sure to use them if you stay. They could tell you walk times and cab fares even! We never had any troubles there and the staff was really friendly. The location is beautiful and on the dry side of Maui which is great because they get little to no rain when we went, the other side of the island was always cloudy/rainy. The breeze is nice too as it is not too strong, but always available to cool you off. Also it is always in the sun. We had an ocean view suite which is on the inside corner of the building, but it had a great view of the gardens below and the ocean past the resort. We had a great time on our honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Relaxed Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: MHaave
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for the resort feel where you are pampered day and night then this place may not be for you. If you are looking for a low key, private and relaxing honeymoon or family trip this is the place for you. My wife and I stayed in a studio on the 8th floor for 5 nights and loved every min of it. You did not have to wake up early to get seats by the pool, you did not have to wait in long lines for food or coffee. They have Dukes resturant and a little coffee house/grocery store in the hotel which was great for those little things. First night we went to the safeway and picked up liquor and snacks to put in our room and took full advantage of the full kitchen. We really enjoyed having cereal or a light breakfest / snacks on the lanai every morning or early afternoon. The beds were amazing, the room was clean everyday (we booked directly through hotel) and the location was just north of Whalers Village. Loved it. We moved to the Hyatt for two nights and regretted not staying at the Honua Kai. We will definetly be back.

Reviews.Title: “Will NEVER go anywhere else in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: Emi1975
Reviews.Content: Great condos with amazing ocean views. The pools and beach are great if you have kids. The best things may be the deli for lunches and the restaurant Duke's. We were there two years ago and are going again in January and can not wait!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Honua Kai, very few problems”
Reviews.Author: lovinsj
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been coming to Maui for 2 weeks a year since 2004.. Even stopped here a few years back when they were building Honua Kai for an inquiry (when a 1 bedroom was selling for 800k, now 405k).. Found a great deal for a 1 bedroom + den on vrbo so decided to try this place out for 2 weeks the first of Sept. Pros - the grounds are amazing. Probably one of the nicer places on the west side of maui. The organic market was nice even though the prices were high, but you pay for convenience. The pools are great and not crowded at all; plus the beach was very nice. We had our 2 year old with us and she loved the toddler pool, the bad thing was that they closed it half way through our 15 day trip for a complete overhaul. The room was very nice.. having a full kitchen is convenient plus the den for my wife's mother saved instead of buying a 2 bedroom. We were staying in the north tower (forget the name) and the gym was well equipped. They have a small patio that you can workout outside rather than be inside, why workout inside while in maui???? The food and pool service for Dukes was great!! We had lunch 5-6 times from here and every time was fantastic. Cons - the pool chairs.. Good lord, these things were awful. No padding and most were sagging/bent. The dryer in the room.. Loved having a washer/dryer in the room but it would take 3 hours to dry towels/clothes and still have to run another cycle. Not THAT big of deal though. The shower water pressure.... ok, usually I LOVE good water pressure but come on, this thing was over the top. Whenever I took a shower, I took the shower head off since the pressure was so great, it actually hurt. Overall, a great stay. Very few problems/cons with honua kai and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE the Honua Kai but...”
Reviews.Author: Dan T
Reviews.Content: We LOVE the Honua Kai and have stayed here twice in the past year. We will be returning again next spring as well, and we recommend it to our friends and family. The location is great, the grounds are immaculate, and the service is exceptional. Duke's is a great place for happy hour. The condos themselves are also exceptional. The kitchens are fully stocked, the appliances are high quality, and you have a washer/dryer in the unit - what more can you ask for! BUT- My ONLY negative comment about the resort is regarding the pools. There are multiple pools on the property, however they are all open to all ages. All week - morning, daytime and evening - the pools have small children in them. I am not talking 6 yr olds.. I am talking newborn babies. There is apparently no policy that certain pools are for kids and others are for adults so the parents are floating their babies all over the place, in every single pool. If you want to relax in the pool and enjoy the view, forget it. Not gonna happen. If the HK had a policy where even one of the multiple pools was reserved for adults, it would enhance the experience for everybody. I know the resort is family friendly but they really should think about respecting the needs of others that stay here as well.

Reviews.Title: “Maui wedding trip”
Reviews.Author: Ann S
Reviews.Content: the Honua Kai resort was gorgeous! From the first moment of entering the expansive lobby that looks out onto the Koi pond, then the beautifully manicured resort and onto the ocean, all was just as advertised. The staff were always helpful and happy. The small store was full of wonderful aromas, the staff was great. Duke's restaurant was also lots of fun, and very convienient to have right on the property. The only complaints that I have are that the smell from the sewage treatment plant right across the main hwy, and that I could not get a room upgrade unless I paid $50 a night extra (the view from my room was the valet roof and the parking lot, which made for a very noisy time)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Condo/Resort Option”
Reviews.Author: BarrioTravelers
Reviews.Content: Having stayed away from "condo" type facilities we were a little hesitant to stay here in spite of all the positive reviews this property has gotten. Considering our favorite spots in Maui's Kaanapali and Waile areas were astronomical, we gambled on Honua Kai and its very reasonable rates. We paid about $1295 through Costco for a five-night mountain view room. Just walking into this place gives you good vibes. Once we got to the room, it had the WOW factor. Beautiful suite with a very well appointed kitchen and washer and dryer. Two great TVs with dozens of channels including ESPN, HBO and other premium channels. You don't see that in many places. As many people do upon arrival in Maui, we raided the Costco near the airport and picked up water, beer, bread and other essentials. The hotel has two twin towers with very similar amenities. Pools are nice, but very restrictive. No outside alcohol allowed, and they patrol hard. Of course, they do offer beer for $5 domestic and $6.50 for premium brews. Not bad for a big resort, wrong. You get an eight ounce plastic cup that allows the beer to get warm quite fast. Also, lounge chairs are nice looking and go with the rattan motif, but boy are they uncomfortable. They're not flexible at all! And here's the kicker, you get a side show with mice running from hedge to hedge and scrambling right through... under and between chairs. There's a $25 daily resort fee. You get valet parking for it and free internet connection, either WiFi or with a cable. But bring your computer. We tried to look something up on the internet, no dice. We were told to go down the road to a mailbox type business that had internet service. They can't lend you a terminal for three minutes? Not cool. Staff is very nice and the rooms are kept very tidy. Beds are also incredible. It's a good place to stay and a good home base, especially if you get the kind of deal we got.

Reviews.Title: “Read me if you aren't 100% sure”
Reviews.Author: cptnspooky
Reviews.Content: This place is great, I've read a bunch of lame reviews that I want to dispel. The wind - it's REALLY not that bad. We were here for a week, had some 20mph winds. It's not that bad. The wind makes it tolerable in the heat. And the wind really only picks up from 3-5pm The kids - There will be a few kids, deal with it. There are tons of places to camp out by the pool and beach. if you want privacy you can find it. The staff - They are perfectly friendly but don't expect to be dotted on. It's a condo association, not a luxury retreat. The location - Right across the road from a great market, pizza paradiso, and others and 5 minutes away from whalres village, Napili bay, etc. The restaurant - It's good enough. Not a 5 star restaurant, but a great happy hour, The cajun ahi fish tacos are the best on the island. The bar tenderes are solid, food is decent. The spa - it doesn't exist yet - there are spas in every direction around here. Take a walk. The beach. It's really rocky directly out front, but 10 feet left of the left most tower (beach facing) its very sandy and totally swimmable. There is really good snorkeling right there and I am an avid diver. Almost as good as black rock down the road. The rooms. Impeccable. We stayed in 221 - a studio in the far back of the building, but with a central ocean view. This room was perfect for us. great access, great views, and the property manager (from Harris's) was awesome and friendly. Parking - it's $10 a day for valet or you can get a key card. Super easy. The gym - top of the line I would stay here again in a New York minute. We walked by the Westin, Sheraton, Marriott and every beach club starting with Kana and ending with Ali - This place is really nice in comparison. Don't listen to the wankers - unless you have a silver spoon attitude you will be perfectly happy here. If you want to pay $35 to park, and $30 for a chair, and $15 for every cocktail, go stay at the 4 seasons. If you want great value and a really premium property with great staff and accessibility, the HK is great choice. The grounds are clean, pools are nice, and it feels like a 5 star resort without charging you like one.

Reviews.Title: “Aaahhh... :)”
Reviews.Author: Francis B
Reviews.Content: Honua Kai was one of the best resorts I've ever stayed. We wanted to upgrade to a one bedroom suite from our studio reservations and Val was so nice to make the accomodations. Beautiful swimming pools, very clean facility and oh...the beach was fantastic. If one we could've stayed a couple of more days at Maui. Our suite was so elegant that it really set our vacation off right. Never was a dull moment at Honua Kai. Duke's restaurant provided food and drink service while we were at the pool side and I even got to use the laundry and dryer one time. We are very pleased with our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: LDVOLVO
Reviews.Content: What can I say that hasn't already been said ......Ahhh, put your feet up , close your eyes , and listen for the palm tree blowing in the warm wind , feel the sand in your toes ,cocktail of choice , blue calm sea ..you are there ... In addition to the spectacular setting , you have spacious spotless tasteful rooms , friendly staff , great pools/grounds, and a perfect location on the island.No,,, you will not get popsicles or cold towels , but you also dont have to wait around for a drink or to check out , or fight for a spot or chair . Its that casual vibe that the other high end resorts are trying to achieve without the pretension. We didn't want to go home !

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JasonRussell
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel, the staff was A++++!!! This place looks brand new and is clean clean clean!!! The room was very nice, it was a sad day leaving after 12 days. I highly recommend and would stay again with much anticipation!!! The beach out front and the pool area was top notch. We Honua Kai by researching Tripadvisor and found its high rating to hgelp make our choice easy!!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth the money”
Reviews.Author: SDAG
Reviews.Content: We purchased a package (air, accomodations, and car rental) from Costco. We were very pleased with the physical facility. The two bedroom unit was comfortably furnished and the kitchen was stocked with quality cookware. We had an L-shaped balcony with a great ocean view. In addition to chaise lounges on the balcony, there was a large table on the balcony, giving us the option to eat outside. Although our unit did not have a BBQ on the patio, there are several BBQs available on the premises for guest to use. We were four women (2 married and 2 single) who each wanted a bed. Sleeping six nights on a sleeper sofa in the living room was not an acceptable option. The unit had a king in the master bedroom that could not be separated into two twins and a king in the second bedroom that could be separated into two twins. It took several phone calls before we were able to get a roll-away with two (at our request) mattresses. Two other problems were quickly addressed even though our phone calls about the problems were made after 9:00 p.m.: (1) The air conditioner was set too low and a manual override was necessary and (2) the refrigerator was not cold. When we arrived, there was a basket with dishwashing liquid, dishwasher powder, laundry detergent, kitchen towels, and a sponge. These items were replaced, as needed. Housekeeping, however, was not good about replacing face towels in one of the bathrooms. A note suggests that we hang up towels we will re-use. No problem, if there were towel racks! Exiting the airport, we stopped at Costco and stocked up on bottled water, snacks, and food for eating in. There is a Safeway as you drive north toward the resort on Highway 30. Because Safeway and Vons (a California chain) are related, you can use your Vons card at Safeway. The resort has two driveway entrances. Directly across from the northernmost driveway is Times Market. Times' prices are slightly less than Safeway's prices. Times is a 2-3 block walk away. For those familiar with the L & L Hawaiian BBQ restaurant chain, the chain has a restaurant in the Times shopping center Resort fee: We asked and were given a small slip of paper listing what is covered by the $25/day resort fee. Tips are not included. Thus, if you use the valet service, which is included in the resort fee, remember to tip the valet. Except when we checked in and checked out and availed ourselves of the valet services for our luggage, we self-parked. If you want to use the WiFi, you need to ask for the directions; they are not posted in the unit.

Reviews.Title: “another great visit”
Reviews.Author: Rub-a-dub-dub619
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Honua Kai Resort & Spa. After our visit last year, we decided that this resort met our needs for a weeks stay with a 2 year old. Since last year, a new building "Konea" opened and this is where we stayed. Konea is a quieter than the main building since its mostly filled with visitors rather than owners. The grounds were immaculate, just as it was during our last visit. We enjoyed a nice resort view suite with all the amenities of home. Since this was our second time, we knew to bring some of the little things, such as spices and specialty food items that can really start to add up at the super market, which is within walking distance. Our room was clean and comfortable. Just an FYI- the spa is not open yet, not so sure when it will be. The beach is swimmable and lovely, but not little kid friendly with coral, strong currents, and a sudden drop in depth close to shore. The pools were nice and clean. The infinity pool was closed for remodeling during our visit. Konea has underground parking (not sure if the other building does) with elevators that take you straight to your floor. This is nice for easy coming and going, or valet is included in the daily resort fee of $25. I really enjoyed our stay at Honua Kai again and would recommend it to anyone looking for a place in Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Honua Kai!”
Reviews.Author: ccmsbm
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 2 bedroom, 2 bath condo in the Konea tower last week with my mom & husband. It was a wonderful experience. We rented directly from the owner. The pools and hot tubs are really nice and the grounds are beautiful. Also enjoyed the easy access to Ka'anapali beach & we thought the views from the beach were stunning. We loved opening the fold-away glass doors onto the lanai. We had a huge wrap-around balcony because we were in a corner unit on the 2nd floor; we enjoyed eating meals on the lanai. We shopped at the market right across the street and enjoyed being able to eat breakfast in every morning. We found that it is a bit more windy at the resort than in other areas in West Maui but it didn't pose a problem. I would not hesitate to stay at Honua Kai again. We stayed our first night in Maui at the Hyatt Regency and for around the same price, the condo at Honua Kai really blew us away. It's nice to have all the amenities of a hotel resort in a condo (Duke's restaurant, the gourmet market, ability to rent/buy snorkeling gear, etc.). Overall, I can't say enough nice things about our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort All Around”
Reviews.Author: Chaser580
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, beautiful views, flawless property and amazing value. Didn't mind the lack of maid service, as it provides more privacy. It's like staying at the suites of the 5-star hotels, without the price tag. Resort pools comparable to any of the big ones. They only have one restaurant on-site, but there are plenty of places close by, and you'll sometimes find it more convenient to make a home cooked meal anyway in the high end kitchen. Will always return here when staying in Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: pawji
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2 bedroom 2 bath through the resort for 8 nights. My 4 stars are for the property, NOT the service, I have heard from other guests while there, that you may get a break on the rate if you book through VRBO. Each unit is independently owned, but unlike other resorts, there seems to be a lot of cohesion in the resort, so there is no need to pick a particular unit, they all seem fairly standard from what we saw. Our unit was very spacious with a HUGE patio that added even more space. We went to Costco on our way to the resort, so we had pretty much everything we needed for a week. Last year we stayed at the Westin and we liked this space better, 1) it was larger and 2) the resort itself was less crowded. The pool was awesome! Fun water slide, there's a semi lazy river (it doesn't go all the way around), lots of space, easy to find lounge chairs with and without shade. Duke's is a pretty decent onsite restaurant, there were a few nights they had live music. The grounds were nicely kept and quite beautiful. The beach is a little small but my husband and I like to explore so we only enjoyed it one day. The only issues we had with the resort was the service. We had to wait almost 3 hours to check in, which would've been ok if the front desk would have just told us that but instead they kept telling us it would be 15 more minutes...for 3 hours! If we didn't have our 15 month old, I don't think it would've phased us, but with a baby it started to become a problem. It seemed like there was a big communication issue between the front desk and housekeeping, each department kept blaming the other for the problem instead of just fixing the problem. The other issue I had was that we had requested a crib (just FYI they charge for this service) and by the time we got into our room, they had no more available. They had promised that they would get one for us the next day by renting it. It never happened. By the 3rd day I got sick of calling and our daughter seemed ok in her make shift bed so I just let it go. Overall, I would stay here again, it was convenient, spacious and nicely done. If they got it together on the service side, they would be a class act and bump up a star!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: Thor1164
Reviews.Content: Im actually writing this review sitting on our balcony during our stay waiting for my family to wake up. I would like to confirm some things people had stated in other reviews. True: Not a ton of privacy on the balcony's. Everyone kind of looks at each other while outside your room. If this place were 100 percent full, it might bother me a little more. Not a ton of service at the pool. Waitress comes around every 10 to 15 minutes. There is a big difference in service compared to a regular resort so we kinda noticed that. No maid service at all since we rented from an owner. We actually like having our room cleaned everyday and a turn down service.
