If you rent from the hotel, I think you can get your room cleaned. $10 dollars a day to park your own rental car. But that does give you access to the gym and ice machine. Rooms are frickin great. I seriously think they have some of the best rooms and balcony's in Maui...LG plasma's in every room and a Blue Ray DVD player in the living room. Sweet folding doors that open up to the balcony. We spent the day at the new Westin with our friends and I liked our pool better. We played football and brought down a little stereo to listen to music and had a great time at the pool everyday. You can bring your own alcohol to the pool and they wont bother you at all. Just bring a dixie cup or something else to put your drink in. Just dont bring a beer bottle or a glass cup and you will be fine. Hint: Stop at Costco next to the airport and buy your milk, liquor and beer. Very cheap compared to any other place on the island. Overall we really liked the resort. We liked the Marriot a little better because of the service and location. I think this place has better rooms and definetly better balcony's but like I said before we kinda missed the service. I also think the Marriot on the other side of Black Rock has the best beach location in all of Kannapali beach area. I would stay here again. We paid around 400 hundred a night for our room but it was marked down almost half price because this is the "low" season since all of the kids are back in school.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort for a getaway”
Reviews.Author: Karen P
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at Honua Kai recently on our first trip to Maui. The resort is of a high standard, rooms well appointed. This resort had the best bed we found during our travel through Hawaii. The Bosh appliances in the kitchen and laundry were were great to have in our room. This would be a great escape for families as well as couples seeking time out.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome rooms and decor. Comfortable beds and pillows.”
Reviews.Author: Enigmaholly
Reviews.Content: The resort was incredibly clean. The condo was brand new. Top of the line appliances. No need to pack amenities they were provided. Bonus with Aveda shower supplies.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation yet”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoCorky
Reviews.Content: spectacular setting on open beaches, great snorkeling directly off the resort, 3 pools, Dukes restaurant on site, condo amenities bar none. Bosch appliances, viking grills on premises.. large sections of lawn for the kids to play on in the evening. Waterslide!! Kiddie pool section, Jacuzzi's!! Avoid underground parking fee and park for free in the lot in front of the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs!”
Reviews.Author: michelle n
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying the rooms here are very nice. They are spacious and new. That is about all I have to say about the good. Now the bad. Their housekeeping is terrible. They did not vacuum the whole time we were there which was for four nights. Neither do they replace the bed linens. I get doing this in order to be green and environmentally conscious but after the fourth night, it was getting kind of nasty. At first, discovering red bites on both my husband and myself, we thought they were from mosquitos. Then waking up in the morning and realizing more bites had appeared where none were the night before underneath our clothing, I am fairly certain they have a bedbug infestation. Be warned. We are now dealing with quarantining all our clothing and everything we brought back with us on the trip. Terrible!! We called the front desk to ask for addtional toiletries because they do not replace them and none were ever brought up. Also, we mentioned in passing that it was our anniv. The receptionist asked for our room number and nothing ever came of it. We thought that was right along the lines of their customer service there...pretty much nonexistent.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, but do not book your room directly from the resort”
Reviews.Author: bwco
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a week in one of the studios. The resort has some strong positive items as well as some negatives. We booked directly thru Intrawest, the owners of the condo complex. Positives: The room size was incredible The view of the ocean from our lani was great. The lani was large and had a table and chairs on it. We ate all our meals outside. The staff is very friendly. The kitchen has top of the line appliances and had about every utensil that you would need. The complex has many pools, all different. It also has three hot tubs. Negatives The unit has a combination washer/dryer. You put your clothes in the washer and when the load is done, you press another button and the clothes are dried, without having to remove them from the unit.The washer worked fine, but the dryer took forever, (3 hours for a small load of towels). Since we rented directly from the resort, we were given a handicapped accessible unit. This unit did not have a bathtub. We were not told that when when we checked in and by the time realized it, we were already unpacked and did not feel like changing rooms. We made do with just a shower for a week. There is an easy way to tell if your room is a handicapped room by looking at the front door. If it has two peepholes, its a handicapped accessible unit. While we were there, there was a managers reception for the guests. When we went there, it was very apparent that it was a sales pitch to sell condos and we left immediately. The wireless internet was spotty at times. Other comments: We did our grocery shopping at several places including the nearby Times store. I found Times to have reasonable prices. Pricewise and selection wise, Times reminded me of an A and P. The beach was rocky in front of the hotel, so we moved south a little bit to the beach in front of the construction zone. It is located near the West Maui airport, however I did notice that much air traffic directly overhead the complex. The landing pattern took the planes over the abandoned development next to the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and Comfortable Resort”
Reviews.Author: Sean B
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in a 2 bedroom suite at Honua Kai at the end of May 2011. Everything about the resort felt clean and brand new. The tower that we stayed in was the newer of the two and our room was on the second floor overlooking the courtyard/ocean. The bedrooms and living area were extremely spacious and the kitchen was stocked with high end appliances and silverware. We had a wraparound balcony that was large with numerous places to sit. The doors to the balcony could be opened up to create one large open air living area/balcony room. The beach in front of the hotel was surprisingly a good place to snorkel, swim, or relax. The water was clear and calm most of the time and the beach was rarely crowded. The Aina market on site had some good stuff but was overpriced. Duke's (the only restaurant on site) had pretty good food and even better drinks. The pools were large and the staff was very friendly. The Ka'anapali Beach Walk starts at Honua Kai and goes all the way down beyond the Black Rock which makes for a nice walk and connects the hotel to other hotels/restaurants along the path. After walking around the Ka'anapali area, we realized that most of the hotels/condos in the area were pretty dated so we were happy with our choice. It is a short drive into Lahaina and only about a 45 min drive into the Kihei/Wailea area. When we return to Maui, we will definitely stay at Honua Kai. You can't really beat the value and location of the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to expectations and then some.”
Reviews.Author: HonuAkul
Reviews.Content: I never got around to writing this review until now. Nonetheless, I would stay here again in a heartbeat. So would the rest of my family. The room, facilities, staff, pools, beach, Duke's, boardwalk, view of either the ocean or the West Maui mountains...all of it was fantastic. We saw several rainbows over the mountain in the late afternoon and a couple over the ocean in the morning. Stunning. Very comfortable, very clean, beautifully decorated. We did end up walking a couple of minutes south to swim at the beach...less rocks down there...when we were just sunning, the beach just out front is great. Overall, beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “great views-good location--family friendly”
Reviews.Author: seetheworld2525
Reviews.Content: The whale watching was spectacular, but the highlight of our stay was the great walking trail all the way to the other end of Kaanapali Beach. This hotel has all the basics with great kids facilities including kid-friendly pools and outdoor grills. The beach is fine except the coral is dangerous in high surf. The spa was not open when we stayed but could very well be now. The housekeeping is good. Be sure to read the fine print: depending on how you book many things would be extras. We booked through the hotel booking site and had no issues with any service. The little deli/coffee shop made excellent sandwiches and wonderful lattes. I recommend this resort specifically for families.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort!”
Reviews.Author: salsarital
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a one bedroom outside suite on the 6th floor with a partial ocean view. Beautiful, new, modern and comfortable decor. The kitchen had bosch and cruisinart appliances and fully stocked. The views from both the bedroom and lanai were beautiful. I loved that the sliding glass doors opened all the way across the livingroom out to the lanai, and also had screen doors that still let in the breeze and sounds of the ocean. Very curteous and efficient staff. Beautiful grounds and pools. Great snorkeling in front of the hotel. Dukes lounge was very convenient and open to the ocean. The location was close to shopping and sites. The three excursions we booked through the hotel were excellent recommendations. Greatly exceeded our expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort!”
Reviews.Author: Sweetmarie123
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 3 bedroom suite and it was gorgeous. We were on the second floor in the first tower overlooking the pools and the ocean. It was beyond my expectations. The kitchen is brand new and beautiful and they have it stocked with mostly every utensil and kitchen aid you would need. The hotel also supplies you with laundry detergent and dishwasher soap which is helpful. The pools were really nice to sit and relax at and the calamari we ordered while tanning was delicious. Try the Hula Pie at Dukes which is located on the resort premises. While snorkeling in the ocean in front of the hotel, we saw turtles! How cool! The resort is also very close to most fun attractions (Lahaina, Whalers Village, Sansai). I recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Condo Resort”
Reviews.Author: lcosette
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for 5 nights in a studio unit. We really enjoyed our stay. Our unit was closer to the middle of the tower, and we had very nice partial ocean views. However, if you are looking for privacy on your balcony, this may not be for you - you can see/be seen by pretty much any of the other units. However, we had our balcony doors all the way open a lot of the time, as did others; no one seemed to be too bothered by the relative lack of privacy. The rooms are really great - nice and new, with top-of-the-line appliances, a nice flat screen TV and a very comfortable bed. Everything was very clean. We rented from an outside company, which saved us some money, although then we didn't have maid service. The resort grounds are beautiful, and there are lots of pools and pool chairs to choose from. The beach in front of the hotel is also very nice, although not so deep, but good for snorkeling and swimming. Duke's Restaurant on site is great as well - they provide drink/food service at the pool, and we ate lunch there twice. Aina Market was a bit pricey but had very nice food and other products. For most of our trip, we didn't experience any wind, although on the last day we did and workers went around closing all of the umbrellas at the pool. We also had no problem with the amount of kids at the resort - there were some, but most were with their parents and well behaved. Overall, we loved it and would definitely stay at Honua Kai again!

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: JBCLyon
Reviews.Content: We (parents with a 7 month old and grandparents) spent a week at Honua Kai and thought it was an amazing resort. The resort is top notch. The grounds are well maintained and the pool areas are gorgeous. The beach in front of the resort is beautiful with good snorkeling reef. We saw turtles and all kinds of fish. Our condo was very comfortable and very clean. It was well stocked with kitchen supplies, towels, beach accessories and pretty much anything you would have at home. Location of resort was great. Very close to Kaanapali, grocery stores and restaurants. We will stay at this resort and this condo again with our family!

Reviews.Title: “Truly Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Terry G
Reviews.Content: We had debated as to where to stay in Maui and are very happy that we settled on The Honua Kai. Our booking was through VBRO so we were aware that the cleaning was at the end of our stay but we would not be paying the daily $25 resort fee. Parking was simple with the option of $10 for self park or$15 for Valet. Having a new,gourmet style kitchen was a major plus so we made a point to put it to use. We landed at OGG, grabbed the rental car and drove 1 block to Costco and loaded up. When we arrived we were blown away! The room was gorgeous and had everything you could want right down to beach towels and a martini shaker. Granite counters, stainless appliances, a huge ensuite bath, a flat screen with HD TV and Blu Ray plus free wireless internet were all as advertised. We loved the option of either using one of the many pools and hot tubs or just crossing the boardwalk and relaxing on the sandy beach. The boardwalk was also handy for morning walks along the other resorts of Ka'anapali down to Black Rock and Whaler's Village. Lahaina is a short drive away but most nights we ended up at Duke's for happy hour to listen to a little live Hawaiian music before returning to our lanai to consider what we might create that night in the kitchen. There are 2 fitness rooms, one in the Hokulani tower that is pretty basic and a much larger one in the Konea tower that is state of the art and free to use. If you are looking for a spa it has not yet been built and is at least 6 months away from being done. We were concerned about some comments on the excessive wind but we were there in August and the winds were fairly mild and really keep us from being too hot. This place exceeded our expectations and we have rebooked already for November

Reviews.Title: “bad service, no sympathy by crew, 2 jackets stolen in the room...”
Reviews.Author: spid3r
Reviews.Content: we stayed there in june for 5 nights, and we have not a good souvenir of it... at first and after 2 nights with a permanent noise, we had to change the room (noisy or damaged A/C fan or something like that). It was our honeymoon, they promise us a bottle of champagne, after remembering 2 times, we give up... as we move from the first to the second room, we forget 2 jackets in the garderobe, the day after, they "didn't find them", thanks for that by the way... The Cleaners came into the room in the morning in spite of "do not disturb" sign on our door... the listing of negative events is not in its entirety, but we think it's enough to communicate to other people how was our staying there... so if you are looking for a minimum of sympathy by the crew (reception, bar or cleaners) it's not a good place to go! Positive: the Buildings, pools and gardens are very nice and more or less good located.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place, but needs some better housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: MauifanSanDiego_CA
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 11 days at the Honua Kai. It was our second time there, and we plan to go back in December, so obviously we love it. The rooms are gorgeous, and pools always have empty chairs. People who work there are typically very friendly, especially the valet guys. Our only problem this time was with housekeeping. We booked through Expedia, so daily housekeeping is included. The information in the room said they would do various things (wash coffee-pot, start dishwasher, etc.) which they didn't do at all while we were there. What they did was make the beds. They took away dirty towels when we left them in the tub (as instructed) but didn't always replace them. That was it. When we checked into the room, we found the lanai was really dirty - clearly hadn't been cleaned from the last folks. We called housekeeping and stopped at the front desk to ask for a cleaning 3 times, had promises that it would be taken care of, but nobody ever did it. We finally gave up, and ended up just not using the lanai, which was a shame. Otherwise, it was a lovely stay, as always. General comments: Dukes is good for happy hour, but breakfast is not great there. We tried it twice and were disappointed both times. Food was cold and service was not much better. Happy hour prices on drinks and snacks are good, though. Pizza Paradiso across the street by the Times Market is good food, especially for take-out. We picked up gyros there a couple of times, and they were great. The beach in front of the hotel is also pretty rocky and not easy to swim or snorkel comfortably. Walking south helps somewhat, but the beach at Black Rock is far better, and worth the drive. Other good places to eat around there: Pineapple Grill (Kapalua), Plantation House (also Kapalua), the Gazebo for breakfast. We had dinner at Cheeseburger in Paradise, and it was truly awful food. We all were sick afterwards, so I think there was something off with the meat there. We've eaten there in the past without problems, so maybe it was just that one time. Maui is great fun and the HK is a beautiful resort. Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Too windy...kids everywhere...not value for money.”
Reviews.Author: 2jjai
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Honua Kai Konea tower as part of our honeymoon travels. We were given a mountain facing room which we were happy with having seen the rest of the resort where there is less privacy. We were given a lovely bottle of champagne. The room and hotel generally were clean and spacious. All staff were friendly although I felt service was lacking. I didn't find the 'spa'...you have to go to other hotels/independent places for treatments. The $25 daily resort fee is a bit of a rip off. We were not made aware of this until we got there. Furthermore the items we used were not replenished which I understand was part of the deal. This area of Maui is extremely windy..this is a major negative point about staying at this resort. Furthermore it is a family resort and you will see kids everywhere so its not the kind of place you want to go to relax as a couple. Maui has some beautiful beaches and the one by the hotel is not one of them. The resort is close to shops and food places across the road. Lahaina is a 10 minute drive away. Although the hotel was nice, it is not located in the best part of Maui and I did not think this place offered value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort On This Island”
Reviews.Author: bill c
Reviews.Content: We almost didn't stay here becasue of the reviews we had read about the wind at the resort... After our stay, I urge you - don't worry about the wind you read about in other reviews - Maui is a windy place and the Honua Kai is generally no more windy than the rest of Kaanaplali. Honestly, if it weren't windy it would be too hot. At no time during my stay was the wind a bother. That said, this place was awesome - the best stay I have had at any hotel in any location. Rooms: Awesome, million dollar + condos complete with high-end everything. If you like luxury and are a hotel snob, you'll be in hog heaven. These units are legit. There are no bad views in my opinion - mountains are beautiful and so is the ocean. There is a constructions site to the south of the resort which (IMO) is not a bad view either. Balconies are huge with a full size dining table and chairs - had most of our meals out there... Location: The best location in my opinion. Close enought to all the hoopla of main Kaanapali if thats your thing. Far enough for some peace and relaxation. Market, a great pizza place (Pizza Paradiso), and some other little stores right across the street. We went back to Pizza Paradiso like 4 times over our 6 day stay (it's that good). Beach: Awesome. Some reviewers complain about the reef coming right up to the water line. That is true directly in front of the resort. Just walk like 30 paces south and you have plenty of sand. My little ones and I played in the water all day long every day. The beach was very nice - clear water, a few waves - perfect really and not too crowded. Pools: Lots of them. We stayed around the one with the slide for the kids. Plenty of lounges - never stressful by the pool as it can be in many resorts. Summary: If you like to relax on your vacation then this resort is for you. This place is so low key and the service is top notch. The facilities are truly 5-Star (even the outdoor BBQ's are Viking, c'mon!) - you won't be dissappointed by the detalis - they thought of everything. The location is great and very convienient and if you have kids, they will have plenty to do with the awesome beach and all the pools. We didn't want to leave. I have already recommended Honua Kai to everyone who will listen and am planning our next visit. If you have the means - get a unit with a out door kitchen (yes, they have those) the lanais are so awesome in the rooms - the only thing mine was lacking was one of those BBQ's... Have to send a special thanks to the manager, Darren - he is the best and took alot of extra time (that he didn't have to) to make sure my family and I were happy with our room. He even took us on a tour of the available rooms for us to choose the one we wanted before checking in. Just cant say enough about the people - thanks to everyone and keep it up.... All of the staff at Honua Kai were super friendly - never intrusive but always there if you needed something. I didn't have one negative interaction with hotel staff (that's pretty good for being there 6 days i think).

Reviews.Title: “Far Exceeded Our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: anonymous46429
Reviews.Content: It's always hard to pick a hotel online without referrals. Pictures can be deceiving. This was the BEST choice we could make. We were scheduled to stay at the local Hyatt as we did on our honeymoon 20 years ago. We were coming back with children and the idea of seperate rooms was appealing, so was a kitchen. This is not just a hotel. It was spacious and roomy and it was QUIET, you didn't hear another person in the hotel. This was an immaculate, well maintained property which takes pride in their presentation. As the units are individually owned, each room is maintained properly and it shows. I would ABSOLUTELY suggest this property.

Reviews.Title: “Great family trip”
Reviews.Author: Gabbimama
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a great stay at the Honua Kai Resort - the kids (5 and 2 yrs old) had a blast. They loved all three pools, and my older one especially liked the water slide. The pools were at the perfect temperature. Having Duke's on the property was nice and convenient, and we enjoyed a couple lunches there. We didn't use the kid's club, but It was still a great kid-friendly place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property Especially for Families"”
Reviews.Author: EpiDave
Reviews.Content: So we loved Honua Kai. The rooms were top notch with a comfortable bed, nice living space and fully appointed kitchens. Best part was the folding wall of windows that really brought the outside in. The staff were great, especially the front desk and concierge. I though the concierge service asked us a lot of great questions to get at what we really wanted to do on our trip - did not feel pressured into pricey tours or activities at all. About the wind - its everywhere on Maui. The port at Maalaea (30 mins south) is the second windiest in the world. Here's the thing - without the wind, it would be HOT. This wind keeps the weather on Maui stunning (especially in West Maui). Our only minor complaint, there was no adult pool (like there is at Ritz or other high end resorts). So our fault for choosing the busiest family travel month to go on a couples get-away, but it would have been nice to at least escape screaming Tiffany Britney Amber Emma and her brother Cooper Jackson Jefferson for a few minutes. Truth be told though - ANY resort this time of year would have this issue. But an adult pool would help. And yes - they still have no spa. I didnt miss it but imagine someone would. Bottom line - I would definitely stay here again in a heartbeat, especially once the school year begins. I am totally recommeding Honua Kai to my Brother and his family (2 young children) as well.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place EVER!”
Reviews.Author: tnhelen
Reviews.Content: Actually we stayed in July of 2010 for a week. This resort was one of the most beautiful places we have ever stayed. The valet parking was wonderful - they would even help you with your groceries and were very courteous. The resort was beautiful and immaculate. They provided us with all the amenities we needed with daily housekeeping. We loved it so much we looked into buying a condo at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “great stay, great for families, just keep in mind it's not a "resort" per se”
Reviews.Author: angiewall
Reviews.Content: Today is the last day of our family's stay for a week in Honua Kai Konea 302 booked through Brook at Harris Hawaii. Here's a summary of what we thought. THE UNIT Outstanding unit with 3 beds and baths directly looking at the ocean...very comfortable and luxurious condo, high end finishes, decor, and appliances, w/d, huge deck with seating and dining table...no complaints. Having read the reviews where the people weren't crazy about their ocean views, we decided to go for an alii unit (full on ocean view), which we felt was a great value when booked through Harris. Brook at Harris was super nice and helpful, btw. SERVICE/AMENITIES The thing that would've come as a surprise if we hadn't read the reviews here is the fact that it's very not really a hotel per se, and you get that sense even more so if you book through vrbo or Harris. Also, not sure it's a spa for that matter. I didn't see the spa. Basically it's two towers with high end condos and many of the amenities seem to be leased out for management by other entities: for example there is a little snack and sundries shop in the adjoining tower (Konea is the newer tower) operated by the I'o restaurant people, all the service at the pool (renting out of snorkels, cabanas and gazebos...gazebos are $62 a day, worth every penny...giving out of towels, etc is done by a company that is independently operated (hence they didn't care that one morning a family was playing music a bit loud in their gazebo). The restaurant on site is Duke's and they provide the pool service, as well. Very yummy, good prices. I don't see the fact that there isn't one common management of everything as a problem...it's just different from a resort where everyone has the same unified service mentality. I think here there isn't a lot of staff and what staff there actually is here assumes you know what you're doing and you're on your own. Not to say they're not friendly. BEACH and POOLS As for the beach, it's not a big one with a lot of shoreline before you hit the water but it's lovely. I was expecting it to be a horrible, rocky, coral covered area from some of the reviews but it was fine. As for the pools, they are shallow (I don't think there was any area above 4 or 5 feet) and oriented towards little kids. The waterslide was a bit of a joke as was the lazy river. LOCATION Very close to Lahaina. Lots of great restaurants and touristy things to do there. If you need groceries, which you surely will if you are staying here, go to Costco on teh way from the airport then stop at Safeway in Lahaina. THE CROWD Tons of families with younger kids. Since our kids are 13 and 11, they were a little older than the average crowd. OVERALL I'm glad we chose this place. Traveling with five people (parents, two kids and a grandma) would have meant that we'd have needed 2 or 3 rooms at a regular hotel and we'd have been obligated to eat out for all meals. Staying here, though it was not inexpensive for the alii unit with 3 bed/bath, still ended up costing a lot less than staying at a regular hotel and we had the freedom to eat in sometimes and get our laundry done. Having stayed at other "resort" places with more of a service mentality and fancier poolos maybe spoiled us a little but because we were aware that this wasn't going to be a "resort" vacation, this was an excellent experience. Might try something different next time but would still very highly recommend this, especially to younger families. Not sure if it would be the place for honeymooners or much younger or older travelers for that matter.

Reviews.Title: “The only place i will stay when I come back to Maui with my kids!!”
Reviews.Author: Viva_Vacationer
Reviews.Content: I am very picky, and I love this place!! Very clean, and new, and the staff is so friendly.. The rooms/apartments are stocked with all the amenities of home, so you can travel light.. The ONLY thing that I would recommend is ask for a room NOT facing the highway because it you enjoy having the sliders open, it can get a little noisy..

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to come home!”
Reviews.Author: kurin
Reviews.Content: We returned last week from an 8 day stay in a 2 bedroom/2bath unit. We were upgraded to a partial ocean view room (maybe because we booked through American Express?) and had a wonderful view of the pool and ocean from our large lanai. We loved this property!! The pools and grounds were beautiful. Our room was replenished each day with laundry and dishwasher detergent and fresh towels. We made good use of the kitchen and ate almost all of our meals in the unit and even used the hotel's grills one evening. The wind was a bit strong while we were there, but it seemed to be that way on most of that side of the island. This is a wonderful place to stay, particularly for families. We hope to be back again soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly fantastic vacations”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveler719
Reviews.Content: When we were looking around for Hotel alternatives in Maui we found tons of different places and they all seemed to be quite nice, but we choose (and glad that we did) Honua Kai. From the moment we arrived it was evident that this was a great place to spend our vacation. The room was impecable, the kitchen included evrything needed to prepare a meal (which for us was really important since we were traveling with two young kids) The hotel is right front beach and the swiming pools are just fantastic. The kids loved and of course nothing makes parents more hapier than the kids being happy. The hotel is located in a nice area and we found a supermarket just accros the street from the hotel which was very convenient for grocery shoping. The one thing you need to consider (and this applies to any hotel in Maui) is that you definietively need to rent a car to get around. Public service is non-existing....

Reviews.Title: “My new favourite condo resort”
Reviews.Author: mygirlscats
Reviews.Content: When we started coming to Hawaii, there were two options: hotel or condo. Hotels had comfort for a price; condos were cheaper and it showed. The Honua Kai has really brought together the best of both. We stayed for two weeks in a one bedroom partial ocean view in Konea tower. Our suite is on the north side of the tower. With a partial ocean view, the only time you see the ocean is when you are on the lanai. With such a huge lanai (table and chairs for four, plus an easy chair, footstool and side table and still plenty of room), that quickly became my favourite place in the suite. The Konea tower has contemporary furnishings (I think the other tower is more "tropical"); it is stylish and comfortable. There are ceiling fans in both the bedroom and the living room, which encourages us to keep that glorious folding glass wall open all day. The bedroom has a separate glass door leading to the lanai also; the whole north-facing suite is light and bright. We booked the suite via Expedia, so the booking went through the resort management rather than a private owner. I would consider booking again through an owner, but I didn't really mind paying the $25/day resort fee as I quite like valet parking and on-call service. There have been some uneven reviews about the housekeeping: you get a "tidy" (make beds, fold or replace towels, clean kitchen/bathroom counters and remove garbage) daily, and every third day they do a full clean, with vacuuming, new bed linens etc. I found that the service was fine; they missed our room twice but a phone call down to housekeeping had someone up here within 15 minutes and they spiffed the room up right away. We had some online shopping delivered (some places don't ship to Canada, so we took advantage) and bell service was more than friendly and co-operative delivering large boxes. I also needed -- and got -- good assistance from the front desk and the concierge. Housekeeping leaves a basket of 1/4 lb Kona coffee (one each of regular and decaf), coffee filters, dishwashing & dishwasher detergent, laundry soap and kitchen sponge/towels on arrival. Everything but the coffee will be replenished as needed. We went through a lot of detergent and called down for extra to housekeeping a few times; extras were delivered quickly. The usual toiletries are stocked in the bathroom, also. All the products were very good quality. In our two weeks, my family of three ate at restaurants four times in total. Yep, we made good use of that kitchen! Nice to have a water filter and icemaker; didn't need to stock up on bottled water at Costco on the way in. The fridge/freezer are residential size, so you can bring in a normal load of groceries and know that there is room for everything. I did find that the oven takes a long time to preheat...spent an hour trying to accomplish frozen pizza for the teenager. Be forewarned; turn it on early. I also had to get used to the appliances talking back to me...the coffemaker beeps when it's done, the dishwasher beeps when it's done, the oven beeps ...you get the idea. The only thing to be aware of there is the dishwasher; if you turn it on before going to bed it will keep pestering you through the night to unload it after it's finished! Not helpful when you have kids on the sofabed...factor in the two-hour cycle accordingly. There is much more I could say about the kitchen; it is really well fitted out. Aside from the Bosch appliances, there are casserole dishes, a salad spinner, a baking sheet, lasagna pan, grater, kitchen shears...even a cocktail shaker and two martini glasses. Did I mention a blender and a four-slice toaster (thinking of families here...no waiting!). The knives were really sharp, no squished tomatoes. A teakettle, teapot, sugar and cream set. Two cutting boards so you could keep the raw meat area well separate from the veggies. Someone has really put a lot of thought into this. We used the barbeques outside several times (Viking BBQs with granite countertops around them, very posh!) and never once had to wait. There are six available on the Konea side and more close to the other tower. Tools are available at the front desk, but if you don't return them (cleaned) by 10pm they will charge you a $5 rental fee. Wound up just using a fork to turn the steaks so I didn't have to make the return trip after dinner. Okay, I am lazy. The beds were very comfortable. Even my picky teenager liked her sofabed, and such things are normally the bane of her holidays. High quality linens, and the towels were reasonably soft. The bathtub is deep and a good size, but the temperature on the hot water tank is not set high enough to fill the tub more than halfway before the hot water runs out. The air conditioning was really good...not profoundly cold (you can set it at 65 where it will stay for about an hour before defaulting back to 68), but they have balanced the humidity so that the air is not uncomfortably dry. Add in two big (42"?) flat screen TVs with digital cable (the living room has a blu-ray player) and we were set for serious laziness. The Times Supermarket across the street had about the same size and selection as the Safeway in Lahaina, and I found the prices were comparable but far more convenient. It also had one of those DVD rental machine thingies, which we used a couple of times. The bakery at Times was not the best, but it had a reasonable deli section. The pools were far nicer than any other condo property that I looked at, quite similar to the ones at the Westin Villas. There are four pools, quite shallow as are most pools in modern resorts. The river went to 5' in one area, but 4' was the norm with other shallow areas for little people. The pools are heated, which surprisingly is a good thing in Hawaii, even in the summer. There are four hot tubs (nice after that long flight) and the pool area was rarely very busy. The umbrellas have been bolted to the ground as a precaution against wind, but you can shift your lounge chair around an umbrella if you are seeking shade. The cabanas are rented for $60/day, $30 if you start after lunch, and are yours until 10 pm. That being said, on slow pool days the attendant offered me a cabana for $20 for the afternoon. Being shade-seekers, we were really happy to find that the beach outside had a long, shady area over the sand just a very short walk to the south. The reef and rocks are a short distance from the shoreline; lots of room for kids to splash about in the shallow, sandy part and snorkelling on your doorstep (although I found it got a bit better as you moved toward Black Rock). In a perfect world, what would I change? It would be nice to have a tray to carry stuff to and from the barbeque area, and to have more than exactly four place settings (as soon as breakfast is over, all the dishes are dirty and there are no extras to be had until that 2 hour dishwasher is done!) The glasses get very spotty in the dishwasher, and housekeeping did not provide rinse agent. Minor, minor details in the great scheme of things. I would definitely come back again; this is a new high-water mark for vacation condos.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on earth!”
Reviews.Author: BetteAlkazian
Reviews.Content: Looking out from the lobby toward the ocean was so beautiful! Everytime I walked through I felt a sense of peace. The unit was beautiful with views (even small) of the ocean, palm trees, sunsets, rainbows... We kept the windows open allowing that amazing Maui breeze to fill our unit. Loved the fabulous appliances in the kitchen. Having a full kitchen allowed us to bring in our own food so we didn't have to eat out for every meal. That was so great for my 3 kids! It may seem trivial, but having spa water (with cucumbers in it!) in the lobby on my way to the elevator was a delightful touch! The staff were always so nice and genuinely interested in hearing about where we were from and other info. We would definitely stay there again! Soon, I hope! :)

Reviews.Title: “honua kai is the best place to stay on maui's west side”
Reviews.Author: golferinsf
Reviews.Content: this is our 4th stay at honua kai. great place for the family. lobby, workout facilities, location are great. its much more quiet than the down the beach with all the major hotels. at honua kai you don't have to stake claim for a chair poolside at 7 am unlike the other hotels. great beach, great pools and very family oriented. we stayed in a unit with a mountain view which was great with the morning sun, afternoon rainbows. at sunset we were usually grilling out near the pools or at duke's having dinner. a plus is the supermarket within walking distance and kapalua is less than 10 minutes away for golf. this is a great resort and we will be returning once again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: anna191
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 12 day stay in a 2 bedroom ocean view in the Hokulani building. Our 2 bedroom unit was spacious, clean and had a great ocean view. The property is just gorgeous. My kids loved the pools, hot tub and snorkeling. We ate many meals at Duke's and stopped by the Aina Gourmet market for delicious cupcakes, cookies and coffee. I loved being able to walk across the street to the Times Market and Snorkel Bob's. This location was perfect for us as we were just 10 minutes from the Kapalua/Napili beaches and town of Lahaina. This was our 3rd visit to Maui and our favorite place to stay so far. I booked our trip with Brooke Moore at Harris Hawaii and was very pleased with the service and professionalism. Make sure to try Roy's in Kahana and Ululani's. They were fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome resort for everyone!”
Reviews.Author: tkripala
Reviews.Content: After looking around at a number of different options to stay on Maui, I decided on a 1-BR condo at the Honua Kai for our family of four (2 adults and 2 pre-schoolers), Further research narrowed the list to a few units and found a suite through Harris Hawaii that fitted our needs. Dealing with Harris was a pleasure and they were very patient in dealing with all of my questions as I was booking the suite.Brooke M. from Harris met us at the front of the Hokulani tower and took me to the front desk to pick up the self-parking parking pass. After that we headed up to the suite and along the way Brooke pointed out all of the amenities that were available to us at the Honua Kai. The suite itself was gorgeous! The pictures of the view from the lanai were understated. The view was actually better than the pictures! We even saw a rainbow over the West Maui mountains! With the lanai doors completely open, the breeze was more than enough to cool the suite without needing the air conditioning. The suite came with all amenities, towels, cookware, soap, shampoo, dishwasher detergent, laundry soap, beach towels, and even boogie boards and sand toys for our toddlers! Being on the top floor without another suite above us gave us a feeling of privacy and exclusivity that we did not anticipate. Being close to the elevator (and not hearing it!) was very convenient in getting out for our activities at the beach, pools and the garage. In general, it was very windy during our stay there but the suite and the location more than made up for any deficiencies. Way better for us compared to staying at a hotel. Not having to deal with hotel staff or front desk was a nice thing for us. We didn't eat at Duke's as there weren't too many options available for us vegetarians unless your meal consisted of sides only which didn't seem all that special. The convenience of the kitchen helped us a lot with the meals for the kids and we probably saved a bundle not eating out. Definitely didn't miss any of the conveniences or amenities of a hotel. The beach in front of Honua Kai is much better than what has been described by a number of other reviewers. The better spot is a little further south than directly in front of Honua Kai and the best part is that it was not as crowded as some of the other more popular beaches like Kapalua, Napili or DT Fleming. The waves were not too strong or over-powering and we didn't encounter any rocks that other reviewers have written. Way more rocks at Kapalua beach then here. I was able to swim out about 20-25 yards before noticing any rocks. The pools were ok and the kids had a blast there but it was fairly crowded with lots of families and whenever we were there it was very windy to the point where the only warm spot was being in the water! We enjoyed the beach more as it was less crowded and less windy. We absolutely loved being here and we hope to be back here again next year in the same suite!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean hotel and nice location”
Reviews.Author: parcntravels
Reviews.Content: This hotel is best for large family gathering. Nice beaches and well maintained beach walk trails that connects to other resorts like Westin and Royal Lahaina Resort etc.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Value”
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey P
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a tremedous experience at The Honua Kai. Beautiful facility with outstanding staff. The room, a one bedroom studio, was spacious, clean and contemporary. What you see on the website is what you get. I had a partial ocean view in the north tower that for the money couldn't be beat. In my opinion it is the best value. The pools are wonderful with lots of options and plenty of umbrellas around. Just get there early if you are planning on spending the day, as the best spots go early. It's a great place for kids. So for my next visit, I will go during the school year. The concierge service was extremely helpful. Carolyn assisted in booking a road to Hana tour and a luau. She listened to my preferences and made outstanding recommendations that were spot on. The service staff is very friendly and eager to help. The cleaning staff did a marvelous job of being non-intrusive, but getting the job done. I walked to Whalers Village and viewed a number of the hotels that I had researched and found them a bit lacking in terms of value for the dollar. Honua Kai exceeded my expectations and for my money is the best value in Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Great condo with resort feel”
Reviews.Author: Anialw13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while on Maui for 4 nights. We rented through Kaanapali beach properties and had a 2 bedroom, 2 bath with wrap around lanai. LOVED the lanai and the fact that it had the fabulous sliding wall that could fully open up and enjoy the breezes. We had ocean views and due to the fact that we had a wrap around lanai, we could sit facing the ocean and had a fabulous view! The kitchen was very well stocked and we could have had a full service meal like Thanksgiving if we chose to :) The condo resort was pretty full, yet it did not feel crowded at all by the pool or even at Duke's where we spent several hours one day while we watched our daughter play in the pool. The pool area was really nice with plenty of pool options including slides and at least 4 hot tubs. One reviewer mentioned that the water was shallow but that has been our experience at all the outside resorts and hotels we have stayed in here in HI ( a total of 4). They are all shallow with max 5'. The beach area was nice as well, and you could rent chairs if your condo did not provide one. The one negative, but not the properties fault, was that our ice maker did not work and although called the Kaanapali property folks, they did not fix before we left. It is also VERY windy here, and although nice when you have your lanai open and are simply enjoying yourself, it was hard to sit on the beach as the sand would be kicking up quite high and in your eyes. This was not true for other parts of Maui we went to such as Honolua Bay and Wailea area. It seems that where Honua Kai is located does pick up much more wind. Makes it really chilly when you jump out of the pool :) Overall, I would highly recommend this. Great option to have kitchen, great bathrooms, large rooms, tvs and a fabulous lanai.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, great room and amazing view”
Reviews.Author: CindyR05
Reviews.Content: Honua Kai is a great property. We rented a 2 bedroom/2 bath oceanview unit. Very spacious and clean for our family of 4. Grounds are well maintained, staff was friendly, view was awesome, and pools never seemed crowded. The pools do not have "layers" of lounge chairs like some properties - they hug the edge of the pools and you never feel like you are right on top of one another. It is well located - close to Lahaina. It is breezy at times but I think that was a benefit - the heat was never overwhelming. I would highly recommend this resort but please note - the Spa is not yet open.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely come again”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler923
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two bedroom condo and just loved the room and the resort. (They were also offering a "fall special" for half price, so that helped a lot too!) The condo was perfectly located with easy access to Whalers Village and Lahaina (via car). The room was amazing. Our favorite part was the deck. Even though we stayed in a resort view room, it was beautiful! The biggest deck we have ever had. They had everything you could want in the room in terms of appliances and cooking utensils, plus room service and easy access to Duke's restaurant. The pools at the resort were fine...nothing super special, but a lot of good options, usually pretty easy to find a spot to sit. Only real problem was that it was usually really hard to find anything with good shade as the umbrellas didn't always help with that. I think our biggest complaint would be that none of them are very deep. 4 feet is the deepest, which is great for the kids, but for those of us who actually like to tred water it was a bit of a bummer. The water slide was fun though and our 2 year old son did enjoy the 1 foot deep pool with sand area. Access to the beach was easy and nice. The area around the resort is really windy...but I think that is just a Maui thing, it was windy everywhere we went. :) They also have BBQ grills out by the pools that you can use. A nice cafe, though quite pricey, we did get a few coffee drinks. Prices were comparable to Starbucks. Good sound protection between rooms. The only noise we heard came when people were moving deck furniture. Overall we would definitely like to return!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel....they just need friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Justin T
Reviews.Content: Overall, I thought the hotel was very impressive. My family (wife and 2 kids - both 7) just returned. We stayed for a total of 6 nights. I had searched extensively to find a great hotel at a good rate. It was our first trip to Maui. The hotel itself is great - beautiful property, awesome pool area, easy beach access, etc. My only complaint is that the hotel staff is at best slightly friendly. I am rare to complain but upon check-in the woman acted as if I wasn't even there, the bell hop wasn't around and then chased me down to get my car keys while I hauled my own luggage up, and the final straw - housekeeping is non-existant! They rarely show up to "freshen" up your room. The second day there we came back to our room around 4pm after being out all day. Housekeeping had left our room wide open from when they did clean it earlier in the day. I called to speak to a hotel manager and all they would do was pass me on to "house keeping". I spoke to a woman who said "Opps. We'll make sure it doesn't happen again!" Even with all that being said....as I stated the hotel is a great place to stay. Maui is pretty hard to screw up. I do recommend the hotel for a get-a-way or with your family.....just don't expect to be thrilled by the employees.

Reviews.Title: “Great For Families”
Reviews.Author: SCL94556
Reviews.Content: At the outset, Honua Kai is not the Four Seasons, nor does it pretend to be. Instead, HK is a newish property with nice, clean grounds in a good location. Although not marketed as a family resort, the majority of guests appear to be families who would most benefit from the kitchen and washer/dryer in each unit. The staff was friendly and helpful. My wife left her phone charger at home, and they searched to find a replacement from their stash. Please note that the spa has yet to be built (slated for the Hokulani building). There are three smallish pools (none more than 4' deep) on the property, including a short waterslide. A number of small jacuzzis dot the grounds. We only went to the pools twice, but never had any issues finding available chaise lounges. Frankly, however, the pool areas looked larger in photos than in person. HK fronts a nice long beach. Depending on the tide, coral is present about 30' from the beach, leaving enough to swim in without worrying about the coral. The upside is that there is decent snorkeling right outside HK, which gets better as you near Black Rock to the south. We saw plenty of fish in the water outside of the adjacent Westin. There is a beachwalk which goes down to Black Rock (not as far as Lahaina). Our unit faced the mountains rather than the ocean, which may have been a blessing in disguise. The buildings are shaped in an open U and (as another reviewer noted) the ocean-facing patios open up to one another, mitigating any sense of privacy (except for the units at the very end). Worse, many of the ocean-facing units were adjacent to the pools, which treated guests to games of Marco Polo well into the night. It may be sour grapes, but I'll take the low highway buzz from the mountain side any day. HK is located across the street from the Times Supermarket and a small strip mall (you can't see it from the property). A few low-priced restaurants (L&L, Ono Kau Kau) are within walking distance. Lahaina is 10 minutes away by car. Several on this and other sites have complained about the wind. Yes, it was windy at HK, but it was also windy in Lahaina, Wailuku, Kahalui and upcountry when we were there. My spin is that it would have been much warmer were it not for the wind. I did unnecessarily buy beach mats which were never used because of the wind. When I win the lottery, I'll book at the Four Seasons. Until then, however, Honua Kai is a great option providing the space, amenities and location ideal for my family.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place but not Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Persimmon51
Reviews.Content: First I should preference this review that this location was the second week of our vacation and we loved staying at the Embassy Suites in Waikiki. Comparatively, this place was more expensive including the rental car and the island experience for our family was different. Personally, we enjoyed Oahu much better than Maui since Maui seemed more like visiting someplace in Southern California. The hotel was nice since you have a kitchen to cook and a washer and dryer for you clothes. It would have been nice if they would have had instructions for the washer in the room since there are different slots for the detergent and I had to call the front desk on such a simple item. However, the beds and sofa beds were comfortable, the room furnishing were nice, kitchen items were all nice so it was a good set up for folks who just want to relax at a resort. From looking at all of the resorts in the area, they all look to be fairly nice where you can walk to the beach too, and so the Honua Kaiâ€™s location doesnâ€™t seem to be any better than any other resort in the area. My children loved the pool area, and they have a few different pools so the variety is great for the children to explore. Also the deck with the table and chairs is quite large and so we had a few meals outside dining in this area and it was fun. The one area of weakness was the housekeeping, at the service was too good at times for cleaning. Once I had trouble communicating with housekeeper that on the day we only needed sweeping and garbage, one day the housekeeper said that she would come back with new kitchen towels and she never did, one day we ran out of dishwasher soap, but on the whole these are nuances and not major concerns. But overall, the place it certainly well maintained inside and outside. Overall, I would suggest that since all of the resorts are close together and you need a car to travel anyway, review each resort and see what it appealing to you personally for what you desire and as long as it is price competitive with another resort â€“ book that resort. We do recommend the Honua Kai as the units are nice and the children loved the pool area, however, if we decide to go back to Maui we would consider a different resort if the pricing less.

Reviews.Title: “I only wish high-end suite properties like this were more widely avaialble”
Reviews.Author: gtdroptop
Reviews.Content: This is absolutely everything I dream of when traveling with the family. We used to travel extensively as a young couple and enjoyed staying in relatively higher-end properties. Now that we have young children, it's been a real challenge to vacation with a similar level of accommodations. Our children go to bed at 7pm, so it's critical that they be in a room with a door and we have a separate living space, otherwise we end up sitting in the dark from 7pm until our bedtime. The majority of "suite" properties have the living and bedroom space in the same area with no wall/door separation. It's certainly possible to get adjoining rooms, but that's not usually guaranteed, and I'm not entirely comfortable with my kids in a whole separate hotel room. Marriott's Residence Inn does a good job functionally, but I wish there were higher end accommodations. The Honua Kai is the PERFECT solution. LOVE LOVE LOVE this place! We had a 3 BR/3 BA condo in the Konea tower. This is the newer of the two towers, but is not the main building. If I were to choose, I'd have chosen Hokulani Tower next time, to have closer access to the market, kids club, fish feeding, etc, but not a huge deal. The Konea tower does have the benefit of being the closest to the 3 foot pool which is the warmest, least windy, and the best for preschoolers that can reach the bottom on their own. Each bedroom was beautiful, all the bathrooms were luxuriously appointed. The kitchen impressively had all Viking appliances (two ovens, range, hood, microwave, refrigerator, wine fridge, dishwasher). Big 8-person dining table, huge outdoor deck with outdoor dining and lounge areas. Absolutely gorgeous. The hotel amenities were awesome as well. We rented a high chair, baby bath tub, crib, indoor toys and sand toys. They were all waiting for us when we arrived. The crib was a REAL crib, not just a Pack and Play, and the kids really enjoyed all the toys. At the pool, we also rented an inner tube and a kids' snorkel/fin set that our 3 year old daughter really enjoyed. Duke's restaurant is delicious, their drinks are amazing. While they do have poolside beverage service, it's faster just to go to the bar yourself, the wait staff doesn't really come around that often. Room service is from the Aina market at the hotel, not Duke's, so isn't really worth it. You might as well just go down to the market and order your sandwich yourself. Duke does do takeout though, so it's just an easy 10 minute walk down. The market is "expensive" compared to the mainland, but then again, so is the "normal" supermarket across the street from the hotel. From a rough estimate, groceries are about 2-3X what they cost on the mainland (as compared to Northern California). Our shopping trips were easily $50-$75 per bag. I think that's just unfortunately part of island living. There is a Costco in Maui right by the airport, but that's an hour drive from the resort, so wasn't worth it for us. As many of the review note, the resort is pretty windy. In August, it was warm enough that the winds were generally pleasant but stronger than is ideal. Since we've come back, looks like December and January might be the best times to go in terms of wind.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, very good”
Reviews.Author: x229
Reviews.Content: We rented a 2-bed condo thru VRBO, and it was excellent. Well equipped, comfortable, and came with a range of boogie boards, etc. Lahaina, which is about 10 minutes drive away, has lots of dining options - and the Honua Kai provides barbecues. (We recommend Foodland). The only downside was the persistent wind. It was windy on each of our 7 days, and at one stage the wind was so strong that we couldn't open the door to the lanai / patio!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Todd M
Reviews.Content: My family and I just got back from our vacation and staying at the Honua Kai was fantastic. The 2 bd, 2 bath condo was perfect. The appliances were new and stainless steel. All of the employees were very nice and helpful. Some people have complained about the wind. I call it a strong breeze and it is needed. Without the breeze, it does get a little hot so the wind was not an issue. I've also heard people complain about a smell. There wasn't any bad smell. BTW, I love to snorkel and one of the best areas is right in front of the hotel. Lots of beautiful fish and coral. My son and I even swam with turtles on different days. This area is better than black rock. We will be back. Todd, Riverside, California

Reviews.Title: “You HAVE to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: soansari
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bed/2 bath unit and it was phenomenal!! I know this because we stayed for 2 days prior at a Kaanapali beach hotel, and when we moved here - well, what a breath of heaven and fresh air! Breathing room, relaxation, no crowds. THIS is Maui. And guess what, if you still long for the crowds and activity, drive 5 minutes down the road to whalers village and all the great food/shopping. But when you're done, drive home to the quiet luxury of Honua Kai. We even drove to Wailea to have lunch at the #1 rated Four Seasons, and boy was I glad we didn't stay there - super super crowded. Wall to wall people - for that price? No thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Family Resort with great amenities”
Reviews.Author: TexasTX_Travelers
Reviews.Content: We rented a 2 BR Oceanview room through Harris Hawaii. Brooke Moore was fantastic and very easy to work with. The room was exceptional with a separate bedroom and bathroom for the kids (ages 7 and 9) and they even broke the bed into two twins so the kids didn't have to share a king. It has a wonderful kitchen with everything you could need, washer and dryer and, in general, high end furnishings. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in away from home. The lanai was huge and the wall of windows that you could open up was a very nice touch. The entire property was very well maintained and beautiful. A few pointers we learned that may be helpful to some others: 1. This is a great family resort. If you are looking for a quiet couples resort, there may be other that are better. It is also very new. The Konea Tower (Which we stayed in) just opened last year and the other tower opened in 2009 so everything is pretty new. 2. The pools are fantastic, water slide, lots of hot tubs, waterfalls and free form pools. I did not see any that were explicitly only for adults. They also do not have lifegaurds, so the rules are loosely enforced but we saw no disarrary during our time there. 3. Food and drink service by the pool during our stay was excellent. Happy Hour from 3-5 was one of our favorite things - $5 Mai tais and drink specials as well as appetizer specials. As with anywhere, the level of service is probably impacted by how friendly you are or how well you tip if you have a couple wait staff waiting on 300 people. 4. The Beach is great and very close as is the reef. You can literally see exactly where the reef starts and it is close to the shore. Swimming is better just to the south area of the resort. If you are an idiot and go walking out on to the reef with bare feet you will definitely get hurt. Having said that, the snorkeling is fantastic, especially in the morning. We saw tons of different fish, see turtles, and all sorts of life just a few yards away from the sand. The beach was also not crowded. The resort will set up chairs and umbrellas for you if you want, but we never used this. 5. We did the Royal Lahina Luau which was a nice walk down the beach walk to the Royal Lahaina Resort. There are some bad reviews on this but we found it to be fantastic. Again, if you want a romantic luau with table service this might not be your choice. For a family with kids, it was incredibly good. Hint - buy your tickets on the Royal Lahaina website - you get VIP table and free blender drinks all night and most importantly do not have to wait in line for about the same price as the tour operators will charge. 6. Pizza Paradiso across the street had fantastic pizza, Moose Mcgillicudy's in Lahaina had great breakfast. Very nice dinner and atmosphere at the Hula Grill in Whaler's village. Betty's Beach house in Lahaina has a beautiful sunset on one side, sports bar in te other direction and front row seats to a luau that you can watch for free directly in front of you starting around 7 if you want to (Get a table around 6:15 or 6:30). Ululani's shave ice was our favorite and we tried a few. 7. Road to Hana is not difficult and fun, especially if you explore some of the trails and swim in the waterfalls. Leave early in the day. 8. Haleakala was cool, we didn't do it at sunrise. Waited until 9:30 to leave the resort and avoided the crowds. 9. The coffe at the Aina coffee shop in the resort is exceptional. 10. Duke's restaurant at the hotel is quite good. Make sure you get the hula pie. 11. If you rent form a owner or property manager, you get a slightly different experience than renting as a hotel room through the resort (no daily housekeeping, free towels at the pool or room charging), however, we got garage parking directly under our unit and a huge cost savings as a result. We also got a closet full of beach toys. Honua Kai proved to be a great home base for a wonderful family vacation and we wouldn't hesitate to come back or to rent from Harris Hawaii and Brooke Moore.

Reviews.Title: “Do not hesitate to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Benw2011
Reviews.Content: Read previouse reviews as you should but please take with a grain of salt. This resort is absolutely top notch! The accomodations were excellent, the staff ultimately accomadating, and overall value exceeded expectations - check for deals during certain times and 7th day free. Dukes - great food and great people. Cost is comprable to Big City meals and quality is equal. Stayed in a mountain view on 7th floor - great. Really did not see need for ocean view as by the time we were in the room it was dark. I normally do not take the time to write reviews but felt compelled as our families experience was just that great. Oh, I agree with one con - there is no spa. But, go elsewhere for that if you really need it - this place is, as my son put it ,"Beastly!".

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort but TOO WINDY!”
Reviews.Author: travlfamly
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 4 weeks in Hawaii, the last 2 in Maui at the Honua Kai. The resort itself is very nice, very clean, and the room was perfect and spacious (we had a 1 bedroom plus den, so each of my 2 kids had their own bed, and we had a king in the bedroom) I have no complaints about the resort or the service. Everyone from the front desk staff, to the valet, to the bell service, to the concierge, were very friendly and helpful (although housekeeping was a bit inconsistent). But whoever decided to build this resort right where the valley funnels the trade winds down the mountain directly into it should be fired. I'm not talking gentle summer breezes, which would have been welcome, but most days it was so gusty that nothing stayed put--not your beach towels, not your food/drinks, and not even the pool chairs! We spent 12 full days here and it was always windy, which became very annoying, especially when a 5 minute walk down the beach and there was NO wind. We left the resort most nights and went to Lahaina to enjoy the beautiful, calm, warm nights there. We have always travelled to tropical destinations at Spring Break, and this was our first time to Hawaii in the summer. The wind did not blow like that in Honolulu, nor anywhere on the Big Island (we were at Hilo and Kona), nor anywhere else in Maui for that matter (we drove to Hana) When we inquired about it at the resort, we were told "That's the Trade Winds". It's too bad there was such bad planning to put a beautiful resort in such a bad spot. Our kids enjoyed the pools, we enjoyed the hot tubs and watching the sun set at night, but we definitely won't return in the summer. Next time we will stay closer to Lahaina where it is hot and the WIND DOESN"T BLOW. **a note about Duke's Restaurant: if you think you are getting a deal at Happy Hour, you are not. They fill the cups with twice the ice and charge half the price. Same goes for the Happy Hour food menu, much smaller portions. $9 for a cocktail in a plastic cup full of ice at the pool is too high, but I guess that's Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious unit with exceptional customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa A
Reviews.Content: We stayed in unit #622 for 9 wonderful days. From the moment we walked into the condo we immediately felt "at home." The unit was spotless and included high end linens, towels and very comfortable King beds. Everything you would find in a luxurious hotel, but with a lot more space and a smaller price tag! Also included in the condo was just about everything we needed for a great day at the beach including chairs, boogie board and cooler. Unit #622 was so well equipped, the only thing we needed to buy was groceries--which was conveniently within walking distance! Nikta was an absolute pleasure to work with. She repeatedly followed up with us during the booking process and throughout our stay. She even offered to help with luau tickets and had the hotel concierge contact us for additional assistance prior to our visit! The welcome basket was also a nice, personal touch. A definite "extra" that you wouldn't find in a hotel! The resort is a great place for families or couples looking to relax. Overall, we agree that our stay was a very good value and we would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Please understand..... This place is NOT for single, young couples, or energetic people”
Reviews.Author: houstontx1976
Reviews.Content: I am here (35 YR OLD MALE) now and after checking in, I am very surprised at this resort. first of all... it is mostly a time share property which means that the rooms are VERY nice and have a comfortable "homey" feel. I am 35 years old and I have my mother with me (of who I brought with me to spend some quality time). The staff are awesome. OH... RENT A CAR AT THE AIR PORT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!@!!!!!!!@!@!!!@!!@!@!!@!! cab ride here was 100!!!!!! Rented a brand new RED jeep for 179.99 for 7 days!!! OMG! The "ocean view" is bull pooo! You can see the ocean, but as I write this... 60 people are watching me with my shirt off from their balconies and from my bed... all i see is 60 balconies! The bar (Dukes Restaurant) does NOT play music during the day, so sitting there drinking a frosty beverage is just about as boring as playing bingo by yourself! There are 4 kids to every adult and when they say they have "adult pools".... BULL MESS!!!!!! The property is first class, the staff are ... first class, the food and bar are.... well done, but the truth is.... please do NOT come here looking for excitement! This hotel is, hands down the BEST place to bring your loved one for some ONE on ONE time. The views are great (not from your room), the air is clean, and the ocean is near. Bring your "best friend" and have a romantic theme in mind... and you will have a great time. Anyone under 40 who are here with no kids..... its not just this hotel. Its Maui! Boring! I am a retired 35 yr old who does not party or even go to clubs. I have been there and done that over 7 years ago..... This place is 100% boring unless you have a lot of 1 on 1 time with your best friend in mind, but tomorrow I am taking my mother fishing for an 8 hour marlin hunting adventure, so I will keep you posted. Please do NOT think I am being negative. I am being honest on my experience and I wanted to give back to this website because it has given me a lot over the years. Cheers to ALL vacationers and no matter what.... have a great time away from the daily grind of our rush rush lives! Peace to all! I hope this helped

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place for a Honeymoon!!”
Reviews.Author: NicoleOnrario_Canada
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to Maui on our honeymoon and have nothing but GREAT reviews of the island and of this resort. We booked the condo through Chasing Rainbows and they made our arrangements very easy. Our air didnt work (it was our fault) so we called Chasin Rainbows and within 15 minutes someone was there to fix it. Our studio condo was perfect for the 2 of us. Anymore would have needed a larger room. Everything was spotless and our view was breathtaking. The pools were perfect and we had three to choose from. The beach was nice and quiet and when we wanted something a bit more we travelled down the road to Kanapali West beaches. Dukes and the speciality store were great places to eat. All staff was polite and courteous! We cannot wait to visit this property again and would recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to rent a condo on Kaanapali”
Reviews.Author: whatupdude
Reviews.Content: My family loved this place. I can't say enough great things about this property. We rented thru VRBO and had a 3 bedroom with all the rooms having an ocean view. I highly recommend #625 in the Hokulani tower. Steve the owner is super. The only negative is the wind. At times is was too much. However, it keeps things cool. My kids didn't notice the wind though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort for a family vacation”
Reviews.Author: natmah
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first vacation to Maui. We booked the Honua Kai resort through Costco Travel. We had looked at the many reviews in this forum before our trip and were not sure what to expect. I would say that this was one of our best places we have ever stayed. The place is very new and furnished with top notch (Bosch) appliances including Washer/Dryer. The kitchen is fully stocked with all kinds of utensils and cutlery. We got a room on the 10th Floor (topmost) in the Konea tower. Our room was facing the mountain but we also had a partial ocean view. The service was very good and more than met our expectations. The overall atmosphere was very family friendly. Let me tell you a few things that have been highlighted in some other reviews. 1. Yes, the place is a bit windy, but it did not bother us one bit. In fact, it seemed to be a blessing in disguise when you are not in the water. 2. Pool facility - Yes, there are no pools which are deeper than 5 feet. Again, it was the least of our botheration. We and our two kids (9 & 14) had a great time. The pool service was evidently absent, but we never felt the need for it. 3. Restaurants - We went to Dukes just once to have a drink. Being vegetarians, we did not find anything suitable. Again, we ended up going to other restaurants in the Lahaina area and mostly fixed our own meal in the room and had them sitting in the Lanai enjoying the excellent view. We could pick up groceries from the Times Supermarket conveniently located across the road from the resort. 4. Beach â€“ There are a few rocks you need to be careful of. If you need to have a better experience in the beach, we would recommend going to the Kaanapali beach in Whalerâ€™s village which is just 5 minutes away by drive. 5. Gym â€“ We used the facility and found it more than adequate with a good number of equipment. If we have to pick one negative aspect of the room itself, it will be the bathroom. It is quite small and was sometimes a bottleneck for a family of 4.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back***Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Wow99NewJersey
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, our two sons (14/10) and our daughter and future son-in-law stayed for 6 nights in a 3 bedroom 1st floor suite Aug 3-9. It was outstanding, the rooms was larger than expected, plenty of room to spread out and lounge (very clean and top of the line appliances and granite) easy access to the pool and beach as well as Dukes for drinks or eats. Usually Marriott people but this place beats what they have. Very convenient location and valets was very quick and constantly offered to carry bags/groceries to the room. If you are thinking of staying in Maui, definitely look into this place a true 5 star resort

Reviews.Title: “Great family resort !”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravelmd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Honua Kai in the Konea tower with our children. Rooms are spotless and having most meals in the unit is fantastic. We could not the the kids out of the pool. The kids club is another bonus. Very inexpensive compared to other hotels and our children did not want to leave. The staff at the kids club was amazing. We did find it breezy at times but for us a welcome relief from the heat after spending a day at the beach or in lahaina. It was great to sit outside without the need for a/c at night. Dukes and Aina the on site restaurants had fantastic food. Another plus is the food market within walking distance. The beach is great for snorkeling but not for much else which is great for us since we are not "beach people" If you want a new, clean and quiet resort with all the amenities of home this resort is fantastic . Check out the Maui golf and sports club what a blast.

Reviews.Title: “Honua Kai room 622, a dream come true”
Reviews.Author: Marc G
Reviews.Content: We stayed in unit 622 at Honuakai in July 2011 and had a wonderful time. We were greeted with fresh flowers and a fruit basket â€“ what a nice surprise! The condo was exceptionally clean and looked brand new. The kitchen had everything from paper towels to tea bags to spices. Same goes for â€˜beach preparednessâ€™ â€“ everything from beach chairs to umbrella to towels. What we cherished the most, though, was the personal touch the property manager, Nikta Houston, provided. She gave us great tips on where to go eat and what to do, and even called us after our arrival to see if everything was okay. We will definitely come back next year!

Reviews.Title: “service lacking.”
Reviews.Author: gsydaust
Reviews.Content: I am in my late 20's and I travelled with a friend. we found the rooms to be beautiful and very comfortable but the service was lacking, especially for the price we payed. i would have rather of stayed elsewhere and gotten better service as its the friendliness of the staff that makes it a special place to stay. reading previous reviews, it was suggested that we should book a ocean view room, so we payed an extra $150 for the ocean view.
