Our room had no ocean view, there was a large tree in front of our room, blocking everything. when we brought this up with the front desk, the first time we were told that someone would get back to us but no one ever did and when we chased it up again we were told that we had booked a 'partial' ocean view, however there was no 'partial' view of the ocean at all! we would have been happy with a partial view but all we had was a tree and a view of the opposite building. we never got refunded, which is very poor as we payed for something we never got. we were dropped off at the old building at the resort by a taxi. when we approached the front desk they told us we were at the new building and just pointed to the general direction we should walk to. we asked if they could bring our suitecases for us but they said no. not impressed as we had travelled for 13 hrs to get to this resort and we had to drag the suitcases across the resort. activities centre booked a few tuors for us, but the ones they picked and suggested were inappropriate. the resort is more suitable for families, if u are a young couple or a few friends i suggest u stay elsewhere and you must have a car. the rooms were beautiful with everything u need, but the service was lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family”
Reviews.Author: KyleHuntersvile
Reviews.Content: We had a two week vacation in Hawaii. We stayed in Waikiki for the first 6 days, Honua Kai for the next 5 days and the north shore of Oahu for the last 3 days. Honua Kai and Maui was our favorite part of the vacation. Honua Kai is only 15 minutes away from Lahaina which had plenty of reseraunts and shopping and 1-2 miles North of Ka anapali. Even though it was close to these areas, it was far enough away for the beach to be faily quiet and relaxing. It is important to rent a car to get araound, since it is a faily long walk to any resteraunt other than Dukes. The beach was great for snorkling (better than Black Rock). We saw sea turtles, moray eels and plenty of beautiful fish. The view from the beach is beautiful with Lanai and Molokai in the distance. If you want a sandy bottom for swimming, you might be better off staying in Ka anapali. The room are very nice and comfortable. We liked the convenience of the washer/drier in the room. We had a partial ocean view which let us see the ocean at one side and the mountains on the other. Every day there was a rainbow over the mountains.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: SharolynWV
Reviews.Content: Great time at the Honua Kai! Just returned from a 2 week stay at the Honua Kai with my husband and 6 year old daughter. Would would stay here again for sure. Here are my candid thoughts. Likes: - I booked with a membership code and saved 40% off of the best advertised rate available from the resort directly ... so I got a better rate than from an owner directly as well as daily housekeeping service... SCORE! Picking up a room for $250 a night really made the vacation feel like an amazing value. - lovely grounds - nice room furnishings - no high pressured sales presentations or phoney invitations/gifts - felt safe at all hours on the property - great valets - nice boardwalk to the black rock Just okays - the ocean is good for snorkeling but just okay for younger children. Go to Napali or Kapaula for some GREAT family-friendly beach time where you don't have to be an arm's length away from your weak swimmer. - hotel could add either a towel-rack or shelving in the bathroom for toiletries and provide small stools for families with young children to assist them reaching sinks. - almost time to replace the mattresses.. some nights were good.. others were bad. Dislikes: - windy... it did make some days very difficult to enjoy.. patio furniture was being blown across the grounds but that was an extreme day ... the other days it was still very windy - too windy to read a book, golf, etc. - pool service is horrendous.. if you happen to find someone to order from they don't seem to EVER come back.. waiting an hour is not good customer service. Mgmt needs to address this issue. - would be nice to have a shuttle in to Whaler's village in the evenings so that families enjoying a Luau do not have to ben concerned if they have a drink or two - activity desk seemed a bit clueless and disinterested when approached about events happening in the resort - no planned activities in the resort itself - didn't see anyone checking the chemical levels in the pool - many children were poorly behaved at the pool... running up the waterslides after they had closed and jumping down rocky waterfalls... parents need to take responsibility here though. We did not use the kids club ... ironic as we have ALWAYS used them when we go on vacation so I am trying to figure out why we didn't this time. Maybe it was because the program is housed 'out of the way' and we didn't see a group of happy children doing activities or exploring the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice condo/hotel near all...great for families!”
Reviews.Author: laurence00
Reviews.Content: The view at the Honea Kai was partial. You could only see the ocean if you went on the lanai and looked left. The main view was looking at the property next door. The traffic noise from the freeway next to the hotel was bothersomeâ€¦would have preferred the view off the center of the hotel looking over the pool. The room itself was excellent, with plenty of room for us and our 3 teenagers. Very comfortable beds with modern appliances in the kitchen. The pools were very nice, but there was no main, large poolâ€¦only smaller "river-like" pools/streams. The beach was nice, but there were no amenities or rentals. The beach was quite rocky so it wasn't very good for swimming. The only restaurant "Dukes" was very good, but the menu is limited. Service all around was excellent with a very helpful concierge desk. A large market is right across the street and you are close to all of the Lahaina restaurants. All in all a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Unit 219 offered great value on Kaanapali Beach”
Reviews.Author: Catitude
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Honua Kai in November 2009 for a week. We found unit 219 (Studio) available as a vacation rental on vrbo.com, and later learned that it's also available through mostromanticvacations.com. We had a great room rate because we stayed in low season, and there was still some minor construction on the resort (beachside restaurant was being completed). The hotel was about a 40 minute drive from the airport. Upon arrival, our room entry was convenient with a programmed pin key code provided in our reservation confirmation. The room was spacious, clean and modern with a large walk-out terasse which overlooks a large pool area and ocean. It also had a washer/dryer stacked in a hallway closet which we found convenient for the back half of our two-week/three island vacation. The kitchen was well-equipped with modern appliances, and a few complimentary consumable items like coffee and filters. The resort was fairly new, so it was all very clean and quiet. The pool facilities were nice and were within a few feet of the beach. The resort's location is just a short drive from Lahaina. The bellboys recommended a grocery store nearby, but we found it pricey. There is a nice grocery store in Lahaina with great food, including fresh seafood, great service and was competitively priced. In addition to Lahaina, there are other attractions nearby including a few beaches north of Kaanapali. There is a Marina and Aquarium about 30 minutes away which serves as a base for several activities and day-trips. The resort's concierge was very helpful in planning our time in Maui. We took a few days trips including the Road to Hanna, deep-sea fishing and a catamaran snorkel trip which included snorkelling with sea turtles. Dining in Lahaina was disappointing in general. Food was not bad, but not great. Menus were boring and a little overpriced. We found inspiration from local ingredients and seafood from the grocery store and enjoyed cooking in our room. On our last day, we decided to give Mama's Fish House a try on our way to the airport. the restaurant name led us to believe it was a casual restaurant so we didn't make reservations, and were not appropriately dressed. The restaurant's owner was unpretentious - he greeted us at the door and let us in anyway. He and our waitress did their best to make us comfortable. The menu options were not cheap, but the food was fantastic! We would return to Maui just to eat here again, and consider Mama's Fish House one of the island's best attractions. Overall, we had a great stay at Honua Kai. We're also fans of Westin resorts, so if room rates were equal, we might stay at the Westin next time. However we would not hesitate to stay at Honua Kai again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort BUT too windy, too noisy and extremely expensive on everything for the time you pass here”
Reviews.Author: Jkenk
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband came for our honeymoon at this resort. At first we were very happy of our studio room 519. Nice lay out and very good location. We stay 10 days. But it is extremely windy. Yesterday the wind was 51 km/h. Today it's 14km/h which is not too bad. There is a supermarket just around the corner where you can get all you need. I most say we didn't reserve through the hotel but through the Kaanapali beach website resort. Much cheaper and you don't have the cleaners bother you all the time or worry about someone stealing something from your room. The other thing I found ridiculous is the umbrealla you can rent. You better off buy one at the store. Here they charge you $15/day or $8/hour. If you want to stay around the pool which is nice but because of the wind it's hard to keep the umbrella open all the time. In addition, if you want food it's take fo ever. You are not allowed to bring alcohol to the beach. In the evening, there is lots of noise over different balcony. It's seem some of the people just doesn't care. It's kind of annoying when you want to relax after a nice day on your balcony. The duke restaurant is very good. The staff are nice and very polite. The is need of more staff hiring there but in general it is very nice. You would like the morning breakfast there. The cute birds who always want to have your crums left. Very cute In general -yes it is nice but I think the next time we are back I would like to go to the south- kihei

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay with little kids. Convenient, Convenient, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: smopart
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Honua Kai for 3 nights in late July. We have two young boys( 4 months and 3 years). This resort was perfect for us because of the convenience of having a full kitchen, washer/dryer, and dishwasher. Did laundry EVERY day. NIce that they provided all cleaning supplies and detergents. We had a 1 bedroom resort view. Our first room was in the Hokulani tower but overlooked the parking lot. With one quick call they happily moved us to the Konea tower and we had a nice mountain and resort view with a view of the koi pond as well. The Aina Gourmet was very conveneint to pick up small things such as milk, juice, beer, wine. We did go to the Times Grocery accross the street as well which was fairly reasonable. The rooms are huge with big lanais. Still quite new with very fancy appliances. Bathroom was huge with Aveda products. Maid service was adaquete. Elevators were fast. Concierge was extremely helpful in making restaurant reservations as well as luau reservations. The grounds are big and the pools were nice. Wish the lazy river had a current and the pools were a bit more elaborate but was still quite nice. The waitresses by the pool were few and far between. Took quite a while to drinks and get our checks.The green area around the pools was nice to sit in at night. The location of the hotel was good. Plenty of restaurants etc around the area. The luau at the Hyatt was great and close by. Went to Lelani's in the Whalers Village and the food and views were great. Also took the kids on the Sugarcane Train. The station is right across the street from the hotel which was great. Valet parking was ok but at night time it was was quite slow. Overall, it was a great stay. Good location, family friendly, great rooms. We moved to the Grand Wailea for 3 more nights for a wedding. Separate review for that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice family resort but WINDY!”
Reviews.Author: Navlone
Reviews.Content: I am not one to complain about much, especially when you are in Hawaii! This resort is very, very nice. We stayed in a 2 bedroom partial ocean view unit, two adults and three children (Teens). The condos are extremely clean and well appointed. The units are stocked full with cookware, dishes etc... that you will need to prepare most any meal. The staff is friendly and the grounds are kept very clean. The grocery store across the street is literally within walking distance and is stocked just as your local grocery store. If you are renting from the resort, you will not have anything in the condo i.e. spices, condiments etcâ€¦but they do supply you with paper towels and toilet paper. The washer/dryer is nice and they supply you daily with laundry detergent and dishwasher detergent. The foldout bed in the living room has a down comforter and extra pillows in the coffee table/cedar chest. The beds/pillows are very comfortable. The accordion doors from the living room to lanai are awesome. Now for the windâ€¦ This is not your typical Hawaiian breeze. This is blow your hat off wind, blow your towels off your chair wind and blow your half full $12.00 Lava Flow over. We took a few early morning walks down to Whalers Village, (about 2 miles, very nice walk, I recommend it) the pathway passes through several other resorts. You could feel the wind die down as you walked south. That was your typical Hawaiian breeze. We spent very little time at the pool because of it which is a shame because the pools are very nice. I was a little worried about the beach out front because of the reviews I read here. The beach is perfect. All sand up to about chest height and then coral reef, which is nice because you can snorkel right in front of the resort. Our last day was to be a lounge around resort day. I checked my family out and booked a room at Makena Beach Resort over in the Wailea area. What a difference! We were at the pool and overheard some people comment on the wind that day. Ha! That wasnâ€™t wind, that was a nice Hawaiian breeze. Not even comparable. Again, I donâ€™t like to complain because this is paradise, but the wind is bad and was bad EVERY DAY. I asked some employees if it is always windy like that, they said â€œyepâ€�! Loved the resort, hated the wind. So much, I would not stay here again. I would stay somewhere south of here or over in the Wailea area. If youâ€™re looking for a NICE place to stay and spend your days somewhere else, then this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “You need to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: lookforme
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon. This resort is gorgeous! We splurged a little staying here and don't regret it for a minute. The resort is exactly as shown online. There are two buildings, and the main registration desk is in the Hokulani building. If you follow the signs on the property it is very clearly marked. We went to this building & registered & then we drove over to the Konea building where are our room was. Listed below are the Pros & Cons of staying here ... as you can see the Pros heavily outweigh the cons! Pro: -resort is new, clean, & gorgeous -Aveda products in the bathroom -Duke's restaurant onsite -easy walk to Whaler's Village (shopping & restaurants) -lots of pools & pool seating -staff is very helpful & friendly -maid service is excellent! They do a light tidy up daily & every third day they do a big clean. -well stocked kitchen (everything you need & a nice welcome package of laundry detergent/dishwasher detergent, coffee, etc). -Grocery store right across the street that is open until 1:00 a.m. Cons: -it would be nice if they had a designated adult pool. -You need to book an oceanview room. The resort is beautiful, but we wouldn't want to have stayed on the sides or backside of the hotel. -The people above us seemed to like to move their deck chairs around a LOT. It would be nice if the deck furniture had those rubber footings to help muffle the sound a bit. It sounded like nails on a chalkboard!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Kaanapali”
Reviews.Author: my_travels99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our trip to Maui in May after getting a good deal on Costco Travel. Our friend recommended this hotel after staying here with his family. He loved it and for the most part I would agree. Our 2 bedroom condo was spacious and well appointed with a partial view of the ocean. Since the hotel was not busy we were upgraded from a resort view room. The lanai was the width of the condo and the sliding doors opened up the entire living room. A couple of times we forgot to put the sliding screen in place and birds flew into our condo. One other note is that the A/C will automatically turn off if the patio doors are open. The two rooms were spacious, with both having king sized beds and adjoining bathrooms. One of the rooms was slightly smaller and didn't have a window that opened. The other room had a patio with access to the lanai. The former room's share the same thermostat with the living room so if you had the patio open as mentioned above, that room could get a little hot. The latter room had it's own thermostat control. There are LCD TV's in every room with the usual assortment of channels. Wifi is included with the $25 daily resort fee. There are plenty of pools in the resort and it was not too crowded during our stay. Most of the pools are pretty shallow and well suited for kids. The beach was a short walk from the pools and while small, had nice sand and you could enter the water easily. We snorkeled a few times and did see some fish, no turtles though. A couple of the other places we looked at before picking the HK had steep entries into the water or a rocky beach. As some others have mentioned it was very windy for a good part of our stay and not as warm and sunny as I imagined. After reading some of the reviews on TripAdvisor, maybe that's the norm? There's a restaurant, Duke's, located near the pools. It was convenient with very good food and prices on par with a lot of the other restaurants in the area. The Ahi Poke and Ahi Tuna main course were particularly good. Overall, I really enjoyed our stay and would stay here again the next time we are in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Family Resort!”
Reviews.Author: OCTravelers4
Reviews.Content: Loved it! The Resort looks just like the pictures on the website. Clean, well maintained, polite, courteous staff and valets. Major kudos to Jared, Leo and Jake. These guys were always courteous and helpful. Pulled up with a car load of baggage and groceries. They pulled everything out of our car and stored it in cool containers until our room was ready and delivered it. Beautiful grounds, very family oriented. Not a location for a weekend romance. Families barbecuing, playing in the pools and swimming in the ocean. Families having meals on the large lanaiâ€™s and enjoying the sunset. The reviews about the sanitation plant off the highway in near proximity to the Resort are a bit harsh. Only on a couple of occasions did we get a mere whiff of the plant when the wind shifted. This did not detract from our enjoying the grounds. We had a mountain view, one bedroom for ourselves and two teenage daughters. The sanitation plant was in plain site but was not obstructing our view or overbearing. It was on the other side of the highway and you really didnâ€™t notice it (really - it wasn't that significant). Suggest stopping off at the Safeway (bring your Vonâ€™s Club Cardâ€”things are expensive) on the way in to Lahani. Safeway is about 10-minutes from the Resort on the way in. There is a Times Market very similar and very comparable to the Safeway right across the street from the Resort. This will save you a tremendous amount of money on feeding the family. Had a late lunch at Dukeâ€™s restaurant which is right on the Resort the day we arrived. Food was very good. Take note â€“ this is a practice that I am seeing more of. Upon ordering drinks poolside or from the waitresses at the bar (this is a service Dukeâ€™s provides, not the Resort), we did not receive the change due us from our transaction. The waitresses informed us that the bartenders do not like them to carry â€œcoin.â€� Well, the waitress lost out on some of her tip because the .55 cents that we were due we didnâ€™t get unless you asked for the exact change. Over time, this begins to add up. The only other minor item was with the housekeeping. We were there for 10-days. There was supposed to be a more complete cleaning half way through our stay. I donâ€™t think this ever happened. Most days there was daily trash emptying and bed making. We also took out trash and made the sofabed â€“ remember it is a condo resort not a full service hotel. Did purchase supplies of toilet paper and papertowels. Bring water shoes for the beach. This helps when walking in the surf on the rocks to get in the ocean. The beach is clean and not real rocky but the shoes helped a lot. We would definitely return to the Honua Kai.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place. We are already planning our trip back!”
Reviews.Author: ReadyToGoBack10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from staying 7 days and 6 nights at the Honua Kai. We were very impressed by the grounds and the quality of the rooms. I will preface this review by stating that we booked with Harris Hawaii and were able to pick the specific room we were staying in. I highly suggest this option. We knew exactly what our view would be before we left the mainland and that was reassuring to say the least. There are some units in this complex I would personally not want to stay in. Some of the Mountain view rooms look directly across the street at the sewage treatment facility. While it did not bother us at all, I would not want to pay to look at/smell that for my entire vacation. As other reviews have stated the Honua Kai does not have the biggest beach in the world. My wife and I were very happy with it though. It didn't get nearly as busy as the other beaches around the rest of the island, which is what we were looking for. There are plenty of places were you can wade in and out of the water without encountering many rocks. We were very happy with the foliage that hangs over the very edge of the beach. It gave us a great way to get out of the shade without having to rent an umbrella. We also stocked a cooler and took our own beverages to the beach. I didn't see anyone serving drinks on the beach so this was perfect for us. You are not allowed to have a cooler by the pool as Duke's restaurant is responsible for serving drinks. Seemed like service was pretty slow, but I'll admit we did not use any server. The location of the resort is great. Right in between Lahaina and Kapalua. We spent nights in both places and it was not more than a 10 minute drive either way. This does seem to be one of windiest parts of the island, but it was actually quite refreshing to us and didn't cause much inconvenience. It was very nice to have the kitchen amenities in the condo. We were able to do breakfast and lunch in almost every day and saved us a ton of money on food. We were also able to buy 90% of our beverages(adult and kid friendly) from the grocery store. It was great to have a full size refrigerator to keep drinks cold and make ice when needed. The times grocery store is just outside of the complex and was fine for picking up what you needed. We saw nicer stores on the island, but this was close and the prices seemed to be fair. If you were staying for longer than a week you might want to stop at Costco by the airport. We will probably do this next trip. Overall this was a great place to stay and we will be back. I think this resort can really be what you make it. My wife and I were looking for a place to relax and keep to ourselves and try not the blow our budget on drinks and food. This is a great place for that. However if you choose to eat out every meal and order your drinks Duke's is a great place to do it. We ate there twice and were very impressed by the food. The Mai Tai was not the greatest though. If you want a great Mai Tai you have to head to Mamma's Fish house!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Clean, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: dcsmeyer
Reviews.Content: The beauty of this resort hits you as you approach. The check-in process was very easy and everyone was extremely friendly. We had a 9th floor room that was huge with a mountain view. We could still see the ocean and the mountains were beautiful. No bad views. The kitchen was well equipped and we were able to eat breakfast everyday in our room. The grocery store across the street was also a help. It was great to have our own washer and dryer, just wish we had more hangers. The pool was amazing. There was a lot of room for families and couples to enjoy. My family (3 children, 2 adults) enjoyed the cucumber water every day by the elevator. We used the activities planner twice and they were very helpful. I used the fitness room 3 times and was impressed with the amount of room and equipment. We can't wait to visit again and will definitely put Honua Kai at the top of our choices of places to stay. We ate at Duke's for lunch every day just for the view, plus the food was delicious. We wish we could have stayed longer. Thank you Honua Kai for making our Maui trip memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Depends what you're looking for...”
Reviews.Author: szpal
Reviews.Content: We rented from owner, and found this a great value. We were able to get a 3 bedroom condo, full ocean view for about $688.00 per night (with taxes and cleaning fees included, on a 4 night stay). This was a comparable price to what we paid at the Maui Sheraton for a one bedroom "villa" with no kitchen or private bedrooms. This was our first trip to Maui and we split up our stay with three different types of accommodations. We did enjoy our stay at Honua Kai, and would probably go back--for a portion of our trip--simply for the value it presented. Some observations: The beach in front of Honua Kai is not great at all. Lots and lots of coral. My kids couldn't even walk out in it to body surf. It is probably a 15 minute walk to Airport Beach which is probably where we'd hang out if we went back. The atmosphere is very sterile. My husband commented that it had a "Stepford Wives" feel to it. For instance, on every lanai is the exact same furniture and, if you look, you will see that everything in every condo is exactly the same, right down to the coffee cups! It's a small complaint but the place seemed to seriously lack personality. Perhaps the immature landscaping contributed to that feel. We liked Duke's, but it's very expensive and, after 2 nights, we felt like we'd "been there, done that" with the menu. There aren't a lot of other close restaurants around, nothing like the area closer to Whaler's Village. The gourmet market was handy but also extremely expensive. Having said all that, my family REALLY enjoyed the roominess, the luxurious feel of the condo, the pool area, and especially that wonderful lanai where we spent some great family time. I would recommend Honua Kai if you have a big family like we do, if a swimmable beach isn't THAT important to you, and if you can find an excellent price like we did. Be sure to only rent from an owner with lots of positive reviews!

Reviews.Title: “best resort in hawaii!”
Reviews.Author: joolee501
Reviews.Content: we stayed in a 2 bedroom with 5 adults and 2 toddlers. we loved our place. it was very spacious and nice. we loved the huge balcony that the kids could play on safely. the pools were all very very nice and it was great to have the beach right there to walk onto. granted there are some rocks it was easy to avoid. my son fell asleep in his floaty on the ocean. talk about relaxing! it was also very nice to have the duke's restaurant on site. they also had poolside ordering which made it very easy. this is the newest and nicest resort you can stay in on maui in my opinion. i was able to find a great deal online as well.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was perfect”
Reviews.Author: jjochimsen
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading several reviews on tripadvisor.com but we still were not sure what to expect. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone that doesn't want the "hotel" experience for their whole trip. Hotel- VERY nice and seems almost all brand new. Lobby is amazing and they have a great market/coffee bar in the hotel. The gym is a bit small but who cares go outside and run if you want to exercise. There is no spa in the hotel. The pool is ok, a little small and usually a lot of families at the pool. It is also not very deep (more for kids I think) You can get a lounge chair with no problem though which is very nice. The Room- AMAZING. We had the studio with a king bed and the room was huge. Everything was brand new and it had a full kitchen that was nicer than ours at home. This was honestly the best part for us. I hate eating every meal out. It was great to wake up and turn on the coffee pot before going out for the day. There is a grocery store across the street. We didn't go there we actually went to the Safeway in Lahina about 15 minutes away. The bed is comfortable and the balcony is great. The beach- The beach is very nice. It's right in front of the hotel and is beautiful. The waves can be a little strong and there is a decent undertow but it seemed that every beach we went to here was about the same. For adults it's no problem, if I had a little kid I wouldn't let them be alone. Beach was clean, no bugs, and not crowded at all. Tips- I would rent a car no matter what hotel you stay in. Especially if you are going to do a lot of activities while in Maui. There are really no taxi's and we ended up driving to a lot of different things. It's not the hotel's location just that different activities are all over the place. There is a decent boardwalk that you can go jogging on right in front of the hotel. To do a round trip it's about 4 miles maybe a little less. The hotel doesn't have a restaurant but Dukes is basically next to the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons - it's what's important for you”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn4421
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the HK for ten days in July 2011 in the Konea bldy, a change since we usually stay at the Westin Ocean Shores Resort just next door. Definite pros and cons (listed below) vs the Westin and other places we have stayed. Personally I would not book again, but the rest of my family would so go figure! Pros: Condo layout and value for money was excellent - we got a two bedroom for the price of one at the Westin, very nicely decorated inside, lots of storage for clothing, nicely laid out features Grounds are lovely and very well maintained Dukes right on the beach is a great amenity, although it would be nice if they had more variety in their barefoot menu - lovely atmosphere here with music etc.. Snorkelling, despite the coral, was not as good as outside the Westin or at Black rock, but was still pretty good Right opposite there is a small strip mall with Times supermarket, close to an ABC store, in resort Aina store had nice quality local organic produce Cons: I did smell the sewage plant often, although it wasn't strong it did bother me, seemed to be worse in the Hokulani Tower area It was very windy during our stay - it did seem windy at Black Rock too, but both the wind and the rain (occasional) did seem to be notieceably worse at the HK than even a little further south at the Westin I missed the shuttle bus which the Westin has - because of the wind we ended up going somewhere in the car pretty much everyday and it would have been nice to get a shuttle into Whalers or Lahaina I personally found the HK lacking in atmosphere The beach right outside the condo has coral right up to the entry - you really need to go south a couple of hundred yards to get in and out with safety and dignity! I thought the $25 day resort fee was a bit of a con for wifi (I get this free in the park at home, who charges for that nowadays?), parking, and the gym Overall, this had much more of a feel of a fully owned condo resort - many of the units were empty since they were either not sold or the owners were not renting out when they weren't there. No Spa yet, no activities like Movies etc.. No fire pit for smores (they should add that), but the usual BBQs etc. Pools were nice but I thought nothing special. There is no 'lazy river' as such, just a river shaped pool in an arc, no flowing water. Poolside chaises were a little hard if you sat very long in them. There were lots of umbrellas for shade (many were broken probably due to the wind but still many available). Poolside service from Dukes was barely present, you really had to go out of your way to get attention from the limited serving staff. Although the condos are pretty new, we saw quite a bit of wear and tear that would concern me if I was considering buying. Some of the fixtures (dishwasher, faucets) were already aging suggesting the quality wasn't really up to the job. The lanai with the fold away windows was a great idea but we were not able to use at all because of the wind. So overall three stars - don't get me wrong, this is a lovely place and we had a great vacation, but for me the cons did spoil things a bit, especially the smell and the wind.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our condo.”
Reviews.Author: lupert87
Reviews.Content: This resort is top notch. We stayed in the 1 bedroom 1 bath condo. The condo was state of the art with granite counter tops and an awesome view of the mountains, yes the actual mountains and not the parking lot like some reviews have said. We booked through Costco Travel and believed we got a great price. They had us set up on the first floor but when we asked to be moved further up so we could have a better view they moved us to the sixth floor. Big difference! If you do get one on the first floor make sure you ask for a higher floor. The lanai was spacious with a table and four chairs. We had breakfast their every morning. They have many pools that our kids loved. The beach is a little rocky but you can swim in it. Hawaii is majestic and this resort just matched it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, but some issues”
Reviews.Author: Inspectorj
Reviews.Content: Wife and I spent a week at Honua Kai with 7 family members. We had two 2-bedroom condos on the 5th floor of the "main" tower with partial beach views (we faced the other side of the "inside" of the U-shaped building but could easily see the ocean from our balcony. The resort is relatively new and is beautiful. The pools are nice and the beach is just a few steps from the resort facilities. The rooms are nice and comfortable - our 2 bedroom condo had a good kitchen a big living room, good sized patio with a table that sorta fit all 9 of us for dinner, washer/dryer. The resort gets super windy. It seemed more windy that other locations along the Kaanapali beach - even compared to the other resorts pretty much next door! But it wasn't a huge deal. The little market has great natural/healthy foods and drinks. The gym facility is poor. There is a small gym in the main tower and a slightly larger one in the second tower. The small gym isn't air conditioned and you can't open the windows. They had a fan in there but it was awfully hot and humid. The bigger gym has better ventilation and there's more equipment but the equipment is so jammed in there that it feels very crowded. And there's no room to stretch or use dumbbells really. Also, the equipment in both gyms is not well maintained. I'm sure it gets a lot of use, but it didn't appear to be cleaned while we were there. The staff is a mixed bag. The valets were awesome. Super quick getting cars and really friendly and ready to help. The staff at the little market and at Duke's were also great. The rest of the staff - housekeeping, front desk, general staff around the resort - seemed indifferent. They weren't unhelpful or rude, but they struck me as content doing the minimum and not being happy to do it. I don't need cowtowing or huge fake smiles, but this was too far the other way. Having to pay $10-12/day to rent a beach chairs is a bit ridiculous. Especially since they come and collect them around 4:30 every day. It's sunny and light out until closer to 7, it was lame to lose the chairs and umbrellas so early. Despite those "complaints", I'd stay at Honua Kai again.

Reviews.Title: “Another great visit to Honua Kai”
Reviews.Author: Hey_Big_D
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year and decided to return. It was just as good as we remembered (which is not always the case...). This is a large resort but it does not feel like it. Although it was quite busy (July) we always found space by the the pool. Great pool staff and service from Dukes. The beach is very clean and practically deserted! Nice waves for boogie boarding and calm enough for snorkling. Our 2 boys (10 & 8) loved the pools and the beach. We felt extremely safe and allowed the boys to have lots of freedom, which they reall enjoyed. The made lots of new friends. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “HK has it all”
Reviews.Author: thesecret_squirrel
Reviews.Content: This is probably the best overall resort on Maui. Where to begin? Let's start with the structure: Honua Kai is a well designed property. Even with a suite in the back half of a building facing away from the beach, I could still sit and easily see the ocean from my lanai. And to the left was the West Maui mountains and frequent rainbows. It's win-win. The rooms are soundproof and it felt like we were the only ones on our floor. The property is laid out open and spacious to the beach. Unlike the Westin Villas to the south, the HK did not build structures to the property edge and squeeze the common areas. Instead, it has expansive pool and garden areas with wide open vistas. Lounges are not sandwiched side to side, lined rows deep, but are comfortably spaced throughout the grounds - which feels more like luxury, less like a stockade. When the gardens mature, it'll be quite lush. Speaking of luxury, the HK provides it at realistic, post recession prices. A spacious pool gazebo offering sun and wind protection and cushiony soft lounges is $25 for an afternoon. Attendants will take your drink and food order from Dukes, or let you set up your own drinks and food. Dukes was excellent. Delicious food, varied menu, and you can't beat $5 happy hour mai tais and small plates with live music beachside. The pools themselves are large, fun and lovely. There is no adult-only pool, but most of the kids are attracted to the slide pool. The "river" pool doesn't have an actual current, but it is fun. There are several spas, and also wading pools for the little ones. The beach out front isn't an outstanding swimming beach, but it is servicable. The best entry is to the south; avoid the north, especially in front of the Mahana (and water socks area always a good idea in the ocean). But if you are snorkelers like us, the water is clear and the snorkeling is decent, so it worked better for us than a sandy bottom. We had a one bedroom suite, which was spacious enough for our family of 2 adults and 2 teen boys. The storage was great - I especially liked the laundry room which allowed us to sash our snorkeling gear and boogie boards out of sight. And as much as I hate doing laundry, it was super convenient to have a washer and dryer. The california king bed was easy to sleep in. We reserved from Quam properties via VRBO. We did not pay the daily resort fee, but still had access to the workout facilities (which we didn't use, preferring a morning jog on the beach path). Quam was great, charges no cleaning fee for stays of 7 days and the prices reasonable. Of the two towers, the Hokulani tower has the Aina market and is a bit closer to the ocean. We stayed in the Konea tower, which is newer. The underground parking is close and accessing your car quick and easy. This trip we visited both the Grand Wailea and the Westin Villas and - unless you need an onsite spa and multiple restaurants (and some do) - felt like neither of those properties had anything over the HK. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel for perfect Hawaii vacation”
Reviews.Author: m0llyd0g
Reviews.Content: Our family of 2 adults and 3 children was looking for accomodations that would have a full kitchen and the amenities (location, pool, service, conciege etc) of a full service hotel. We found it all with the Honua Kai. We rented a beautiful 2 bedroom, 2 bath suite with full kitchen. The suite was very well laid out and offered a wonderful view from the huge lani (deck area). The pool area was just perfect with lots of lounge areas and fun swimming, including slide. I can not say enough how great the Honua Kai is for families traveling to Maui. You can not find a better spot. Aloha

Reviews.Title: “A Dream”
Reviews.Author: preciouslizzy
Reviews.Content: We had a two bedroom ocean view condo on the 7th floor. The view was spectacular. It was perfect for our family of 4. These are million dollar condos that are also available for sale. It was a home away from home. It included all appliances including a washer and dryer. We had two full bathrooms, a living room, dining room and lanai (balcony) overlooking the ocean. I am very picky and this place exceeded my expectations. We also received a small basket with dish soap, laundry detergent, etc. It was perfect. It has a few swimming pools, hot tubs, access directly to the beach. It is about 5 minutes away from Front Street Lahaina. There is a Duke's restaurant on the property which is very nice overlooking the ocean. There was a $25 daily resort fee but it includes valet, wifi, access to the fitness center, beach towels and more. The staff was very nice and helpful. This hotel is very family friendly but couples will also enjoy it. I will definitely be returning. P.S. They did not let us check in until 4pm so plan accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort Property”
Reviews.Author: AZLill
Reviews.Content: Exceptional service all the way around. Check in with the concierge service and they will answer your questions and accommodate your travel goals. They helped us seamlessly book a cruise, a luau and a zipline adventure.. The Aina market is chock full of healthy supplies, drinks and meals to get you through your day. Their bakery items are incredible. Duke's restaurant is worth several visits. Great breakfast, lunch and dinner options await you with a lovely view of the ocean. Service was fantastic. The pools at Honua Kai are beautiful. The grounds are immaculate and you couldn't ask for a better room to relax in each day. Our stay was both comfortable and beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent grounds and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: DawnyMT
Reviews.Content: We loved this place! Family of four with two teens - loved the accommodations and grounds. All of the staff were extremely friendly and helpful - a special shout out to Genie at the concierge desk who really knows her stuff. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for a Beautiful resort - Konea 101”
Reviews.Author: sawneeman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from June 29 - July 3 2011 in Konea 101. The buildings are new and very upscale. We rented through Kaanapali Beach Rentals. We initially dealt directly with the owner after finding the unit on VRBO.com. He is a great guy and easy to deal with. The unit was immaculate and had a full kitchen, laundry closet with stack washer/dryer. We also had a dining area, 2 1/2 baths with 2 bedrooms. We had full wall nano doors in the living/dining area. We also had the nano doors in the master bedroom. We were on the ground floor only steps away from the pool and Dukes restaurant with a view of the ocean from the living area, lanai, and master bedroom. My absolute favorite, was the gas grill, sink, and referigerator right on our lanai. We grilled hamburgers one night, steaks on another night, and yet again on another night we grilled fresh seafood. All while watching the sunset over the ocean! It doesn't get any better than that anywhere! The only downside is the wind. There was so much wind on the beach and a good bit at the pools too! We walked down the beach once, but after experiencing the wind, we spent all of our time at one of the pools or lying in the sun on our lanai or under our pergola. I'm ready to plan my vacation here for next year.

Reviews.Title: “You Cannot Go Wrong”
Reviews.Author: NYer1969
Reviews.Content: This place is great. Everything is new; rooms are very clean and well furnished. We stayed in the two bedroom ocean view unit on both trips, Plenty of room. Staff is very friendly especially the Valet folks - we asked for directions to several beaches and restaurant recommendations and they were very helpful. The grounds are kept up; all the pools and hot tubs were clean. Beach area is nice and having both the Grocery Store and Dukes on property was great. Canâ€™t ask for more I would definitely return to this place for a third time.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Alyscia123
Reviews.Content: This place is beyond beautiful! The second you walk in a smile sets on your face and doesn't leave until it's time to go! Duke's restaurant is on the beach in front of the resort and is too much fun! Happy hour landed me on bed by 7:00 pm and the local music there each night is always soothing and entertaining. One thing to note for couples: because this is a time share property there are lots of kids around and usually occupying the majority of the pool. Not very romantic from that point. It is VERY family oriented. But as I said, beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxed & quite accomodating”
Reviews.Author: RMeese98
Reviews.Content: We made the decision to spend a week at Honua Kai Resort after careful review of Tripadvisor reviews regarding hotels in the area (first time to Maui.) The combination of excellent reviews regarding the facility and the savings we foresaw in a 3-BR Condo lay-out versus 3 adjoining hotel rooms (6 adult family vacation) lead us to book here. Observations: Pluses: - 3 BR ocean-view Condo suite was clean & accommodated our needs. The Lani porch was large with table, chairs, and lounges. We used the grill twice to cook local fish. The sunsets were gorgeous. Both the kitchen and bathrooms were high end and clean. - Hotel wifi worked well and was included in resort fee. - Valet parking was prompt and courteous. - The two buildings serve multiple pools and beach. The guests were predominantly families but well behaved children & remarkably not crowded. Easy to always find available lounge chairs at the pool. - Boardwalk runs along beach for quite a distance and is great for both walking and jogging -"Times" grocery mart in strip center across from facility and great for food shopping - Great snorkeling right in front of facility b/c of coral & can body-surf short walk up beach Minuses: - One building had 2 room Exercise facility / other one room. Neither had good ventilation and felt like "after-thoughts." - Concierge service generally good for finding activities and sea-side dinners. But one lady quipped to my daughter & her friend, as they came off the beach and inquired about a Spa Pedicure: "We have no spa, their is one at the Westin next-door. but are you sure that it is in your budget or do you just want to get your nails done at the strip center across the street?" (not very professional.) Oh, they don't have spa despite it being in their name. - Dukes restaurant is good and they have a market with quick groceries and coffee. Another eating option on-site would have been nice. In general, the facility was beautiful and relaxing; but realize this is more of a luxury condo facility then a high-end hotel. This met our needs as our family could congregate and enjoy our time better than if we were in separate hotel rooms. Also: would definitely rent a car; check out the Hula Grill in Whaler's Village for sunset meal; and get Opah (local fish) somewhere as it is the best light, flakey local fish I have tasted! Hope this is helpful, Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Totally Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Maclibrarian
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Kannapali area and Maui and we loved it. We rented a 2 bedroom condo (#745 Hokulani Tower) for our family of 5 (three kids 12 and under) through Harris Hawaii and we very pleased with what we experienced. After confirming by phone when our plane was due in, the property manager Brooke met us about 10:30 pm and showed us around our clean and well appointed place, and we were able to call him or his associate any time we had any questions or ran out of anything that they keep stocked. The condo came with towels for inside and a beach towel for each person which can be washed as often as needed in the washer/dryer unit. There were some beach toys and chairs that we were able to use as well. It was stocked with shampoo, hand, dish, dishwasher and laundry soap. The beds can be two kings or four twins with a queen hide-a-bed in the living room. There is a small charge for making the beds into twins, and making up the hide-a-bed, and a cleaning fee at the end (altogether $250 I think), which makes up for the fact that you don't pay the $25/day resort fee. We liked not having the maid service each day, but if you like that sort of thing then stay in the hotel, not a condo. There is the option of having a mid-stay clean for an additional charge which we did not do. We got a reduced rate since it was not high season and it was short notice. The place had three big flat screen tvs (one per room) which is either great or terrible depending on how you look at it. There is free wi-fi that we could use in the room, and possibly outside the room, not sure, and a phone to use as well, at no charge. We enjoyed the pool and green space below our tower and also the series of pools in front of the neighboring tower. We used the BBQ in front of our tower and there were tools in the stove drawer which I found afterward. Noticed the other tower's BBQs less busy. We used the services of the activity advisor which saved us money in one case and cost us just a little more than booking direct in another. The only irritating thing about the condo itself was that the dishwasher beeps until you turn it off when it is done and so putting it on before heading to bed was a a pain until I discovered the delayed start. We did not rent a car, but I think there would have been a $10 fee for parking per night. There is a grocery store across the street (5-8 min. walk). and a 40-45 minute brisk walk takes you to Whaler's Village shopping area. There is also a little resort shuttle that you can catch 2-3 hotels down the beach and a Maui bus you can catch ($1 per ride or $2 for the whole day if you ask for it) at the hotel next door (5-8 min walk) that will take you to Whaler's Village, Lahaina and beyond or the opposite direction. The view from our room facing the courtyard was great, and being able to snorkel right down at the beach in front of our place was great too. We will book through them again if we return to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hanoua Kai Resort”
Reviews.Author: SpitzieAussie
Reviews.Content: Travelled with family of 4 (children 9 & 5). Stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment with partial ocean view. The apartments are very spacious and well appointed. After seeing other reviews on this web site regarding privately owned apartments, I actually rented our apartment through a separate web site to the resort itself. This web site has numerous privately owned properties, which you can choose from. I was then able to see actual photos and location of the apartment I chose. No suprises on arrival. You save about 30% to 40% and still use all the facilities on site including assistance from concierge for excursions. Booking privately also gave us free wi-fi and use of boogie boards, beach chairs, toys and umbrella provided by the owner. The owner E-mailed us all the details prior to arrival. We phoned a gentleman on arrival in Maui as directed, who then met us and let us into the apartment. Had no troubles doing it this way rather than direct with resort. Great resort and facilities. Would highly recommend, especially if travelling with a family.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: honeymooner2011_06
Reviews.Content: First time to Maui, and being on our honeymoon, we wanted to stay somewhere nicer. We had a studio room with a partial view, which was enough space for us and seeing the ocean from our lanai was great. We were put in a handicapped suite which was disappointing because we didn't have a big bathtub in our bathroom. The only other minor problem we had was the unavailability of BBQ tools to borrow. Guests would keep them instead of returning after usage, so we weren't able to BBQ when we wanted to. Also, they advertise as a resort AND spa. We did not see any spa or any mention of the spa anywhere in the hotel. Steep resort fees of $25/day for wifi, parking and access to pool and fitness area. Other than that, we had a great stay, beautiful hotel, great pool area and loved the luxury AVEDA products in the bathroom!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT AND CAN'T WAIT TO RETURN!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bimbus11
Reviews.Content: Awesome time celebrating a close friend's 40th birthday party! The 2 bedroom room that we shared had lots of space and privacy. The only "complaints" I can think of was; 1. One day our room was not cleaned. 2. Our unit had one of those "euro" washer/dryer in one unit...so you could not wash a lot of stuff at the same time as it would overload the dryer. 3. The ice maker on the brand new refridgerator made ice at a snails pace. The only other option was to trek all the way down into the parking garage to a Coleman cooler sized ice machine. Lots of families, so you must tolerate kids. The kids water slide is next to the adult pool...so that raised an eyebrow. But the beach was very clean. Lots of coral so be sure to wear protection as you WILL get cut if you try to venture out into the water. We saw whales out beyond the breakers. One of us even snapped video of a sea turtle while snorkeling off of the beach. Duke's is a great place for lunch and poolside drinks. A bit pricey, but it is new.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Resort!”
Reviews.Author: sactosan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom condo and it was fabulous! We had a garden view but could still see the ocean. It was a wonderful stay. My only (very) minor complaints were: shower head was super low-flow, housekeeping forgot to make one of the beds one day and it was quite windy every day (which really isn't the resort's fault).

Reviews.Title: “Best value in the high end condo rental market by far.”
Reviews.Author: gocamco
Reviews.Content: We (family of 4 including two older teenagers) love Maui and have stayed at several hotels and Villas on the northwest coast. We thought the Westin Villas were the very best until this current trip. The Honua Kai is now #1 in our book for several reasons: 1) Big, comfortable and well appointed units. We had a 2 bedroom with a huge lanai. The window walls on the lanai totally open. 2) The price was amazing. We booked last minute on Orbitz at about 50% of the Westin Villas for anything comparable. 3) Pools and beach 1st rate and not crowded. Convenient full grocery store across the street. A few negatives but no deal killers here: 1) The staff is ok, not the friendliest you will find in Hawaii but tolerable. 2) It's aparent that the project is on a shoestring budget. The valet is not well staffed and sometimes not there. Pretty much a shut doen after 10 PM. Little skimping on accessories and art. Some baren areas. 3) The beach is rocky. Wear beach shoes if you go in the water or walk south on the beach and go in at the Westin or farther south. Overall, however, you can't go wrong at the Honua Kai.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect vacation place”
Reviews.Author: FresiaTX
Reviews.Content: We loved the Honua Kai Resort! We arrived in the evening after dark and had a hard time to find the hotel - there are two buildings, and on the reservation there wasn't noted the name of the building. They are next to each other, during the daytime you cannot miss them. The quality of the hotel is awesome. The kitchen is really well stocked: range, oven, microwave, toaster, blender, shaker, pots and pans. You can grill next to the pool. You have everything in the hotel what you need for a perfect vacation: comfortable room, spacious and perfectly clean bathroom, beautiful furniture, huge balcony with a view. We stayed on the 3rd floor in a partial ocean view unit and from the balcony we had a perfect view. The pools and the landscaping is simply beautiful. In the pool be careful if you have kids. We traveled with a 11 and a 13 year old, and they like to play in the water - it can be slippery, obviously, and the side of the pool is decorated with stones, so our younger one had a head injury. My kids took surfing lessons in the Surf Academy from Mike, who was absolutely awesome! You can find them close to Banyan park, opposit the 3-hour free parking lot, or make a reservation at the consierge desk in the hotel. I recommend using the underground parking garage. Valet parking is included in the $25 daily resort fee if you prefer that. If I ever have a chance to go back to the beautiful Maui, I would love to stay in Honua Kai again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome resort especially for families.”
Reviews.Author: Ricamd
Reviews.Content: We were truly blessed to have found Honua Kai Resort. My husband and I travelled alone a year ago and stayed at the Hyatt, which was nice. However, this time traveling with our 3 children, we knew we needed a "home away from home". This resort provided this for us. It us upscale, yet family friendly. We highly recommend this resort. It has lots to do on site, but the 2 bedroom condo was exceptional with full kitchen, large patio,DVD player. It was perfect and the service is second to none.

Reviews.Title: “Too Windy”
Reviews.Author: 101Aloha
Reviews.Content: I originally chose to stay at this hotel because I wanted to stay in Kaanapali. I didn't know this is not where most of the hotels in Kaanapali are located. It's actually in North Kaanapali. I found out after the fact that North Kaanapali is a lot more windy. My husband and I booked a one-bedroom with the mountain view. The mountain view from our room was beautiful. The sliding doors in the living room and the bedroom can be opened all the way. I was hoping to sit out in our lanai. However, it was just way too windy outside. Also the lanais are all connected. So people could walk by your lanai and your room. I was also hoping to sit in the lobby or by the pool area. Again, it was too windy to do that. Everyday my husband and I dreaded going in and out of our car to get in and out of the resort because it would be like the windy city of Chicago. By the 5th night we were there, I wanted to leave and move to a hotel in the main Kaanapali area. But given that we only had two nights left in Maui, we decided to stay. I mean, the room was nice. We liked the full kitchen. I didn't have to buy bottled water because the fridge came with filtered water. We also did our laundry as our room came with a washer and dryer. We also enjoyed free internet in the room. We didn't mind paying the $25 resort fee. I think most of the hotels in Maui do that. We had to pay resort fees in Palm Springs before, so it wasn't a shocker for us to pay the fee here. To avoid waiting for our car in the wind too long, we would call the valet from our room to have them pull our car up when we were ready to leave the resort. Anyway, to me, the wind really bothered me. Next time I would stay at one of those hotels in Kaanapali south of Black Rock where it is less windy. In terms of housekeeping, well, they were not that consistent. For the first two days we didn't have a liner to our shower curtain. We thought that's the kind of shower curtain the resort used. So for two days our bathroom smelled mildewy. We finally called housekeeping and found out we were missing the liner. We were also missing a light bulb for the wall lamp next to the dining table. For the first few days we thought the wall lamp was just a decoration. We finally figured out it was a real lamp but just missing a light bulb. On some of the days we would not get a new bottle of body lotion, and then on some of the days we would get a whole bunch of towels. And on the last day we were out of toilet paper because the day before they did not give us a new roll of toilet paper. But they did throw our dishes we left in the sink (meaning to wash them later) to the dishwasher and had them washed, even though there were only a couple of cups and a knife or a spoon. We felt bad wasting all that power and water for a few dishes, so a couple of times we just washed them ourselves before housekeeping came. The valet guys were very nice and helpful. They gave us a few tips on where we should go. The resort only had one concierge person. Every time I went over there the concierge was with somebody, so I never bothered to get info there. There was a little convenience store in the lobby, but the prices were not cheap. So we would drive to Safeway near Lahaina to buy groceries. Before we left, we found out there was another supermarket further north that we could have gone. Duke was right next to the resort, but the food was over-rated. I would just get my cocktail there. For food, just drive to Lahaina, which is only 10-15 minutes away. Or just drive 3 minutes north to Okazuya & Deli Honokowai. We found out the chef there used to be a chef at Mama's Kitchen. The food was soooo good and inexpensive. Overall we do like the resort. It's just unfortunate that it's windy there all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Resort”
Reviews.Author: SylFisch
Reviews.Content: We just returned from one week at the Honua Kai and would go back again. The resort was beautiful. We were initially in a one bedroom mountain view room . We arrived late at night so I did not get the full effect of the room until the next morning and I was not happy with the road noise that one would hear if the patio doors were open or if one wanted to sit on the balcony (which was huge) which I really enjoy doing. I asked to be switched to something quiter and we were moved to the other building (Konoa) and given a room that was still a mountain view but faced the other building and not directly onto the road. This was a vast improvement. The noise was greatly diminished, we no longer looked out over the parking lot and still had beautiful mountain views. The new room also had a den which the previous room did not, and with two teenage girls, the additional space was wonderful. The room was great. Huge bathroom, 3 flat screen TV's, super comfy beds. We loved it. We found all the employees at the resort and at Duke's to be very friendly and helpful. We had no complaints. A few minor negatives: My god was it windy!!! I read about this in a few reviews but not many so perhaps it is something that just comes and goes. I would say that 5 out of the 7 days we were there, it was windy to the point of it being comical. On the other hand, it didn't rain at all while we were there, so I guess that is a pretty good trade-off. Pool areas were beautiful, very lush and tropical. Only complaint was that the pool chairs/lounges were very uncomfortable. They looked great, but extended seating (even with frequent shifting around) was painful. It might be worthwile if something like this is an issue for you to rent one of the 2-person cabanas ($25.00) per day or for only $15.00 more a large cabana. The beach was fine with good snorkling only about 20 feet out. Beach was never crowded although it would have been nice to be able to rent beach cabanas like one can at other beach resorts, but again, this is a very minor complaint. Ate at Duke's and for the most part it was good, but prices were the usual for eating out in Hawaii- expensive. Housekeeping was hit or miss for the most part and I feel that the $25.00 resort fee is a bit ridiculous, it seems like they are charging for things that should come with the room anyway. In conclusion, aside from a few minor complaints, I would say that my family really enjoyed our stay here and would definetly come back to the Honua Kai resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome Home, ladies!”
Reviews.Author: ChoansView
Reviews.Content: It's the "Personable" that counts! Everyone - and I mean EVERY ONE - showed a genuine concern that our time there be the best. A wonderful family environment and although we didn't have children with us, we met and enjoyed some beautiful families. We also loved Duke's music and food!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful ocean views!!”
Reviews.Author: LeaOCgirl
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from our 8 day stay at the Honua Kai... What a beautiful resort with very friendly staff. We Booked a partial ocean view studio.... let me tell you AMAZING!!! The view was not partial it was a full ocean view in my mind i think that people have a problem with the partial ocean view because of the lay out of the hotel and that they are booking one or two room suites. That being said the studios are along the front of the hotel and between the ocean view rooms and partial ocean view rooms. We were in the new Konea tower which is shaped like a U facing the beach. My suggestion the studio is huge and has a great view that will not disappoint! Our room had plenty of storage full kitchen wonderful and large baclony with a dining table. The only thing it was lacking was there was no bath tub which we didn't mind at all. There is no bar at the pool but the servers from dukes come around every so often to take orders. the pools are not to crowded but they are small and by the end of the day they get pretty dirty. I have grow up in Southern California my whole life at the beach and I'm not one who likes to swim in the ocean because of the murky water but the beach in front of this resort is gorgeous no trash clear water and wonderful!!! Lahaina was fun try and find street parking and book your luau before you get there they fill up fast. we went to the luau at the Hyatt and it was great! Last thing DO NOT FLY AMERICAN AIRLINES they confused my reservations with someone else gave away my seats and told me sorry but you can either get on the flight or not and we wont do anything for you. We were not the only ones a family could not get seats anywhere close to each other on the flight and the airlines told them sorry I understand your uncomfortable with your four year old child sitting alone but to bad! they were so disorganized and so rude!!!! I will never fly with them again.... and if you think you can upgrade to get a seat you want 12 hours in advance..... wrong again!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: JONESZY9
Reviews.Content: We were referred to this resort by some friends and we can't wait to thank them. The rooms were clean and very new. Great appliances, tv, very comfortable bed and a joy to hang out in. The staff is very friendly and the pool and beach is amazing. We also loved Duke's. What a great place to eat and hang out. Location is also ideal since there is a grocery store across the street and you can walk to the Westin and Sheraton in just few minutes down the beach walk. Love this place and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Honua Kai is a nice resort with a few issues”
Reviews.Author: ObLaDiObLaDa
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at this very pretty resort (there is no spa that I could see...why they say "spa" in their name, I do not know). We arrived late at night and they were expecting us. The valet/bellman (Randy, I believe) was excellent. The check-in went smoothly. Our room was very nice. We had a two-bedroom/ocean view. The first thing we noticed is the fantastic lanai. It was a huge wrap-around with wonderful views of the courtyard and ocean. The room was well laid out, but you can tell that it is starting to get a little worn around the edges. Nothing major, just little things like frayed carpet, hinged door missing from the thermostat, a crack in a fridge compartment. Otherwise, the room was very nice and functional. The resort grounds are lush and gorgeous, as are most of the beachfront resorts in Maui. The trees, shrubs, flowers, koi ponds all add to the relaxing atmosphere...which is partially negated by many, many small children. We have older teens so we have definitely been there, done that with small kids. I was just surprised at how many kids there were as a percentage of resort guests. We were never bothered to the point of being annoyed. Just something to be aware of. If you are expecting a quiet, relaxing outdoor environment, free of small children, you should probably look elsewhere. The resort has three separate pool areas. If I were them, I would really try to designate or at least encourage parents to use the two pools that are obviously tailored to children. Leave the pool at the southern end of the property for 18+ yrs. I don't know how workable that would be, but I think it would help offer a more peaceful atmosphere. The beach here is lovely and a photographers dream. It is also relatively uncrowded. This could be partially due to the fact that as you wade into the water, you will find it to be objectionable to the feet. Very rocky bottom. If you want a sandy bottom, you should stay to the south of Black Rock. But the snokeling was somewhat better here (although if you want GREAT snorkeling drive about 15 minutes north to Honolua Bay). We had several great dining experiences at Duke's, the beachside restaurant on the resort property. It was expensive, but in line with other Maui restaurants of it's caliber. The food and service were always consistent and good. We especially enjoyed their breakfast and dinner. (See Duke's review). One of my biggest gripes with Honua Kai was their lack of a business center or anything resembling one. On one of my excursions, I was asked to bring a copy of my confirmed reservation. When I went downstairs to do this, the front desk person told me that they have no way of providing this for their guests. No room, no printer, no nothing. When I asked how I was supposed to print out this confirmation (or boarding passes for that matter), I was met with an "I'm not sure". They couldn't even tell me where I could find a nearby facility to accomplish this very simple task. So I had to go find a printing place on my own (in the shopping center just north of the property). A resort of this caliber should have this type of very basic service available to their guests. The staff ranged from very friendly to indifferent. I got more good information from the valet and bellmen than from the front desk or concierge. Also, the activities center by the pool was better than most resorts. Although you are gouged for their services, like every other resort, they at least treat you well and give you good information. And they don't hassle you to buy everything they are hawking. The little store downstairs was nice, but only to be used if you need something right away as their prices are much higher than what you can get from a nearby store. All in all, we really enjoyed our stay at the Honua Kai and it is a beautiful resort. If they dealt with the few minor issues I mentioned, they could really improve their offering.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place-What You Need to Know”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1Denver_Co
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 days here and there are some things to know that are very helpful. 1.) If you are staying in a condo on the road side (not the sea or pool view) your balcony is not useable. The wind precludes any activity so it is lost space. 2.) No need to go to CostCo or KMart for food upon leaving the airport. There is a wonderful super market just across the parking lot. It has everythng you need at about the same price. 3.) Virtually none of the umbrella stands at the pool are in working order. The constant wind ruined all of them (and they were cheap stuff to begin with). 4.) Be prepared for almost constant wind and don't let it ruin your fun. 5.) There is a fabulous walkway that runs along the beach from the Honua Kai to Whalers Village. It is about an hour walk that is beautiful and easy. You have to wind around some of the hotels but you will find your way. 6.) If you are going to pay for a snorkeling cruise (and you should go to Molokini) then look to the QuickSilver Maui. The crew is just fantastic and will take care of your every need. The lunch on board was unbelievable. There are a lot of boats at Molokini but it does not diminish your fun. No need to take a small boat as the QuickSilver is just right. 7.) If you want truly great snorkeling head the other direction from the Honua Kai. Go toward the other end of the island not toward Whaler's Village. Take the road about 15 minutes until in narrows down to a winding road in the jungle. About 15 minutes from the Honau Kai you will come to the bottom of a hill, a narrow one lane bridge, and a bunch of cars parked. The bay is visible when you make the turn to go down the hill. Walk through the jungle on the well worn paths to the rocky beach. There is no sand so this is a snorkeling spot only. The water is clear and beautiful. Head out to the reef and go to each side of the bay. Note. Do not even pause when the squatters at the water's edge give you the scam that they are care takers of the beach. It is only a scam. It is public property. Don't stop to listen to their scam just walk on by. 8.) Spend the time to go all the way to the end of the road at the other side of the island. It is about a 45 minute drive but you will find incredible surf and crystal clear beaches. Just head back toward the airport but don't make the turn just stay along the water. You will pass all of the big name resorts. Keep going until it becomes rural and remote and you will find the locals. 9.) Expect little from the hotel staff as they are simply not trained to be great hosts. You don't need them. The coffee shop is fine but they keep banker's hours so if you want coffee early don't rely on them. 10.) Get out and away from the condo. The coffee plantation across the street is free and has some incredible views. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Would be 5 Star if it were not for the WIND!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bdaniels345
Reviews.Content: As I walked into the main lobby of Honua Kai Resort, I was literally in AWE! The view was breath taking! We rented a 2 bedroom condo with "partial ocean view" and we were very pleased. The pictures on their site simply do not do justice for how beautiful this condo really is. We have 3 kids (7,7, & 9) and with the 4 pools and the beach, they were in heaven! The staff was super friendly. The only downfall to this resort was the wind. It seemed as though the wind was worse at our condo than anywhere else. I am not sure if this time of year is generally windy. After talking to an employee, he said the general rule of thumb on this island is, "if you don't like the weather here, drive 2 miles in either direction". I would DEFINITELY recommend the Honua Kai Resort & Spa!!!

Reviews.Title: “We really loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Robert32764
Reviews.Content: This place was amazing. I brought my family of six and we all loved this place! Everything was so open and pleasing to the senses. Pools were great with a lot of places to move about and look at. The beach was nice and snorkeling there was fun. Honua Kai is located in a great spot. Close to everything you need and want to do but away enough where there is less of a crowd. Everything was very clean and the service was excellent also. I would highly recommend going there and we will be returning again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing !!!”
Reviews.Author: jola46
Reviews.Content: Just go... Brand new and everything was perfect. We went there for our honeymoon and if I had to pick one place again that would be the one !!!

Reviews.Title: “Did not want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: HokieMaj
Reviews.Content: This resort was fabulous! We searched online for hotels in Maui. We had never been there before so we were unsure what area to book our hotel. We chose the Honua Kai when we saw the websites and previous reviews. When we first arrived, it was awesome. I actually told my husband that this trip has been great so far and he said, dont say that yet bc we havent seen our room! When our valet took us to our room, we were pleasantly surprised. It was awesome. So big, and clean! Our room had a King bed with a down mattress pad and a down compforter with sheets on each side. I am really a germaphobe and hotel bedding really grosses me out so this was great. Also, the bedding smelled so clean like home, Normally hotel linens smell like chemicals. We also had a sofa bed and chair, full kitchen with full fridge, and dishwasher, bathroom with stand up shower and bathtub and washer and dryer. Our sliding glass doors went out to a lanai that overlooked the ocean with a table and chairs. The door also opened up to become all screens for an awesome breeze. The pool and beach in front of the hotel were great. All of the staff were nice. There is a nice boardwalk area for walking up and down the beaches. I believe it stretches a few miles. The restaurant, "Dukes", was really great. We ate there 2 times and had drinks there because it was right on the beach and at the pool. It was open air and a lot of fun. We also used the gym everyday and although small, it was very sufficient with treadmills, elliptical, free weights and weight systems like the total body gym. I dont know if this is for everyone, but our services included a $25 a day resort fee. That included towel rental, free valet, free valet service to carry luggage, groceries to your room, gym fee and internet. I thought that was more than fair. We never had a problem with any of the services. I just cannot explain how awesome this hotel was to the full extent. We are planning our next trip back soon. It was so convienant to everything. We ere able to go to the grocery store to get food for our room which saved a lot of money. The laundry facilities were also very nice since we were there 2 weeks and would have ran out of clothes. This is the nicest hotel I have stayed in and I have traveled a lot, internationally also. Not in regards to being a fancy hotel, but a well decorated, hospitable, clean hotel with all of the amenities I needed. I know I keep saying "clean" a lot but that was the part that impressed me the most. These days it is hard to find somewhere that makes you feel as comfortable as at home and this hotel did. You definatly have to stay there! Truly awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort for the Money”
Reviews.Author: MSYMd
Reviews.Content: Like others who have posted this month, we enjoyed the resort very much. Keep in mind, this is Maui and you will pay more for everything.The new 2 bedroom condo would have rented for three times as much at the Grand Wailea(I priced it).
