The 2 negatives with this property are the diminutive beach and the more frequent cloud bursts that Kannapoli (where this is located) is subjected. Our friends at other resorts got no rain at all whereas we had a mild squall almost every day. Staff was very friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: bunnyluv
Reviews.Content: I think it's important when writing reviews to be clear about why I've rated something excellent or poor. And I want to be very fair. So I will note that there was much to like about what Honua Kai had to offer, but it was their poor customer service which will make me determined to never return and be sure to visit any of the MANY other neighboring resorts. Honua Kai is a beautiful resort, steps away from the beach and situated in Lahaina close to various shopping and dining. I enjoyed that the room had 1 bedroom and a separate living and dining area, a full size kitchen with every comfort of home (coffee machine, dishwasher, deep basin sinks, microwave, stove, oven, full size friedge), plus the convenience of an in unit washer and dryer. It was nicely laid out, the furniture was comfortable and well taken care of. The balcony was large and you were able to completely open the doors to join your indoor and outdoor living space together. The resort itself was beautifully situated, along with it's neighboring resorts. The pools were great, enjoyable for couples and families. The gym that I went to was small and humid but the machines were nice. Not the best gym I've used at a resort, but workable. They did say there was another gym on location that had more machines. The pool towels were rough and quite worn, definitely needs to be replaced. We did not take advanatage of their "discounted" rentals (such as snorkel sets, etc.) - for that we went elsewhere. Duke's Beach House, the restaurant at the resort was not that great. Service was - okay, and the food wasn't really worth the price. The view was great - but again, I have no doubt that the other neighboring resort restaurants had equally beautiful views. Aina Gourmet had some decent and interesting offerings, but was definitely overpriced. If anything the overpriced restaurants made us take advantage of local mom and pop restaurants as well as a trip to grocery store and farmer's market. At the end, what was incredibly unreasonable, was their Resort Fee. Now I'll be honest, this IS the first time I've ever had a hotel charge a resort fee - and certainly the first time that a hotel did not disclose what there would be charges for ahead of time. And we've stayed at many different hotels, from Vegas to Tokyo to Hong Kong to Costa Rica and LA. First time ever - charged a resort fee - first time ever that no costs were disclosed upon checking in. That's ridiculous. It was $25/day plus tax of course. Now when I book a hotel, I really don't think it's much to expect that what I pay for includes certain things - period. We did not valet our car either folks. They claimed that the $25/day was for: - Self-parking - Room cleaning (such as refreshing of towels, replenishing toiletries, etc - everything that every other normal hotel includes in their price) which btw we only had our room cleaned twice since I like to be conservative of towel use, etc. (you know, because it's beaten into you about how a resort prides themselves in their "Sustainability" efforts) - Pool Towels - which we only used twice, AND if you didn't return a towel, it was a $25 charge per un-returned towel. - Their "discounted" rates on renting equipment such as fins, masks, snorkels, etc. Which we did not take "advanatge" of. In fact their rates are no different then any other resort, and definitely not as good as a place like Boss Frog's (fabulous establishment btw, go there to rent your snorkel sets and book a helicopter ride with Air Maui!). - Their wi-fi - which we also did not use. - And whatever else they wanted to throw in there to make it seem like worth $25/day. And really, was anything listed that you wouldn't have expected to be included in the price you already paid? What leaves a bitter taste in my mouth is how they slipped us this bill at the end with no disclosure in the beginning. If they said all those things from the getgo - believe me, I would have said "Great, how much is self-parking - because everything else, we don't need." And all they could say was well - we have a Resort Fee, everyone has Resort Fees. Really, that's the way you handle this sort of situation? Disappointing - I expected something better. First time there, never to go back - they did not resolve the matter to my satisfaction. I would much rather stay at the Westin next door - same views, same beaches, or the Ritz Carlton just a little bit north. It certainly would have come to about the same price.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent place to relax with the family in style and comfort.”
Reviews.Author: Johntravels61
Reviews.Content: The perfect set up. We had a two bedroom two bath ocean view inside court room. Plenty of space for our family of four with two teenagers. Elegant and relaxing resort layout. One of the better properties for people per square foot. We never felt crowded by the pool or anywhere in the resort. Very friendly and efficient staff. Our room was very comfortable and the lani was spacious perfect for eating and relaxing. No effort was spared to make the accomodations top notch for enjoying Maui in style. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Resort”
Reviews.Author: surfer63
Reviews.Content: Do not hesitate to stay at this lovely resort. It is the nicest place I have ever stayed. Top quality in all areas. Appliances, comfortable beds, pool areas, beaches. The beach surprised us. Great for snorkeling and swimming, and not crowded. There is a store walking distance, you can get nice salads and sandwiches if you prefer to eat in your room. I read the reviews and glad I chose this resort and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Honua Kai saved our vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lvtolvlife
Reviews.Content: We have previous visits to Maui where we stayed at the Marriott Ocean Club (new Lahaina tower) and also the Westin Kaanapali Villas (one bedroom). In planning this trip I researched the Honua Kai but decided to instead stay at the Kapalua Resort for a change of pace. We figured it was summer and there would be better weather. Before we headed to Kapalua we stayed 3 nights at the Hyatt Regency in Maui. There was a large group of us and we had two rooms. First I have to say that stay was wonderful. The staff was incredible and the grounds were WOW. This was my sister's first visit to Hawaii and she really enjoyed herself. I think the one disappointment I had was the pool area for my 7 year old son. I wish there was more 3 ft. section for him to frolic in....there was a small amount but it was in the grotto. Once some of the family left we moved to Kapalua. Wanted to have a condo. I did extensive research on this trip. Since Outrigger could not guarantee me where my "partial" ocean vew would be (bay, golf or ridge) I decided to book a particular condo through an outside rental company. This turned out to be a HUGE mistake for us. Not that there was anything wrong with the condo...except the fact that it smelled really musty and moldy to me and had been locked up for a few weeks not rented. It really bothered my allergies. I contacted the rental company and they quickly moved me to another unit (and charged me more because it had a better view). The ac unit tooks HOURS to even get the unit to 75 and we had to leave for 5 hours since it was so hot. We spent the night and this place also smelled musty and moldy. I got no sleep and my eye, nose and ears were itching like someone had rubbed a cat in my face. Granted.. I am very sensitive but in all our travels I have never experienced this before. I have to admit the rental company (although rudely) agreed to refund our money and gave us till that afternoon to find another accommodation. I contacted Outrigger but they were sold out of units there at Kapalua. We then got in the car and drove down to Honua Kai. I based this visit on the fact that it was rated so highly on Tripadvisor (thank goodness i had my laptop!!). The front desk staff was so incredible in assisting us to find a room and provide us with a great rate. They even walked us to a few of their mountain view rooms to check them out. I remember reading reviews about a :sewage smell" but I can promise you we never had any issues AND we slept with our doors open all night. While we missed giving up our ocean view room...the stay was incredible. I have to agree that it did not compare to "resort grounds" like those down in Kaanapali in the older hotels. But the grounds were still incredible. Our 7 year old loved looking for frogs at night! They were wonderful at the Kid's program that they have in the evenings and you only pay per hour!! No need to lock into a full night. We loved the room. We had a one bedroom with a den. If you can grab one of those, it is nice, especially with kids. My husband and I could sit in the living room and my son had his own space to play and his own TV too! I loved the pools. Better than the Hyatt, Westin or Marriott....at least for our family. It is not a massive pool like the Hyatt, but had lots of chairs and sections for both families and kids. Nice areas for cooking out also. I agree it is not a great "swimming beach"...but our son played in the waves and my husband snorkeled right offshore! We have visited most all the islands and stayed in a number of resorts. These 4 days were really nice. It was so easy to park and walk to your room...in contrast to other properties where self parking is a nightmare. One of our favorite parts of this resort was the HUGE balconies with the folding doors that had screens also!!! If we had to recommend one condo based on the locations we stayed at...this place would be our number one choice...especially if deciding to stay at Marriott Ocean Club or Westin.

Reviews.Title: “All That Glitters IS NOT Gold- New Doesnt Mean Luxury!!”
Reviews.Author: Audee1111
Reviews.Content: 2.5 I hate to be jaded and snotty but I must save some travelers that I know will come to the same conclusions as I did. "Just cuz something glitters and gleams doesn't mean its a diamond!" This place is more like a cubic zirconia! Firstly, this is not a resort, there is no spa...this is a CONDO COMPLEX that is brand spanking new. Last time I checked almost everything that is new is generally nice. Probably 30 years ago the now sleazy condo complexes in South Kaanapali were blinging 30 years ago too, doesnt make it a luxury resort SORRY! The good: The size of the condos The designer kitchen with washer dryers Strip mall across the street The hippie organic market was expensive but awesome Aveda bath products Convenient location between Lahaina and Kapalua Beach CORAL CORAL CORAL, awesome because there were so many fish and snorkeling was AWESOME, they dont tell you that cuz they dont want you to get hurt on the coral, its shallow too! Clearly not good for kids The bad and we wouldnt stay here again: Its not a resort, there is very little service Grounds? ehh..have you seen the Hyatt or anywhere in Wailea?Nothing special The pool/pools tiny and BORING! Marginal for a Hawaiian resort pool Kinda far from the water Partial ocean view, LOL LOL Gym stunk- never been to a resort gym on maui that didnt have an ocean view, layout was also super awkward. Maid only cleaned our room once!! Do you really have to request these kinds of things give me a break!!!! Probably the worst part- THE WIND!!! North Kaanapali is WINDY! Ive been to Maui several times and know this, dont know why I didnt remember! Overall its nice, but nothing to write home about. It's funny- luxury is often just an intangible feeling and this place doesnt have it and doesnt come close....Sorry

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: ironmanny
Reviews.Content: Went here with the family in June of 2011. It's a beautiful hotel with lots of nice touches in the rooms: AC, ceiling fans, glass accordion doors that open to the lanai, full kitchen and washer/dryer. The kids enjoyed swimming in many pools and the great snorkeling on the beach. We chose a mountain view room to save on costs and were treated to a rainbow nearly every day of our stay. We're already planning our trip here for 2012.

Reviews.Title: “paradise”
Reviews.Author: Jennyx28
Reviews.Content: This resort has it all! We had the most wonderful family vacation ever! This is a very family friendly resort with every ammenity possible. We absolutely would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “"NO Airconditioner"”
Reviews.Author: smiguel25
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family from June 1-7th. Used the gym everyday for 4 days and I can't believe that they don't have air conditioner for their fitness facility. It is frustrating to know that the staff are aware that there is no air conditioner unit in the fitness facility but everytime you walk up to them and report the problem they will tell you that they will have the engineer adjust the temperature! The place is nice, not everybody is friendly. I can only name Kaniela from the reception desk and Chris from Duke's are the only 2 people who are very helpful. The pool is amazing, a lot of kids. Maybe its better if they have a seperate swimming pool for kids and adults. The $25/day resort fee is a waste of money!! They should not charge this seperately because I don't understand what it is for. Most of the 4 star hotels have a gym facility for guests to use; pool umbrellas is a given. The employees said that they don't get a seperate gratuity from the facility so I don't understand why they say that $25/day resort fee includes gratuity to employees!

Reviews.Title: “Great quality and great value!”
Reviews.Author: Strommc
Reviews.Content: The Honua Kai was everything we were hoping for in a hotel for our stay in Maui. It's on the great Airport beach in Ka'anapali area just north of Lahaina. It has a good restaurant and a nice market (both are a little pricey but good and convenient) on site as well as multiple pools and a river/waterslide. The poolside staff is a little slow and at times can be obnoxious to guests (trying to be too funny or too chummy) but overall courteous and kind. Our room was excellent with top notch amenities and decor including stainless steel appliances, granite countertops, fully stocked kitchen, nice large bathrooms, LCD TVs, and nice large, comfortable beds. The hotel staff was extremely courteous and did a great job to make sure we had everything we needed for our stay and that our rooms were always well kept and clean. My favorite part was enjoying a cup of coffee each morning at the large table on our gigantic lanai watching the ocean. The hotel is fairly new and is working to sell a majority of the rooms so in the meantime there are good deals to be had as it was not too crowded and they were trying to keep it full. It was a great value especially compared to the Westin next door which we have stayed at in the past. I highly recommend the Honua Kai!

Reviews.Title: “Everything About This Place Was Perfect For Our Maui Adventure!”
Reviews.Author: syrahgirl
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to Maui to celebrate our 30th anniversary this year and our daughter's recent college graduation. I found a fantastic travel agent on Facebook, Sandy Gadd with Hawaiian Honeymoons. Her page was offering a 50% rate with the 5th night free at Honua Kai. We booked with her for our hotel and rental car. Upon arrival our room was upgraded to a beautiful partial oceanview room. The property at Honua Kai is gorgeous with lots of pools, waterfalls and tropical flowers. We were in the Konea Tower, room 542. We were very impressed with the quality of the room. Beautiful living area with flat screen TV, washer and dryer, upscale kitchen with beautiful appliances. The bathrooms are also stunning with soaking tubs in each bath, granite countertops and a spacious separate shower. We had 4 in our party and felt like we all had so much space and privacy. The lanai had a huge table where we enjoyed breakfast each morning before venturing out to the pools and beaches. Each bedroom also has a flat screen TV. Duke's restaurant is on site and the food quality was some of the best on the island. We also loved lounging and relaxing at the pools daily and took advantage of the food and drink service poolside. Locaton is perfect, close to both Kaanapili Beach and Kapalua in Maui. Downtown Lahaina is also not very far away. There is an additional $25/day resort fee here which includes the valet and wi-fi which worked perfectly. Honua Kai also has a great maid service, our room was always tidy and fresh when we returned in the evening. The beach in back of Honua Kai is gorgeous, a nice stretch of sand for walking or jogging and close to Duke's. We snorkeled there the first day and saw some fish and alot of pretty kelp. The sunset when we renewed our vows was also gorgeous at this beach. We are already planning a return trip with our entire family for Dec. of 2012. Honua Kai met all of our needs and we cannot wait to return again next visit to Maui.:)

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jfulls84
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon and had an incredible stay! We stayed in the Konea building and were upgraded to a one bedroom ocean view suite when we arrived. The room itself was incredibly luxurious and the staff was excellent! We loved the pool area which was never crowded and always very clean. Only downside of the place was that the beach was not great for walking because it was narrow and sloped... but there was a great snorkling spot just down from the hotel! We also loved that it is a little ways removed from the incredibly busy Kanaapali beach area but only a 3 minute drive. We would definitely recommend the hotel to both couples and families!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property, hotel-like condominiums with amenities similar to traditional hotels”
Reviews.Author: OnOurList
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Honua Kai. After our experience at the property in 2010, we decided to book another stay for 2011. We stayed in a 3-bedroom direct-ocean-view unit that is managed by the onsite "hotel" service for part of our trip; then moved to a studio, partial-ocean-view unit, rented directly from an owner. Both experiences were positive and we plan to return next year. Find owners at VRBO.com. If ocean views are important to you, book a 3-bedroom unit ending in 25 or 29, or a studio unit ending in 23 or 31. Second floor units share a common lanai area, but the views are partially blocked by the solid railing around the perimeter of the large deck. There are larger ocean-front 3-bedroom specialty units with great ocean views from the living area and lanai, but the bedrooms are side-facing (into the property). There are some 2-bedroom units with direct ocean views from within the unit, although many only have ocean views from their lanais and none from the bedrooms. All one-bedroom units have property or mountain views. Renting directly from an owner may be the best way to guarantee the view from a particular unit. There are undeveloped construction sites next to the property and some units face these areas. The hotel does not guarantee the availability of a particular unit and will not tell you which unit is yours until you arrive at the front desk for check-in. There are two towers at the property: Hokulani and Konea. Hokulani is the first tower accessible from the highway and has a small gourmet market in the lobby. The fitness center for the property is located in the second tower, Konea. The Spa, to be located in Konea, is not open yet, with no announced service provider. If you are looking for one of the best spas in Maui that is near Honua Kai, drive north on Highway 30 for about 10 minutes to the Kapalua Spa. There is also a pricier spa at the Ritz Carlton Kapalua. If you do not want to drive to a spa, walk down the boardwalk to the closest spa at the Westin's Spa Helani. If hotel-like maid service is important to you, book through Honua Kai. We thought the maid service was adequate with light daily cleaning, bed-making and fresh towels, but did not miss the service when we moved to a unit without maid service. Coffee addicts, it's BYOC after the initial welcome packet is used. The bell/valet service was excellent. During our check-in, our bags were delivered to our unit before we made it up the elevator. Each time we phoned ahead for our car, it was ready when we arrived at the front entry. The bell service was prompt, even during the busy check-out time. Underground self-parking is convenient and available for a lower daily fee. Honua Kai-managed units have traditional hotel-like telephones with single buttons for each type of service. Individually-owned units may have regular phones with no service buttons. The owner-operated studio unit we occupied had free wireless internet access. Both units had great flat-screen TVs with Blue-ray DVD players (DVDs can be rented at The Times market across the highway for $1+tax). The 3-bedroom unit had an iPod (not iPhone) docking station that could play music through individual controllers and speakers in every room, including the bathrooms. Although the 3-bedroom unit had high-end kitchen appliances like a Viking refrigerator and two Wolf convection ovens, we preferred the Bosch appliances in the studio unit. The Bosch refrigerator included a water dispenser that we found useful. The stacked washer/dryer units were adequate for light loads but had about 2-hour dry times. Be prepared for children. This is a popular spot for families. Be prepared for pets. Unfortunately, the developer chose to sell the units as pet-friendly. We watched as one pet owner repeatedly allowed his dog to use the lawn in the courtyard of Hokulani tower. This is sad because we also watched many children at play in the same area. Pet owners could do themselves a favor and keep the interior courtyard free from pet waste and yellow-spotted grass. There are many other areas on the property that are accessible for pets, but not frequently used by people. Shade-seekers can rent Gazebos at the pool from the Maui Activities center located behind Duke's restaurant. Unlike the regular pool deck chairs, the Gazebos include comfortable cushions. The pools on the property are well kept and offer a variety of types of fun, including a small water slide in front of Konea. There is no "Adult-only" pool. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect accommodations for a five-day rest & relaxation trip”
Reviews.Author: Tahoe13
Reviews.Content: I wanted to find a beach hotel with a fully equipped kitchen and ample room for me and my daughters (ages 29 and 32). A friend who specializes in Hawaii vacations immediately recommended the Honua Kai Resort & Spa. Our two-bedroom condo was extremely spacious, with a modern, fully equipped kitchen. Best of all was a beautiful brand-new washer-dryer, a must for anyone enjoying an active vacation. Although the hotel was quite full, the way the pools and waterways are landscaped, you can always find a quiet corner for sunbathing, reading and relaxing. On our last evening several whales put on quite a show for us. They weren't that close to shore, but we could see them from the beach as the sunwas setting. Plan your trip for the whale-watching season!

Reviews.Title: “A nice resort overall - mostly focused on pools and not the ocean”
Reviews.Author: mattybaddy11
Reviews.Content: The rooms look great, and it can be such a budget saver to stay at a place that has a kitchen - I recommend you load up on Costco food. I really liked the little food market in the main tower - great selection and the coffee drinks are awesome. For the time that we were at the resort it was very windy, which kept the temperature down but became a pain for several reasons (one day the pool umbrellas were not allowed to be up). If you enjoy spending most of your time at the beach, or if you hate having kids around, I would not recommend this resort. The beach is not a featured part of the resort - it has a lot of coral reef and the wind (again) becomes a factor. The beach was mostly empty when we were there - everyone was hanging out by the 3 pools with their kids. Also, Kimmy the concierge is super friendly and eager to help.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place, would love to stay again”
Reviews.Author: Tartanmoore
Reviews.Content: This resort is beautiful, the rooms are well appointed and spacious. My husband and I stayed here for our 10th anniversary trip and we were not disappointed. We were so sad to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Partial Ocean view=No ocean view”
Reviews.Author: SUSIE32657
Reviews.Content: We were excited to stay here after reading the reviews but were very disappointed upon arrival. They only had one person to check guests in and it took a very long time. We booked a partial ocean after reading the reviews but that was a mistake. Our first room was ground level with a view of a parking lot. When we called we were told to go out the the lanai and look to the left. Then we was a tiny bit of the ocean. The next two rooms were the same but at least the third was a view of the freeway and some lawn. We offered to pay for the ocean view but the said they were sold out. We paid over 400.00 with resort fee and taxes for this room. We were soooo disappointed and felt that they really misrepresented the views on the website. The bath tub pictured was not in any of the one bedroom units we saw. We did like Duke's restaurant. The place is set up more for owners than guests. No one showed us how to work the thermostat or any of the appliances and it took us several phone calls and two hours to get champagne glasses. It is too expensive and far to fly to end up with a room like this. We won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best resort on Ka'anapali beach!”
Reviews.Author: BGDUDE
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Honua Kai resort because of the reviews we read and also because we were able to book with an owner and get a 2 bedroom unit with an awesome view! This resort is so quiet. There are 2 towers, 1 with mostly couples, i think mostly owned, and the other more family oriented with a family type pool and waterfall. We booked on VRBO.com and had room 515 in the Hokulani tower. The unit was about 1300 square feet and the Lanai was a wrap around, about 340 sq. feet. This unit had everything you would need for a week or more including laundry and full kitchen, even an ocean view from the bedroom! If you are looking for the perfect beach, ( we found a starfish the very first day!) for walks and snorkeling or just hanging out, this is it. As far as driving, it is about 25 miles from Kahului airport and 2 miles from Whalers village with tons of shopping and great food on the beach. Also, about 5 miles from Old Lahaina with everything you could possibly imagine to eat and drink and a great Luau.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful new resort, on a very nice beach”
Reviews.Author: beachgirl430
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights during my 10 day honeymoon in Hawaii, and was very impressed. My room had a nice kitchen with top of the line appliances, really good kona coffee, granite countertops, extremely clean dishes, glasses, silverware, etc. The room was a studio, decent size room, nice large bathroom. Great washer and dryer in room that I definitely used after staying in Hawaii for 8 days, it was nice to be able to go home with clean laundry! The hotel also hooked us up with a beautiful ocean view, we paid for side-ocean and really it was more like full ocean view from the nice balcony on one of the top floors. This is a new resort, and while it is very nice, there are a few things I would improve on in the room. #1 and this one is huge for me is Replace the Shower head so more than a trickle of water comes out. I'm a skinny girl, 110 lb. and the water only hit one arm at a time, and I have long hair too so you can imagine how long it took me to shower and feel clean after wearing sunscreen all day and swimming in pools and the ocean. #2 is add a full length mirror somewhere in the room. ONly mirror is in the bathroom. REsort was very clean, very nice staff, they put away our groceries in the fridge before we even walked into the room since we had to wait 30 min before we could check-in. Not a big deal bc the staff was really accomodating. The snorkel equipment was overpriced here, $15/day so if you want to snorkel i would suggest driving down the road a little and renting equipment from a local place for $15 for the week! The beach at this hotel is really nice because it's not as crowded as some of the other hotels nearby. Location is great, fairly close to Lahaina with shops, not walking distance but a short drive. The market downstairs is awesome, they have pretty good food, and excellent gelato. There are bbq grills outside to use and there's also a Duke's restaurant right there on the property. Overall very nice place, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, just a few items to refresh”
Reviews.Author: mrll
Reviews.Content: Ok, so just to start off and so some of you may filter the reviews, we are not real picky people as i personally grew up on a farm in my early years so i understand the silver spoon thing. We vacationed with our family of 5. ( 2, 7, and 9 year old boys) The good This resort is beautiful some of these reviews blow me away, this place is new and clean. My wife did notice that the baseboards were not totally clean in the room but whatever. Location was great, theres a boardwalk that links up all the resorts and shopping right across the street. Overall Staff were great except one (see the bad) Check in check out was great, along with the Bell service. They helped out with bringing up groceries and were always available. Valet parking was all included but we optioned just to park our car ourselves, i dont know, i just felt more comfortable just personal i guess. We had a 2 year old that required a nap and our flight wasnt until that evening so they let us have a late check out which was great. The Bad We initally booked a resort view room and basically we had a typoon constantly running throught the room along with the noisy highway traffic. I finally had enough and they ended up moving us to the next building with a particial oceanview which was just wonderful. No typoons and no highway noise. The moral of the story dont book resort view overlooking the highway. Pay the extra money you wont regret it. One employee (i forget her name, older Hawaiian Lady) was very diffciult, short and not made for customer service. Sorry but they should give her a new title with no contact with customers. Both my wife and i noticed a few occasions that she was rude with us and other customers. I did mention this some other staff and they agreed they heard that before. The moral of the story, beware of the older Hawaiian lady at the front counter of the main building. The grounds are beautiful but theres was always a smell of sewer that would show up at random times. Theres a sewage treatment plant accross the highway but i think there more to it. They resuse the grey water on the resort and it has some sort of system in place that manages this. I think this is where the smell around the pool areas was coming from. The moral of the story, if you dont mind a random act of stinkyness youll be fine. Thats about it...We did have a great holiday with family... Cheers

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: RUSHER1285
Reviews.Content: My wife and I loved everything about this place! So clean great people best vacation Ive ever been on !!!!!!!!! Cant wait to take my kids!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Went above and beyond our expectations”
Reviews.Author: pairofsocks2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Honua Kai a couple wks ago and had an amazing stay. My husband and I were celebrating a special occasion, and the Honua Kai upgraded us from a 1-bdrm to a 2-bdrm 2-bath condo with an amazing ocean view (although it was listed as a partial ocean view rm). They also provided us with welcome champagne and two souvenir champagne flutes. The room was clean and soundproof, the furnishings were new, tasteful, and luxurious, and the in-unit washer dryer were useful. We were provided with dish soap and enough for two loads of laundry. All the basic utensils, plates, etc, were provided, and there was a large flat screen TV in every room. In Hawaii, it's hard to get value for your buck, but we definitely felt like we got our money's worth and more here. One caveat- the rooms can be very luck of the draw in terms of view- some partial ocean view rooms have great views like ours did (we were on the south building facing north), whereas others have very poor views. If view is important to you, the vrbo's might be the better way to go to lock in the unit that you want. The nice thing about them too is that you can avoid the daily resort fee, although there may be a cleaning fee. We had done a bit of research and really wanted to go with the vrbo Honua Kai 616, but unfortunately it was booked solid, so you really have to book far in advance. I cannot say enough good things about the owner Chris Geng- even though he had no availability, he went out of his way to help us find the perfect place to stay, helped us find current deals, and offered some great and very helpful advice. Overall, the Honua Kai is a great place to stay if you are looking for luxurious, clean, and convenient accommodations. It is not cheap but is relatively good value for Maui. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: BHS1978
Reviews.Content: Just returned yesterday. Facility is excellent. Two adult parents and two adult (20 and 22 year old) children. 2 bdrm condo had good sized kitchen, eating and sitting areas. Lanai was huge. Everything was new, clean and in great shape. Had read several reviews regarding the beach and was somewhat apprehensive regarding rocks/coral. The beach was very nice. The only time we noticed any rocks was at low tide. At high tide you would need to be in over your head in order to touch any rocks/coral with your feet. What we didn't expect were the intense trade winds. The resort is located in kind of a vortex where the winds are intensified. You can walk about 300 yards to the south and amazingly the winds, while present aren't nearly as intense as they are at the resort. That might cause us to consider other locations in the future. The only other issue we encountered was housekeeping. They never came at the same time every day. They were supposed to "tidy" 5 of the days we were there and "clean" on the others. We never could tell when they cleaned (ex. a dirty dish towel that was left on the counter never left it's spot on the "clean" day). Overall however I'd recommend Honua Kai to anyone travelling as a group (families or couples) looking for first class amenities, lots of space and a Kaanapali location.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: Gary2011
Reviews.Content: We have vacationed on Maui on numerous occasions and on this trip we selected the new condo complex of Honua Kai. We were deeply disappointed in the stay and highly recommend anyone not to stay here. The first issue is the front desk. Rude is am understatement. I have never quite experienced service so poor in my life. They show no customer service and less empathy to ANY request. Very pathetic was reported by others prior to us. The second issue is there are no changing facilities making late overnight flights very challenging. Once again, the poor front desk says that since the units are privately owned, there are no facilities. Lastly, the pool while it looks nice, has the most uncomfortable furniture. Beyond that, while less than 1 year old, the furniture is looking very worn. Do your self a huge favor and stay next door at the Westin Ocean Resort Villas. We have stayed there on 3 other occasions and found everything top notch.t

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Honua Kai”
Reviews.Author: kellsma
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 10-day stay at Honua Kai. We were there from May 25-June 3. We rented directly from an owner on VRBO and got a 1 bed + den in the Konea tower. Great views of the mountains and view of ocean from teh lanai. The den was set up with two twin beds. Worked great from my teenage daughter and her friend. Got the room for 199.00/night. Thought that was a great deal. Bought lots at Costco. BBQd a few nights there, did pizza one night as we were all tired and went to Dukes and Aloha Mixed Plate a couple of nights. Great location, great room and the grounds were wonderful. There were families, couples, older kids(mine were two girls who were 19 and they found lots in that age group). No problem getting pool chairs. Couple times came down with red cups and got a warning even though the red cups had water in them. Appaently red cups are a sign of alchol; however, many people brought down their own beer, etc. We did too just no longer in red cups and were never bothered again. The poolside service is a bit lacking on some days, depends on the server. Happy Hour from 3-5 but at 4:00 one day the server came around and said she was doing last call! One day, never saw a server during happy hour time. Since we rented from an owner, no resort fee, got free internet in the room, had our own beach towles and did not hve to pay for parking. We did not get housekeeping service but for that price, it was fine with us. The biggest problem which is not the hotel's fault were the winds when we were there. Huge tradewinds and on some days, they only seemed to be blowing throught the Honua Kai. My husband and I walked athe boardwalk all way to Whaler's Village and no winds, as we were coming back to Honua Kai, we literally passed the Honua Kai sign and the winds kicked up. Other than that, great time, lovely resort, would highly recommend and keep an eye out for great deals on VRBO.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, great place!”
Reviews.Author: ally113
Reviews.Content: I came here with my family of four (all 18+), and we absolutely loved it. We had a great deal of four nights, and get the fifth night free. This place is especially great value because of all the brand new commodities and spacious, spotlessly clean rooms. We had a full kitchen, a living room, and a bedroom, which makes this unlike other hotels where you are left feeling cramped and crowded - we had plenty of space to spread out! The room had a great balcony too. The whole hotel was also comfortable, with a breezy open lobby with plenty of comfortable places to sit. The adjoining restaurant (Duke's) was great for breakfast too, be sure to try the delicious French Toast. The little store in the hotel was pricey, but also very good and had local Hawaiian foods, snacks, and some souvenirs. But there is a supermarket within walking distance, so saving money on food can easily be done at a hotel like this (buy the majority of your food at the supermarket then cook in your room). The location could not be better, right on a great beach and a 5 minute drive to Lahaina and Whaler's Village which has some great restaurants and shops. Also only a 5 minute drive to Kapalua, another beautiful beach with great snorkeling and restaurants. My only two complaints were that the pool area was very windy (not really under the hotel's control though I guess) and the chairs filled up quickly - and we were there during "off" season! The other complaint was that the coffee was not restocked in the room. But overall, an amazing place and highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Maui Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Farmerica
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have returned from a week stay ( May 27- June 3) at the Honua Kai in Maui. We usually travel to the Caribbean yearly so, this was our first trip to Hawaii. We are in our early 40s and have two children under 10 ( who did not join us for this vacation). We booked a package for a 1 bedroom unit with a mountain view. Our flight landed in Maui around 4:30pm and once we retrieved our bags and picked up a rental car, we were off to the resort. We did stop at the Costco near the airport for a few food and wine provisions, but in hindsight it wasn't necessary. It is about a 40 minute drive in moderate traffic to the resort. We were greeted by a valet who had our name on a list of arrivals for that day. He directed us to the Konea tower ( there are two tower developments) and we checked in quickly and without incident. They have car valet service at the resort, but the parking lot is less than 50 yards from the lobby entrance and we did not see the need for using it to go in and out. There is also an underground garage if you don't want your car sitting in the hot sun during the day. Our room was on the 8th floor and appeared as advertised and described. The mountain view was spectacular every morning and evening. The ocean view would have been an substantial upgrade ( in price ) and we personally found looking out at the great mountainsides as beautiful as looking at the ocean may have been. We had a large kitchen with marble counter and new Bosch appliances. A comfortable living room and dining room area that locked out to a wide balcony with more tables and chairs for outdoor seating. The balcony side of the unit was floor-to-ceiling folding glass doors which we found a great feature to the room-particularly on those breezy maui mornings. The bedroom was also very comfortable, but the dresser drawers were a bit small and shallow. It was hard to put more than a few pieces of folded clothing in them. The bathroom was very big, double sink. large glass shower and a soaker tub with nice marble and tile. There is daily maid service and they did a very good job. But if it is more than two of you in the room, be mindful of the tiny kitchen trashcan. Ours was always in need of emptying and because there was no disposal in the sink, smelly food waste could linger in the kitchen easily. On our first and last night's we ate at Duke's. This is the only restaurant on the property and tends to be busy. We had an hour wait the first night and on the last night sat in the bar area. It is not on the beach, but close enough to see sunset. The service is good, menu is pretty basic hawaiian bar food and they have live music. The Mahi sandwich really stands out, though. The pool areas of the resort are fairly small ( compared to what we've seen at other resort hotel properties ) and they appear to be heavily slanted for children. They are not very deep and there are slides and wading/play areas. The layout of the grounds is nicely done and there appeared to be wait service during the daylight hours around the pool and there are gas grills for guests to cookout if they desire. The gym was a good size and had new equipment. There isn't much of a business center, but we did use it to print out boarding passes the day before departing. The resort view rooms face each other overlooking the interior grounds. It appeared that you would become very familiar with your adjacent neighbors as you would be looking directly into each others' rooms, so keep that in mind if you desire more privacy. The resort also has a gourmet market on site ( in the main tower ) that serves as the room service provider ( if you need room service ). We did not shop at the market as we found the grocery store across from the resort more reasonably priced and with better selection. The resort is located about 15 minutes past the town of Lahaina. Because this was our first trip to the island, we did a lot of exploring to the north, east and south and did not spend much of our daylight hours at Honua Kai. Places close to the Honua Kai where we had wonderful lunches and dinners were at Mala tavern, Star Noodle and The Sea Hose. There were a fair amount of families with young children or multi-generational families ( in-laws, grandparents, etc. ) as well as honeymooners and couples like ourselves. I would absolutely stay at Honua Kai again, but for those who might expect a higher-level resort/pool experience, this may not work for them. We found it an affordable, comfortable, well-staffed venue for the type of adults-without-the-kids-getaway we planned. RF

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded My Expectations”
Reviews.Author: TeenyWahine
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights this past week over Memorial Day weekend. We booked our trip through a Travelocity package that included flight and hotel. After reading the numerous reviews on Honua Kai, I had fairly high expectations upon arrival. Much to my surprise, most of the reviews were on-point about the resort. Here's how I break it down: ROOM & AMENITIES We got a room in the Hokulani Tower on the 7th floor. Our view out the balcony was of a huge dirt lot that we found out recently got sold to The Westin ( next door ) in which they will be expanding their property. Though it wasn't the pretty sight to see when you look out, you could see the mountains to your left and some ocean view to your right. I'm not sure if they give the "dirt lot" views to those who don't book directly through the hotel. Nonetheless, we were still satisfied that we got a room on a higher floor and some partial ocean view. The room itself was really nice. Like other reviewers have commented, the modern decor and the nice kitchen appliances definitely made it superb. It was convenient to have pots, pans, coffee maker, fridge, microwave, washer/dryer all in unit when spending so many days on the island. Since eating on Maui is pretty pricey, it helps you save some $$ by buying groceries at the local markets (though be warned - it's STILL pricey to buy groceries...we're looking at $3.99/lb of broccoli). SERVICE Upon check-in, the gentleman who checked us in was awesome. I wish I remembered his name. However, because our flight heading out of Maui was a red-eye, we were hoping to for a complementary check-out. When we asked one of the ladies working the desk if we could have a late check-out, she offered a noon check-out (instead of 11am) or we could pay $125 to stay until 10am. We asked if there was any way we could stay until 5pm, but apparently our only option was to pay the $125. We declined the offer and were really disappointed that a later check-out time wasn't granted after paying for 5 nights. In addition, the room service is less than to be desired. The first day, we received an additional set of shampoo/conditioner - your usual restocking of toiletries. Strangely, we didn't get restocked for the rest of the week! The towels were just stacked on the counter of the restroom. That was the extent of room service. Don't expect a whole lot in this area. There is a daily resort fee of $25 that includes parking and internet. FACILITIES The Aiina Cafe downstairs has overpriced goods but we enjoyed the fact that everything is locally grown. We had a breakfast panini there one morning and it was delicious and the portion was just right! Their gelato is also super delicious. The pool area are well maintained and we enjoyed having mai tais by the pool after a long day of snorkeling. We also used the Viking grills one night which by the way, were awesome. However, be prepared to wait as everyone seems to grill their dinners. ATMOSPHERE The location of the resort is a short drive away from the main downtown Lahaina. However, it's nice and peaceful here - if you don't mind all the kids running around everywhere. DUKE'S RESTAURANT ON SITE Other than the happy hour, I wouldn't say there's anything exceptional about Duke's. The dinners are pricey and the dinner service was nothing to write about.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: leggett1942
Reviews.Content: The resort is fantastic, everything about it was amazing from the amenities to the views. I dont always write these but I figured that I should so who ever is thinking about staying here will feel releaved after reading this.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great vacation, couple of hiccups”
Reviews.Author: MannyParz
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful vacation May 16 - 25, stayed in the Konea Tower (newer tower) with a mountain view. The location is great, snorkeling right off the beach along the coral reef is super. Not a beach to body surf as the coral is close to the surface. Beware of the sharp coral if walking in at lower tide and the stinging black sea urchins. Accommodations are brand new, clean and high quality. Don't leave anything sweet out on the counters as their are some native mite/ant like creatures that will help themselves to a snack. I suggest you book through the property as you will have all of the amenities of the resort. Visit www.honuakaicafe.com and utilize the Ambassador Club Owners Discount when booking. I saved over $30 / day using the discount code 60001X mentioning the code with the resort. Duke's Restaurant on site has great food, somewhat expensive, but hey it's Maui, you are on vacation and you should be helping to boost the local economy. The gas grill area is convenient for BBQ on site. Downside, they don't allow you to bring your own alcohol drinks in the area of the grills or pool. Yes there are a fair amount of young children, but not obnoxious. Hey we were all in their shoes at one point, so just enjoy. Some reviews point out the "awful smell". It's there, but not constant depending on the direction of the wind. It's not grease pits from Duke's, it's the "Poop Plant" (Waste Water Treatment Plant) across the street and when they are stirring the pot and the wind is right, it stinks! Go sniff the Plumeria when it occurs, the flowers smell a lot better. Too bad the resort was built right across the street. I think the "aroma" was stronger in the original, Hokulani Tower. One hiccup during our stay, we left early for a trip to Makena (Big Beach) and when we returned later in the day, found we never had housekeeping service that day. They corrected the issue immediately when I called the front desk. Shop 4 miles down the road back to Lahaina at Safeway or Foodland for groceries and beer, wine and other alcohol. It is a bit less expensive than Times Supermarket across the street from Honua Kai. All three groceries are a lot less expensive than Aina Gourmet Market on-site in the Hokulani Tower. Kapalua Beach and Napili Beach just a few miles north of the resort are some of the nicest beaches for snorkeling, scenery and seeing sea turtles.

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for style on Maui, this is the place”
Reviews.Author: love2ski2008
Reviews.Content: This is a very expenisive hotel, but worth the money. The style is very tropical, location is great. We had the suite which was really over the top, but very romantic. Try the little bar downstairs for some good drinks and some funny local bartenders!

Reviews.Title: “For families simply fenomenal!”
Reviews.Author: ZokaMaui
Reviews.Content: May is considered to be off season month, so it's not crowded. It is very clean, staff very friendly. Pools are amazing as well as the Ka'anapali beach. Location is great. Lahaina is 10 min from there. Duke's restaurant is one of the best in Maui. As croats we have been to most of the European and Canadian top resorts, but Honua Kai, Maui has been THE best vacation so far. Zoran, Biljana and Alexander

Reviews.Title: “Style and comfort”
Reviews.Author: yogam
Reviews.Content: Honua Kai exceeded our expectations. We loved the views from our 3-bed apartment, not only of the landscaped pools and gardens but of the ocean with Lanai and Molokai offshore. This encouraged us to relax on our lanai with breakfasts and lunches and occasional dinners prepared in the modern kitchen. We loved the quietness and spaciousness of Honua Kai. The layout of the grounds meant that one could find a peaceful pool spot. My granddaughter, 3, was wonderfully catered for with safe pool areas - and morning feeding of the carp. The steeply sloping beach with underwater rocks immediately in front of the Resort was suitable for snorkeling but not, unfortunately, for swimming or sandcastle-building. However a 5 or 10-minute walk along the beachfront takes you to stretches of kid-friendly and adult swimming beach shaded by trees. Dukes Restaurant on site is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed atmosphere with top of line ammenities”
Reviews.Author: SeattleTravelone
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Honua Kai Resort for a week from May 14th-21st in the Konea Tower. Our suite was a one bedroom mountain/resort view. We travel often and found the room to be perfect for our needs. It was clean, quiet, and very comfortable. The bed was outstanding! The rooms are well designed and you don't hear any noise from the other guest rooms. The lanai/deck was very large and we enjoyed seeing rainbows 3 days in a row over the mountains. My recommendation to other travelers: although there is a grocery store within walking distance (across the street) DON'T go there for larger purchases. The prices are too expensive ($7 box of cereal, $5 bag of regular Doritos, $9 for Planters Nuts). I suggest you drive 4.5miles back toward Lahaina to the Safeway grocery store. You'll find prices in line to what you will pay at home.

Reviews.Title: “Honua Kai is an amazing resort with service better than most.”
Reviews.Author: thsieh74
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved staying at the Honua Kai. I stayed in a 3BR unit from 5/15-5/19, and just about everything about the resort was top-notch. I've stayed in Wailea on Maui on previous trips, at both the Fairmont and the Four Seasons, and while those really set the standard for luxury accommodations, the Honua Kai was just as elegant and a lot more accessible. ACCOMMODATIONS: The rooms were spacious and very clean, and the master bathroom was huge! Having an extra large bath tub to bathe the kids in after a trip to the beach was great. I was traveling with another family, with a total of three kids under five, which made having a kitchen and an in-unit washer/dryer imperative. The kitchen was fully stocked with dishes, utensils, and cookware. The resort staff even included a welcome package with dish towels, laundry detergent and dishwashing liquid. The large lanai is a great place to eat breakfast, and we even cooked dinner one evening and ate it out on the lanai while watching the sunset over the ocean! Finally, the room was pretty high-tech, with individual room temperature settings, an iPod/iPhone dock that can pipe your music into any of the rooms, flat screen TVs, and a DVD/BluRay player. There are no desks, but the large dining room table or the bar area can be used easily for work. Wireless internet is available, and was included in the $25/night resort fee we paid. We had a partial ocean view that overlooked an empty lot, but also had a clear view of both the mountains and the ocean. RESORT: Honua Kai is beautiful, with lots of native plants and flowers on display. The pool area is very kid-friendly, with two different areas for toddlers to play in. The on-site restaurant Duke's is an upscale chain restaurant that has a great view of the ocean and tasty food, but is on the pricey side. I live close to a Duke's in Huntington Beach, so it felt weird to be eating at one in Hawaii. There is also a gourmet market/coffee bar that I walked through but did not get to try. There are two different fitness centers - the one in the main building is on the smaller side, but the other one is supposedly larger with more equipment. If you book through the resort, they charge a $25 fee that covers valet parking, in-room Internet access, the fitness center, etc. I personally did not mind the fee, as I got a great room rate, but I could see it bothering some people. Also, it is a little odd that the resort has "Spa" in the name as the spa facilities are all at the Westin property next door. The concierge can book appointments for you, and I've heard the Westin spa is excellent, but don't come expecting on-site spa service. SERVICE: Every staff member I interacted with at Honua Kai was very friendly, from the reservation agent to the front desk to the housekeeping. We would get handwritten notes from housekeeping after they cleaned our room, welcoming us to Hawaii. Requests for extra paper towels or detergent were promptly met. A maintenance worker even took the time to show me around the fitness center. One nitpick is that the pool staff, while very courteous, had a hard sell going with their sunglasses. LOCATION: Honua Kai's location is both good and bad. It's great to be in Kaanapali - there is a supermarket just one street over, awesome snorkeling nearby at Black Rock, and easy access to Lahaina. There are golf courses within 5 minute drives. Ohana Tacos (a fish taco truck) and Aloha Mixed Plate are short drives away. The downside of Honua Kai's location is the beach. The beach itself (part of Kaanapali Beach) is beautiful and not crowded at all, but lots of rocks immediately offshore means less than ideal swimming conditions, and forget about boogie boarding or anything like that. On the flipside, you can see a few fish and coral immediately offshore. Great beach for kids to play in the sand or in the shallow waters, but better water play is available further south on Kaanapali Beach or north in Napili Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place we stayed on our honeymoon in Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: Jetset101710
Reviews.Content: Amazing place, everything is new, clean, and top of the line. We got a 1 bedroom condo through Costco and it was great. The linai is big and the linai furniture is very nice. The pools are amazing and there are ample chairs and umbrellas. They also will set up chairs and umbrellas for you on the beach for a fee. Not all of the other hotels even offer this so its a great amenity. The crowd is great - nice people, families, couples, etc. People were quiet and respectful. Duke's was great, we went there are few times, for breakfast, drinks, and dinner. I would go back Honua Kai in a heartbeat and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A great place with our 5 year old!”
Reviews.Author: MommyK
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip through Costco, and I feel like we got great value compared to other packages I looked at. We loved our stay here! Everything suited our family quite well. We were upgraded to â€œpartial ocean viewâ€� when we checked in, probably because the hotel was not full, and the room had a partial view toward Molokai, true to its description. As for the previous visitors who compared it to the hotel next door, yes, that place is on the ocean, but they are almost IN the ocean, with no beach or grounds it seems. The Honua Kai has very nicely landscaped courtyards with koi ponds and pools, etc. Our room had a full window wall with a screen, so even the inside felt like outside. One downside was that we were next to the parking lots of that other hotel and the public beach access, so occasionally there was noise like a stereo or car alarm at night, but that didnâ€™t bother us much. The unit was immaculate, with everything new and nice, including the kitchen and laundry appliances. The several pools are great for kids, and our son loved the water slide. (There was no ridiculous chair jockeying either.) The beach frontage was great, and there was good snorkeling basically steps outside our building. We even saw two sea turtles! We used the kids club a few times in the evening, and the counselors were great. Our son wanted to leave us and go back each day! It was about $10 per hour, which we canâ€™t beat at home for a babysitter if we want to go out for dinner. All of the staff was very friendly and helpful. We ate lunch at Dukeâ€™s once, and it was yummy. We would have gone back, but once we had stocked our room refrigerator, we had light lunches in our room and went into town for our dinners. In short, I would highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay for Families with Small Children”
Reviews.Author: RobertMSeattle_WA
Reviews.Content: We were quite pleased with the Honua Kai Resort & Spa. We were staying with a 4 year old and didn't plan on much siteseeing so we'd be spending alot of time around the hotel. Check-in was a bit difficult since we got there in the early afternoon and the room wasn't available until 4PM. But the staff kept our luggage (including groceries that needed to be refrigerated from Costco) until the room was available. So, we were pleased with their flexibility. The resort is a fairly new facility with no sign of any trash, wear & tear, etc. The common areas were top-notch. Our room (#H-224) was right above the entrance with a view of the parking lot but it was still a pleasant place to stay with no outside noise. I would recommend trying to get a courtyard room on the first floor which seem to be very convenient to the pool. Rooms with views appear to be privately owned and not in the rental pool. So don't get your hopes up for an ocean view. Our unit was nicely furnished and we could make a modest breakfast in our room but getting items like salt/pepper and butter and oil for basic cooking might not be worth the trouble unless you are staying for a week or more. All utensils were available. We made us of the washer/dryer and felt we brought too many clothes since it was so convenient. Housekeeping appeared to be pretty hit or miss. Some days they'd come and some days they wouldn't but the front desk was responsive if they didn't arrive in a timely manner. There is a deli/coffee shop that appears to be open most of the day so it's convenient for getting a smoothie, sandwich or groceries. It seems to be pretty expensive though - get an iced coffee ($2) instead of a latte ($5). The pool was quite extensive with waterfall and slide and was great for small children and never seemed to get overly crowded. If you tire of the pool scene, the beach very clos. Some reviews are critical of the beach. We found it great for snorkeling with rock formations a short distance from the shore and beautiful white sand for miles. The best snorkeling is to the south around Black Rock. The trees near the shore provide ready shade so no need to rent a parasol from the hotel. But overall, it is a great beach, with plenty of snorkeling, swimming and frolicking in the waves. The hotel is centrally located to dining in Kapalua or Lahaina but Duke's which is the hotel's restaurant was a very pleasant place for breakfast, lunch or dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: Arsenalmom
Reviews.Content: Just finished up a week long stay at Honua Kai Resort and Spa, and we would go back in a heart beat. Our two bedroom two bath ocean view condo was top of the line, and the beds were so comfortable, the best we have slept on anywhere in the world! The grounds are beautiful, the staff very friendly, and great snorkeling off of the beach in front of the resort. It is relaxing and north of the rat race of some of the other resorts. The location was perfect for getting to golf, surf lessons and the zipline. The view from our deck was priceless. We utilized the Viking grills down by the pool , and a grocery store is across the street for any item you need. I would recommend this resort to anyone. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Was one of the best!”
Reviews.Author: camiehansen
Reviews.Content: This resort was one of the best we have stayed in! We were very satisfied with the rooms, staff, pool (was a little small), beach & area. I read reviews before we booked the resort about how there was a bad smell. It is across the street from a dump or something but we didnt smell it at all. We smelled worse traveling around the island then at our hotel and our room was facing the street. It was not bad at all! Dukes is located right next to the pool area next to the beach, there food was great and it was nice having it so close! Rooms came stocked with everything you could need, plus there is a grocery store across the street:) Always had plenty of towels and the room was always cleaned and stocked. We had an amazing time and part of that is thanks to the resort! Also didnt hear any loud noises

Reviews.Title: “Perfect accomodations”
Reviews.Author: DriverandMike
Reviews.Content: Stayed 9 nights during Easter break. Best condo resort on the island of Maui. Saved a lot money by cooking meals. Times supermarket is easy walking distance. Resort is well maintained. We were never hassled to purchase a condo. Rented 2 bedroom 2 bath condo through vbro.com. There are many to pick from on this website. Also less expensive than going through resort. We had a beautiful view of the mountains. I did not want to pay an extra $1000 for ocean view since activities and food is expensive on Maui. Parking is $10 a day underground. Yes there were a lot of children at the resort, but we never heard anyone when we were in our room. Only complaint was our condo did not have wireless Internet and the cable was not very long.

Reviews.Title: “Not a romantic getaway, but for families with little kids!”
Reviews.Author: CAfolks
Reviews.Content: This condo was exactly as described. The property was so very clean & well maintained with all of the extras. Plus the bed rivaled the Sheraton/Westin Heavenly beds. The property was beautiful with lush grounds, meandering pools and a good beach. It was close to the best snorkeling, that is part of a reserve, in front of the Westin Kaanapali Villas, just a very short walk/swim away. We loved the fact that Duke's was right on the property with excellent atmosphere, great food, prices and a very helpful & friendly staff. We loved eating at the Hula Grill & Leilani's at the Whaler's Shopping Center & Kimo's in Lahaina. The only draw back for us was the property was overrun with little children 4 & under. All the pools were 3 feet deep, so all the children swam in every part of the property's pools. While we LOVE little children, it wasn't what we expected for a romantic getaway. But it's a very family friendly place!

Reviews.Title: “HEAVEN ON EARTH..........”
Reviews.Author: Clairec0910
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable place - great location - We visited paradise for 4 days. I highly recommend this resort, great for kids, parents, young and old... I would go back there in a heartbeat. Rooms were big and comfortable, cleanliness A1, appliances nothing but the best... I have nothing bad to say about this place .... and the staff was ever so friendly and helpful.. Stay here - u wont be dissappointed...

Reviews.Title: “The best vacation ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Yankee1384
Reviews.Content: I literally read every review from trip advisor prior to booking and we made the right decision! We stayed at Honua Kai from 4/30/-5/7. Upon check in, my wife and I were amazed by the beautiful grounds. First class all the way! Koi ponds and beautiful gardens/pools/spas surrounded the 2 towers. We had a studio ocean view. It does not have a "pure" ocean view, but it still had an amazing view of the ocean and the several pools and gardens. Speaking of pools, there are probably 5-6 pools and 5-6 jacuzzis. None were crowded. In addition, we never struggled to find a great place to lay out. We would even move the lounge chairs to a grass field near the beach to watch the sunset. The room literally had everything (silverware, cups, blender, stove, microwave, soaps, dishwasher, washing machine, dryer, EVERYTHING!) There were kids around, but they were all young (ages 2-10). They were not an issue at all as they were always with their families. We have a 2 year old that we did not take, so we kind of felt home sick seeing all the children. Never the less, all the kids were well behaved and polite. The "smell" that others speak of was non-existent. Dukes is great! We were there for dinner twice and happy hour a few times! Great prices. Do not waste your time driving to Safeway. The "Times" grocery store is right outside your resort and has everything. The BBQ pits on the grounds were immaculate. Viking grills cooked our steaks perfectly for dinner on the beach! The resort does pretty much shut down after 11pm, but so does the rest of the island for that matter. We had the smalles balcony which was still huge! Easily 7'x12'. Great for morning breakfasts or lunches. We had a friend stay two nights on the sofa bed and he said it too was very comfortable. We walked the beach several times and after seeing some of the "older" resorts, it re-assured that we made the right decision. We went zip lining which was great, a luau at another resort (not great) and snorkling at monokini (probably spelled wrong) which was great! The staff was great in suggesting things to do and places to eat. There is a small organic shop on the grounds which has all the basics, but kind of pricey. We went to relax and get away from the hustle of reality and totally made the right choice. Lots of laying out, listening to iPod by the beach/pool and reading was the highlight of our trip. There is a ton more to do in Maui, but we took advantage of the hotel to simply relax. The parking is great (underground garage takes you right ot your floor if you decide not to valet). The water had some coral, but we noticed several people snorkling and heard of no complaints. The hotel is about 45 minutes from the main airport (OGG), but only 5 minutes from one of the small airports. All in all, you cannot go wrong staying at this resort....pure class and style all the way!

Reviews.Title: “Brand New Resort in Excellent Location-Perfect for Families!”
Reviews.Author: Crystal S
Reviews.Content: Ok, just returned from a 2 week stay in the brand new Honua Kai Resort. First week we stayed in a studio unit with ocean views at $260 night, the second week we stayed in a 2 bedroom full ocean view unit at $560 per night. Their idea of a full ocean view was our idea of "partial ocean views". Things to remember about this resort: Because it is a CONDO resort, it caters to families with loads of children. It was hard to find ANY quiet time around the pools. It would have been nice to have at least ONE adult-only pool. There is NO daily maid service! Rooms are cleaned only every 3rd day. If you want DAILY maid service you have to pay extra for it. Also, you are issued 2 towel cards for the pool. Routine is that you give the pool attendant the 2 cards in exchange for the 2 towels....OMG-do not think about asking for extra towels, you'd think they were guarding gold or something! If you forget to turn in towels at the end of the day and get your towel cards back you have to go back to the front desk and beg for more. You are given a welcome pack when you check-in which includes ONE pack of coffee and two packs of creamer/sugars. YOU must buy any additional coffee/cream for $5. Kitchens are great, but no garbage disposals. There are NO lounge chairs ON THE BEACH, you must rent them for $10 per day! OUCH! I highly recommend this resort to anyone traveling with kids. The resort has a small water slide and children are very protected. Staff was very friendly. The hotels night bell-person was very knowledgable. He directed us to the BEST nightclub in Lahaina for hip-hop dancing "Timba" . He reminded me of "The Rock".....a beautiful simoan young man with a great attitude! There is a $25 per day resort fee, make sure you factor that in!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful Resort!! Would come back again!!”
Reviews.Author: Lahaina13
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this resort for 10 days in May 2011. Originally I was looking at going to Honolulu or doing a week there & a week in Maui, however when reading the reviews for Honolulu resorts I found them all to have alot of negative reviews. I also had a co-worker that went to Honolulu for a few days & also stayed at Honua Kai in Maui for a few days. He said he wished he had stayed in Maui at Honua Kai the whole trip and that it was the most beautiful resort ever! If you can afford to stay here I would strongly recommend it... the rooms are extremely clean & stylish, the staff is very friendly and the grounds & pools are beautiful! I had always heard that Hawaii is very expensive however I didn't find that... there is a grocery store across from the resort (a short 5 min walk) where food is priced the same as at home, in the same plaza where the grocery store is there is a Mexican Restaurant & Pizza place where you can get a plate of pasta & garlic bread for $6! We ate at Duke's alot too (the restaurant at the hotel) they have a casual menu where items range from $13-$15 but you can't make reservations & should go early to get a table. The dining room side takes reservations & prices are around $25-$30. We also got coupons from the resort & from taxi drivers for free dessert or appetizers from Duke's so we never paid for dessert or calamari! Breakfast at Duke's is about $9.95 but you can grab cereal etc at the grocery store across the street & eat at the hotel. The atmosphere & staff on the resort and the whole island is amazing... the go out of their way to make sure you're having an amazing vacation. This is one place I would definitely come back to in the near future & I will be staying at Honua Kai again!

Reviews.Title: “great place for families with children”
Reviews.Author: kimspokane
Reviews.Content: Just got back today from a one week stay. The reviews I read before our stay mentioned an inordinate amount of children. I do not mind children at all and figured that it was spring break related. If you are thinking about staying here without your children then you really should take heed to the reviews here. It makes sense. It is a perfect place to stay with your children. Lazy river pool, nice grass areas, BBQ's, many little friends for the kids to meet, plenty of room in a beautifully appointed condo... beautiful grounds, Dukes is just fine for ocean front dining and kid friendly, and when your child has a fit (as all children do) you don't have the crabby people staring you down. TONS of kids. Our children are older and we left them home. We travel to Hawaii 2-3 times per year. Waited until we were sure, spring break around the country was done, weather at home was still bad and occupancy was not too high at the resorts. I really like the privacy of a condo vs. hotel and ability to make coffee, bbq, sit out and watch the sunset... but many of the condos in Maui are getting a bit old and shabby. The older condominiums have the ocean front units that are truly oceanfront but you risk the potential of a bad bed, dirty old furniture... We stayed at Sugar Beach Resort last year, fleas ate my husband, and the bed was marginal at best. We have previously stayed there many times and loved it but decided that we did not want to risk a bad unit again. Have also stayed at the Westin Villas but had a top floor ocean front unit and so still had the privacy and the view, no units to look across at... I looked at booking an "ocean view" at the westin, I guess they do not typically book the oceanfronts unless you are an "owner" and they wanted $800/nt for the ocean view. I did notice many less children at the Westin but that was a couple of years ago. We booked this trip a week in advance and got a good last min deal on the condominium thru vrbo. Ocean view one bedroom inner courtyard, top floor. Unit was beautiful. No complaints with the rental company. Only complaint I had with unit was two pillows for two people. They had some extra pillows in the closet but no extra pillowcases. I think the most important thing you need to think about is what you want from your vacation. Our unit was inner courtyard so no noise from the road as the mountain views and outer units has. We did have a good ocean view. About four units down the side bank of the U shape. The negative for me was the communal sense I felt while sitting on the Lanai. I like to wake up in the morning and sit on the Lanai, drink a cup of coffee, listen to the ocean, and watch sunrise/sunset... This trip was not that. I wake up early, as do most travelers to Maui, as at this time of year pacific coast time is three hrs. behind. So this means at 6am when I sat on the Lanai there was already many, many, many babies in the courtyard, laughing, swimming, screaming, playing.. My husband was also baffeled at the amount of little ones. But after we thought about it it made sense. Most of these units are two and three bedrooms. Most Lanais were filled early morning with grandparents, parents and their little ones. There were not many school age kids at this resort during our visit. The majority were 5 and under. If it does not bother you to have the little privacy from your neighbors and the kids then it's a great place to stay. If you have little kids then it's a great place to stay. If you want privacy and not a ton of little ones then it's not the place for you. Other good points. All the families we met were very nice. Good parents, grandparents.. Not the type of place where someone will take your belongings at the beach or pools. Also the type of place where if someone did try to take your stuff while you were in the ocean my guess is that someone else would prevent it. The ocean in front of the resort has coral. Not the best beach spot for swimming but great for kids to play in the sand and splash in the waves. Also very populated. We left each day and went to other beaches. Had a great time at some very unpopulated beautiful sandy beaches and were gone most of the days. The store actually does have some good deals and items that you don't find at Costco or Wallmart. Beer is $12/six pack of Coors lite ($23 for a 30 pack at times grocery) but they had some salads that were excellent ($6 which is good when you figure the cost of purchasing these ingreidents) and local with yummy dressing, pickeled ginger for $3/jar which is what we would pay at home and some organic items that were local and not too high priced. Coffee. I like to buy local but I have never been a fan of any hawaiian coffee. Very bitter in my opinion. Some people love it though, so just my opinion. The market on site sells local coffee $19. for 8oz. It was terrible. Very bitter. There is a starbucks down the road that will grind you some fresh coffee for half the price. Overall we had a very relaxing time. I would stay here again with my kids. Would love to find that perfect condo that is a bit more private, ocean front and totally remodeled but did not find it. Would recommend this place over a hotel as it has the hotel immenities and the condo feel. Good rooms, grounds, hot tubs, pools, sand on the beach, walking path... withing walking distance to blackrock if you choose (about 20min). Dukes was very relaxing and good service. No wait and fairly good inexpensive food for Maui. Only other rec. If you know how to drive you should probably rent a car at the airport upon arrival. They are very inexpensive. It's very easy to get around Maui and a car is almost a necessity.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Staycation @ Houna Kai Resort & Spa”
Reviews.Author: HeavenlyFlower61
Reviews.Content: Our Women's group from church stayed at Honua Kai Resort & Spa this April for a Women's Retreat. We had 42 ladies in attendance. We spent 3 days and 2 nights relaxing and enjoying each others company and our beautiful surroundings. The grounds of the resort are manicured very well.
