The sweet scent of flowers linger as you stroll down the pathway which takes you to the Aquatic playground on the property or to Duke's for dining. Our suites were beautiful! Upon checking into our suite there was a Suite Starter Kit on our dining room table. The kit included everything we needed for cleaning in the kitchen area( dish washing liquid; dishwasher detergent; laundry detergent; . We had a full kitchen with all the dinnerware, silverware, cooking utesils, pots and pans. The unit also comes with a washer & dryer. The rooms were very spacious, lots of space for 4 ladies to a suite (2brm suite). The bathrooms were the size of a some studio apartments here on Maui. It was a smooth prcess from the get go. The Reservations Dept. assisted in getting our rooms all in the same tower (Hokulani). Thanks Doll The service we received from the guys at the Bell Desk (Ian, Ben, Leo, Don, Stephen, & James) to the Front Desk staff (Bobbie,Ted, Kelsie, Berna, Daniel, Tim, Tonae & Rick) was exceptional. The Conference Room that we used there was very comfortable. Aina Gourmet Market had the most delicious cupcakes. The Duke's staff were excellent. They accommodated our group of 42 ladies no problem. Thanks to Noah, Chris, John, Wehilani, Joemy and the rest of the staff that helped us. Times Supermarket was located across the street for groceries. Great places to eat only 5 to 10 minutes away by car. I just can't say enough about what a great time we all had during our stay!!! I will most definitely recommend this resort to everyone looking to visit or staycation here on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel/Condo in Maui”
Reviews.Author: Bradley156
Reviews.Content: We Checked in late at night from a Long Flight From Los Angeles.. The Valet and the BellMan were waiting out front.. They were more than Helpful.. We stayed in a 2 bedroom condo with a Full Wrap around Balcony.. It was Stunning. We had our 3 young children and we put them in the Resort day care so we could eat dinner etc,. They Care was Fantastic. The kids loved it. I would not stay anywhere else. If your blessed Enough to Stay in Class this is the only place you need to Look.. The only thing its missing would be a few more resturaunts to choose from. But Dukes is pretty good overall.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Borioles97
Reviews.Content: Honua Kai Resort and Spa is the newest resort in Maui and it is just gorgeous. Our condo was not ready at check in (my only complaint) but Nahiku at the front desk more than made up for the problem. We were upgraded from a studio to a 1BR oceanview condo on the top floor close to the ocean. He also sent up a gift basket with a bottle of champagne with 2 champagne flutes in honor of our 30th wedding anniversay. If that were not enough, he gave us an evening check out since our flight home left at 10 pm giving us the entire last day to do whatever we wanted. The condo was so well equipped with top quality appliances, furniture, bedding, granite countertops etc. The pool area was amazing with plenty of room for all guests. The property in ocean front and the beach area was stunning with great snorkeling. OK so I had one more complaint, we did eventually have to check out and go home.

Reviews.Title: “Great family trip, Honua Kai was exceptional”
Reviews.Author: mikebop
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay, accomodations were excellent, staff was friendly, responsive, and helpful. Bellmen were helpful and courteous, gave good directions and advice on where to go for groceries, shopping, restaurants, etc. We did not get to resort until about 10:30pm on a Wednesday night. We received a friendly greeting from the Bellman on duty, he loaded all our luggage on a cart then parked our car, met us at the front desk after we checked in, escorted us to our room, unloaded our luggage, explained how A/C controls, kitchen appliances, etc worked. Showed us how the wall door windows to pation opened and worked. Great way to make a good first impression. The Resort grounds were beautiful and well maintained. Lots of pools and jacuzzi's. Very family friendly atmosphere. Lots of activities at site for kids of all ages. We were with family of six adults and one toddler. Large grassy area for kids to run around, play, throw balls. The cleaning staff was friendly, quick, and effiecient. She even gave us extra coffee, filters, detergent for washer and dishwasher. Nice beach on resort property with good snorkeling. Very relaxed atmosphere, plenty of staff on duty to take care of needs. The place was clean and the equipment and furnishings were in good working order. Plenty of lounge chairs and umbrellas around pool areas. Lots of shallow areas for kids and young children to play in. Easy access to the beach with lounge chairs available to take with you. There may have been a charge for the chairs but not sure, we just used the beach towels provided and the beach mat from our room. There was a restaurant on site (Duke's) that serves breakfast, lunch, and dinner, and a little coffee and sandwich shop in the lobby area. The Resort location was close to many great beaches, golf courses, shopping areas, and local attractions. Plenty to do withing a 15 minute drive. Everything is priced high, expect to pay $10 or more for a burger in any restaurant. Places like McDonalds is still relatively cheap compared to everything else. Groceries are high also but you can save some money by preparing some of your meals in the suite. We mainly made our own breakfast, packed fruit and snacks for lunch then ate out for dinner. There is a little grocery store about 2 blocks from Resort that has a great wine selection called "The Times". There is a Safeway about five minutes away going toward Lahaina with a number of shops there. The town of Lahaina has all kinds of shopping and places to eat with some historical buildings and sites. All in all the Honua Kai was a great place to stay and we will book with them again when we come back.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ostermillerr
Reviews.Content: Our 3 days at Honua Kai were relaxing and restful. The rooms are superior quality and the service is impeccable. They offer all the amenities at a beautiful location. I highly recommend this resort for business or leisure. Would choose them again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Spot”
Reviews.Author: CoryGLee
Reviews.Content: Best resort in Kaanapailii! Suite Honualani 109 is a huge 2 bedroom. It is great for kids as it has easy access to the pools and grass area. It also has ocean views.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property - Misrepresents Ocean View”
Reviews.Author: byrdlover
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property with great amenities, but I agree with the previous poster. "Ocean view" studios at the Honua Kai are a joke unless you are you want to spend all of your time hanging over your balcony rail. Although we loved the room furnishings, the beautiful grounds,the resort's proximity to Lahaina, the ocean-front trail, and the on-site Duke's Restaurant, next time we will stay elsewhere with a true ocean view.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Resort with a friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: EJCase
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found the hotel through a deal on costco.com. the valet guys were friendly right off the bat and the hotel is BEAUTIFUL! Our room was perfect - we had a mountain view which I wasn't excited about at first, but being from Washington, we liked that we weren't getting the afternoon sun on our patio. We didn't excursion down to the beach to sit out until the day before we left. Tip if you aren't with kids - the pool is packed with families & kids, go down to the beach, it's cooler with the ocean breeze, you can rent chairs & and an umbrella from the pool and you can watch the sea turtles swim & play, it was great! we wish we'd checked it out our first day! The grocery store on site is also really handy for your morning latte and quick snacks. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “What ocean view?”
Reviews.Author: Jykim
Reviews.Content: We book this place and upgraded to ocean view thinking that we can actually see the ocean from the kitchen area. We were surprised when we walked in and were staring at the balcony on the other side of the building. You actually have to go out the balcony and strain your neck to the side to see the ocean. This was a fourth trip to Hawaiian islands for my family, and the worst view we have ever had. When we called the front desk and expressed our dissatisfaction, we were told that they "could sense our hostility" and were very rude. They did end up giving us different room which was bit closer to the ocean, but very unfriendly to say the least and were absolutely not accommodating. We actually missed our first day due to our flight, and we extended our stay by one more day but they did not even give us any consideration for that either. They charged us for the full first day that we missed, and for the full extra day that we stayed, and tried to pass a garden view as ocean view. We will be coming back to Maui, but never to this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, Family-Friendly Resort”
Reviews.Author: JerseyGirlTravels26
Reviews.Content: With 5 family members traveling, the 2-bedroom condo we had was spacious, clean and extremely well-planned. We had an absolutely fabulous time at this resort. Our kids (11 and 5) loved it as well. Our room (H715) provided a wonderful ocean and pool view...with spectacular sunsets. The L-shaped lanai was spacious and we spent a lot of time sitting outside and taking in the views. Dukes had high-quality food and service and the market was great as well. If you have a need, use the onsite concierge, they provided wonderful service and true aloha sprit. We travel a lot and have extremely high stanards...this place lived up to them all. I would absolutely return. The only somewhat negative thing I can say is that the beach was a bit disappointing...narrow, rough surf and the chair and umbrellas required payment. Otherwise, this place is a wonderful choice in the Lahaina area.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Saweet
Reviews.Content: A beautiful resort. So much more than what the pictures suggest. Really enjoyed the two bedroom condo we booked through Travelocity. The pool areas are fantastic. Dukes is reasonably priced. I loved it so much here, can't wait to go back. Thanks Honua Kai for making my very first trip to Hawaii so wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great amenities”
Reviews.Author: smac5
Reviews.Content: My husband, teenage son and I have just returned from our stay at Honua Kai. For us, it was the ideal hotel. LOVED the fact that it had a washer/dryer and full kitchen. The kitchen is very well stocked with plenty of cooking supplies... even had a blender. We had a continuous supply of laundry soap, dryer sheets, dish soap etc. There is also a broom, mop, and bucket for tidying up all that sand you will inevitably track in. We had no problem with the housekeeping. They give fresh towels,remove trash, make beds daily and also change sheets every 3rd day. I found it very easy to do a quick tidy up every day after we came in from the beach, and would do a load of laundry daily. Even though other guests have mentioned they had a few issues with housekeeping, we thought it was fine. The room was very quiet and comfortable. The beach is awesome for snorkeling. On a clear day you can see where the coral is very easily, so you just swim out in the channels between the coral until you are in deep enough water not to touch it, and you will see loads of beautiful fish. As for lots of kids at the pool.... yes, there was, but we just avoided the pools since the warm ocean is literally right there. If you have read previous reviews about the notorious odor... really, it is not an issue. I am very sensitive to stinky smells and I wasn't bothered by it at all. I would say in the week we were there, I caught a very fleeting whiff maybe 3 or 4 times. No big deal. Dukes restaurant is awesome. It is on the pricey side, but really delicious. My hubby and I are very picky about restaurant food and both loved the two dinners we ate there. We found the Safeway in Lahaina Cannery Mall to be a good place to grocery shop. It is only a few minutes from Honua Kai right off Hwy. 30, very easy to locate. If you want to use the fitness room, go to the one in the Konea Tower. It is excellent. Many cardio machines, treadmills, recumbent bikes, ellipticals, and great weight machines and free weights. The best fitness room of any hotel we have been in to date. There is also a boardwalk that runs along the beach between resorts that is great for walking or running. If you are thinking about visiting Kaanapali Beach area, we would definitely recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome for a family stay”
Reviews.Author: SunnyandShade
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, decent value....There were lots of kids at pool area (week before Easter) so very much a kid-friendly place...If looking for a family friendly resort in Maui...this place is great.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: bogieman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in a studio unit through VRBO. Had a 7th floor in 1st tower and had a great view of pool out to the ocean. Very nice unit with top notch furnishings and appliances. Resort is all that I expected it to be with ambience, amenities etc. As previously noted lots of families staying here and it was Spring Break. So lots of children at the pools. Getting beach loungers not a problem before 9 am although you have the usual suspects who drop towels on chairs at sun up. Dukes restaurant is nice to have on the property although we had breakfast and lunch in room since Times Market was just across the street. The gourmet market on property is good for an emergency but costly. Walks in the morning on the beach walk were priceless as everyone seems to wake up early in Hawaii so lots of activity. BEST meal we had was after a whale watch cruise in Kehei at Stella Blues. We have been meaning to try for years now and it was OUTSTANDING.. Please folks....make the drive and eat there. Only downside to our trip was a man was killed walking across the highway one night as it seemed he crossed in an area where the driver never saw him. What a shame. Maui is our favorite island by far and we stayed here after a week on Oahu. No more Oahu from now on....just Maui and Kauai. Great stay at a great resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Caveat”
Reviews.Author: AliG_WorldTravels
Reviews.Content: We are a couple for NY area in our 30s with no kids. This place is top notch as far as quality of hotel goes. Rooms and appliances were fully updated. Outdoor space is nice with easy access from pool to beach. Beach has corals, so great for snorkeling, not so great for casual dip. As far as other visitors, mostly families with lots of kids in the pool. Specially in the pool with the slide. The restaurant/bar on site is pretty nice with good food and bar. We like to drink and have a good time on a Friday and this place shuts down around 10; we felt very loud after that time. Lahaina is a tourist trap with generic bars, so not great options in town either. Would definitely get bored/annoyed after a couple of days given the family scene.

Reviews.Title: “Honua Kai vs The Mahana (next door)...The Mahana wins hands down!”
Reviews.Author: mrsbee123
Reviews.Content: We just got back from staying at the Honua Kai. We asked for a 1 bedroom and they gave us a 1 bedroom with den, which was nice. And although, the place is nice. It does feel more like a hotel rather than home. Our view was looking at the property next door (The Mahana) and the partial ocean view was very accurate. You could see the ocean, if you looked to your far left and between the buildings. A bit disappointing. On our first morning there, I went down to the front desk and asked if they had any oceanFRONT or oceanVIEW rooms available. She searched and I think really tried to help us, but they had nothing. The problem is the two buildings are shaped like a "U" and the end units, or top of the "U" ,are the only ones that are truly oceanFRONTand these are all privately owned. The owners of these units have not put their units into the rental pool, so if you book via VRBO or HomeAway or something like that, you MAY get lucky, but I doubt it. The only oceanVIEW, not oceanFRONT units, the main desk had were a grand total of 7 units and none of them were available. So, our options were to stay where we were and look at the property next door or move two units closer to the beach, but still only partial oceanVIEW, yet pay another $100 per night?!? OUCH. We were already paying $480 (including the $25 resort fee) per night. I guess what surprised me the most was that they have so few oceanVIEW units in the rental pool! And, if you want oceanFRONT -- forget about it! The other problem with the layout of the building is that it is so far away from the pool and the beach. You need to hike to get to the beach and the action at the pool. We prefer to just go down the elevator and walk out the lobby doors when staying somewhere near a beach. No such luck at Honua Kai. You have to walk through the large lobby, then the large gardens, then through the pool area and then you finally reach the beach. Uggh. Other than that, Honua Kai is okay. They have an organic market that is EXTREMELY expensive in the lobby. We used the Kids club and it was okay. ($15 per hour per kid). The pools/waterslide was fun, but our kids would have been happy in a regular pool too. Dukes Restaurant was very crowded and we decided to skip it the one night that we were planning on going there because the wait was 35 mins and our kids were hungry. We went at about 5pm. The fitness room is really small. It only has a couple of machines. We never found the spa - not sure where that was? Front desk were nice. Housekeeping was slow. All in all, it was okay. Not great. Not bad. Just okay. Very expensive. So, we decided to check out early! We only stayed at Honua Kai 5 nights, when we were booked for 15 nights. I hated coming into our hotel room and looking out the window at the property next door, which we knew was oceanFRONT. Our bill at Honua Kai was $2500.00 for 5 nights. So, we moved next door to The Mahana. We have stayed at The Mahana before and ALL the units are oceanFRONT!! It is wonderful. Yes, the pool is smaller and no they don't have valet parking. However, you cannot beat the location and the views!! Depending on what unit you get, some are upgraded (ie granite counter tops, new appliances, tiled floors etc.). You just need to be picky about which unit you take and the front desk will let you look at several until you find the unit that you like. They also have reciprocal privileges with Kaanapali Shores (two doors down) who do have a kids club and a restaurant. We LOVED our stay at The Mahana and we will be back again next year!! Hopefully, this review has given you something to think about when deciding between the two...

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly and Kid Perfect”
Reviews.Author: StartSmall
Reviews.Content: Pricey, but modern. Right on beach. Good snorkeling just a 25 yard walk. Waterslide = kid heaven. Duke's canoe club on site. Organic smoothies and snacks in the cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place & Awesome Staff Great Views Great Beach”
Reviews.Author: weathermatt14
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, plus another couple stayed here the first week of April 2011. We had an ocean view 2 bedroom suite. The rooms are awesome with modern decor. It felt like we had a home away from home and it was very quiet and relaxing inside (the little time we were there). Appliances all worked great and good AC in there too. We ate at Dukes Restaurant which is on the grounds probably 3 times and it was also very good. The staff was friendly and very helpful every time we needed them. The staff that does the parking valet and walks around the grounds were very nice to us and gave us some really good "local" tips on where to eat and things to do and helped us with advice for our drive to Hana on one of the days. Last, the beach that is front of the hotel is an awesome swimming and snorkel spot. You just have to watch out for the shallow areas because the coral could hurt you. There are still lots of sandy places to get in the water though and the beach is calm and very nice. We didn't use any of the pools but they were well kept and clean. We had a blast at this place and were very sad to leave. I would HIGHLY recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Best place for the family (all islands)”
Reviews.Author: MR_VB
Reviews.Content: We have been on all of the Hawaii islands and we have to say that staying at the Honua Kai was one of the most rewarding for the following reasons: -2 bed room suite was very nice and classy (high end condo). -view on the 6th floor was great with partial views of the ocean. -grounds were well taken care. -pools (3 total) very nice for the family. -beach was empty and waves were small. -reef is at the break with fish and sea turtle (seen one). Good place to snorkel and not surf. -Condo is very clean and neighbors are welled mannered. -Staff (when needed) is great and friendly. Cons: -Lack of umbrellas for shade at the pool side. -Cost is a little high but well worth it. We rented the unit from the owner for the week. -Probably not the best for singles or couples since it is made for the family.

Reviews.Title: “Wish i could go back right Now”
Reviews.Author: pyre1234
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip as a family and it was amazing. The staff was extremely helpful. if you have no idea where to go or what to do, talk with the activity concierge. The facilities were spectacular. Our kids loved the Pools and if we hadn't used the activity concierge to book a few trips (Maui ocean center, Snorkeling, and a Luau) they would have stayed there the whole time happily as would we. Dukes, the onsite restaurant had a amazing atmosphere and great food. Our room had a full kitchen which we used every day at least once. picked up some food from just across the street our first night. we have already talked about going back

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for families...not necessarily for couples!”
Reviews.Author: jen814
Reviews.Content: We rented via VRBO and had a wonderful experience with our unit. We had a one bedroom in the Hokulani tower for 4 nights in February. The location is amazing, Dukes is very good, the market is good, though overpriced. The fitness facility was perfect for my simple needs. The bed was amazing, and my bf is trying to find the mattress.... There is however one problem...the pools are not monitored/lifeguarded and therefore do not make for a relaxing couples trip. Large floating turtles and crocodiles are the norm. Unattended children may not be the norm as most parents are enjoying their children on vacation, but unfortunately they are enough that it takes away any chance for relaxation or romance. Some people can tune it out, my bf included, but not everyone can. If I was coming with children, I would stay here again in a heartbeat...may be one of the best options on the island. If coming for relaxation and romance...you may want to consider another location...if you are planning on spending time on property.

Reviews.Title: “Best place in Maui”
Reviews.Author: MinisterDizzy
Reviews.Content: Ive been to Maui several times and decided to try this one with my new wife. Best resort ever in Maui. Excellent customer service, very clean, great facilities, great restaurant, The cafe/sundries shop in the lobby is great. People complain that it is expensive, but its all organic and a lot of it is locally sourced. The young people working there are great and very friendly. I place a really high value on customer service, and this place gets a 10/10. The parking valets were great. Quite often they left our car parked in the circle out front so we never had to wait. The Room: Great sized suite, excellent view, great lanai. Wife loved the fact that there were bosch appliances (for me to cook and her to laundry). All the luxuries of home in the kitchen, in fact they had all the same appliances we have. We'll stay here again when we go in the winter.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous time in Maui...when's our next trip?”
Reviews.Author: LovinNYC2009
Reviews.Content: First off, I would have to say that the HK is really a place for families. My husband and I travelled a lot before having a child, and we would have never picked a place like this in the past. But at this point in our lives, this place was perfect! We had a partial ocean view 1 bedroom and den unit in the Konea building (newer - under 2yrs old?), unit 540. The ocean could be seen from the lanai, but unfortunately, the property next door was constantly maintaining their surroundings - leaf blower, lawn mower etc..., so I wasn't always able to enjoy sitting outside (while my daughter was napping in the afternoon) to enjoy the smell of the ocean, the beautiful waters etc..... We did however see whales one eveing from our lanai. If I could request for any part of the resort, I think I would pick the Hoku Lani tower, with a unit facing the Konea tower. You would be able to get an ocean view, and it appeared to be quiet. As other reviewers have mentioned, the unit was new, modern, luxurious and tastefully decorated. We had a very comfortable pillow-top bed, huge living space (inside and out), Bosch kitchen and laundry appliances, huge bathroom, and all the comforts you could ask for. The only downside is the weak housekeeping. I have to say that it did get better as our week went by. We didn't get housekeeping services in the first 2 days there....was it because they came by while my daughter was napping and we had the "Do Not Disturb" sign up? Regardless, when we called the Housekeeping line to request for service, the voicemail box was full. No big surprise! I had read about the housekeeping before going on this trip, so my expectations were low. When we called the front desk, they told us that housekeeping services ends at 4pm, so... "did we need lots of cleaning"? The fact that we have to pay a $25 daily resort fee which includes DAILY housekeeping, I would expect nothing less. Before booking our accomodations, I did consider renting a unit at the HK directly from an owner (via VRBO), but many of them do not offer daily housekeeping. That was a deal breaker for me, as I figure....if I'm on vacation, why would I want to make the bed, do laundry to get fresh towels etc...? Anyways, as I said, the housekeeping greatly improved after a couple of days (and that's without any complaints to the resort). Perhaps someone else did the complaining for us? The pools were awesome! I do wish they had more "kiddie" slides for younger children, but overall, it was great! The pools are heated, so it was the perfect temp to jump right in! (although I think the heater was broken the first couple of days we were there coz' the water was really cold!). Thank goodness they fixed it! Downside....I did get quite a few mosquito bites sitting by the shrubs.......beware!! The valet service was good. Call 10-15mins ahead before going down. Dukes Restaurant was always busy! I would recommend making a reservation (available on OpenTable or directly with Dukes) if you are planning on having dinner. The Lava Flow drink was yummy! For on-line flight check-in, there is a computer in the Hoku Lani tower (not Konea) that you can use to check-in and print your boarding passes. There is a pretty big grocery store directly across the street from the resort - the Times Supermarket. Really convenient! They had everything under the sun! Sunblock, water/beach toys, food, drinks, alcohol.... For those of you with young children, there is also a playground just a one minute (drive) down the road - turn left out of the resort. If you have a car, here are some restaurants that we really enjoyed: Mama's Fish House in Paia (REALLY expensive but a MUST - stuffed Mahi Mahi - simply FABULOUS), Star Noodle in Lahaina (dangerously delicious martinis, Seafood Dynamite was to die for - we went twice in a week!!), Aloha Mixed Plate in Lahaina (really affordable and good food - very casual), and Maui Tacos in Lahaina (extremely casual and good mahi mahi tacos). We have been to Maui twice, and have stayed in Wailea and Ka'anapali. We enjoyed both areas very much, but I have to say that the beaches in Wailea are amazing! We will definitely consider going back to the Honua Kai on our next trip to Maui. The big question is.....when are we going back?? Let the planning begin!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved everything!!”
Reviews.Author: aggiehawk
Reviews.Content: Honua Kai is a wonderful place to stay. We stayed for a week in April with our three children all under the age of 12. It was perfect!! Our two bedroom suite was spacious, upscale, and gorgeous. Our deck was amazing and partial ocean views were great!! We absolutely loved the pool areas. It is hard to describe just how nice the grounds are and how beautiful all the pools and hot-tubs are. Also...the best part is Kaanapali Beach is right there. The beach is beautiful and the sand is soft. We found the Boogie Boarding to be excellent right here. The beach is connected to the resort with wonderful Trex walkways. Everything about Honua Kai is fabulous!! I can't imagine a better stay or staying anywhere else...ever while in Maui!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: Plentynine
Reviews.Content: My Husband, 16 year old Son,16 year old Nephew and I spent one week (Feb 5-13th, 2011) at the Honua Kai Resort. We loved it from the minute we stepped foot into the resort. I read a few of the reviews ahead of time so knew what to expect. We've travelled to many tropical locations in the past but this was our first time to Maui. It was everything we expected and then some. Our Fridge was not working in our first room so we were very promptly moved to another 2 bedroom suite on the 5th floor. The bonus....a room with a view!!! Our first room had a view of the mountains and that was nice but after being moved to an Ocean View Room, I have to say, it would have been well worth the extra money. We will book an O.V room next visit. Ted (night supervisor) really went the extra mile to ensure that we were happy. Ted, if you are reading this,THANKS....You're awesome!!! We look forward to our next visit!!

Reviews.Title: “We want to Live at Honua Kai!”
Reviews.Author: LadyofCanada
Reviews.Content: From the instant of our arrival Honua Kai was perfect; weary travellers greeted and settled in by Randy; Even in the middle of the night our Residence was delightful- we stayed up very late just breathing and listening to the surf. You won't believe the whales we saw from our 9th floor Residence! It must have been a very active 2 weeks because they seemed to be everywhere! I saw 1 from the beach that looked liked he was standing on his head, really...and me without my camera. The resort itself is lovely and so well kept. The pools and amenities are unmatchable for us. You will find it too easy to while away the time; get a turtle from the pool shop so you can just float...over to the poolside service from Duke's. Dress up your tan and reserve an ocean front table for dinner at Duke's; send your teenagers there for breakfast to give yourself a break... Don't be tempted to bring back those perfect pumice stones for your GF, it's illegal and unlucky! Leave them for Madame Pele. Don't miss Lahaina Market on Sunday; do it after your whale watch ride. (I hope you see 6-7 whales on the surface at once!) We met the most charming artisans and families. The banyan is amazing! The beach at Honua Kai is perfect for watching the ocean and for snorkeling. I saw an eel the size of my thumb with teeth and a huge turtle startled my son! Just walk right into the water. A seal hung out there for a while too. Every single staff member we met deserves a commendation! I hope they all enjoy their work because they do it so well. We can't wait to come back to Honua Kai!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel ever - for what it is”
Reviews.Author: tripadvisee_90210
Reviews.Content: Would I pick this hotel for a romantic getaway? Likely not. Then again, we wouldn't find cooking on vacation particularly romantic, so we wouldn't pick a condo hotel in the first place. However, for a family vacation with kids (8 & 10), this was the best hotel we have ever vacationed at, by far. Value: We booked this as part of a package with Costco. As compared to other lodging options we had for this package, this was by far the best value. Room: Pristine. Huge refrigerator, great appliances, nice blender, all the utensils/cookware one might need. Very nice washer & drier in the room. Fast Wi-Fi. Pools & Beach: Simply outstanding. Views of the ocean from beach loungers. Convenient walkways between the beach and the pools and a nice paved walkway along the beach. Service: We didn't need much. The Concierge (Sherry) was great. All the suggestions she had (Hike Maui, Pacific Whale Foundation, Old Lahaina Luau) worked out great. Location/Convenience: We walked almost the entire beach walk in Lahaina. While there were other fancier hotels (Westin condos, Hyatt), none of them on balance seemed as ideally located as this place. It was far enough from the strips of hotels in downtown Lahaina, yet not as desolate as the hotels further up north in Kapalua. There is a strip mall across the street with a nice food market, a decent pizza place, and a great coffee/sandwich shop. For our situation, it was ideal. Resort Fee: Yes, there is a $25 per night fee. But for that we got convenient garage parking, and wi-fi that actually worked. Seems like a fair deal to me. My only complaint: While I saw waiters from Duke's roaming around the pools, not once did one of them approach me to ask if I wanted to order a drink, That really has nothing to do with the hotel, but given that it is the only bar on the hotel property, that really was a bummer. All in all, we'd come back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-school gone bad.”
Reviews.Author: biccabons
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 8 days at the Honua Kai. Doubtful we would go back. The property is lovely and well kept. It has a nice location and the grounds are lovely. The service is good, but the maid service is kept at a minimum. This is a place that desperately wants to be an all condo property so it seems they rent out rooms to keep it going. There are several areas where there will be additional building but that seems to be stopped at the moment. The beds were hard as a rock and both myself and husband woke up sore and tired each day. We finally slept on top of the comforter and that helped a bit. The room was nice. Everything is quality and full kitchen were great along with the washer and dryer. Now for the reason we wont go back. KIDS! This place is overun with children. I dont dislike children, far from it, but the noise level here is amazing. We did stay during what is traditionally spring break, but the noise was unreal. Most of the parents I saw had toddlers and that precludes the spring break theory. From 4:30am to 10:30 pm the screaming that goes on is like a preschool gone bad! The older kids arent the problem, its the screaming younger children. The shape of the hotel (think horseshoe) makes echoes that dont stop. I understand that people travel with small children, but this place has the motherlode of toddlers. With the pools that are on the property, people take their darlings out first thing in the morning and dont bring them in until dark. With the time change, many people have their youngsters out VERY early because they are awake with their schedule from home. Also the amount of unsupervised kids(7-10 yrs) was surprising. There was group of kids harassing the koi in one of the ponds in the lobby area. There was never an adult around...........nice parenting. There was a unit across from us (we were on the 5th level) that had it lights on day and night with no one in the room. Made for bright nights. Also the air conditioning is weird. You cant change it. We ended up keeping the doors open all night to cool things down a bit and the neighbors across the way made it way lighther than we like it. It was either dark and too hot or light and a bit cooler. The maid service was a bit strange. They take the towels and trash every day or rather they are SUPPOSED to and change the sheets every third day. We were in and out one day and came back in the afternoon and no maid. We left again and told the front desk we hadnt had any service that and they said they would let housekeeping know. We got back 3-4 hours later still nobody had been in the room. At that point we needed toilet tissue and towels which we got after I once again it went down and told the front desk. Was told the manager would be told but never heard a word from them..................For the price we were paying I expected a bit more professionalism from whomever is the manager. The management should do themselves a favor and have some "adult" only areas. They have an abundance of pools and the newer tower is set up a bit differently so it would be easy to make some areas more adult friendly. At this point I would NOT go back. Too bad because I wanted to love this place. On the plus side the market in the lobby is A+. Yes, its a bit spendy but everything is very good. The Times grocery store is a good place to stock up on staples. Dukes is good eating.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the pools fool you and there is No Spa.”
Reviews.Author: tiger9996
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for 7 nights. Pros- The view was Great! We originally booked a 2 bedroom condo. When we arrived we were told that due to inventory they had to bump us up to a 3 bedroom condo, which had an outstanding view of the ocean. Cons- Pools were horrible. There were kids running around everywhere. It was hard to relax by the pool as kids would run and jump in the water. When we asked where the adult pool was, were were told that there was no adult pool. We tried several times to get in the hot tub and everytime we tried there were kids under the age of 6 in it. Several times there were even babies in diapers in the hot tub. GROSS! The signs clearly state that children are not allowed in the hot tub. When we complained about the pools to staff, we were told that the hotel does not manage the pools and that an outside company manages it. We were there for 7 nights and never were able to go into the pools. There is No Spa on site. It says it is a Resort and Spa, but there is no Spa. My wife's aunt was getting married and they wanted to go to the Spa. We were told that there was no Spa and that they wanted to build one in the future. Watch out for the hidden fees. We were charged $45.00 a day for a room tax and another $25.00 a day for parking. Room service was terrible. The beds were not properly made. New towels were just thrown on our bathroom counters. We had to request that they clean our room. There was no ironing board. When I requested an ironing board they brought me a cutting board for the kitchen. I eventually got an ironing board. Overall the thing that kept us there was the view of the Ocean. If you don't mind babies in the hot tub and bad room service then I would recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “VERY Very Nice, but...”
Reviews.Author: gcgrayburnjr
Reviews.Content: This hotel / high end time share resort is great. Everything smells brand new, staff are very friendly, and the beach view is awesome! If you want an easy stay in a very low stress environment, this is the best place on Maui. HOWEVER, the hotel should consider restructuring their billing process. A nice two bedroom MT view will cost nearly $500/night and the hotel should wrap resort fees into this nightly cost structure versus nickel/dime your bill at check out ($25 resort fee, $? parking fee, etc.). Once you add all these fees, you are close to if not equal a Four Seasons and/or Ritz cost. Also you will get hit with three Maui taxes at check out for about 15% of the nightly room rate (accommodation and two general excise taxes). All worth it if you are looking for near perfection!

Reviews.Title: “Better than the pictures, pure paradise”
Reviews.Author: Lovetravel079
Reviews.Content: This resort is amazing! Gorgeous lobby, rooms, grounds, pools, walkways, everything. We stayed at Konea in a two bedroom (comes with 2 king sized beds and a queen pull out) We had 2 teen girls and two preteen boys with us. Perfect! No complaints. Very nice kitchen, washer/dryer, the pools were great. The pictures do not do Honua Kai justice. Come see for yourself. Only complaint is they need more than one restaurant (Dukes, which by the way, was delicious, we used their bar and lunch menu almost daily, and had dinner there three times) . Loved Honua Kai! Hope to go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great condo and we are typically hotel travelers!”
Reviews.Author: smuie
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay in this condo resort because as a family of 5 we wanted some elbow room but we also craved the amentities of a hotel. We were very happy with our choice. The spa has not yet been built so they should omit that in the title - however, the fun pools and the option of dining at Duke's as well as the great selection of foods in the store at the resort made it "hotel like." We were in a 2 Bedroom/2 Bath and with the pullout sofa in the living area, it was perfect! The finish out is VERY luxurious. We rented from an owner on VRBO so we did not deal with the front desk so I cannot speak to their helpfulness. Also, because we rented from an owner, we did not have maid service so I cannot say what they were like either. The property is very nice in my opinion. My kids enjoyed the pools and the open grassy areas. The beach is nice too but there is no beach service if that matters to you. A lot of the owners provide beach chairs and they can also be rented from the hut. My daughter did cut her foot on coral so it is true that you have to wear water shoes when in the ocean there. I enjoyed walking/jogging on the boardwalk - yes, it becomes crowded but people are accommodating. I smelled the sewage plant a couple of times but it certainly did not "ruin" our vacation or opinion of the place. The lazy river is a little misleading - it doesn't move so you just walk or float thru it on your own -- it's pretty small. The main pool at the Hokulani tower was the one that we enjoyed the most. Yes, because it is a condo resort, there are many families - I don't think many honeymooners or couples looking for romance would necessarily stay at a condo resort because of the families. As nice as the property is, I thought it was a bargain at $425 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Potential to be relaxing, but filled with kids”
Reviews.Author: Nicbri17
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I came here to celebrate our engagement (he proposed on the trip!). We absolutely loved the room. Ours had a glass "curtain" wall which could be folded away so the entire room was open to the outside. It was gorgeous. The room's were well-appointed and the staff was friendly. We were surprised, however, by the $25 a day resort fee for amenities we weren't using (the safe in our room was broken, we didn't use the internet, business center or gym--we were on vacation, duh!) and we weren't able to opt out of access to these unwanted "amenities". It just seems like another way to gouge customers for every penny possible. Also, we couldn't escape from kids. They were everywhere and were largely out of control. This would be fine, if there were an adults only area. We went to the bar to seek refuge and sure enough, there were children eating kids meals at the bar! Also, on the resort map they have labeled the "serenity pool" which sounds like a fancy way of saying "adults only" but it was the pool with the water slide and thus, filled with children. Overall, this hotel has a great location and great food (Duke's was really lovely), but the sneaky fees and shouting children really detracted from our experience. I don't think we'll be returning unless they increase their accommodations for guests who are traveling sans offspring.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel We've Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: kidonaki
Reviews.Content: HOTEL: Great room. Just as their web site says. No gimmicks. It was renovated. Clean. Roomy. Maid service was weak. That's my only complaint. Other hotels we've stayed at, the balcony is so small we don't use it. But this balcony was HUGE. It had a large dinette AND lounge furniture. 5 of us would go out there to eat and play games. I wish I had upgraded to the ocean view given how much we used the balcony. We got a room on the south side of the resort and we had a view of a big pile of dirt. It looked like a future construction site. You will not be disappointed staying at this hotel. MAUI ACTIVITIES: Beware of the concierge. They try to stare you away from free activities and push the paying activities. If you have internet, highly recommend on-line research. HIKING WAIHEE RIDGE TRAIL : (5 stars) did this hike with my kids ages 9, 10 & 12 and my husband. I was very concerned about my 9 year old but she had no problem with it. In fact she kept up easily and she LOVED it. All 3 of the kids loved it. And let me note here that they hated the road to Hana. They hated being stuck in car for 6 hours to "look at trees". But they loved, loved, loved this. This ranked higher than zip lining and horseback riding and it was free! btw, the concierge tried to talk me out of this and do surfing lessons instead at $60pp. So glad I didn't listed to her. ROAD TO HANA: (3 stars) My husband and I loved it. Kids hated it. They also got car sick. Don't recommend for young kids. SNORKELING: (5 stars) All loved it. HORSEBACK RIDING at Ironwood ranch: (1star) My horse got bumped by the guide's horse and had a fit right over the edge of a cliff. Very scary. Otherwise fun for me. Kids didn't care for it. Given the mishap, I would not put my kid on a horse for safety reasons. I called the ranch directly and paid $80 pp. The concierge quoted me $90pp. ZIP LINING: (2 stars) Maui Plantation: This was okay. There were 5 lines. 14 people in our group. We spent more time waiting for everyone to get across than on the line. The lines were very short. Wouldn't do it again. It wasn't worth the money. Kids didn't care for it either. WHALE WATCHING: (2 stars) This is like going to a zoo and overlooking the whale tank for 2 hours from a distance. At first it was cool but it got boring pretty fast. Kids got bored. We saw about 10 whales. Wasn't worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel/condo, best I've had on Maui”
Reviews.Author: rome-ing_man
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about Honua Kai. All aspects were excellent. The staff was helpful and friendly, the resort had a good vibe. Beach wasn't the greatest beach in the world, but pretty good as long as you wear water shoes (rocks and coral). We had a 2 bedroom with ocean view. The view was very nice, the condo was excellent. 2 full baths with all the amenities. Living room was large, kitchen excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Just plain ole vacation and relaxation”
Reviews.Author: aa81j
Reviews.Content: Pros: This place is high class with clean and well kept grounds and worth it. Green and lush. The fire at night was amazing. During the night, walk to the beach and look toward the sky and be amazed at the amount of stars. The beach is quiet and secluded. There were no sailors, kites, jet skiiers, ppl selling you stuff; just the blue ocean and 2 islands in the distant. VIP: Ruell is your man!! Wazzip Ruell, your the best. Thanks for your help with shopping bag, groceries, and everything. Not a Con: House keeping does not thoroughly cleans the room. We had a huge room; 3bd 3bth full kitchen. All he/she does is give you fresh towels, make your bed, throw away your trash, provided unlimited amounts of tp, shampoo, and soap. Don't expect the floors to be swept, tables cleaned, or dishes washed. We maybe asking for too much but we wanted the dishes washed. Who wants to wash dishes on vacation. PS: If you are a young African American with an urban look don't be surprised if the concierge or other hotel employees say a few slang word like "bomb" instead of great or "gangsta" instead of cool to make you comfortable. It's funny. Blacks only make up 3% of Hawaii population and it is even less in Maui. To see blacks is a rarity (I think me my wife and my friend were the only 4) at the hotel but they are glad to see us. Talk to the locals they think we are interesting and want to know more about us. Dont feel out of place if other vacation look at you like "Why are you in "my" Maui?". Have fun. Feel exclusive and put on that sunscreen. Expectations: There are no resort activities such as Luaus, bar tending on the beach, fireworks and such. Just plain ole vacation and relaxation at Honua Kai. Rating: Cleanliness 4/5 I really wanted the dishes washes and the toilets, shower, and tubs cleaned. Value: 3/5 For $4500 a week. I really wanted more to do on the resort than swim and eat at Dukes. Overall: Loved it. Once they start hiring entertainment. I'll give you that extra point. 4/5 For the readers: Deluxe room are the real Ocean Views. Ocean views are truly Partial ocean views. Partial ocean view are smaller rooms with a corner lanai view the ocean and grounds. Further back though. Garden view is ground level. I warned you. And I did not smell anything at Konea.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort!!”
Reviews.Author: Lolly3728
Reviews.Content: We all enjoyed our stay at the Honua Kai Resort. The room was great. The bed was very comfy; slept well every night. Our son thought the pull out bed was comfortable too. Kitchen had every appliance your could need. Would have been nice to have a mirror in the bedroom. Staff were friendly and helpful. The beach and pools were fabulous. Nice having Dukes restaurant right on site with live music playing. We had a mountain view room and yes if you looked down you saw the parking lot and a construction site next door but the mountain was beautiful. Traffic was a little loud when you had the patio doors open but couldn't hear it at all when they were closed. Enjoyed running on the board-walk just steps from the resort. Would definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection found................”
Reviews.Author: JBanana
Reviews.Content: Had to write a review since I used trip advisor extensively to figure out where we'd stay on our Hawaiian vacation. Honua Kai did not dissapoint. Pictures do not do the resort justice. It is so beautiful. Honestly, the nicest place we have stayed on vacation and we have travelled extensively all over the carribean, Mexico, etc. We will not be going to any of those places again though - Maui is the ultimate vacation destination and Honua Kai is absolutely the perfect place to stay. This resort is full of families with children so if your like us and are travelling with young children, you'll be very comfortable. Very family friendly and very convenient. Could go on for hours and hours............just honestly - if your going - be so, so excited! Your in for the trip of your life!

Reviews.Title: “Different than any other Hawaii hotel - 5* plus”
Reviews.Author: doacharlie
Reviews.Content: Definitely a true 5 star in Maui - all the other big chains can market all they want - however, there is nothing on Maui that comes close to the cleanliness, quality, service, and activities within the property itself. The grounds resembled one of the mega resorts of cancun and area....not your typical hawaiian pool, chairs, beds and some palm trees. Check out the sites pictures for yourself, they speak for themselves. The 2 bedroom we stayed in was most of the reason we decided to book - brand new in all aspects...even under the sink smelled clean and kept (try to find another condo/hotel with that comment :) Beds are double pillowtop, 3 large HDTV's, fantastic appliances, etc - absolutely perfect in every way We snagged a 2 bedroom with an ocean-view for a 50% upcharge from a partial ($150/night more) - be careful here....from the room itself you cannot see the ocean AT ALL...all there is to see is the rooms on the other side of the courtyard. In order to see the ocean you have to be on your deck. Beach is superb, not really any different than any other W.Maui location (we tried them all for a reason - see below) - snorkling right outside was amazing as well....turtles and fish everywhere - even saw the odd sea snake and eel. Pools, lazy river, water slide and hot tubs were fantastic - service around the pool was a little sub-par though (could have used more staff) The Deli in the main level was fantastic - expensive, but if that meets your expectations you will love it. Had coffee and a muffin every morning (8) Overall service was great, valet car service took about 2 minutes to snag our jeep - bravo! We stayed March 19th to 28th - I would avoid this timeframe and anythign around it if you want to stay at this hotel or anywhere nearby - wind, wind, wind, wind and more wind. I honestly have to say it was the most wind I've experienced in my life, anywhere. For 7 days it blew so hard that the backs of the beach chairs were flipping over onto the chair and flying apart (and yes, they were made of steel). Numerous times during the afternoon you would find the pool area completely vacated...terrible. Now the strange part...if you drove south of the hotel (as little as 2-3 miles) the wind would be reduced considerably...or in 5 of the days, completely gone! From 40mph to zero...immediately. For those you you that know Maui quite well its easy to understand why development took so long to move north of the blackrock area....trade-wind central. The locals in the area said this year was abnormally windy, but they discouraged staying north of blackrock in the late Mar-Apr timeframe. This is not a problem with the hotel or service in any way....simply a recommendation to think elsewhere during these times. Even places as close to Lahaina were wind free (about a 5 minute drive) and Kehei (30 minute drive) was as calm as could be.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful property with great ocean view”
Reviews.Author: Dlmink65
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 437 (studio) March 7th thru 15th . The room was exactly as advertised.(clean modern)The concierge was very efficient and was able to book activities once we arrived. The staff without exception was always cheerful making our stay pleasant. Duke's restuarant located on the property had wonderful food. (the macadamian pancakes were to die for and the huge chocolate ice cream dessert was well, I'm still trying to lose the pounds).. Praises are due to the hotel staff. We were there for the tsunami and chose to move to higher ground although those who wished to stay were evacuated to the fourth floor and above.. The only negative and to me it was a big negative, our last night (march 14th) there was a mouse in our bath tub. Yes, I was freaked out. Couldn't figure out how the critter got there in the first place. I captured the thing and the front desk sent three people to remove it. They seemed to be as baffled as I was....Anyway, that may not seem like too big a negative but it did get my attention because the property was pristine...For that reason I would give the hotel a four instead of a five......Would we stay there again.....yes..(The sheets and beddingand the bed were wonderful) You must go to "Mama's Fish House" in Paia...Very pricey but the food is over the top and the view is fantastic....Make reservations ahead of time..

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place To Stay In West Maui”
Reviews.Author: bwill
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent property if your looking for a relaxing quiet getaway! We arrived the night of March 10th for a six night stay. The staff was very professional...especially how they handled the approaching tsunami, providing hourly updates and when the time came, instructing those on lower floors to move higher-up in the building. Our Room 543, of the newer North Building, was perfect. The unit we had was a two bedroom ocean view. While I was a little disappointed in the "ocean view," we could get a limited view of the water if you stood on the nice sized balcony and turned to the right. I was not impressed with Duke's...very high prices, and a split menu depending upon where you wanted to be seated. Some in our family wanted a nice steak dinner while others wanted a burger and to sit closer to the water. We settled for a small table near the bar so family members could order from both the "upscale" and "casual" menus. Kind of silly if you ask me! Don't spend to much time looking for the Spa...there isn't one. Also, Don't waste too much time in the onsite market located in the south building. There is a very nice grocery store, Times Supermarket, right across the street from the resort which has much more reasonable prices, for Maui anyway. Final Con...No business office! However, they do have a PC setup with a link to all the airlines to print your boarding passes before heading to the airport. The Pools are OK...more of a hit with younger kids would be my bet. The pools lack some of the excitement the teen and pre-teen have come to expect these days. However, for us adults it does keep the noise level down. The hot tubs, and there are several located throughout the pool area, were great. Another nice feature you'll enjoy are the many BBQ grills located around the pool areas. Overall the Honua Kia was a hit with us and we will definitely look to stay here if we return to Maui again. This was or Third trip to Maui and by far the best resort we have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Hufboys
Reviews.Content: Nice new place. Great rooms. Pools were really nice and the kids loved them. The restaurant on property was good as was the cafe. Located on the north end of Kaanapali with easy drives to beaches and Lahaina. Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Honua Kai is a first class resort”
Reviews.Author: on_the_road_again020
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a six night stay at the Honua Kai and was not was not disappointed for relying on Tripadvisor for helping in my selection. On arrival the amiable and ever present bell service captian made it clear to us that we were there to enjoy our vacation and not work, so he arramged for the delivery of all of our items, which included several bags of groceries, to our room (Thank You Very Much). The greeting and information provided at check in was not only friendly and but very helpful as well. The one bedroom unit was spacious, clean and comfortable. Dukes resturant which is located on premises was our favorate place to eat in the Lahaina area (and we ate at several). The connecting beach walk to other resorts in the area is enjoyed by both early morning walkers and joggers, as well as by all for evening strolls at and after sunset. The exterior pictures shown of the facility do not do it justice as the it is far more beautiful. The beach area directly behind the Honua Kai was a bit of a disappointment due the coral but there there are several other beach areas a short walk away for swimming and snorkeling. The three pools allow for spaces to be enjoyed by families (larger pool with water slide) as well as quiet spots for adults desiring such areas. A budget hotel it is not, but, if you are looking for upscale resort accomodatons then this is the place. Overall, we were very pleased and will probably stay at the Honua Kai on a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly trained staff, awful smells!!!”
Reviews.Author: Wayoverbook
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are currently staying and feel we paid a premium for this fairly new facility. We came with friends the first week and had a two bedroom, then we moved to onebedroom. The problems seem to be at front desk and with maid service. The front desk staff have few if any answers. Always refer you to concierge where they are always busy. The entire 9 days we've been here there has been a horrendous smell (think vomit) by the pool and no one seems to want to take responsibility. We've heard at desk that it's Duke's greasetrap, the waste plant across the road, and even possibly frogs that come out at night???!!! Truly disgusting experience and has kept us from the pool! Not why you come to HI! They should be offering everyone some compensation. As far as the maid service... When we moved to one bedroom, it was missing a lit of kitchen things! No towels or dishcloths, no dishwashing liquid, no hot pads. And as someone else mentioned... They ask you to reuse towels, but when you try, they pull them off racks and replace anyway. Our calls to housekeeping have gone completely unanswered. Plus there is no "Do Not Disturb" signs and no chain locks. Housekeeping shows up early, gets you up and then often doesn't come back! We have barbecued twice, but it has been really inconvenient as they have you check out utensils at the front desk, but never have enough! And you need to use washcloths for hotpads and dishwashing, so there's never enough washcloths! Bosch appliances leave a lot to be desired. Freezer spews out ice everywhere, dishwasher is iffy and only works well on hottest setting! Also, even though we REALLY like Duke's Restaurant here... They aren't affiliated with the hotel and the liitle market is vastly overpriced!! For a complex this large, they need more dining options! We would not return to Honua Kai!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place... but not friendly staff and it's costly”
Reviews.Author: Momo3469
Reviews.Content: We found the place beautiful and comfortable . Added charges for wifi, etc. were annoying -- and a rip off (25 a day!). The maid staff were friendly as well as the valets but the front desk staff were not helpful or nice and were rude when trying to help us with the wifi. Childcare is ten an hour, per child. We have three children -- TOO MUCH. The childcare was essentially empty. No Wonder! At that cost, forget it! We had one of our kids go there and the space is great and the staff is nice and competent but it's too expensive The pools are over the top -- too many to deal with when you have small children. The pools were not relaxing set up for my husband and I, though the families with older kids seemed totally content. I heard from guests who stayed there that some of the other resorts, nearby, are a better set up for families with young children.

Reviews.Title: “great room, beach has coral”
Reviews.Author: Cndfamily
Reviews.Content: The 2 bedroom room unit we stayed in was beautiful and spacious. To add to the comments already written: 1) View - many units face into each other or face the mountains, a bit disappointing, but not surprising if you look carefully at the building layout. The Hotel staff cannot guarantee where your room will be until you check in, but are helpful if you are disappointed, (and if the hotel's not full). The Hotel management was excellent to deal with. Note - if you book direct from an owner, there's little connection to the hotel staff, and you can't charge items to your room. 2) Beach - there's lots of loose coral pieces, and a solid bed of coral just a few feet into the water in front of the hotel. Many people were getting cut even with water shoes. At low tide, it's not very safe for swimming or body surfing, but better at high tide when the water comes higher up the sandy shoreline. We drove to the other Kaanapali beach (Whaler's Village area) for swimming and body surfing. The ocean area near the Hotel, (directly in front of the Westin Villas and the empty lot) is great for snorkeling. 3) Pools - great pools, good variety, a bit shallow at 3'. 4) House keeping not well trained - even though we hung our towels to re-use them, the housekeepers replaced them every day, but never replenished toilet paper, kleenex, or paper towels, or swept the kitchen which had sand etc. and really needed a sweep. 5) Appliances - the Bosch d/w cleaned so poorly, we had to wash everything by hand. The washer/dryer was very hard on the clothes. The 'delicate' cycle ran longer than most 'regular' cycles, and our clothes came out looking 'pilled'. 6) Building Amenities - There are 2 Buildings, the Honua Kai (first building), and Konea (second building). Aina Market (gourmet grocer, coffee, gifts, take out food, wine etc.) is located in the first building (Honua Kai), as is the Children's Activity Centre. There's no coffee bar, or retail in the second building (Konea), so you must walk to the other building for coffee, sundries, ice etc. The Fitness Centre in the Konea Building is 3x times the size of the one in the H.K. Bldg. 7) Lap pool - there's no separate 'lap pool'. The pool in front of the H.K. is long and wide, and you can swim laps if it's not busy, but with so many families in the pool, it's pretty hard to swim laps unless you go very early before anyone's there. 8) Food Stores - Near the airport there's a Costco and new Whole Foods (better prices than in Canada). Near the Hotel, there's several grocers incl. Times (across the street), Safeway and Foodland Farms (between Lahaina and the Hotel). Foodland Farms is very nice, similar to Whole Foods, cleaner than Safeway, with better produce prices. The Foodland Farms s/c has a Barnes and Noble, and a great Vitamin Shop. All the grocers sell beach toys, boards etc. 9) Concierge - very knowledgeable for booking activities. The Beach Activity rental booth has a full range of beach and sun items to rent or buy, more $$ than a retail store, but convenient. 10) Construction - there was no construction while we were there, but there is an empty lot beside the first Building and guest comments (from those who stayed in February) mentioned construction noise? Overall, very nice hotel, but ocean disappointing for swim/surf.

Reviews.Title: “Best experience at a hotel for a long time”
Reviews.Author: piacentine
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity to stay for spring break March 2011. What an experience!! This was a great family vacation. We had our 21 yr old scuba diver son along who loved his own "suite" with bathroom and big screen TV. The kitchen was great- all Bosch appliances and the lanai was our favorite hangout. We ate breakfast on the lanai, played cards, drank wine and watched the sunset. All in all, a great experience for a great on the beach hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tsunami trip”
Reviews.Author: bluewater92
Reviews.Content: We were greeted at the front desk by a very nice man that cared. Security communicated well during the tsunami warning. Room service was OK. The problem was the rest of the service. We will not be going back. Spa not open at the hotel yet and snorkeling is disappointing in front of the hotel. Needed to walk 10-15 minutes to a nearby location for both spa and snorkeling.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Family Friendly, Yet Romantic Resort”
Reviews.Author: elazl
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful place and beautiful location. Last year, we stayed in a private house on a beautiful property up in Lahaina. Since we have small kids, (6,8) we thought a resort style condo on the beach with multiple pools would be exciting for the kids. WELL, We're totally impressed.. 1) Rooms - spacious 1 bedroom. Yes we face the mountain views overlooking the parking lot but since we are on the 10th floor, it doesn't bother us much. The mountains are gorgeous. Actually, after a hot sunny day, this side is nice and breezy without the hot sun. AND quite honestly we're on the beach each night watching the sunset anyways. On arrival, our room had coffee (couple days worth) , filters (total for our stay), dishwasher liquid, laundry detergent, bounce sheets and shampoo/lotion. The cleaning supplies get replenished daily or as needed so you don't have to go out and purchase a big jug of anything. You also have daily service which includes towel renewal, removal of garbage/recycling, cleaning of your counters and making beds with existing linens. Every 3 days, they change your linens and vacuum the suite. Along with free parking AND Valet, all of this is included in your $25 resort fee. 2) The Property/ pools - Lots of grassy spots for the kids to run around. The boardwalk starts at our condo and goes past the westin, all the way to the Sheraton at Black Rock. Great place for a walk or run. The pools are great with lots of variety (large pool, a water slide pool, a pool with a cave/waterfall and hot tubs attached to all the pools so that you don't have to go too far looking for a cozy spot). You get towel cards for the pool.. exchange your card for a towel and get the card back when returning the towel. Seemed a bit odd at first but it's a no brainer. At the end of the day, give them your wet towel and you can get either your towel card back or a freshly clean dry towel for next time. :) 3) Restaurant - Duke's is GREAT. It's our 10 year anniversary so we went there the first night for supper. The prices were reasonable when compared to other nearby restaurants (and really, cheaper than most) and the food was fantastic. We both had local special fish that just melted in our mouths. The next day we went there for lunch ...the hamburgers are tremendous and only $11 . They come with great wedge fries. BONUS for us is that kids meals were cheap ($5) and delicious. Mind you the drink was not included with the kids meal. We plan to go here one more time before going home. 4) The beach. - sandy in many locations. Many reviewers write about the rocky beach, but right in front of our resort all the way and past the Westin, the beach is very sandy and the water is swimmable. If you stay further north , then the beach is minimal and very rocky. We spent tons of time boogie boarding and snorkeling on our beach. Lots of fish. 5) Aina market - over priced along with all the beachside stuff you can purchase. $15 for beach toys that you can buy at ABC for $8. Lovely family friendly resort with service that is expected at a condo (kind, respectful, helpful, but from a distance (which I love)). If you need something, ask but you should never feel like people are constantly harassing you!! We would definitely stay here again. Canadian young family with 2 very busy boys.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cicadijana
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent the most amazing seven days in Hawaii, in Honoua Kai Resort. It was just wonderful! We requested room on a higher floor, since it was our anniversary and we got the room on the 6th floor with ocean view. Rooms were extremely clean. We had full kitchen. Wonderful bathroom with the bath tub and the shower. There is a barbecue area, so you can grill your own food. Very nice pools. All the staff was very friendly and helpful at any time. The only thing that I will suggest to younger couples, who want to have more fun- you should choose different hotel, since this is more family friendly resort (at least it was mostly young couples with young children at the time when we were there). Even if we don't have any children, we had an amazing time anyway, since we were looking to relax and not go out to much. There is no one thing that I could complain about. We had the best time ever.

Reviews.Title: “Honua Kai - Absolutely amazing...”
Reviews.Author: mbabson
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Maui in early March with family and we stayed in an oceanfront condo. There is not a single downside to staying here. The location is prime (beachfront access and boardwalk). Amenities were great (room service, valet, fitness center, in-room washer dryer, open-air living rooms, balconies, & a full kitchen to name a few). Duke's Beach House Restaurant could stand alone and be amazing. I got the fresh Mahi sandwich and the family shared "Hula Pie." Food was tasty and drinks even better (try the "Dig-me Daquiri"). But the view is what seals the deal. You can literally get out of bed, open the curtains, and see whales...every morning. You really couldn't ask for a better experience with a resort. Would not think twice about staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: larissagreen1
Reviews.Content: We rented a two bedroom condo (#715) and everything was perfect ...the view, the price, the amenities, spacious open-air living room, clean, and in a great location. Rooms have washer/dryers, all linens, dishes, etc. A beachfront boardwalk is just downstairs. great for those morning walks. Two pools, awesome restaurant (Dukes). Stay here and enjoy a glass of cold wine on your lanai while watching whales play....doesn't get much better than that. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “I love Honua Kai!!!”
Reviews.Author: John_and_Seth
Reviews.Content: This was my 5th trip to Maui. Over the years I have stayed everything from budget condos (Polynesian Shores) to luxury resorts (Ritz Carlton). Honua Kai is my new favorite "home away from home" and I cannot imagine staying anywhere else on Maui. We stayed in a 2 bedroom ocean view unit on the 3rd floor in the Hokulani tower. The unit was extremely comfortable and everything (furniture, appliances, beds, bathrooms) was very high quality. I loved the huge lanai. The pools were very nice and never over crowded. The beach was nice but if you want to snorkel you'll want to go down to Black Rock or Kapalua Bay. The Times Supermarket across the street had a great selection of food at reasonable prices (for Hawaii), much better than Safeway in Lahaina. Valet parking and wireless internet is included in the $25/day resort fee. We tried self parking our car once in the garage but found it to be easier to just valet. I would highly recommend Honua Kai.

Reviews.Title: “Sewage smell ?”
Reviews.Author: Chloee45
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Place , unfortunate it is across the street from sewage plant.... and plagued with sewage gas smells backing up at Dukes open air restarent, and pool area !

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for a beach front condo”
Reviews.Author: DJRN
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights with our daughter and son-in-law. Our 2 bedroom condo in the newer tower was very nicely furnished and roomy. We enjoyed having a kitchen and a washer/dryer. There is a grocery store across the street from the property and a gourmet market on the property and we took advantage of both. The pool areas are lovely, the beach is nice, and the sidewalk connects this property to many others in the area. There are lots of comfortable seating areas in the lobby and in the courtyard between the buildings. There are great beaches for snorkeling or surfing, and hikes in the area. These condos do face on another over a courtyard and if you are picky about privacy you might be uncomfortable. You can see all of the people on their balconies and inside their units, if their drapes are open. This didn't bother us but it is something to be aware of. Overall I would highly recommend this property if you are looking for a condo. It is just north of the very busy beaches by the big hotels of Kannapali so the location is great, there is a lot beauty in the building, furnishings, and art, and there is plenty to do in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!..Tsunami a bit distracting...”
Reviews.Author: LtinVanLV
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Honua Kai from March 7th through the 12th. The only negative was the Tsunami warning but can't control nature! Unfortunately we were up most of the night Thursday because the warning sirens went off every hour until the threat had passed. The hotel did a great job and announced status after each siren. We had to be on alert to evacuate but luckily that never happened. Other than that....... I had booked directly with the hotel for a one bedroom ocean view but got upgraded to a two bedroom when we got there. The condo is just beautiful and well equipped. Whale season is in full swing and the first night we we there, while dining at Duke's, two whales came up and breached very close off shore right in front of the restaurant! Couldn't ask for more than that.....and no need to pay for a whale watching trip as the entire time we were there you could see plenty of whales from the view off our lanai. Very spectacular! Assuming you have been reading the other reviews for this place I will try and hit the points mentioned. Beachwalk- great can go for a long way if you like to walk Beach in front of the hotel-yes a lot of coral so not great for swimming but excellent for snorkeling and well worth doing it, lots of fish Pools-good and plenty of room for everyone Times market across street from hotel- Good and well supplied Specialty market at hotel- Good for specialty items Housekeeping- read the card so you know what to expect.They do just a resupply of towels etc each day and clean every 3rd day of your stay. Personally I liked this because it was not disruptive. Duke's restaurant- food is not bad but not great. Atmosphere is great because of location and their nightly entertainment was good. Much better dining available in nearby Lahaina namely MaLa Ocean Club. Decent Chinese restaurant called China Boat right up the street north of the resort. The rumored sewer smell- did not smell it at all Conclusion- GO!!! You will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on earth at Honua Kai”
Reviews.Author: nicoledavey25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Honua Kai for a week in february and I have to say it was truly one of the most amazing places I have ever stayed. We had two couples in our group and we rented a 2 bedroom 2 bath condo. You can book through the hotel or what we did was book through a property rental company. Owners of the units go through them and we figured we got a better deal this way. (The property management company was called kaanapali beach rentals and I recommend them as well) We were in unit 919 which had great views of the pool and beach. We could see whales from our lanai. This property is beautiful every unit has a lanai where the doors open up completely and everyone just leaves them open all day. All the decor, appliances, furniture, etc are completely brand new and of high quality. The pools are amazing as well as the beach. It is 100% worth the price to stay at this property if you are going to maui. You will not be disappointed. Dukes which is on the hotel property overlooking the water has great food and drinks and a happy hour every night as well as live music. Only downside if you book directly through an owner or property rental company is the hotel staff is rude and unhelpful since they know you didnt book through them and they are technically not obligated to provide any services or help to you if you are problems etc.

Reviews.Title: “brand new, lovely rooms, gorgeous kitchen”
Reviews.Author: JoM_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 8 nights in bachelor suite(king bed, kitchen, spaceous bathroom, laundry) on 2nd floor on ocean side (ocean view out past the pool and lawn if walk out onto lanai , but not ocean front). Pay a lot more for ocean view. They are still selling the units - ours did not appear to have an owner yet . With Lanai doors open (full front of room), could hear the pools. Once shut the doors, could not hear any noise at all from other units or outside. Lots of families week we were there. Beach not too crowded and could walk along beach path to Westin.
