Did not have a good experience at the restaurant attached to the hotel but other good restaurants nearby. Nice snack/coffee/upscale foodstuffs place in lobby, quite pricey. - Great snorkleing on beach in front of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay - service a bit lacking”
Reviews.Author: PAnative026
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Honua Kai resort from February 26th until March 5th. It was the best vacation I was ever on and the Honua Kai resort was a big part of the reason why. In a nutshell - the rooms were fantastic. The lanai was huge and beautiful (even with the less expensive "mountain view" which was spectacular every day.) The kitchen had brand new appliances all in stainless steel. Having a kitchen was great - it saved us a ton of money, mostly because we sleep late so we work up at about noon and had breakfast for lunch in the hotel, and then went out for dinner. The concierge we had (Heather) was super helpful - she set up a snorkeling trip for us and gave us some great advice on local beaches. She also set up a luau for us but that got rained out and was already too late in our vacation to reschedule. Heather was awesome and was there at the beginning of our trip. Later in our trip we made two phone calls to the concierge desk, both were not returned in a timely manner and caused us to lose some time. This is part of the reason why I gave them a 3 on service. Housekeeping at Honua Kai was strange. The first couple of days they came super early in the morning (we were still adjusting from eastern standard time so we were awake and in the room. We turned them away but they came back later and serviced the room, which we thought was awesome. Later in the stay (when we were just sleeping in) they did not return to the room. Also - there was a note that said that laundry and dishwasher detergent would be restocked every day. It was never restocked. When I complained I got one packet of laundry detergent. Since we were only staying a week, this got us through, but it was a pain. We didn't really care that housekeeping didn't come back to our room on the back end of our trip back to our rooms after being turned away, but it says something about the consistency. Also - we weren't really sure what housekeeping did other than replacing the towels and making the bed. The rest of the room didn't seem particularly cleaned up at any time. All of this though is nit-picky, I would totally recommend this place to anyone (and beg them to take me with them lol) There is a lot made of an odd smell when staying at Honua Kai. There appears to be a waste managment plant nearby that I think produces the smell, which is mostly prevalent on the mountain side of the hotel and is most prominent actually a mile or two down 30 closer to Lahaina. I guess if your sensitive to this sort of thing it could be a problem. My wife hated it more than I did but in all honesty it forced us to sleep with the air conditioner on one night instead of with the linai open. Another thing the Honua Kai gets a bit of a bad rap for is the swimming conditions at the beach. It's true that there is a lot of coral right in and that the water is shelly. This is a potentially bad thing if you are a body surfer, I get that and was a bit disappointed myself however I must say that for snorkeling the beach outside the hotel was terrific! I saw more fish and closer to my person outside the hotel than I did on an actual snorkeling trip. Also - on my last day there I wore water shoes and just swam (conditions weren't good for snorkeling). The water shoes protected my feet from the shells, and about 15 feet out the water is too deep for me to stand (at 6 ft tall). There is a good spot though - if you are facing the ocean and take the walkway that is just to the left of Duke's and walk down about 50 yards or so to your left; you'll find a part of the ocean that (when I was there) wasn't very shelly or corally. There was an old broken grill attached to one of the trees there. There you will find a nicer sandy entrance to the ocean - it's totally good enough to swim at as the coral doesn't start until the water is almost 7 or 8 feet deep. I would go to this resort again in a heart beat. My wife and I are considering going again by bagging our normal Jersey shore vacation in lieu of going to maui for another week. Oddly enough it seems more expensive in the summer than in the winter when traditionally hawaii is supposed to be cheaper. All in all, you can't go wrong staying here. One final thing to note. The "complimentary" computer in the main tower that they let you use to print your boarding passes is terrible. The internet at Honua Kai was amazingly fast - the fastest of any hotel I've ever stayed at (wired, I didn't try wireless). That being said I while I was using the complementary computer I had nothing but problems. The computer threw up all kinds of java script errors when I tried to print, so I was unable to print. I work in IT and wanted to see if any other processes were running. I did a little snooping around and found that the machine isn't running an antivirus program (or it is disabled) and was running incredibly slow. All potential indicators of viruses or malware. I should have reported this to the hotel, but I was running extremely late for my flight and needed to just leave. Keep this in mind if you stay and consider using this computer - it might be better not to.

Reviews.Title: “Best condo we have ever rented!”
Reviews.Author: Tpolisher
Reviews.Content: We rented a 1 bedroom unit through vrbo. The condo was gorgeous! The kitchen had granite counter tops and stainless steel appliances. It was convenient to have a washer/dryer in the condo. The bathroom was very large with 2 sinks, large bathtub and separate shower. There was a flat screen TV in both the bedroom and the living room. It was beautifully decorated,very upscale and perfect in every way. I loved the Nana patio doors which really opens up the condo to the outdoors. The workout room was large and very well equipped. The grounds were beautifully landscaped and clean.Fantastic pools. I highly recommend these condos!

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: AJ&ERtravel
Reviews.Content: Grandparents, we spent a month in one of the VRBO units. An adult daughter and partner visited for a week. A son, wife, a two and a five year old visited for another week. The resort accommodated everybody. It's very child oriented. The pools are a delight and a great hit with the children. Everything is new and very well done. Somehow the pool configuration dilutes the possible negative effect of a lot of children. So often we have stayed where there is but one small pool and a screaming child can ruin it for everybody. Here there is so much for them to do and so many pools, it truly is a delight. Dukes is alright for the odd visit but it's not fine dining. It is however convenient, reasonably cheap by Maui standards and quite lively. For us one of the big hits was the fitness centre. It has just enough equipment and space to keep you on track. It's air conditioned and has a bathroom and water cooler, towels, stationary bikes, treadmills, a couple of weight machines and a few free weights up to fifty pounds. Another big hit was the boardwalk. At a gentle pace you can go for an hour all the way to the southern tip of Kaanapali beach. That's a two hour walk there and back. If inclined you can stop halfway at Whalers Village and shop or grab a coffee. But do it reasonably early for the sun gets hot quickly. The resort is very handy for both the Kaapalani resorts and for Lahaina but you will need a car especially if you are doing your own shopping and cooking. There's a good grocery right across from the resort. We thought this a great place to stay and we will be back next year for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Go if you can!”
Reviews.Author: Prairiegirl88
Reviews.Content: This resort was wonderful. I would post pictures, but they look exactly like the ones posted by the hotel. We booked a studio ocean view but when we arrived they upgraded us to a two bedroom suite! The kitchen was well stocked with dishes, cooking utensils, pots and pans and the resort provided a starter basket with local coffee, creamer and sugar, tea towels, dish and laundry soap and a sponge. Because we had to wait for our (massive) room to be cleaned, they also gave us a 75$ credit for the resort restaurant, Duke's, so that we could grab a bite and wait in comfort. Like the resort, the restaurant was very casual yet upscale. My husband has celiac disease and the staff were very well informed and accommodating, recommending dishes and then checking over his order with the chef. The meal was expensive (around 100$ for appetizers, dinner, drinks and coffee for two) but well worth it. There is also a gourmet market on the premises. They also were well informed about allergies and carried a variety of foods, including some gluten free. It too was expensive but many of their products, including the coffee, is grown on their own local farm and much in the store was local, supporting local producers. Nice to see. What else can I say. The room was wonderful, the pools were great (and very clean), the staff were friendly, and the location was good--on the beach, close to shopping and boating in Lahaina, and to many many golf courses. And we could watch the whales from our balcony everyday we were there. This resort is new, and from touring other nearby resorts, you could tell they had put a lot of thought into its construction. Most rooms have good views, the grounds are sheltered yet breezy, and there are lots of activities for children and yet still quiet places to read a book or watch the sunset. We've been on many holidays to Mexico and the Caribbean, but so far, this was the best. My only minor complaint is that the hotel spa wasn't finished, but you could use the spa next door at the Westin Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was fantastic - condo/hotel - best of both worlds”
Reviews.Author: Jacq86
Reviews.Content: We have been to Maui many times and stayed at many hotels and condos. This was the best of both worlds! You have the room you get with a condo and the services of a hotel. There is even a restaurant on site that does pool service! The bigger work out room is like what you would find in a nice hotel. It has beautiful swimming pools - Grand Wailea like (on a smaller scale). The beach is nice. Love that the board walk goes into Whaler's Village (it is a long walk - over a mile). This is a perfect place for families with smaller children - there are lots of shallow pool areas (we had ages 10 - 17 and it was good for them too).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Beautiful Condos”
Reviews.Author: mgooddeals
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here mid-February for 1 week. We had a 1 BR condo overlooking the south lot where construction has begun again, but it's considered a partial ocean view. We got an excellent price for our room (less than a regular hotel room at another Kaanapali hotel), and because of the price, this hotel was excellent. If I were paying much more though, I wouldn't have been as excited. The building and rooms are immaculate. I loved the stainless steel appliances, furniture, decor, and large bathroom. The lanai with the Nana doors were also amazing. When I travel to Hawaii though, I want to spend my time on the beach. While this is an oceanfront resort, it's true that it's pretty hard to swim/boogie board on the beach in front of the resort because of the amount of coral. You can pay for beach chairs/umbrellas for the hotel beach, but I don't like being nickel and dimed for things like this. They also have to take the time to set it up. My husband and I bought our own umbrella and set-up a few mats to sit on the sand; not as comfortable as beach loungers, but much cheaper. This resort would be an excellent place for families with young children--the pool looked fun for kids, but it wasn't my ideal setting for just lounging as young ones splashed and ran around the pool area. Overall, we had a great experience with our unit and getting our room through Intrawest, the company based at the hotel. I highly recommend this hotel, especially for families with young children, although if you're looking for a romantic getaway, I think there are other resorts on the island that would suit you better.

Reviews.Title: “best place on the west coast of Maui”
Reviews.Author: bookbaby
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded from a studio to a 2 bedroom, with gorgeous ocean view. Staff extremely friendly & helpful. Watched whales from the restaurant on the grounds! Kitchen well-equipped. On-site "gourmet" shop was a disappointment., but there is a good supermarket within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Whales, whales and more whales!!”
Reviews.Author: laroo906
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 5 nights here and it was an absolutely great time! We had a studio with full ocean view. Every morning we watched whales from out lanai. We fixed dinner in 3 of the nights and the full kitchen was great to cook in. Definitely an A + in out book. A great walking path we enjoyed too!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay in Maui!!!”
Reviews.Author: K2GO
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this review short... This place is perfect for a family vacation. We have visited here twice in 6 months and must say that most reviews and reflections of Honua Kai are accurate and true. Don't waist time looking at other places. It may cost a few dollars more than others, but you will not be disappointed with this property and what it provides. You will have a fantastic, relaxing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found”
Reviews.Author: EastSac
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a memorable trip at the Honua Kai in Maui. It was memorable because it was the first vacation with our son who is four months old. My wife and I love to travel, but with all the horror stories of traveling with babies out there, we were a little bit nervous, or at least I was. Being our first time, we were bound to make a few mistakes, like forgetting the swaddle that our son uses to sleep at night or the base that we use for the car seat, but those were minor bumps which we handled with ease. The flight was perfect, 5 hours straight, and our son handled the take-off with ease. The pacifier helped him become acclimated to the air pressure, and he was his normal cheery self for the whole plane ride. The people sitting around us were amazed and my wife and I are grateful that we won't have to worry about air travel. Now on to the review of the resort: Arrival: The drive from the airport to the Honua Kai is about 45 minutes usually, but we hit traffic so it took closer to an hour. We knew this going into it. We made the stop at Costco where we bought too much for two people. We chose the Honua Kai based on recommendations on tripadvisor and our friends had stayed there last year. Drove up to the front entrance and dropped the car and luggage off at the valet. Stephen was great. He talked to us about his 2 month old daughter and told us he would have our luggage up at the room when we got there. The valet is included in the resort fee of $25 which is nice, especially when arriving or traveling with all the extras that a child needs. There is also underground parking that we used as well. Check-in was quick, the lobby and view was excellent, and we were off to our room. Room: We booked a partial ocean view 1 bedroom unit as part of our package deal on Orbitz. We figured with the 4 month old we would be spending more time than usual in the room so we wanted something to look at when we were there. We got the Honua tower room 538. It is on the north side and had views of the ocean/pools to the west, the grassy knoll/waterfall to the north, and mountains to the east. You have all the utensils you need, including glassware and plasticware for tropical drinks, wine, beer, and even martini glasses. The appliances were energy efficient which was nice since we had many dishes and dirty clothes to clean. The bathroom was spacious and reminded us of how small our one is at home. Overall, the room was perfect, like living in a modern loft apartment, but right on the beach. Grounds: The grounds were green and worked on daily. We spent most of the time at the pool. There are four pools, but we spent all of our time at the kid pool which has a pebbles that make it like a beach. It was great for our situation. We had bought a PeaPod to use with our son and he stayed in it while we were there. There were waterfalls to listen, watch, and cool off under, water fountains to entertain toddlers, and a small 1 1/2 foot deep pool in which we introduced our son to swimming in. We went on walks on the beach boardwalk that goes all the way down to black rock several times. In the afternoon we would hit happy hour at Dukes from 3-5pm for some $5 pupus and maitais and listen to live music. And in the evening we would cook our meals up at the room. We used the Viking grills on the grounds one night to BBQ our tri-tip. I also, woke several morning to go and work-out in the gym. It is small with 2 stationary bikes, 2 treadmills, 1 elliptical machine, and free weights. It is very warm in the room, but they do have a small floor air-conditioning unit that you can turn on which I highly suggest. Activities: Since we had a four month old in tow, we didn't do many activities. Our daily off site experience was going to Bad A** coffee down the road for an iced drink, and stopping at the Farmers Market which occurs on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday in the parking lot. There is a Times Market across the street that we used for groceries and would probably fit most two person needs. The cost wasn't much different than what we see back home, especially for sale items. We went on a whale watching expedition through Pacific Whale Foundation in Lahaina and saw many humpbacks up close and personal. Our son slept through the whole thing due to the rocking of the boat. If you get sea sick this might not be the trip for you. Before the trip we got a hawaiian snow at Local Boys which was just as I remembered. I would probably opt to not have the ice cream before the boat trip next time;) We also spent our last day in Lahaina walking around the shops and had lunch at Lahaina Grill before heading back to the airport. Usually we try to make a tropical trip once a year when the weather is gray and stormy. In the past this has been an all-inclusive. However, my wife is sold on Maui. It allowed us a top of the line condo, within walking distance to local places, with great pools and beaches, with attentive service without being overly attentive. All in all a paradise found for this family with a new son.

Reviews.Title: “I will be staying here again!”
Reviews.Author: MegTheMom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at Honua Kai in Maui. It was absolutely wonderful! The staff was friendly, the rooms were large (ours had a full kitchen and washer & dryer - I believe all of them do), and the grounds were beautiful! The hotel was at capacity while we were there, but it never felt crowded, whether in the hotel, at the pool, or on the beach. I have a few MINOR complaints about the hotel. First, there were several times we came to drop off or pick up our car and the valet wasn't there. This was simply and issue of being under-staffed. It only took us three days to realize it was a shorter walk to the parking garage (which was direct access from the elevator) than it was to the front of the hotel. Second, the concierge was difficult to get in contact with. Again, it was an issue of being under-staffed. There are two towers to the hotel, and the concierge had to split her time between them. Third, there was a $25/day resort fee we had to pay that we didn't know about. The fee payed for access to the fitness area, pool, and valet parking (we had to pay and additional $2 every time we got our car). I don't like hidden fees. Looking back, I wish we would have put up a stink and requested to not pay it. That being said, I would still go back to this hotel, fee included. The pool area had a very natural feel. It was surrounded by large "rocks" and waterfalls, and stretched through the property in the form of several long, skinny, meandering pools instead of one or two large pools. Because of this, there was a lot of pool side access, and finding the perfect place to lounge was never a problem. There is a slide going into one of the pools, but I never got around to using it. Maybe next time... There was easy access to the beach. There were no hotel-provided chairs on the beach. Most people sat directly on the sand, or on a blanket or towel. The sand was very soft, and perfect for building sand castles. The downfall to the beach was that there were rocks right off the shore in some places. It was fairly easy to see where the rocks were, and it didn't stop us from playing in the waves. We loved the location of our hotel. If you're looking for more local flavor, drive up Lower Honoapillani Road. It's lined with small hotels and condos, but also with tiny restaurants packed with native Hawaiians. Otherwise, head south on Hwy 30, to Lahaina. The entire town is one big tourist trap posing as a historical site, but it's a lot of fun. Overall, our stay wasn't absolutely perfect, but it was pretty darn close.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value, amenities & quality of accommodation”
Reviews.Author: apk_brit
Reviews.Content: We stayed over President's day weekend so the resort was full yet didn't feel at capacity. We had a studio room, which is in the internal corner of the u-shaped building (we stayed in the newer of the two buildings - the Konea building). A great partial ocean view - it's well architected so that I imagine all units get to see the Pacific. Call outs: - Dukes is a good all round restaurant choice down by the beach for breakfast, lunch or dinner, but gets old after a while. You'll need a car to explore further afield - the boardwalk, walking south from the resort, is a great exercise option in the morning with amazing views and breaching whales before breakfast. About 3 miles round trip - there is a Time supermarket right opposite the resort. Really good for stocking up on either basics for the room, when (like us) you primarily eat out, or fully stocking the cupboards to make use of a very well equipped modern kitchen if you'd prefer to eat in. - breathe the sea air. Open up the glass doors fully between the room and the lanai to create a completely open air space. It makes a hug difference. - snorkeling is good from the beach at the resort, but slightly better about 500yds away at the Westin. Earlier in the day = calmer water generally. - you will not get bored of the humpback whales. Recommend a kayak & snorkel trip to get real up close and personal. Griff at www.mauikayaks.com was awesome from Olowalu. - it's a family friendly place with no real designated adult only area. While we weren't there with children neither were we particularly distracted by those of others - all got along well. - happy hour 3-5pm. Mai Tai's are the devil's work ;-) - no spa at the resort & spa as yet, however there is a gym which is well enough equipped, but hey - go run and swim in the great outdoors! Overall a fantastic property. We will be back in a year, next time as a family affair!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tempest461
Reviews.Content: Wow, everything about this resort was elegant and gracious. We felt our condo was brand new. It was stunning, clean and well appointed. We had a beautiful view of the mountains with a large and comfortable lanai. We loved the pool and slide area. Duke's restaurant provided delicious and convenient food and drink. The beach was beautiful. The hotel's location was convenient to everything altho enabling us a private, quiet relaxing vacation. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Our first trip to Maui and Honua Kai made it special.”
Reviews.Author: mybluebush
Reviews.Content: The room, grounds, and pools/hot tubs are fantastic. We were greeted every morning with smiles and a "Aloha" from the desk staff. We used the valet parking which is free except we did tip. Our car was brought to us within 1 to 2 minutes and when we called for it before we left our room, our car was waiting for us with the air conditioner on high. The valet personal always addressed us by our name and wished us a good day. The beach is beautiful but you must read the signs. If you ignore any of the warnings, then you can not blame the resort. The waves were very large and it was hard to stand up at times. I would not allow a child to swim in the ocean at this location because of this. However, there are two nice size pools and a kiddy pool, pPlus 2 hot tubs.There are also shower poles where you can shower off sand before going into the pools or back to your room. There is a small store in the resort that carries sweet treats, salads and sandwiches that are made up. They also have a wide selection drinks - alcoholic and non-alcoholic. We ate at Dukes, the restaurant on the resort grounds and never had to have a reservation but if you can plan ahead, I'd recommend it. The only complaint we had was the choices on the room service menu. If you are looking for something simple at the end of a long day such as a sandwich or pizza, you won't find anything from room service. Also they did not post the prices which always is a concern. We stayed 8 days at the resort and the room service menu is the only thing that we would change...so we give the resort an A+ and we will visit again. Housekeeping cleans your room everyday. Our bed was always made and our coffee packets were replaced when we ran low. Our room had a full kitchen with a dish washer. I did not take the time to wash our coffee cups but when we came back, housekeeping had rinsed them out and put them in the dishwasher for us. We found a basket on our table with dish cloths, towels, dish soap, dishwasher soap, laundry soap and conditioner, and sponges. On top of the box was a nice note stating that this was a gift which we were able to bring home to remind us of our trip. The basket had a lid that was decorated in Hawaiian decor. The staff also delivered a bottle of wine to our room because we were celebrating our anniversary. We have nothing but great things to say about the resort. We loved the location of the resort. It is just minutes from Front street which has a large variety of shops, restaurants, and sight seeing activities.

Reviews.Title: “Honua Kai was everything we wanted & more..”
Reviews.Author: HeatherAnnK77
Reviews.Content: We loved every second of our vacation to Maui at Honua Kai, with 4 young children it was important to find something that they would enjoy too, along with me & my husband! The kids club which they attended was very fun for them, they did a half day - and enjoyed it very much the gal that was working was very nice and they made lots of fun stuff! The slides & pools we're fun, but between the beach thats right there & the pool we were constantly walking back & forth - so it was nice having such a nice beach close by! There is a nice boardwalk that goes pretty far, that me & my husband enjoyed many RUN's on, it does get pretty crowded so i would recommend going between 7-730am.. We ate at DUKES the restaurant onsite, and loved it - as everything in Hawaii, it was expensive tho.. The little cafe onsite was nice too & we enjoyed our morning Latte's & doughnuts, the cupcakes we're delish! Every employee was very nice & helpful! couldn't say a bad thing about the place! Our room was the FULL Ocean View 2 bdrm Villa, it was perfectly big enough for us 6 very nice rooms, kitchen great - but wouldn't pay the additional price for the full ocean view, as i didn't think it was worth the additional cost once we saw the view... We we're on the 2nd level & their palm trees blocked most of our view of the ocean (during whale season that kinda sucked).. Just wish Hawaii did "ALL INCLUSIVE" hotels like MEXICO, we hated spending so much money on food, but thats why you gotta go to the grocery store across the street & use their onsite BBQ Grills for dinners to save money!! There's even a subway & mcdonalds close by thats alot cheaper then most all restaurants! We did eat at a place called "CHINA BOAT" down the street, and LOVED IT, price wasn't bad either! SO overall great place LOVE HAWAII & we LOVED HONUA KAI, and we would recommend to our family & friends!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort - Great value!”
Reviews.Author: KarthikVugane
Reviews.Content: My wife and 2 kids(ages 6 and 2) stayed a week in the Honua Kai resort last month. The property is in immaculate condition given it is fairly new compared to its counter parts in the area. The property is clean and very well managed. The customer service was top notch - very friendly and helpful staff. The housekeeping was regular and timely. The kids' pools were a hit. We stayed in a 2 bd room condo with a partial ocean view. We could sit in our lanai(balcony) and watch whales all day. No money spent on whale watching tours. Lahaina downtown is a short drive away and several restaurants both north and south of the property. Duke's the local restaurant is great for short eats and drinks. We were less than 3-400 ft from the beach. Lots of space for the kids to run around. All in all, a great property, two thumbs up! Highly recommend! One nitpick: There was construction beginning to happen on the south side of the property a couple of days after we landed(End of Jan 2011). Watch out for construction noise during the day. Wasn't a problem for us. Our kids enjoyed watching the heavy machinery at play for hours on end :)

Reviews.Title: “GORGEOUS, newer condo complex on Maui. LOVED IT! #616”
Reviews.Author: Martinimom
Reviews.Content: I don't know how to review this place since many of the condos are individually owned. This review is for unit 616 and the common grounds only. LOVED our condo. We rented through VRBO with no problems. The owner was easy and pleasant to deal with. The condo was so clean, perfectly stocked, located well, awesome views, giant bathroom, comfy bed, even the pull out sofa was comfy, etc...my only complaint would be the shower pressure and that the hot water runs out sooner than i'd like. The pools are awesome! Something for everyone. The Dukes restaurant great, but pricey. On premise store is perfect! Serve deli foods (gourmet) and not too badly priced like you might think. The beach out front is just gorgeous. BUT the reason I'm not giving 5 stars is it's almost all coral. Soooooo you can't really frolic and swim out there. However you can snorkel and it's a turtle area. It's not that far of a walk to the left to beaches with all sand. If you have little ones, too far to walk prob. Bottom line: I highly recommend =)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Maui vacation at the Honua Kai.”
Reviews.Author: ktc-california
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to Maui with our 3 grandkids (ages 2, 4 & 5) and stayed 9 nights at the Honua Kai resort. I have been to Maui and Oahu several times and this room / resort was at the top of the list. We stayed in a one bedroom unit but it had plenty of room for us and the kids - it actually has a little room which doubles as a second bedroom (great for kids). The resort was beautiful, staff was attentive and location is great. I had asked to get a ground floor room (if possible) and to my surprise we got a ground floor room with a great mountain view. Underground parking is convenient and included in the $25 / day resort fee. Dukes on the beach has great food and the pool area is fantastic for families with small children. The only problem with this resort is you will never want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Go Back!”
Reviews.Author: Brungart
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week stay at Honua Kai. We rented unit H503, a 3b/3b from Intrawest--the onsite property management company. The group travelling with us rented unit H351, also a 3b/3b from a local property owner. We got a better rate because of view, although ours was still fabulous. We were travelling with a group of 10 adults--many of which are picky and well seasoned travelers. We all absolutely LOVED Honua Kai. My husband, who tends to be frugal, has already agreed to let the two of us book a trip back next February. As to any complaints I 've read on the message board, (1) smell: we had no issue with smells from the nearby sewage plant and (2) what's included: the resort is ultimately a condominium unit with some units rented by individual owners, some rented through property management companies, and others rented by the resort itself. The units are pretty uniform in appearance but vary in amenities. For example, our unit including valet parking, daily maid service, and a supply of laundry/dishwashing detergent, no check-out cleaning fee, etc. The unit our friends stayed in did not include those amenities. Because of the various ways to rent, make sure you understand what you are getting in your price. Travelers shouldn't blame the resort for what they failed to read in their agreements; (3) Coral: there is coral in the ocean--as there is in many other local resorts. There is adequate warning of this on signs leading to the beach. Just wear beach shoes and you'll be fine. (4) Wireless Internet: we never had any issue with getting a strong signal anywhere in our unit. Our friends had no issues in their unit, either. There are three really large pools all with many chairs. It was not like a lot of resorts where you have to rush down to save a chair for the day. Duke's is great. We ate one night as a party of three. We had drinks, two appetizers and three nice entrees. Our tab was $125--cheaper than we could have had that meal on the mainland. They also serve food and drinks poolside. The service at the resort was outstanding. The valets, front desk and concierge were always friendly and willing to make suggestions on anything we asked. We were there during peak whale season. It was incredible to sit on the patio and watch the whales blowing and jumping. It was increadible the amount of whales in the channel between Maui, Lanai and Molokai (Honua looks across the water at Lania and Molokai). And, the beds and pillows were the most comfortable ever staying away from home! Overall, this was an outstanding experience. We could not have been more pleased--especially for the price we paid. It was a complete steal! I have also reviewed our activities from the trip and restaurants seperately. We woudl recommend all of them.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Bad Thing to Say”
Reviews.Author: verval
Reviews.Content: 4 of us travelled mid January for one week to the Honua Kai. After getting specific instructions as to where to check in prior to leaving (heard of problems regarding this), we arrived with no problems. Check in was fast, within half hour of arriving we were in our beautiful 2 bedroom condo-suite on the 2nd floor. Everything was just as the pictures, beautiful. Very comfortable, spacious living space. The lanai was spectacular, with lots of room & seating. Unfortunately, after day 3 the ice maker quit working. The resort was unable to have it fixed within a reasonable time frame, so they immediately offered an upgrade to a 3 bedroom. We decided to take it & the move was an easy one. This condo was on the 5th floor directly facing the ocean! The only issue about staying at this resort was there were no restaurants within walking distance, so there was always the trip to Lahaina. A very small inconvenience for a very special place. I would definately recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect. Everything Maui should be!”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasChapel
Reviews.Content: I'm always a little nervous when booking hotels online, but as soon as I walked in the doors at Honua Kai, I knew I made the right choice! The view from the front door, extends through a large indoor-outdoor sitting area, over a koi pond, through a huge grass area, over the gorgeous pools and straight out to the ocean! Our first floor condo had a sliding glass door that opened to a lanai with a set of nice (not cheap) lounge chairs and a full outdoor dining table - and the ocean was just a few steps away. You feel as though you have your own private beach - it's not huge and "tourist-y," but it is everything you need for a relaxing Maui vacation. The condos are absolutely spotless, with brand new stainless steal appliances. On our first day, there was a beautiful hand-woven box, tied with hawaiian-print fabric, and garnished with a wooden sea turtle sitting on the table. Inside our "gift" was dishsoap, laundry detergent, kitchen towels from local Hawaiian companies. There is only one restaurant, and not much else in within walking distance, but we saved so much money by cooking in the beautiful kitchen and not eating out. Plus, they have several outdoors grills if you prefer cooking under the stars! The staff was wonderful and always accommodating - they are so on top of things. For instance, one morning, as we were leaving for breakfast we noticed that a corner of the hallway was scratched up and the paint was chipped. It must have been from someone's suitcase, because it was not there the day before. By the time we returned from breakfast, the scratch was patched up and painted! You would have never known it was there! The pools and all of the water features were extremely clean and beautiful! However, if I'm in Hawaii, I much prefer the beach! I wouldn't stay anywhere else - it was the perfect vacation experience! I can't wait for the spa to open. We'll definitely be back

Reviews.Title: “Very Good only a few Negatives”
Reviews.Author: 01Julie
Reviews.Content: The resort is not very old so the rooms are in great condition and the beds are very comfortable. I needed to fix the dishwasher the first day because the top spinner was laying on the floor of the washer, good thing I am handy. I also found it a bit annoying that there wasn't any dishwasher soap provided along with tea towels or dish clothes. If you want people to keep a tidy place a few basics would be good. Also bring all your own shampoo, toilet tissue and paper towel. The pool area was busy but we were always able to find a place to lounge, but a few more shaded places would be nice. Maybe some table and chairs for people who want to sit up and read under an umbrella. The pool area with the slide is unofficially the kids side, maybe because it is full of little ones. The pools in front the towel shack (a river theme) and up on the hill by the Konea building are quieter and more for the adults which was nice. They Hot Tub Rules state no children under 16 in the hot tubs but lots of diaper age kids in there and the temperature is 104 degrees! I don't think the young parents realize how dangerous this is for small children, hot sun, hot water a recipe for dehydration and a sick child. Leave the hot tubs for the adults and follow the posted rules. I also found that people pay no attention to the NO GLASS RULE in the BBQ area which is right beside the pool area. A shattered clear wine glass in a bare foot pool area is just plain stupid. Of course people never think the rules apply to them especially as they are drinking from their glass in front of the sign telling them not too. Also there are no BBQ brushes in the BBQ area although we actually found one in the condo. But who would want a greasy, gunky, BBQ brush floating around their brand new condo kitchen. Just put some Brushes in the BBQ area there are steel holders so they can be chained beside the grills. Although you are NOT allowed to SMOKE anywhere on the property someone was smoking on their Lani several times around us. After shouting a few evenings that their second hand smoke was choking us they seemed to stop but we shouldn't have had to do that. We too did smell the sewer stink. It seemed to be bad mainly in the evening or first thing in the morning. The beach in front of the Hotel is great just wear water shoes so you protect your feet. There is no shade so bring an umbrella. Dukes restaurant was great and the staff there is very friendly. The bar is a bit small so getting a seat up at the bar was not always possible. If you need groceries there is a market across the street which is well stocked and a short walk. Overall I think the Honua Kai is a great place and we would stay again. South Kaanapali now has some stiff competition.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful spacious resort, perfect place to relax and enjoy”
Reviews.Author: Vcwcpa
Reviews.Content: We selected the resort because they were offering a special and it got good reviews. We were very pleased. First of all, they upgraded us to a two bedroom suite, so we were already delighted as soon as we walked in. The suite had a full kitchen including a very quiet dishwasher and washer/dryer. The resort is an hour drive from the airport, we had a rental so getting around was no problem; there are several stores in driving distance including a grocery store. The restaurants in the area are a little pricey so it's a good idea to buy some groceries. The grounds are beautiful and there are several pools and hot tubs; the beach runs along the resort. It is a public beach; however, you can rent beach items chairs, snorkel gear etc from the resort to take on the beach. We booked tours through the concierge but later realized that we probably could have gotten a better price thru the local vendors

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler0924
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in a 3 bdr ocean view suite on the second floor and really enjoyed our stay. For some reason we were upgraded from a 2 bdr. suite at no charge. Lovely rooms, fabulous kitchen and heavenly beds. Lots of table space to play games on -- huge lanai. Very pleasant all the way around. Service was good and unobtrusive. The location is perfect and this is clearly one of the best hotels on Kannapali Beach. Nice sandy beach. We saw lots of families with young children and then lots of older couples. The pools are great and offered lots of options for guests. Dukes had music almost every night and even though we didn't spend much time there we could hear music softly if we kept our lanai door open. There is underground parking available and we found that to be very convenient. We ate in most days and there didn't really seem to be many restaurant choices or much nightlife which we didn't mind but others might.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your hearing protection!!!”
Reviews.Author: 32744Bruce
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 days half of the stay was quiet but 5 days the bull dozers were running from 8 am to 4:30 pm!!! I read reviews before I booked the rooms and found there was construction going on so I called and was assured the construction was completed. We arrived on Monday and the resort was top notch, but resort view meant fence view, then on Friday when we returned the bull dozers were making a terrible noise and it felt like an earth quake inside our room. I complained and the resort offered to move us to another room but it was way on the other side in the older tower in a smaller room. We had brought my mother, 83 years old, and she didn't want to pack up and move so we were stuck. I felt ripped off. So, our recompense was a resort credit of $150, what an insult. Needless to say I will never book that resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, gorgeous, gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: Lynn005
Reviews.Content: Honua Kai is a luxury resort with its own Duke's Restaurant on site. The resort is huge, with exceptional outdoor pools and walkways. The one-bedroom unit we had had stainless steel Bosch appliances and a granite counter as well as a stacked washer/dryer unit. The bed was extremely comfortable with good bedding. We were in heaven. It was very hard to leave this true home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel EVER!!!!! 10 stars!!!! Service and everything else!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nastena744
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Tramp hotel in Las Vegas (5 stars) and reseived nothing but attitude and terribly dirty room with broken build in TV in a bathroom and nasty management!!! Honua Kai deserves 10 stars for the service and the hotel itself!!!! Room was amazing, people were super nice, cleaning service was very good, pools with slide and hot tubs...landscaping, location....everything was A+!!!! Absolutely everything was awesome! Coming back only to this hotel again!!!

Reviews.Title: “We Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: MandD11
Reviews.Content: For us, everything about the place was excellent. We were extremely happy with our choice to stay there. Some views are better than others but in general the resort is first-class.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: Saluki7
Reviews.Content: Hotel is new and in great condition. Beds are high quality, perfect location and grounds are immaculate. Staff is friendly, valet parking and it is in a great location. We will definately come back to this hotel. My wife who is a complete pain to please even said this place is perfect. The rates are also very reasonable for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and great value!”
Reviews.Author: NYCTraveller999
Reviews.Content: Overall: Large resort in a wonderful area. Excellent value considering the cost of neighboring hotels. Great for families. Location: Honua Kai is located in the Lahaina area on the northern part of Kaanapali Beach, about a 40 minute drive from the main airport in Maui. In doing research it seemed like the 2 most popular areas in Maui were Lahaina and Wailea. Both areas are laden with resorts and hotels, however I felt that the better beaches were in the Lahaina area â€“ Kaanapali Beach, Kapalua, which was my favorite and DT Fleming). The hotel is located about 10 minutes from Whalerâ€™s Village which is where a lot of the shops and restaurants are at (I highly recommend Lahaina Grill). Rooms: One thing to note: I thought I had booked a partial ocean view, but instead got a resort view. Definitely go with an ocean view. Resort view overlooked the front of the hotel (parking area + mountains). We didnâ€™t spend much time in our room, but it would have been nice to sit on the very spacious lanais and whale watch. Other than the view, the rooms were great. They are like little condos and have a dining area, kitchen, living room w/ flat screen, bedroom w/ flat screen, bathroom along with a washer and dryer, which was SO convenient. Hotel even provides detergent and dryer sheets. Furnishings seemed new, the design was nice and beds were comfortable. Iâ€™d imagine a place like this would be great if you are travelling with kids. Also, all rooms have WIFI, which is included in the daily resort fee ($25). Amenities: Being a large resort, this hotel had 2 separate, pretty big pools.. one with a lazy river. It had a couple of nice hot tubs as well. It also had a grilling area by the pool for anyone who wanted to grill their own dinners. The hotel had a sizeable food shop where you can order breakfast/lunch or buy your own snacks and ingredients if you wanted to cook in your roomâ€™s kitchen. The store had everything from raw fish fillets you can grill, to fresh bread, cheeses, and alcohol. I didnâ€™t use the hotelâ€™s gym, but it was nice. Hotel provides self-parking or valet parking, which is a service included in the resort fee. The only downside for me was that there was no room service at this hotel. Hotel has only one restaurant on its grounds called Duke. Itâ€™s located by the beach.. food is ok. Nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Newest and Best in Maui”
Reviews.Author: JohnTraveler22
Reviews.Content: I've check in to the Honua Kai three days ago, will be here for another three days, and find it to be flawless, both as to service and as to amenities/facilities. I am in the Konea Tower - still not a year old from build-out - and have a North-facing POV (partial ocean view) which is quite satisfactory to me. This place is brand new, all-new high-end appliances, fast internet (wifi okay but would,reco you bring an ethernet cable for even faster Mbps, if that's important to you). I'm in unit 536, can see mountains and ocean from here, from a very spacious lanai which itself is beautifully furnished with comfy large table and chairs. Furnishings are new and clean, bed is way comfortable, bathroom is sparkling clean and very large (both tub, and all-glass-enclosed shower) and kitchen has it all; microwave, big fridge with icemaker, all needed utensils and tableware are included, and adjacent to kitchen is washer/dryer. Soap,detergent, starter coffee, all are here to greet me. There is a "station" in the lobby, at which you can print out your boarding and other reservation documents, since who brings a printer? Staff is very helpful; had a small icemaker problem on arrival, house engineer on the spot in 15 minutes and cleared it up. Daily maid service included in $25 daily fee, as is parking, internet, and all standard services. And - it's important to me - central A/C, which works to a "T"... HDTV in living and bed rooms,so it's Super Bowl Sunday on big-screen TV, in High-Def, this year, with brand new kitchen right next to the living room. Who could ask for more. Pools are beautiful and immaculate. Safeway just down the road in the Cannery Center, and the crowds of Kaanapali just minutes away, if you want them; and golf just five minutes down South, though it's costly. I'm driving down-coast to Makena for golf on Thursday, which is "only" $119 per round. I first came to Maui in 1975,and always have stayed in condos; visited two of them yesterday, and man! are they showing their age. Compared to this place,they are stone age. Stay here, if you can afford it. You won't regret it,and if you like creature comforts in your habitations, as I do at the age of 70, this is the place for you...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: ad1228
Reviews.Content: This resort is wonderful. The rooms are state of the art. The only reason I gave it a 3 for location is because it is a long walk to whalers village about 2 miles and the beach in front of resort is full of loose coral and rocks other than that the resort is great and I can't wait to return

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Jacquie_18
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week here... checking out tomorrow :( ... We stayed in 723 and the view is amazing. It is a studio and was the perfect size for the two of us. The lania is great - lots of room and a great place to enjoy your coffee in the morning and a glass of wine at sunset. We used the kitchen for breakfast and lunch and used the bbq's one night for supper. We ate at Duke's one night and it was very good as well. The resort is beautiful. We will stay here again our next time in Maui. Free phones calls to Canada was a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding resort”
Reviews.Author: Jasper2000
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel on the web and the prices were fair for a 1 bdrm and the pictures were not misleading. I own a timeshare with Hilton and this place makes the Hilton timeshare seem like motel 6! The property is a mix of owned units and for sale units. I was concerned about a "pressure sales presentation", thankfully they never asked me. The pool area was excellent and the bar and wait staff were great. Beach is just beyond the pool, but be careful as the corral is everywhere and very sharp! The directions are a little difficult as the street they reference (Molina) only appears on the left side of the road and the road side on the right side is different.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury resort at a great value. Unit 616 was fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: MGoBlue99
Reviews.Content: I'm a heavy travel researcher and once we decided we were going to Maui, I spent a while researching lodging all over the island. While we normally stay in hotels on vacations, we decided we wanted a condo for Maui. First of all, condos are much cheaper than hotels. And since we were going to be there for 6 nights, we didn't want to eat out every day for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Having a condo with a nice kitchen enables you to save some money while eating healthier. I researched condos in Lahaina and Wailea area. While both areas have plenty of condo options, we decided on Lahaina because we felt there was more to do there. I looked at dozens of condo complexes in West Maui and was dismayed that most of the buildings and units were old-looking. Yes, they did have beautiful views, but we wanted to stay in a condo that was luxurious inside and out. Then one day, I stumbled upon Honua Kai. And I knew I had found our home in Hawaii. The resort appeared to be good to be true- brand new, modern luxurious condos, and a nice location in West Maui. And the rates were very reasonable. We only looked at units that were available on vrbo.com, which provides direct rental through owners. You can go through a management company to book, but then you won't get to pick your specific condo. And going directly through the owner is much cheaper. After researching a bunch of units, we decided on Unit 616. This was a one bedroom, 750 sq foot, luxury condo with ocean views and mountain views. I booked directly with the owners- the Geng Family. The Gengs live right down the road from the Honua Kai and were terrific to deal with. The $200 nightly rate was a fantastic deal, especially compared to the hotels in Maui. The condo had a full-sized kitchen with granite countertops and stainless steel appliances. The living room had a big sofa and a dining table. The bedroom had a big comfortable bed and plenty of space for luggage. There were HDTVs in both the living room and bedroom. The bathroom was gigantic and had dual vanity sinks. The shower pressure was excellent too. There was also a washing machine and dryer, which means you can pack fewer clothes. The view from Unit 616 was gorgeous. There is halted construction next door, so yes, you will see some empty land and equipment. However, you have a sweeping view of both the ocean and the mountains. The lanai was a nice size and had a big dining table. It was great to have your morning 100% Kona coffee and read a book while staring out at the ocean. The other nice feature is that the entire glass wall to the lanai folds out. So you could open up the entire thing and have a terrific breeze coming into the living room (though we never did this because it was extra windy during our stay). Ok enough about the room- Honua Kai itself is a beautiful resort. The pools are amazing. There are 3 different ones and we spent time in each one. There is a water slide that is meant for kids but adults can ride on it too. There is a cascading waterfall that you can stand underneath, which is very refreshing. The resort is relatively new and everything looks clean and modern. On-site, there are two restaurants: Duke's, which is a full service restaurant, and a cafe. The cafe is pretty upscale actually and sells some fancy prepared foods. The location of Honua Kai is in the northern part of West Maui. There is a beach walk that you can use to go to the neighboring resorts. It's some good exercise to walk the trail. The resort is more isolated than the resorts further south, and therefore more quiet. Parking is via an underground garage (it is $10 a day). The resort felt very safe. The only thing I didn't love about Honua Kai is the beach/ocean right in front of the property. It is not swimmable due to the coral. You can go in a few feet but nobody goes deeper than that. You will have to go elsewhere to get in quality beach and ocean time (I highly recommend DT Fleming Beach, a few miles north of Honua Kai). Also, some have mentioned the odor from the nearby sewer plant. The only time we noticed this was during the drive when you leave the resort. We smelled no odor while on the resort. Overall, we thought the Honua Kai, and unit 616 in particular, were fantastic. Our week-long stay there provided us some amazing experiences and memories. If you are looking for a condo in Maui, this place should be at the top of your list.

Reviews.Title: “Maui?? More like Wowie!”
Reviews.Author: Amanda253
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Honua Kai for 6 nights. Our decision to stay at Honua Kai was based on recent Trip Advisor reviews. We found the reviews to be very accurate in describing the hotel. We paid for a studio room through Expedia. We were upgraded to a one bedroom suite when we arrived at the hotel. Our suite had a resort view, which ended up being a beautiful mountain view. The kitchen had everything we needed to enjoy breakfasts, lunches, and dinners in our room. The coffee was delicious! The sitting area was very comfortable, with a pull-out couch. The deck was spacious and fabulous, with room for 4-6 people to sit and eat comfortably. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was large and luxurious. My only complaint about the room is very minor but significant to persons who care about their hair: the hotel provided a 2-in-1 shampoo/conditioner, as opposed to a separate shampoo and conditioner. I did not like the product and will bring my own products next time. We did smell the sewer smell from time to time. However, it was mild and fleeting and in no way would it affect my rating of the hotel or my decision of whether to return. The staff at the hotel were very friendly. The grounds were clean. Dukes has a great atmosphere and decent food. We highly recommend this hotel and will return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Honua Kai Paradise!!! Recommend Hokulani #237”
Reviews.Author: DoubleShotJimmy
Reviews.Content: First time I've ever stayed here and definitely not the last. We have always stayed at the Whaler, but this time were looking for a condo with better ammenities that was more appealing to our your children. Honua Kai is the perfect mix. It is a privately owned condo with a resort feel. The grounds are amazing! The board walk extends to all of the Kaanapali resorts, allowing access to all the restaurants, beaches, and shopping areas in Kaanapali. We cooked most of our meals in the condo, bbq and grilled many of nights, and enjoyed Dukes for happy hour. The pools and grassy areas are truly amazing. My 5 yr old and 7 yr old spent many hours every day playing catch and tag in the grass, and swam all day in the pools. There are multiple pools all with a different vibe. Something for everyone.....there is a larger quiet pool for the adults,a kid area which has a lazy river, water slide, sandy bottom area, and caverns with waterfalls. Kids club was the topper for this vacation! While we had not intended to use it, our kids saw the activities and begged us to stay. We ended up dropping off our kids 2 hours each day so they could make arts/ cratfs, play games, teach us new Hawaiian words. I do recommend staying on the inside of the Honua Kai. We stayed in unit #237 and will definitely specifcally request that unit next time. It is truly a perfect unit. It is on the inside of the complex, but on the sunnyside where you can get your afternoon sunshine! I noticed the other side stays shady most of the day (not what I want in Hawaii!!!) Plus we saved money due to it being a partial ocean view, but when you walk out on the huge lanai, you have a wonderful view. Plus it has one of the largest lanais in the whole complex. I'm sure all the units here have there special benefits, but bottom line is Honua Kai is 5 stars (especially Hokulani #237)!!!

Reviews.Title: “Do not hesitate to stay here.....amazing resort”
Reviews.Author: CanadianOnt
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Honua Kai January 1 - 8, 2011 and were not dissapointed. The resort is beautiful. The rooms are immaculately clean and have everything you need to make you feel at home. The staff are incredibly nice and go out of your way to exceed your expectations. Definitely go to Duke's Restaurant for happy hour....they have $5 Mai Tai's. This is a top notch resort and I would highly recommend it. Happy to answer any questions so please feel free to email.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: hel2copter
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here very much. We had a car and travelled north and south from the resort. It is in a great location and easy to find. Parking is very easy outside or underground. Staff was very friendly and service was first class. I got a good sale on our room otherwise it may not have been affordable for us. The rooms were very clean, new, and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: tnhelen
Reviews.Content: This resort was the most beautiful place we have ever seen. The staff was friendly and courteous, our cars were valet parked and we were even helped bringing groceries to our rooms. The thing we noticed the most besides this just being a gorgeous resort, was service, service, service.

Reviews.Title: “The overwhelmingly positive reviews for this resort matched our experience”
Reviews.Author: jmchestnut
Reviews.Content: If you are trying to make a quick decision about where to stay in Maui, and if you can find a rate that looks good, you will not be disappointed with a vacation at Honua Kai. My wife and 1 year old son loved this resort for our first trip to Hawaii. When I started researching Maui, I quickly found the Honua Kai Resort and Spa in West Maui on the north end of Ka'anapali Beach (~10 min north of Lahaina, ~10 min south of Kapalua) This resort features two U-shaped buildings, one finished in 2008, the other finished in 2010. Within a half-day's worth of research (I was in a hurry), I booked a 9 day vacation through Orbitz. This resort has units managed through a "hotel" that you book through them, a website such as Orbitz, or a travel agent...and also has privately owned units that you can book through say, vrbo.com. I was amazed to see that this place averaged 4.5/5 stars by reviewers. I always look at reviews, and I have found that few hotels, restaurants, or anything for that matter gets such high reviews! It definitely lived up to the hype. Beautiful rooms. Great kitchens. So clean. The floor to ceiling retractable window doors out to your balcony are awesome! Booking through the "hotel" gets you daily housecleaning (plus a daily $25 resort fee). I'm not sure what the housecleaning situation is when you book through a private owner. Honua Kai has great landscaping. Beautiful west-facing beach in West Maui with awesome sunsets. Be aware of coral in many shallow areas of water, where many unaware guests lacerate their hands or feet. There are areas along the beach that are more predominately sandy in the shallow waters. Resort lies on the north end of a 2 mile beach board walk. The pools are wonderful. So much fun for kids. We stayed in January, and the water temperature for the pools and ocean was cool, but very comfortable. Tons of great restaurants in the area. Very convenient grocery store, across the street from the resort. We really enjoyed the ambiance and two-tiered menus of Duke's Restaurant, the dining room menu (entrees $25-35) and the grill menu (entrees $12-20). There was live music on some nights. The exercise room is one weakness. It only has 5 aerobic machines, some free weights, and a weight machine. I was still able to get in enjoyable workouts, but the weight room definitely only meets minimum standards. Another weakness, it should only be called Honua Kai Resort. At this point, they do not have a spa, but they can send you over to the neighboring Westin. Finally, the service is excellent. I found everyone to be so friendly and helpful. Bottomline, I would definitely recommend this, and I would very strongly consider going again. I would love to bring the whole family out for a family reunion.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Condo in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: GeeMoneyCA
Reviews.Content: We loved this place & thought it turned out to be better than most of the reviews. We are picky hotel people (4-5 star only) & thought this place fit all of our needs. A quick rundown: loved the nano wall, kitchen, w/d combo, bed comfort, shower, pools, waterslide, Dukes, boardwalk & easy beach access. Since it was our anniversary, they left a beautiful little gift in our room & also, we were invited to a cocktail hour one nite. Everything really was fabulous. Some of the complaints we read prior to our trip went unnoticed by us or could be explained: never smelled any strange odors (we were in 1st tower in studio w/view facing ocean), the boutique/deli/store was so convenient & cute & we didnt find it overpriced (we're coming from Cali where everything is a bit pricier anyway), having Dukes on site was a major bonus (we ate there 4 times that week & had no complaints), tiki torches, koi ponds & grounds were emaculate & just gorgeous, A/C does go off when you open lanai doors but Duh! this is a energy efficiency thing so it makes total sense. Staff was ultra friendly & helpful. My only complaint is we are a couple & we went for Christmas week & it was all families at this resort. Made it a bit less romantic but maybe the same all over Maui at Christmas? I felt like we should have brought a neice or nephew to fit in! Otherwise, totally perfect place for us.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent resort in paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Niudoug
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our first trip to Maui and couldn't be more pleased with our choice. Beautiful suite overlooking a courtyard and pool with a direct view of the ocean from the 7th floor. The kitchen was modern and fully equipped and it was nice being able to prepare a few meals versus being in a hotel room. We also used the BBQ grill one nite and ate on our lanai. Pools were great and we used the fitness center and found everything we needed and my husband is a personal trainer. The grounds were gorgeous as was the beach. Right down the road is a public access beach where we snorkled many times. We didn't try to snorkel right at the resort but there are plenty of spots very close. We were very happy with this resort.

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay as great as the first”
Reviews.Author: MommyJJ
Reviews.Content: A fabulous resort at a great value... beautiful setting, wonderful staff with all the amentities. We look forward to our third stay.

Reviews.Title: “How do I love thee Honua Kai? Let me count the ways......”
Reviews.Author: PJtravel0114
Reviews.Content: My mom reviewed the Honua Kai already, however they deserve two greats reviews based on their impeccable service! Like my mom said, we were there for my wedding, which had the potential of being a disaster because of uncontrollable weather conditions. Being the OCD/Type A individual that I am, I freaked out and started looking for other indoor options. Dave M., at Honua Kai was absolutely amazing! He offered solutions for us, in case we had to have the wedding indoors and these options literally came less than two days before I was supposed to get married. He was patient and understanding while I tried to explain the situation in a "spastic bride" type of way. The next day when we were trying to have something that resembled a rehearsal in their lobby area, Dave offered to open up one of the business rooms so that we could talk about all the "what ifs" involved because of the weather. His customer service was refreshing and unparalled and I hope the Honua Kai realizes what an extraordinary asset they have in him. Generally, the customer service at Honua Kai was exceptional. Special thanks to Brent for ascertaining the problem with our refrigerator quickly and doing it all with a great attitude and smile! You rock! We started in a 2bdrm/2bath and they upgraded us to the 3bdrm/3bath which was absolutely amazing! My mom was right when she said all our family/friends ran through our room because it was sooo spacious and could accomodate so many of us. My mom cooked a full on breakfast brunch for 30 people in the kitchen! Now this kitchen deserves it's own paragraph. It is simply ridiculous (in a good way). I am an HGTV junkie, so I know a good kitchen when I see one. SS appliances, granite. Stone floors and all the applicances of home. I didnt want to leave. There was also a dining table that seated 8 as well as a bar area that seated 3 or 4. The bathrooms are spacious and huge, including the tub. The beds are completely heaven and very comfortable. The pools are absolutely great for adults and kids. They have a water slide, which my fiance (or husband now) loved! For our honeymoon, my husband and I stayed at the Ritz Kapalua. Although the Ritz upgrades us to a Residential Suite, I must say that after staying at the Honua Kai, I was a bit underwhelmed. The HK is just more modern and beautiful compared to the Ritz.. However because of the great customer service and the exquisite rooms at HK, I think anything else would have paled in comparison. Dont get me wrong, the Ritz is very nice, however when we return, we will stay at the HK because it is just nicer all around. Overall, Honua Kai, thank you,thank you, thank you for all that you've done to make our crazy wedding trip run more smoothly. We promise we will come back very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome-Exceeded Our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: rmjohnson12
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Honua Kai in April 2010. I spent many hours researching all of the options in the Ka'anapali area of Maui. Our requirements for our accommodations when we travel are (1) great location/view, (2) 1 bedroom suite with a full size kitchen and living room, and (3) reasonably priced. The Honua Kai met all three requirements, and more. We actually stayed in a 2 bedroom, as we were upgraded from a 1 bedroom. I felt that we were in a million dollar condo. Stainless steel appliances, granite counters, expensive furnishings, a window wall that opens the entire living area to the balcony. The entire complex was almost brand new. The rooms had flat paneled LED TV's in every room, and the bathrooms were to die for. The wireless free internet worked fine. They also have in room safe that are large enough to hold my laptop. The pools are huge, the beach is perfect, and you can watch the sunset each day. Everything is immaculate! Above all else, the restaurant on site, Dukes, is unbelievable! We stayed 4 nights and ate there 2 nights. We did not go to any other restaurants. No need to. Why drive? And we love dining out! One night, we saw Chris Berman (ESPN's, "will he go ALL THE WAY") hanging out at the bar. He has a place in Lahaina and goes to Duke's. The only negative for us, and we knew this when we booked our room, was that we did not have much of a view of the water. The two buildings are U shaped and most of the units in the U do not have much of a view. When we booked our room, we knew this, and it was a difficult decision because we always want/get a room with a bold view of the water. All things considered, it was worth the sacrifice, and if we go back, we'd stay here again, even without the bold view. I am writing this review today because I feel obligated to do so, as I use Tripadvisor a lot, I rely heavily on the reviews, and I feel an obligation to the other readers to do so. I hope all of you reciprocate too. I have just completed booking accommodations for our trip to Anguilla and St Martin in 6 weeks. I utilized tripadvisor extensively. While in the process of looking for accommodations in Anguilla and St martin, my wife and I said many times, "we need to find a place like the Honua Kai" The Honua Kai has set a new standard for us!

Reviews.Title: “Great Birthday Gift For the Blond”
Reviews.Author: genee333
Reviews.Content: Booked this resort based on ratings. I was not disappointed. This was a surprise birthday gift for the Blond. Didn't know where I was taking her there until the airport chech in. From the moment we drove up to the front entrance service was first class. These are excellent first class condos. Yes "Will Be Back!".

Reviews.Title: “Eternally Grateful!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Angelscry21
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Honua Kai on Monday, January 10th for my daughter's wedding which was scheduled to take place on that following Thursday, January 13th. When we arrived, it was raining extremely hard, this short of a hurricane and to make matters worse, rain was predicted for the entire week. We were exhausted from our travels and anxious about our outdoor wedding which had a high probability of being rained out. The Honua Kai was/is beautiful and has such a peaceful, calm feel to it. Just walking onto the grounds was therapeutic. The service is impeccable! Everyone we encountered was pleasant and professional. We were upgraded to a beautiful, 2 bedroom suite with an ocean view. Due to the wedding, I had family and friends coming through our suite most of the day and night. We were on storm watch, monitoring the weather hour by hour. At one point, my daughter had spoken to one of the managers at the Honua Kai (Dave?) regarding possibly switching the wedding to iinside one of the banquet rooms at the Honua Kai. This manager Dave was sympathetic to our plight and provided us with possible options in case we couldn't go through with the original plans at an affordable price. On Thursday, the day the wedding was suppose to take place, it was cancelled due to the storm, reschedule for Friday.The vendors couldn't get over to our side of the island due to closure of the main road. In addition, our refrigerator in our wonderful room wasn't keeping our food quite cold enough. Needless to say, the bride was crying, practically in a fetal position. Once again, the Honua Kai came to our rescue!!! Brent from engineering came up to assess our refrigerator, quickly diagnosed the problem and gave a recommendation to Bobbie in management that we should change rooms while he fixes the refrigerator. We were upgraded to an amazing, 3 bedroom, 3 bath, ocean front view suite! This room was not only beautiful, but functional as my wedding guest and family had a lot of room to move around in. On Friday, the morning of the weddng, all I could do was gasp at the mesmerizing view from the large lanai. There in front of me was the beautiful ocean, the pretty manicured grounds, and a bright sun!!!! Friday afternoon, in warm sunshine we had a beautiful, outdoor wedding!! I want to thank God and the Honua Kai for making this time in our life very special!! My family and friends have expressed many times throughout the trip on returning back to the Honua Kai this summer because we were so impressed with the service!!! I will personally stay no other place in Kaanapali than the Honua Kai. They have a friend for life and I am ETERNALLY GRATEFUL!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “OVERATED-nice rooms, not much else”
Reviews.Author: Orpheus1102
Reviews.Content: Negatives: Don't arrive late (no one is on duty), don't stay in bldg 2 (fewer services), don't expect a nice beach (short beach and water filled with coral) or many water activities (just snorkle) or a large pool or anything in the refrigerator or a computer room (bring your own). In general, service is lacking. Positives: Nice rooms with full kitchen and large balcony. Good restaurant (Dukes) - but pricy.

Reviews.Title: “Agree with all of the excellent reviews.”
Reviews.Author: EdmontonFritz
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 11 nights and really appreciated the "being on your own" aspect of staying at the Honua Kai. We booked our stay through Chase N' Rainbows and never once felt like booking through a third party was a bad choice. Any dealings with the front desk was friendly and courteous. The Aina market in the lobby and the Times market a 5 minute walk away were more than sufficient for most of our grocery needs. Our 9th floor lanai faced the mountain side and water treatment plant that is mentioned several times for producing funny smells...must be all of those Trade and Kona winds that blow the smell away since we never smelled a thing. The pools were a daily activity for myself and 12 yr old son and with the use of our swimming goggles, we noticed that the kiddie pool (water slide) was significantly cloudier than the other pools. I'm glad that toddlers are not allowed in the hot tubs, they should only have one pool to go peepee in! It just seems like they need more signage and responsible parents.....that should get me some comments. Chase N' Rainbows was excellent to deal with and will definitely see my business again. Totally loved Honua Kai, new, clean, spacious, full kitchen with nice appliances, washer and dryer, large lanai in a great location!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay with one exception”
Reviews.Author: Rub-a-dub-dub619
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our experience at the Honue Kai Resort. We stayed in a one bedroom suite with views of the west Maui mountains. There is a small industrial space across the street that we could see (and smell at times), but we dont feel like it took away too much from the ambiance of the place. If you can, get a room with an ocean view, i am sure it is well worth it. The front desk, vallet, and cleaning staff were all excellent. Our room was clean and comfortable. Everything was nice and new. We loved having our own kitchen to cook meals in since we were traveling with our toddler who suffers from severe food allergies. On our way to the resort we stopped by Costco for food and to a couple of grocery stores nearby. The washer and dryer was really convenient when staying for an extended period. The resort was never too crowded. The various pools were lovely, which brings me to our only bad experience at the resort. While pool hopping with our toddler on our last evening in Maui, we were approached by security. We were told that babies were not allowed in the hot tub area, but during our entire stay our toddler and every other toddler staying at the place were in the hot tubs... ALL OF THEM! We were then asked "Are you even guests at the resort?". The fact was that we were targeted because we looked more "local" than the other guests. We left the pool area and did not talk to anyone at guest services, although I do regret that now. The bottom line is that although we enjoyed our stay on the most part, I dont know if i would stay again because of our experience in the pool. There are plenty of resort options to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible!”
Reviews.Author: fsunoles88
Reviews.Content: This resort is first class! The rooms are immaculate and beautifully furnished. We rented one of the condos which had a full kitchen, washer/dryer, and everything we needed for an enjoyable trip. The pools are great, plenty of lounge chairs with easy access to the beach. There is also a large workout room with rarely anyone in there. If booking your trip to Maui, look no further. This is the best place in Ka'anapali.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: jblairgolf
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Honua Kai, in a 2 bedroom ocean view unit in the Hokulani Tower which we loved. I too have nothing but praise for Ted at the front desk. He was my 'Christmas miracle,' when we checked in very late Christmas day evening and decided we wanted another unit. He found us the last unit available in the complex, which turned out to be such a blessing. While the two bedroom has ample space for six, you would need to utilize the sofa sleeper, which my husband was not wild about.
