He likes everything neat and tidy at all times, and having someone on the pull out sleeper sofa meant that would throw the dynamics off. Thank goodness we were able to get a separate room for the girls, and everyone was happy! Thank you again Ted! The concierge Kimmy was very prompt and helpful, and always willing to look for whatever we inquired about. She suggested a whale watch with a company I didn't know a lot about (only because it isn't reviewed alot, but is well deserving of high marks) that was truly like something out of a National Geographic show. (I will review that later, but it was Captain Steve's Lanai Snorkel trip with Jonathon and Jeff, the only two I will ever go out with again!) so thank you Kimmy for that! We booked our unit through Unikta Vacations, and Nikta made sure every detail of our trip ran like clock work, not to mention that she is one of the nicest, more sincere people you will ever meet! My husband is a very discriminating traveller, and he was impressed. We are already looking to return next Christmas. Maui is 'heaven on earth,' that's for sure! Go with total confidence, but know that you may never want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place and great front desk staff especially Ted”
Reviews.Author: nina154943
Reviews.Content: We had some difficulties with housekeeping to the point where it became a concern but the front desk ( specifically Ted) helped us out immensely and the housekeeping issues were dealt with halway through our stay. Also, the front desk was very helpful in taking care of my elderly mother and meeting her needs. I am very grateful to them for that. I would recommend this quiet and upscale hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great property, comical service”
Reviews.Author: sp30166
Reviews.Content: Simply stated, Honua Kai is a 5 star resort with 2 star service. The property is gorgeous and situated on a beautiful beach in North Kanapaali. The condos/suites are brand new, have beautiful and spacious porches/patios, oversized bathrooms and very nice kitchens and living room areas. The bedrooms are a bit small (access to the closets are actually blocked by the entry doors) but, overall, these units are first rate. The amenities are fine, too. Duke's restaurant is much better than the old Duke's, there are tons of pools on the grounds (though the slide and lazy river are misnomers... unless you are under the age of 4!) and the fitness center is fine, for those who can't find enough to do outside. Here's the downside: the service is so bad it's comical. At check-in (for 2 ocean view suites at the most expensive rate of the year), we were met with a woman who tried to give us a downgraded room, spent most of the time explaining what we couldn't do, and then forgot to give us our "towel passes" without which you can't get a single pool towel! We were starving when we arrived so after checking in ordered 4 sandwiches in the Deli which, despite the efforts of the very pleasant crew working there, took 30 minutes for them to make during a slow time of day. After we went grocery shopping that evening, we pulled up to the front to see if we could get assistance or even just access to a dolly. The bellman proceeded to tell us they didn't have dollies(!), then "stealthily" put the 2 luggage dollies resting not more than 20 feet from us into a storage closet. But, there's more. We had a couple items of clothing dry cleaned, and they were returned a day late and only after we called the front desk to remind them we'd turned clothes in for cleaning 3 days earlier. We called the concierge to book a Luau at Royal Lahaina and spa appointments at the next door Westin (there are no Spa facilities at Honua Kai, but they advertise the Westin Spa as if they have an arrangement with it). No one called us back for, literally, hours following both requests for assistance. In fact, when the "concierge" did call back, we were already at the Westin, where the concierge there was kind enough to book a Luau for us while we used the Westin's Spa! And last, when one of my son's ripped his feet open on a reef outside the hotel, pool personnel called an in-house medic--who didn't even know to clean a wound before taping it up (thankfully, our oldest is beginning his surgical residency, and took over the process with supplies from a local supermarket once we realized that the medic wasn't trained for much more than a toddler's "boo boo"). The bottom line is: if you are self sufficient, like to book and generally take care of things yourself, yet want to be in a great location at a brand new facility, this is for you. But, if you are used to having some level of service component to your vacation, book a real hotel. This one is not ready for prime time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: cree8iv
Reviews.Content: This is our last night at the Honua Kai Resort. We spent 8 nights here with our kids ages 7 and 5 -- we all had a great time. The best feature of the resort are its rooms. Modern, clean and spacious. Our kids enjoyed the "kids club," they had plenty of activities to choose from. The pool area was great -- we had 5 pools to choose from, however, the resort doesn't heat the pools and on cloudy, windy days it was chilly. Probably my only complaint would be the fitness club. It was very small and extremely hot. Not sure why the resort didn't spend a little extra money on providing a better exercise area. We would definitely return to Honua Kai, and I look forward to the spa opening later this year.

Reviews.Title: “nice experience in exceptional apartment living”
Reviews.Author: Leonico49
Reviews.Content: New building on north side just opened and it was early december. very quiet and beautiful with mostly couples in truly gorgeous suites. Kitchens are granite and top end appliances. Got local fish and acquired some banana leaves and had the kitchen to make it sing. Dukes is nice and reasonably priced for Maui. And they had Dechutes Jubelale for the holiday special brew. They obviously know their beer. Outdoor activities are tops. Long walks on this beach 2-3 miles which is exceptional for Maui and beach dive SCUBA to turtles, octapus et al in view of our room. Water calm enough to distance swim miles in either direction. Need to get in the car for shopping or other restaurants. .

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful - totally beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoOmar123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Honau Kai in September of this year and are planning to go back this year - it is so beautiful and well worth it. The suites are brand new, clean and boast great views. The restaurant was terrible and the small grocery store on site - terrific. I would highly reccomend it. 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: “I cant wait to get back to the best place on earth”
Reviews.Author: Rosevillez06
Reviews.Content: The staff was professional and very helpful. The pools were great with plenty of lounge chairs. Parking was plentyful outside and in the garage. Most people are not aware of the garage parking. Valet is free just remember to tip the valet guys. Easy walk to the beach. Our kids used the fitness center daily. The concierge desk was helpful with booking our excursions. The room was unbelievable. The wall is all glass and opens up to a huge balcony. The appliances are all top notch. One of the nicest rooms I have ever stayed in and I do a lot of traveling. We can't wait to get back. There is not one negative thing I can say about the resort. Try the pancakes and the eggs benedict at Dukes. There are also BBQ's available to do your own cooking. You can checkout the BBQ tools from the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Brand New Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: kmac45
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the Honua Kai before heading to Wailea. Second visit to Maui but first to this area. The hotel feels more like a condo resort which it is and many of the units were available for sale. Beautifully appointed units. Our two bedroomed, two bathrooms had everything you could wish for and the removable Nano walls which open up the whole apartment are a great finishing touch. Limited facilities with just a small deli/market for meals which were very expensive or the well known Dukes on site for breakfast, lunch or dinner. It would have made sense to arrive with supplies to keep costs down which we didnt! The beach whilst beautiful is pretty dangerous for swimming and was not recommended so we were confined to the hotel pools which I found disappointing. Its a short drive to Whalers Village in Kanapali which we did a few times to enjoy a meal at a somewhat lower cost. If you are looking for lots going on staying at Kanapali would probably be a better choice but if you are looking at peace and quiet this would be a great destination.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest condos we have every stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: saufai74
Reviews.Content: My FiancÃ© and I invited our closest friends and relatives to Maui for our wedding. About 40 decided to stay at Honua Kai. Most people arrived the first Saturday December 3rd and there was a 50% off + 5 night free deal going on. We booked directly through the resort on the phone which is the way to go I think. I hear that the others have problems because they get zero service. Intrawest owns some of the properties and manage others, but for those that book 3rd party they must rely on the 3rd party to take care of any issues or get any service. And the 3rd party is not on site nor is service their core business. Speaking to the staff they get a lot of flak from those that book through 3rd party but it's not their fault. I am assuming the owners have a choice to pay for Intrawest to manage them but choose not to. Therefore you get what you pay for. The service we received was very good throughout. They grabbed all of our luggage and the Costco shopping for us and brought it to the room and then gave us a tour, explanation of the appliances and the features which was a very nice touch. The rooms are gorgeous, kitchens modern and with every appliance you could need. Even the pots and pans are high quality. The washrooms are large and clean and the linen was of a very high quality. The rooms were cleaned very well everyday and they even did the dishes that we would sometimes leave out. They took out the garbage and our recycling. They had a bottle of champagne and two flutes waiting for us in the room (because of our wedding). Laundry detergent, coffee, and some other necessities were gifted. We would have really liked if they had salt, pepper and sugar as well. The lanai doors open up fully, there is a great accordion style screen door to keep the bugs out at night. The air condition works very well. The washer and dryer we were not used to and warned that because they are energy saving they take a lot longer, but it was a little ridiculous. It took hours to dry. My sister and parents got a 3 bedroom, and it was crazy how nice it was. Marble countertops and backsplash, Viking appliances (gas range), two stoves, wine fridge, washing sink on the island. I love cooking and for those that also love to cook these condos are very nice. The level of the 3 bedrooms jumps up a few notches from the 2 bedrooms. We stayed in a studio/bachelor but it was more than big enough for the two of us. The beach is nice, the pools are good for kids, there is a waterslide, there is a restaurant on site, (Dukes is a good 7.5/10). Improvements could include a drying wire in the bathroom, many people got notices that they are not allowed to dry their clothes on the lanais (balconies), which I understand why but sometimes you donâ€™t want to use the dryer for everything. The spa is still not open which would have been nice. We loved the resort, however I would have to say that without the 50% off and 5th night free it would have fallen off our radar but with that kind of deal it was worth paying a bit more. We like our newer buildings and slick kitchens. This is definitely one of the more luxurious resorts in Maui and get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort and great location”
Reviews.Author: Danny007
Reviews.Content: This was our second time in Maui, therefore I knew what I was looking for in Kaanapali. We had stayed at the Mahana which was great two years ago but we were looking for a better resort for our 2 yrs old daughter. After some research on the internet, I found a one bedroom suite with full kitchen at the Honua Kai Resort and got a great deal for a 2 weeks stay in early December. We were not disappointed...the resort is brand new. The suite was very modern with nice appliances, nicely furnished and a huge balcony. We stayed in Unit #924 which faces the mountains and the parking lot. We didn't care that much for the ocean view but it was a little bit noisy with the traffic on the Hwy, even in the evening. The Honua Kai has two towers with common grounds. There are 3 pools, a lazy river and a slide...all of that with the ocean steps away. The resort also has a decent gym, a kids activity room and an on-site market with local produce...and the ocean front Dukes Restaurant. The location is also great with a few restaurants closeby, Times Supergrocer across the street and Lahaina just 10 minutes away. However, we were really disappointed that our daughter was not old enough to use the pool slide and the kids activity room which are both for 3 years old and older...also the resort is called Honua Kai Resort and Spa but don't look around for the spa, there is none...unless they are planning on building one in the future! Overall, we loved it and would love to go back in the future....especially with our daughter being old enough to use the kids activity room on our next trip! *Family activity tip: The Sugar Cane train is a fun activity to do. The train station is just across the Hwy by the Westin Resort...don't expect to see too much of the sugar cane but it is a different way to get to Lahaina and very kids friendly. At the train station you will also find a shaved ice stand and a farmers market.

Reviews.Title: “LUXURIOUS!”
Reviews.Author: 103stacey
Reviews.Content: What a great place! I have nothing negative to say about this property. It has been an absolute dream to stay here. The grounds are well manicured, the pools are fantastic with the lazy river and waterslide. We stayed in the Hokulani Tower #932. This is a 1 bedroom condo with a pullout sofa. We loved having the convenience of a full kitchen with top of the line appliances as well as a washer and dryer. The staff have been nothing but friendly. We booked this room through Chase n Rainbows and therefore had to pay a $10/day parking fee with the front desk when we arrived. We were fully aware of this charge and had no problem with it. We also loved having a restaurant right on the property. Duke's is a great place to eat but I will do a separate review for that. The location of Honua Kai for us has been perfect. Most of the activities we had planned were all within a reasonable distance from the condo and Lahaina is just a short drive down the road. The beach is really nice with some coral just off the shore. Water shoes are recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice”
Reviews.Author: lakeoconee
Reviews.Content: Booked the two bedroom Oceanview 10 day stay through COSTCO. Two bedroom suite was wonderful, staff went out of their way to assist, wireless did not work but the cable method did and was fast. Nana Wall (glass doors open to make one wall open to outside) was wonderful - in living room and master bedroom. Kitchen was well equipped and appliances were Bosch. Dukes is on the hotel grounds and the food/drinks were excellent. There is a $25 resort fee but it covers parking, internet etc. and some places charge separately and it would be higher. This is a wonderful place and I will stay again. Assumed there was a kids pool but kids were allowed to use all pools. Noticed a very slight sewerage treatment plant odor a couple of days. The State needs to budget for an odor controller at this plant - it is not the hotel's fault. The beach was good and yes there is coral which is part of the ecological system. I will stay again. It was a wonderful vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: thunderblaster1
Reviews.Content: We were there from december 9 to 14. Here's the lowdown: Pros: -Very nice hotel. Very well maintained, looks brand new. We had a king sized bed studio on the 3rd floor ("partial ocean view") reserved through Costco. Could see the ocean in the distance. Room had full kitchen and a washer / dryer, including washing soap. -Grounds are very well kept. Some nice flowers scattered around that I took pictures of. -Several large pools, one which is like a canal that snakes around in several loops. Another has a water slide. -it was our anniversary and we were provided a bottle of sparking wine. -Staff was very helpful and friendly -Fitness center in our building was great for a hotel. -Garage parking - very convenient. -10 minutes from downtown Lahaina, where the restaurants / bars are. Cons: -LOTS of little kids. Obviously good or bad, depending on your viewpoint. The kids seemed to love the pools and the grounds. But for a couple on vacation like us, being around lots of kids can be tiring. Fortunately we were out and about nearly every day and didnt spend much time at the hotel anyways. -$25 "resort fee". Supposed to cover parking, internet, the room safe, use of the pools, etc. I think this is just nickel and diming you. Although I must admit that in other hotels, this would be the cost of the parking itself. -the wireless internet signal was very weak a couple of the days we were there. -the beach has TOO MUCH CORAL. I cut myself a couple times. -the hotel was relatively empty when we were there. I'd say about 20% of the rooms were occupied. Made me wonder why. The economy?

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: pumpkinali
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 9 nights. The bell/valet and front desk staff were wonderful and we got an upgrade without even having to ask. The room was clean, comfortable, spacious and exactly as pictured. The kitchen was fully stocked with all gadgets, serveware, and appliances. It was really great to have all of those amenities in the room. We loved the accordion doors. It was very quiet in the room, but it appears that they are preparing for some major construction next to east tower. My husband once smelled the sewage smell, but I never did. We only got the maid service once (and only for a change of sheets/towels and trash removal), so I can't comment on that. Two things I did not like about the room, though: 1) no full length mirror...weird and 2) the bathroom was not accessible from the bedroom. The fitness center was barely adequate... only two treadmills, an elliptical, free weights, and a very basic universal weight machine. The grounds were beautiful and well kept. The pools were really great. We don't have kids and wanted some peace and quiet, which we got at both of the end pools. (The middle pool attracts the kids with the slide, sandy beach, and waterfall.) It was never crowded at the pool, we always had our choice of chaise lounges. We found the chaise lounges really uncomfortable (no padding) and there was no way to secure a towel, which was problematic due to the serious wind some days. I was also annoyed that they did not have any chairs or chaise lounges for the beach. For this type of resort, I would expect these amenities. I also found it outrageous that they charge $25/day for the padded 2-seat cabana (which I never saw one person use) especially since the resort was nowhere near full. The pool attendants were very friendly and nice. However, one day the slide attendant screamed at a little child (no more than 6 y.o.) so loudly and angrily that literally everyone at all three pool areas heard him. I think the child was sitting on the end of the slide, which is dangerous, but this guy was really out of line. The parents were understandably quite upset. We liked Duke's a lot... the staff were awesome and the food was very good and not as pricey as other hotel restaurants. The mai tais were great! One weird thing: they closed for an entire day for the staff holiday party. We were pretty irritated by this since it is the only bar/restaurant onsite. We didn't get anything from the market inside, although everything looked good and not outrageously priced ($10 for sandwich + chips, which is about what you'd pay at a sit-down restaurant). They also had frozen meals, wine, beer, liquor, and other groceries as well as some cute gift items. There is a supermarket right across the street which was pretty good. I was able to find many items for about the same price as at home... look for specials! All things considered, we really enjoyed our stay and would definitely choose this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “The beauty of it hides the real problems...”
Reviews.Author: tphutch
Reviews.Content: First off the place is really gorgeous. The rooms are nice - the grounds beautiful - but that is a small part of any stay. They claim to be a 5* resort and certainly charge enough to warrant that but there's none of the expected benefits of a 5* resort. There are soooo many rules - and they're not afraid to give you warnings. Our big mistake was to leave a bathing suit over the back of a chair on our balcony over night. The horror of horrors!!! That warranted a warning note under our door the next morning. Want to bring a beer down from your room while you go to the pool? Nope - you'll be warned about that too. If you come back from dinner on a week day and want to go to Dukes for a nightcap with friends you'll be a little disappointed as it closes at 9:30PM. Really? a 5* resort where the ONLY restaurant/bar closes at 9:30?? We decided we'd maybe have that nightcap in our room - but wanted some soda. Nope - no vending machines. If you run out of coffee for the in suite coffee machine that'll be $5... It just seemed that they were doing everything they could do to take away the fun from our vacation. And frankly with the prices they charge I would think they'd go out of their way to make our stay more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we hoped it would be!”
Reviews.Author: CACountrygirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Honua Kai for 8 nights starting December 1st. We rented a privately owned studio room through Kaanapali Beach Rentals management company & our room was exactly as stated on the website. On the 8th floor, interior courtyard, great ocean view & pool view from our room. Studio room was a perfect size for two people & the full kitchen is great just for fixing simple breakfasts, snacks and light lunches even if you don't plan to do much cooking in general. Washer & dryer worked well and came in handy - dryers do take a long time to dry things though. Shower head was high enough for my tall husband and water pressure was great. Nice modern amenities/finishes throughout the room and bathroom. Decent bedding and comfortable bed and seating throughout the room. Underground parking was nice. We had wireless internet service that was only spotty a couple times. Lanai with door that opens completely was very nice to extend your living space. The grounds were immaculate and so beautiful. Tiki torches lit up everywhere at night added to the night time ambiance. We did find ashes on our lanai table one morning so someone above us was smoking one night but since it didn't happen again, we didn't bother reporting it - I'm pretty sure there is a no smoking policy even on their lanais. Duke's Beach House Restaurant was great the first night we ate there, was good for breakfast both times, and was just "ok" another night we were there. Overall, great restaurant and the ocean front setting and relaxed atmosphere was perfect. The little store/market in the lobby was great to pick up morning coffee or anything you might need that you don't feel like driving elsewhere for. The beach walk starts in front of Honua Kai and will continue all the way south to Black Rock - great for my early morning runs. I think it was between 2.6 and 3 miles round trip from Honua Kai to Black Rock maybe? Winds were pretty strong for three days, then died down completely for the final five days of our visit. Definitely enjoyed this area (less crowded) north of Black Rock over the crowds we witnessed at the resorts south of Black Rock. Lahaina is just a few short miles drive away. The water treatment plant/sewage smell everyone talks about? Well, we smelled it but never at the resort. It was no big deal to us though. We always smelled it while in the car on Hwy 30 right in front of several of the resorts on North Kaanapali beach & smelled it while walking on the beach walk between Honua Kai and the Westin Villas. Maybe depends on where your room is at as we didn't have any smell from our interior courtyard lanai or on the grounds or at Duke's. Would definitely stay here again & would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: sixsevendc
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 12 day stay at the Honua Kai Resort and spa ( no spa yet but it's coming). We arrived on the 23rd of November for an 11 night stay. When we arrived we were greated by friendly and helpful people that worked at the resort. My first impression was WOW. We walked into the lobby of the Konea tower build our home for the next two weeks. There were gentle breazes flowing through and you could see the ocean from the lobby. We checked in and were in our suite in no time. We had booked a two bedroom two bath ocean view until and the pictures of the units on line don't do the real thing justice. Our suite was on the 5th floor and had a huge lani that ran the length of our unit. The kitchen had new Bosch appliances and the stove was so new it had never been used. Eatch bedroom had a master bath that was connected and had a large deap soaking tub and a stand up shower and marble floors and counter tops. The resort is really large and has 4 large swimming pools and several hot tubs and even a water slidge that I fell in love with ( it brought out the child in me). I was concered first when I saw comments about out of control children but I'm happy to report that I didn't find that. The beach is a few years away from the pools but it's not the best if you want to swim in the ocean since there is to much coral but there was a nice swimming beach about a 10 min walk down the path. We had dinner at Dukes and it was very good. The service was amazing and when we left we each got a big hug from Liz the front desk clerk. By the end of our stay I felt like we were all family and I can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Honua Kai - BEST Resort in kaanapali”
Reviews.Author: munchsmom
Reviews.Content: My family with our two young children along with their grandparents stayed in a 2-bedroom condo in the Hokulani building for two weeks. We were so sad to leave, as it was a fabulous family vacation, mostly due to the magnificent Honua Kai!!! Simply put, the resort is gorgeous and immaculately clean. Even after two weeks I was still awe struck with the beautiful grounds every time I wondered the resort. The variety of pools are great. We spent the majority of time at the lazy river pool. My 3 year old adored it! The hot tubs were lovely as well. The evening ambience of the resort is really enhanced by the torches lining the walkways. Dukes restaurant turned out to be our favorite restaurant to dine at after trying multiple restaurants in both lahaina and whalers village. So nice to have it on site for take out or eating lunch poolside! Prices are great too! The grocery store across the street is handy and is within easy walking distance. The resort is close enough to drive into lahaina or whalers at a moments notice, yet secluded enough to be quiet and relaxing. We never once had noise or disruptions around the resort. The sunsets were gorgeous from our 7th floor lanai, as were the many rainbows we saw day after day. Of note, we did notice the smell from the sanitation plant nearby, but not often and not for more than 5 mins at a time. No big deal at all. If the honua kai smells is, so do the other hotels nearby. Our suite was huge and the lanai was massive too! We loved beingr able to cook in our room in the well outfitted kitchen, as it can get tiring eating out in Maui everyday. Not a huge number of restaurants. We checked out a few other resorts while there including the westin, westin villas next door, Marriott villas, and the sheraton. NONE of them even came close to the honua Kai. The beach is the most beautiful golden sand and lots if it. The water is very pretty too. Didn't swim so can't comment on that, but others were swimming in it. The pools were so nice that we swam there all the time. The pools could be a tad warmer in my opinion. My only complaint is about the wind. There were days that were so windy you couldn't enjoy yourself outside at the Honua Kai. Drive up to whalers and the wind was nearly gone. Apparently is has to do with a funnel In between the mountains at that spot. Nonetheless, many days were hot without a breath of wind. I would return to Maui simply to stay a the Honua Kai again, and only would stay at the Honua Kai. Its that nice!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent grounds, rooms, and amenities, but internet a bit spotty.”
Reviews.Author: Tracy_CY_T
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Honua Kai for seven days in late November. We were first time visitors to Maui so didn't know much about location/covenience to activities since we had not booked any excursions or planned what to do in advance. We booked the accommodations through Costco which offered a package for 7 nights plus a car rental which we thought was good value since a car in Maui is a must. Here is a summary of our likes and dislikes: LIKES: This hotel is new and the grounds are immaculately clean and well looked after. The rooms are exactly as shown on the website and are clean, modern and well stocked with high quality appliances and cooking supplies. There are thoughtful amenities such as several gas barbecue pits on the grounds. Knowledgeable and friendly concierge. The MOST AMAZING BEDS we have ever slept on. I have never slept better. Smart layout of the pool and hot tub areas means that there are several pools and hot tubs spread out around the grounds instead of one large pool in the centre of the property. DISLIKES Spotty internet service. On our first two days we had to call a 24 hour help desk because the wireless and the wired access only worked when we were outside on the lanai. Also an in house technician was supposed to come up to check the connection in our suite but never did despite the fact we were told someone would come. $25 resort fee is a pain but I guess that is the industry practice now. IN SUMMARY.... We really enjoyed the Honua Kai and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Simply stunning beach, clean rooms, great location - Highly Recommend!!!”
Reviews.Author: UNCCaliGirl
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 6-day stay at the Honua Kai Resort the week following Thanksgiving. The hotel is fairly new... its spiel is that it is luxury condo real estate in a luxury resort setting. The resort itself is simple and clean - nothing ostentatious or lavish - yet beautiful. The grounds are well-maintained with beautiful gardens and pools. We stayed in a studio suite with a partial ocean view from our lanai, though our "partial ocean view" was semi-obstructed by Duke's restaurant. Our room was spacious and, most importantly, very clean with a large, fully-equipped kitchen with Bosch appliances and a spacious (but plain) bath. The best part about our room, however, were the folding Nana doors that opened up to a large lanai with a breakfast table, seats, and a lounger... the lanais really are a selling point. The Honua Kai sits right on North Kaanapali Beach and boasts a fabulous beach with beautiful views of the islands of Lanai and Molokai as well as beautiful sunsets. The beach is really what I appreciated most about this hotel. We must've visited Maui at a really good time because the weather was perfect and it was certainly not overcrowded on the beach, particularly in front of the Honua Kai. It seemed like we practically had the beautiful beach to ourselves at times! The only downside, for those of you who care, is that they did not have any beach cabanas nor have any beach service with just beach chairs and umbrellas. We were told by the concierge and front desk that they don't have a license to put out chairs or umbrellas on the beach. We ended up purchasing beach chairs across the street at Times Supermarket. (They do, however, have poolside cabanas). The service at the hotel is above par, though not excellent. The staff is friendly enough. The Wi-Fi worked on our Macbooks the first day, however, it stopped working on the second day. When my bf asked the front desk about it, they had us call a 24-hr IT service for troubleshooting. After nearly 30 minutes on the phone with the help-desk, they were not able to figure out why WiFi wasn't working and I had to use the internet cable. My bf's WiFi worked most of the time, but was also occasionally hit or miss and noticeably stronger when the lanai doors were wide open. Our room was also a little on the warm side at night even with the use of the AC at night, set at 65 deg, its lowest setting. So if you require a cool room to get a good night's rest, be forewarned. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a simple, laid-back, West Maui luxury resort with a beautiful beach without the crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Accomodations with Resort Amenities”
Reviews.Author: roxian
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights after 5 nights on Waikiki Beach. I chose the Honua Kai based on Trip Advisor reviews and pictures. After seraching on VRBO and other online booking sites, I called the HK directly and inquired about their rates. I was told they do rent some units through vrbo and the rate was slightly less. I was very happy with the rate quoted and received good suggestions regarding room types, views, and locations. I was also given a list of the actual room #'s that were available during my stay so I could choose the exact room. I stayed in a studio, #837 Hokulani Tower. Location: I used the maps provided in Maui Revealed to get to the Honua Kai without any problems. No wrong or missed turns. It only took about 40-45 minutes from the airport and is in a quieter area. Although not right on the main part of the beach (near Black Rock), we didn't mind the location at all. No problem. We had a car and drove around daily. Check-In/Check-out: It was very quiet when we arrived although we were told the occupancy was quite high. Valet greeted us and helped unload luggage while I checked in. Front desk staff very nice and helpful. Fast, concise check-in. Bell staff took us to our room and explained various aspects of the room, including the AC system and the folding lanai doors. I agree with others who dislike the $25 resort fees being charged by many resorts but I was aware of it going in. And although the Outrigger Reef in Waikiki did not charge a resort fee, which I appreciated, I still got hit with a $25/day parking fee. The $25 resort fee at the HK does include parking, self-park or valet. We opted for valet (why not? you are paying for it) and tipped them daily as they retrieved the car. The valet staff was so nice. On our way to dinner one night, before retrieveing the car, the staff suggested we needed our piture taken. It was the best picture of us on our entire trip. They were very friendly, fast, and full of suggestions. Check-out took a little longer as I had to wait on change. There is a small business room to the left of the front desk where you can print boarding passes. For some reason, I got checked into my airline and although I told it to "print" my boarding passes never printed (the printer was turned on). We needed to head out quickly to finish some last minute shopping on the way to the airport so I did not ask for help with this. I suspsect at some point later in the day someone received multiple copies of my boarding passes! Room: Exactly as seen in the pictures. Very nice. And thank goodness for the washer and dryer since something exploded in my luggage on the way from Honolulu. The room was nice sized for 2 people. The bed and pillows were great. We did have a problem with our AC the first day but it was fixed immediately. It shuts off when you open the lanai door and you have to restart it every time. I think we could have survived without any air conditioning at all anyway. The folding lanai doors are very nice and easy to use. The balcony has table, 4 chairs and a lounge chair. It did get HOT on the balcony as this unit is on the side that receives sun all day long. The kitchen supplied everything you would need. You can tell the rooms are practically brand newThe bathroom was nice with separate tub and shower. This particular unit (and I imagine all in this stack) has a larger bathroom sink/counter area than others. I was happy with the extra room for toiletries. The safe was in the owner's closet. It was not locked down, however, so someone could walk away with it if they wanted to. The view from the room was just as the pictures showed. We liked being on the higher floor. The elevators were always quick. You could hear some noise from below if anyway was being semi-loud down on the ground or out on their balcony. The u-shaped design of the buildings lends itself to some echoing. It was bad and I never heard anything when we had the balcony door shut. I never heard anything from other rooms or the hallway the entire time. Housekeeping: GREAT! Since we booked with the resort, daily housekeeping was included. This was supposed to be a minimal service daily with extra cleaning every 3rd (or 4th?) night. Well, we got a complete cleaning everyday, even doing the dishes for us. We did tip them a few dollars daily and it was well worth it. We asked for extra detergent/drier sheets on the first night and received it right away. One day they didn't even take their tip. Never had that happen before. They deserved for cleaning our dishes every day! Grounds: The grounds were immaculate. The pools were plentiful and gorgeous. We thought they were quite cool, it would be nice if they were heated. And if I had my way, I would remove the grassy courtyards and convert those areas to more pools, one flowing to the next with a swim-up bar maybe. Then it really would be perfect here! And I would suggest some music playing, lightly, around the pool area. It was windy with extreme winds a couple of times. It only lasted a short while but you had to hang on to everything. I noticed the smell once and wouldn't have paid any attention to it if it hadn't been mentioned on here. I was in the front of the building waiting on the valet when I noticed it. The beach is beautiful and if it is too rocky for you, move over a few feet. The lot next door is empty and next to that is a public access beach (before you get to the Westin). And the snorkeling in front of this area is great. We saw more coral (even spotted eagle rays) here than any other place we snorkeled in Maui. I do think they should include the beach chairs in the resort fee (as should all resorts). Small things like that are how you can keep repeat visitors and keep your resort sold out (although I'd like to keep it all to myself). We ate once at Duke's for lunch. It was good and we recieved a coupon for a free Hula pie when we checked-in. They did have live music in the evenings. Friday night it was packed. A lot of people had lawn chairs out next to Duke's listening to the music before sunset. We used the grills one night. There is a notice asking you not to linger in the grill area (no more than 30 minutes? I cannot remember the exact time). We thought it would be nice if they had an area to eat down by the grills but I understand why they don't want a lot of congregating. In summary, we had high expectations going in and the HK did not disappoint. I chose the resort and made all the arrangements with my travel partner going in blind. He was very impressed and happy with my choice of the Honua Kai. When we return to Maui we will stay here again. As long as the rates are within our budget we won't even look anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and resort.Beautiful beach but a bit rocky in the water.”
Reviews.Author: Bear013
Reviews.Content: Great access to restaurants and extended resort area.Grocery store nearby.Room and beds were fantastic.Nanawall system opens the living area fully to the lanai which was great! Value is good especially if you use the pool and fitness and other resort amenities.We did not really use the pools but families with children would make great use of them. Overall experience was fantastic.The beach immediately outside the resort and for a little ways north and south is pretty rocky(not the beach which is beautiful sand but rather into the water)so its good for snorkeling but not that great for swimming and boogie boards

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Islandlover30
Reviews.Content: This place has it all. I'm almost tempted not to say how great it is because I want the place all to myself! Duke's restaurant is on the resort. Everything is First class here...you cannot go wrong!

Reviews.Title: “TOO MANY YOUNG CHILDREN!”
Reviews.Author: cheryl105
Reviews.Content: Honua Kai is a great facility...however...we booked a bachelore suite with partial ocean view...told us there were none available upon arival (which seemed odd as at night there were very few lights on rooms and appeared less than 1/2 full) so they charged us for the upgrade...full ocean view...usually if a room booked is not available...hotel should absorb upcharge! If you go as a couple...be prepared for ALOT of children! Most of which are running around pools unsupervised...alot of yelling...even in evenings when u r trying to eat dinner on your balcony...they are out playing hide and seek...jumping all over furniture...hopping over rocks in ponds...throwing flip flops over balconys. Very suprised for this calibre of resort to allow such behaviour...you don't see adults being loud and obnoxious! You would think you were in Orlando at a hotel near disneyworld. Numerous infants floating around in pool. Definitely not a quiet adult resort...felt more like a holiday inn atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “great condo resort, a little out of the way but worth it.”
Reviews.Author: dethman
Reviews.Content: stayed at honua kai for a week in november. we stayed in the new konea building, our one bedroom condo seemed brand new, with stainless steel appliances, granite countertops, washer/dryer, and comfy bed. all amenities were in the condo to enjoy our stay, including dishes, silverware, pots, pans, laundry detergent, dish detergent, sponge, etc. also gave us two small bags of coffee which were great. didn't have to think about it which was great. the second building seemed pretty empty, throughout the week i think i only rode in the elevator with another guest once or twice, and never saw anyone in the hallways. building 1 was a bit busier. resort area is nice, there are a number of small pools but no really huge one. i was able to teach my fiancee snorkeling without any kids splashing around or anything crazy like that. one thing to be a bit disappointed about might be the beach, it's not as nice as the areas around the sheraton or westin further south on ka'anapali beach. supposedly the shallow waters were easier to cut your feet up if you stood so i never ventured into the waters. grocery store right across the street from the konea building. customer service was pretty good, everyone seemed friendly and willing to help. i guess the only negative would be that everytime i wanted to do something, i found myself driving away from honua kai, whether it be shopping at whaler's village, snorkeling at black rock, playing golf at royal ka'anapli, eating at leilani's, or my luau at the sheraton. i guess that's the case with most places in maui, but if i had been staying in the prime ka'anapli area, i probably could have walked there to all those places. duke's was okay. it wasn't very busy, the food was decent, and the waiter was so so. overall, we enjoyed the room so much the location didn't bother us in the end. it was nice to come back to a 'home' away from home. oh, one more thing that bugged me. stupid $25/day resort fees. hard to get away from them but i think this is the biggest scam in the hotel business these days.

Reviews.Title: “Love the facilities, a dream to stay at...”
Reviews.Author: JodyTWI
Reviews.Content: We rented a 3 BR/3BA condo and absolutely loved our stay at Honua Kai. The pools, the beach and abundance of fish... the grills by the pool area. Everything was fantastic. We couldn't have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best ever”
Reviews.Author: amadortravel
Reviews.Content: I travelled with family and had a 2 bedroom ocean view unit. I have been to Hawaii over 30 times and this is one of the best properties I have ever stayed in. It is a little hard to find because of the lack of signs and there are 2 towers so unless you know which tower you are in you will have to stop at the first tower and ask. The property is immaculate and oceanfront. There is a choice of several pools and an area especially for kids. Our room was on the 5th floor and had a wonderful view of the ocean and the garden/pool area. The very large lanai had an unobstructed view because the railing was glass. There is a large patio table with chairs and a couple of comfy lounge chairs. One of the bedrooms has a door that opens up to the lanai. One of the best features of the living room is the glass doors that open to the lanai. They are designed to fold back so you have total unobstructed access to the lanai. It was great because there was always a nice breeze. The kitchen was amazing with granite counters and high-end appliances plus a washer and dryer. Bathrooms have glass enclosed showers plus a separate deep soaking tube. The sink countertops are also granite. There were king-sized beds in each room. They were a little soft for me but our other family members loved them. Both bedrooms and the living room had big screen TVs. The property has a little gourmet deli/store that will deliver to your room. At the front of the property is Dukes restaurant. I didn't eat there so I can't tell you about the food. There is also a very cute childrens playroom with all kinds of activities. They do have a fee but well worth it. They also will have a spa but it was not open yet. Everything about the property is first-class. The staff is very friendly and the place is spectacular. The units are for sale but it is not a time-share. It is pretty pricey but they are running a special at 50% off the rate plus the 5th night free. That won't be forever but if you want a very special vacation then stay here. You won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location & service for business conference”
Reviews.Author: surfit2
Reviews.Content: Our organization had a 5 hour workshop presentation in one of the Honua Kai conference rooms and the attendees loved the location and service. Seating up to 35 people, in a quiet room with helpful staff in organizing the set-up for our presentation. During the lunch break we enjoyed our Duke's Restaurant catered buffet food in the tropical outdoor patio with large Koi fish ponds and sleek outdoor furniture. This NEW oceanfront resort featured beautiful pools, boutique deli/store and Duke's Restaurant . Great for family or corporate travel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort meets functionality”
Reviews.Author: heatheratkins
Reviews.Content: The drive from Kahului airport to the Honua Kai was approximately 45 minutes. Liz and Romeo warmly greeted us at time of check-in, giving us a brief overview of the resorts features and amenities. We were then promptly escorted to our Ohana Ocean View studio/condominium in the brand new, beautifully appointed Konea Tower. Just as expected, our condo was spacious, clean and featured a full, state of the art kitchen complete with granite countertops and stainless steel fixtures and appliances. Floor to ceiling custom nana wall doors opened to our personal lanai (balcony) and offered spectacular views of neighboring island, Lanaâ€™i. An amply equipped fitness facility on the ground level of the Konea Tower proved to be useful on more occasion than one. Miles of oceanfront pathways are also great for a jog or leisurely walk. The â€˜Aina Gourmet Market (in the Hokulani Tower) is stocked with an enticing array of specialty, organic and locally grown grocery items perfect for stocking your cabinets with both necessities and perhaps a guilty indulgence or two. 100% Maui Coffee drinks, a quality selection of herbal and caffeinated teas, breakfast, lunch, dinner, and snacks are available for take-out all day. A refreshing beverage from their fresh juice and smoothie bar is an imperative part of your afternoon visit to the pool. There were times when we would take drives up and down the coast to see just how good of a decision we had made with our chosen accommodation. In the end it was concluded that no superior alternative to the Honua Kai exists for miles and miles. As far as condos go, I felt that we had chosen the very best. Many of the hotels along the coast were dated and noticeably past their prime. I also was slightly put off by the touristy vibe emanating from certain areas of the island. It could have just been a slow week at our resort, but I didnâ€™t feel as saturated in touristy ignorance as in other areas nearby. We found the Honua Kai to be a wonderful choice for the traveler in search of a home away from home. The pool facilities are great for the whole family and miles of sandy beach access are ideal for a host of water activities.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to stay on Maui (Konea 301)”
Reviews.Author: beeclean
Reviews.Content: My family (Wife, 4&6 y/o kids, wifes parents) spent 5 great nights at Honua Kai. We rented directly from a management firm and not the property since we wanted to be sure we got the location we wanted. Konea 301 is an ocean front 2 BR unit. We all fit comfortably during the day , and used the pullout for the little ones at night. 301 has outstanding furnishings with all the amenities you would expect in this price range. Being on the end certainly added a nice amount of exclusivity, and made relaxing on the lanai quite pleasant with beautiful views of the water. The property has a very 'resort' feel to it. We have stayed at condos before (see my earlier reviews) and this property was much different. There is poolside service offered from Dukes, concierge service, tiki torches, and just general helpfulness at every turn. Oddly, there are no complimentary beach chairs. There is a stack of them at the edge of the property yet they are chained together. We were told that they were $10/day rentals. We never saw one used during our stay. Positives: New property = latest technology in rooms Comfortable environment Great snorkeling right in front Grocery store across street Well equipped fitness center Mulitple pool options Negatives: Not renting from property. (I commented, and they are attempting to rectify) 1. No kids camp 2. No room charging 3. No ability to print boarding passes No spa (yet) Intermittent sewage smell New property = still getting the kinks out Overall, we were thrilled with this property and will stay here again. The Konea '01' stack is decadent and well worth the extra money. Note: 1. The courtyard area off the lobby's scream for a casual bar. Hopefully they will find somebody to open one. 2. The Konea tower lobby is the second left off the highway (you'll thank me later)

Reviews.Title: “I don't give many 5's but this one deserves 6's!”
Reviews.Author: beav16
Reviews.Content: We kept seeing ads for this relatively new condo resort on North Ka'anapali beach on Maui. Looked intriguing, especially since they were offering condos for the grand opening of a new part of the property for the same price (or less) than a regular hotel room. The great service started the minute I pulled up to check-in and never stopped. I was given the proper directions to the free underground self-parking. Check-in was seamless and I was even given an upgrade! When we opened the door to the room, our jaws dropped. This was larger than some people's apartments! The kitchen was gorgeous with Bosch appliances and granite countertops. There were 3 flat-screen TVs - one in the living room and one in each of the two bedrooms. This was a 2 BR/2 BA unit. The beds were very comfortable. There were ceiling fans in each room. There was also air-conditioning! That is hard to find in beach-front condos in Hawaii! The lanai was so large that it accomodated a dining table for 6 and 2 other chairs. When out on the lanai there was a nice view of the ocean. Looking straight ahead was an inner courtyard. The pool was further towards the ocean so this made it quieter than lots of other properties. We received calls from both the front desk and the concierge just a short-time after we settled in (a nice touch.) Everyone on the staff is friendly and helpful. Nice to have the parking, internet, and free local and toll-free calls included in the $25 resort fee. There is an organic bakery in the lobby which is quite well stocked. There are fitness centers in each tower (the one in the newer tower is nicer and better equipped). In the tower where we were, there was also a kids club and just by the pool was a Duke's restaurant and bar. We went down there almost every night and had a lava flow while watching the sunset. (we were in withdrawl over this when we got home!) I only had a few suggestions to make this perfect. The staff received them well and actually said two of the three were already being worked on. Wow. A place that really does care about the quality of the customer's stay. Just across the field there is a grocery store, a few restaurants and other things you may need. We do stock up at Costco on our way from the airport though. You can stay at a great property and still save on the provisions. They also have a computer with a printer down by the front desk so you can print out your boarding passes when it sadly comes time to leave! I will defintely be back and will definitely recommend this place to others. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “I didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: Soozelander
Reviews.Content: I just stayed for 3 nights in the Honua Kai and loved it! The grounds were gorgeous, it didn't even seem real! The pictures I took of the grounds that I brought back looked like postcards! Views are amazing no matter where you are at in the hotel. There are 2 properties in the Honua Kai which is great because that means there are even more grounds that has multiple pools to choose from not to mention a water slide and 2 small waterfalls. The Duke's restaurant on the grounds is fantastic! Everyone gets the tropical drinks from there and enjoys them while sunning. The rooms are fantastic, so roomy and because the hotels brand new all the Bosch appliances are also brand new. We stayed in a 2-bedroom suite. The master was huge! These rooms are enormous! The amenities are also fantastic, there's a nice basket when you get there filled with soaps from Hawaii and you are allowed to take it with you when you go. Our balcony was a shared one and it was huge! Every morning we had lunch out there. We certainly saved on dining out by going to the grocery which is within walking distance and just cooking in the room. The Honua Kai is really into promoting all things grown locally and even their coffee is non-profit with the proceeds going to the Poor and Unreached through Global Hope Network Intertational. There is a nice shop on the first floor called Aina Gourmet Market which has snacks and souvenirs. Kimmy at concierge was fantastic and all the bellhops and employees were nice as can be! I did not want to leave, this was one of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed at. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “beachfront luxury”
Reviews.Author: BlondeMomma
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a short trip to Maui. While staying at the Honua Kai Resort we were treated so well by all staff members. Our 2 bedroom ocean view room was more than spectacular. The many pools and the way the chairs are set out by the pool is wonderful! There are two dining options on the hotel property. 1. The local deli/market downstairs 2. Dukes beachfront dining (or Dukes poolside service) The hotel is about 5 minutes from the main beach of Kaanapali and another 5 minutes or so to Lahaina. Not only will I be coming back with my extended family in the very near future but I also plan on booking my clients at this location when they ask me where they should stay (I am a travel agent)...also, if you plan to stay here check with Kimmy @ the concierge desks for incredible discounts on island activities. Please feel free to email me if you have any questions or want to book at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tripper096
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March 2010. Have stayed on all the islands, Kauai last year, Big Island, and stayed at the Marriott in Wailea last time we were here in 2003. We typically have stayed at Marriotts, but got a great deal renting directly from the owner for an oceanview room. Definitely want an oceanview, makes a big difference. This was hands-down one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at. Gorgeous hotel, brand new with amazing spacious rooms, close to Lahaina with lots of dining options. Pools were great, Duke's was good as well. Cons would mainly be that the beach in front of hotel is quite rocky with lots of coral reefs, wouldn't feel comfortable lettlng children play out there unless you travel with a lot of bandaids. My husband (not a child, at least not chronologically) managed to scape himself up pretty good. Also, it was very windy the week we were there, which may happen at that time of year from what I understand. Windy to the point beach umbrellas were being uprooted and it was hard to sit and read a book. Still way better than the dreary weather at home, which is what we were going for. Anyway, overall a great place. Would love to go back again, but the prices may by skyrocketing from what I've seen!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: MsLydia
Reviews.Content: Luxury accommodations and beautiful landscaping. Not, too crowded, and had a place for everyone....singles and families. I would have given it 5 stars all around, but the maid needs to be tipped every day, not every other day for a good job.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay with young family!”
Reviews.Author: AKFamTravel
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed in a 2 bdrm / 2 bath partial ocean-view room in early October. We rented directly through the resort. Our view was beautiful, overlooking the neighboring resort and the ocean. We were very surprised at how sweet the unit was!!. The lanai was fabulous with the wall of folding doors opening to the outside. It was a great design feature and kudos to the designer on that one.. A table for 6, and two additional lounge chairs, made it relaxing to eat and lounge outside. We had daily housekeeping which was minimal, but they kept us in new towels and dishwasher detergent. The interior was all nice - Bosch appliances, comfy beds and linens. The pool areas are really to die for, clean and family friendly. There was always a chair for our towels, and a great layout to the pools and hot tubs. My kids loved the waterfall pool and waterslide. The staff was attentive - from the towel cabana to the front desk everyone was helpful and nice. We DID smell the sewage treatment plant a couple of times during our 2 week stay ( in the evening when it was windy and coming from that direction). I'm not usually the one to notice that stuff, but do think that it's worth mentioning - but I also think all of the resorts in that area have the potential to notice it. I will definitely come back here on our next stay in Maui. Our stay here made the vacation very luxurious, relaxing and memorable.....What a truly amazing resort!

Reviews.Title: “Every bit as wonderful as you have heard”
Reviews.Author: cgm95
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our first trip to Hawaii. The trip was great and this resort is a large part of the reason why. The rooms are spacious and complete with everything you need: it's like renting a small apartment. The grounds are spotless, the staff friendly and helpful, the ocean just steps away. I have a few complaints, but they are minor. 1: The onsite food store is very expensive. You can walk or drive to a store nearby for provisions. There is a really nice restaurant on property, but it is also pretty pricey. 2: The resort is really close to the airport, but pretty far from everything else. We liked this isolation, but some people may not. 3: The television signal and the wireless signal kept dropping out for about five minutes at a time. Not a huge problem, but it was annoying. Otherwise, everything was spot on.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl29987
Reviews.Content: The accomadtions are spacious, the property and pools are awsome and the staff is great. We ate at Dukes and I am very picky when it comes to eating out and this place exceeded my expectations. This place is wonderful!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing vacation”
Reviews.Author: luvmickey
Reviews.Content: We returned to Maui to celebrate our wedding anniversary by renting a one bedroom condo at Honua Kai (from the owner). We were actually sad to leave this beautiful property! The beds were comfortable, the kitchen is very nice, and the grounds are gorgeous. Although the one bedroom condo has a sofa bed, I think it would be a bit tight for a family of four, unless the kids were little. But, it is much larger than a regular hotel room, and you do get more bang for your buck. Plus, the added features of underground parking, a washer and dryer and full kitchen. The only drawback was the occasional smell from the treatment plant, dependent upon the wind direction. We just closed the doors of the condo, or moved to a different spot at the pool. Also, they haven't built the "spa" so it's really just Honua Kai Resort. Because this property is so new, it was not very crowded and this was a nice way to enjoy our vacation. The boardwalk is wonderful, Times Market is across the street, Duke's Restaurant is on site, it's close to other hotels and Lahaina that this makes it a perfect destination. I would definitely recommend Honua Kai to family and friends, you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Great new Condo/Hotel with Resort Hotel Feel”
Reviews.Author: outof714
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 6 nights with family and in-laws at the Honua Kai. We stayed in a wonderful 2 bedroom corner in the Konea Tower. Everything felt (and is) new at this property. The state of the art Bosch kitchen was a great plus with a toddler. We did the Costco and Safeway runs shortly after arriving. The unit is spectacular as we had a wrap around lanai that provided great sunset views. The windows are floor to ceiling and are a nanawall system that opens up the lanai completely to open up the living room. True Hawaii living with the outside coming inside. It almost doubles the living space. Beds, sofas and lanai furniture was all top notch and comfy. We did rent from a private party and not the hotel itself. The staff still treated us great and gave us a wristband at the pool. Speaking of the pools, they were great for our little 2.5 year old. He made all kinds of friends at the sandy bottom kids pool. Great thing is, most of the pools were 3-5 feet at most so it was easy to carry him around and catch him jumping in. The beaches were beautiful but not the best swimming beaches. I saw one guest get cut from coral after jumping in at sunset. It is a great walking beach and the sunsets there were awesome. We did some fun sandcastle building on the beach so it is fun near the shoreline and my son was able to run back and forth in the shallow waves. i snorkeled 3 mornings and found it great right in front of the hotel, but even better the more South you go towards Black Rock and in front of the Westin. We did eat at Dukes and its a great place for a sunset dinner. The food was really good, but Happy Hour was lacking in regards to the drink special selection. Not one Hawaii brewery on you Happy Hour list? I find that just not right for a place named after a Hawaiian icon. Even though we cooked and grilled (on Viking grills!) on property, We did get the chance to eat out. Suggest the Gazebo in Napili for breakfast and if youre a sushi fiend, you have to go to Sansei in either Kihei or Kapalua. Don't miss Aloha Mixed Plate too. Cheap local grinds and scenery to die for. Good happy hour starting at like 2pm with surprisingly great mai tais! Honua Kai is a short drive to Lahaina and Kaanapali, but far away enough form that hustle and bustle. The path in front allows you to walk (a long one!) all the way to Whalers Village and the south Kaanapali area. If you have a family or group of friends that wants a resort feel, and doesn't mind cooking in a few nights with cocktails on the lanai, you can't go wrong with this great property! Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “DON'T BELIEVE THE BAD REVIEWS”
Reviews.Author: RGRGATWORK
Reviews.Content: I don't know what those people are smoking that come with complaints about Honua Kai. There are no surprises, including the $25 daily resort fee. There is maid service everyday, and they warn you that a thorough cleaning is every few days, not everyday. There is not millions of staff roaming the property which would be overkill because the real treat about this property is that it is very resort-LIKE but condo comfortable. You can live as "sloppy" as you prefer on vacation and yet have access to high-end appliances to cook or clean or dishwash your own mess on your own timeline. The maid service won't do it for you so there is no surprise around this. You also don't lose mounds of tip money each day which would easily happen at a 5-star resort if staff had to take care of your every move. Our 3-year old enjoyed the Family Fun Club and was the only child that the morning while we went and surfed. A good deal for $30 if you ask us as he had the full attention of the child care manager. I would recommend a 1st floor courtyard facing room if you have toddlers like us. The Lanai-style opening doors really made it fun to watch our toddlers play on the patch of patio grass that comes with a first floor room while watching the other guests stroll by, and not have to worry about traveling daily via elevator. We loved this place - it was comfortable, clean, quiet, not in the heart of Kanaapali and Lanai and definitely not tore up like those high-traffic tourist spots. Be sure to check on the next phases of construction and the start dates. Looks like they're ready to start that up again as they enhance and expand which is only a good thing for us next year when we hope to return. Enjoy future Honua Kai guests. You'll love it here!

Reviews.Title: “"In my Top 5"!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rlbAtlanta
Reviews.Content: Let me just start by saying, I am a travel agency owner of 13 years and I have traveled the world and by far this resort is in my "Top 5"!!! I am sooooooooooooooo very picky and I absolutely, positively loved this resort, the relaxation, and the wonderful staff. This was a fabulous surprise because I was very tempted to stay somewhere else, but I am sooooooooooo glad that I tried it out. I did transfer to another well known brand hotel for a few days in Wailea and became Very depressed. As a matter of fact, my depression started when I was packing my things up to depart from this hotel. We did not want to leave for nothing in the world. Because of this wonderful experience, I am now looking into spending from 2 weeks up to 6 months there very soon (leaving within the next 2 weeks). I did not expect this at all and NO I am not getting paid to say none of this. As a matter of fact, I don't usually write reviews, but when something stands out to me, such as this...........I can't help myself!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Thanks so much Honua Kai!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok I will admit that when I made the...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ok I will admit that when I made the reservation I was worried I am picky and hard to please I like high class places and realy was thinking of staying at one of the other hotels on the island. But we took the chance and it paid off the place was great just like the pictures online the rooms wonderfully top of the line Bosch appliance and a open glass Lani ( patio) three wonderful pools. Great maid service and all around nice people.

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Nickris
Reviews.Content: The Honua Kai is amazing. This was my first trip to Maui and I can't wait to go back. The hotel was amazing - super clean, staff was amazing just an overall super experience. There are 2 areas to stay in this resort and I would recommend the newer side but for the life of me can't remember the name. Just being able to open your windows (which is actually your wall) is the most amazing thing. I honestly can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “New Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: joyeslee
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Resort. A bit further from the action on front street but within driving distance. The hotel is very new, but on the northern side of Lanai. We didn't mind since it was our honeymoon and it was nice and quite. Room was very comfortable. It felt like a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: richterfam5
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect place to spend our 10th wedding anniversary! When others have asked how we enjoyed our trip, I keep saying the word "amazing"! The resort was very quiet and romantic. We stayed in a partial ocean view room that opened into the courtyard and our view was fabulous! The rooms were immaculate and beautifully decorated. The bed was very comfortable. We loved having a full kitchen. The grounds were beautiful. We enjoyed the pools and spa in the evening when the tiki torches were lit. From one of the spas, you get a perfect view of the sunset in the evening. So romantic! The staff was very friendly and welcoming. We can't wait to go back! Oh, one more thing - the coral is rough and can be too sharp to swim right in front of the resort. It wasn't a big deal to us, but I thought I would mention it. We enjoyed laying out on the beach in front of the resort and then when we wanted to snorkel or swim, we walked down a ways.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MaryKate55
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the Honua Kai to anyone visiting the Lahaina area of Maui. I recently stayed for a week to attend a conference and was impressed with the excellent service, quality amenities, and friendliness of the staff. The 3 BR, 3 Bath condo we stayed in was nicely furnished and had a great view. Duke's Restaurant on the beach had great food with a superb view ~ especially at sunset! I fell in love with Maui and will be back ~ next time with my husband for some R n R! :))

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem on paradise island. Shhh, don't tell too many people!”
Reviews.Author: Atlas81
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from Maui this week. We were pleasantly surprised by the beauty of this resort in person. We looked at other ratings on trip advisor and honestly were not disappointed by going in with such high expectations. First of all, the pics online do not do justice. Our room was only used once prior which was so great. We stayed in one bedroom suite with kitchen equipped with Bosch appliances. Even though you may not like to cook or buy groceries on vacations, you might change your mind! Maui is relatively expensive to eat out, not to mention mediocre food. The kitchen was spotless filled with every thing you would need: salad bowls, coffee maker, wine opener, dishwasher, washing machine and dryer. In addition, the linens were crisp, duvet and pillows very comfy. Our patio was overlooking one of the courtyards and made for romantic sunrise/sunset moments. It's located about 45 min from the airport and is quite accessible to the rest of island. You are minutes away from Front street ( big shopping area, night life and restaurants). The staff is friendly and helpful. The only thing that bothered us was the 25 usd per day fee which was added on to our bill ( ie . For towels, Internet, local calls, etc). I just felt that was a bit tacky to add on. It should have been in the original price. Also, their spa is not yet opened ( probably why they are only rated four stars instead of a deserving five!). You get a small discount by going over to the westin spa (5 min walk) which was quite good. Other than that, enjoy Maui by staying in this elegant, functional and romantic resort. Get here soon before more people find out about it . It truly is a hidden gem on paradise island.

Reviews.Title: “Girls week at the beach - all you could want”
Reviews.Author: Delta3MM
Reviews.Content: Our trip had 3 adult women and 3 college women. Our requirements were a 3 bedroom- 3 bath condo on the beach in the Kaanapali area. After lots of research, we selected the new Honua Kai complex - but it was out of our price range. So we waited until about 3 weeks before our arrival in off-season and started contacting owners and property managers. We got a great deal AND a great condo. We rented #201 in the Hokulani building. The condo is less than 2 years old and showed little sign of wear. The kitchen was well stocked - and we used it, cooking in 2 or 3 meals a day. The Viking gas cooktop was quite an experience. The oversized refrigerator held all of our fresh produce. And the wine cooler was useful for keeping the bear, water, and wine cool and at our finger tips. We moved the coffee pot onto the incredible wrap around lanai which overlooked both the pool (on the side) and the beach. This was definitely a beachfront condo. We would stumble out to the lanai each morning. Sip our Kona coffee and watch the surf, people, and wildlife jog by. Early after sunrise, the rainbows were stunning. Nearby are neighborhood fish stores, open air produce markets, and a grocery. We bought fresh fish and local produce. Grilled them on the lanai on the Viking outdoor gas grill. The outdoor kitchen was well used all week long. The ONLY complaint is the lovely Maui wind that strengthens after sunset. The bedrooms and baths were large and luxurious. Well stocked with towles including beach towels. We used the stacked Bosch washer/dryer all week. There was no maid service but we didn't miss it. The complex has a property management company - and really wants you to rent thru their service. If you don't rent thru them, there are some limitations to services. The valet parking and pool-side linens are not offred to "3rd party renters". That was us. We did pay an additional $10 / night for self parking in an underground, secured deck with an elevator right up to our unit. There was no need for valet service. And we didn't need the pool-side linens as we had our own beach towels provided in the condo. The other service that was restricted was free internet to outside renters. Our unit included free wi-fi and it worked effortlessly. We were told that only one of the fitness centers was open for 3rd party renters but we didn't test it. Your condo key was supposed to open the fitness door. Overall, we loved the location, the amenities, the luxury, and the quiet. This complex hasn't yet been "found" and doesn't have a recurring set of regulars. I regretted the attitude to 3rd party renters - they should be focused on getting the complex popular regardless of the source!! Market share!! But after arrival, it was actually something we laughed at and ignored. We highly recommend Honua Kai if you're self sufficient yet want luxurious surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Deserted Island”
Reviews.Author: hallfarr
Reviews.Content: We were on the 3rd floor on the inside of the 'original' bldg (2b/2b) with a beautiful view of the ocean as well as pool and Duke's. We ate a few times at Duke's - breakfast and dinner. Prices are reasonable if you don't want to travel outside the hotel area and the food was pretty good. The views from Duke's are just as exceptional as from our room. The beach/surf was great - calm and the sunsets are just breath taking. The most amazing part of our trip was that at no one time could I count seeing 20 people in one area....the place was deserted!!! Our bellhop told us that September is usually a "slow" month, but we had almost all the pools to ourselves!!! It was absolutely fantastic! Can't wait to go back - especially in September!!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise by the ocean”
Reviews.Author: kmatusic
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a wonderful week here in September. Everything about this resort -- the rooms, the common areas, the pools, the location, the service -- is wonderful. It is by the far the most beautiful resort in Kaanapali!

Reviews.Title: “Excellence Service, luxurious, spacious and fully equipped Condo!!!”
Reviews.Author: tahoek
Reviews.Content: I recently had the good fortune with my husband to an invitation for a site inspection at the Honua Kai, the Red Umbrella Getaway. We stayed 3 days in a 2bd/2bath oceanview room that met every expectation. The Resort is a beautiful 38-acre oceanfront setting in North Kaanapali, that has luxurious, spacious and fully equipped accomodations including a hugh lanai that opens to expand your living area. They offer studio, 1 bedroom, 2 bedroom and 3 bedroom units, with top of the line appliances, including washer and dryer. Fully equipped kitchens, big screen tv's and beautiful furnishings. The grounds offer 3 pools, water slide, sand beach area for a great family vacation. It is also home to Duke's Restaurant. Great food, great fun. The Staff and Management are exceptional. Thank you Dave for the very informative tour, Lance for explaining the importance of Sustainability that the Honua Kai follows. They met our every need, even the lovely lady that delivered ice to our room. Thank you all for a lovely experience. If you are looking for a memorable family vacation with family and friends, and want to experience the "Maui Ohana" and warm hospitality, try the innovative Honua Kai. Our stay there for our anniversary was great! We can hardly wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “The Best hotel I've ever been!”
Reviews.Author: Guy2bd
Reviews.Content: Everything was absolutley perfect! Great staff, excellent service. Beautiful and very relaxing place!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Honua Kai and can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: JKLawson
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my new husband and I on our Honeymoon and 1st trip to Maui. As we got off the plane and drove the 45 minutes to the hotel we were both a little nervous about finally seeing where we would be staying. Soon as we pulled up to the lobby all of our nerves quickly disappeared. Upon walking into our room (a partial ocean view ohana on the 7th floor), we were greeted with an excellent view of the ocean and all the greenery of the property.
