The room had an open floor plan with a sitting area and fully-equipped kitchen. The bathroom had new granite counter tops, as well as a washer/dryer combo in the neighboring closet. The highlight for us, was the lovely patio space with doors which completely opened up to welcome the Hawaiian breeze. Our goal for staying at the Honua Kai was relaxation from work and the previous stress of the wedding. The 3 pool areas with lounge chairs, expansive Ka'anapali Beach, and calm ocean for snorkeling/swimming was the perfect way to do this. Overall, we had a fantastic time and hope to come back soon!

Reviews.Title: “An incredible place that made my vacation unforgettable.”
Reviews.Author: adeknevage
Reviews.Content: The resort was one of the most gorgeous places I have ever stayed at. Everything about the place was top-notch. The room was beautiful and equipped with everything you would need in the full kitchen and bath. The room opened up to a large balcony where we could eat our meals. We were given a gift basket with laundry detergent (to use in the washer and dryer located in the studio!), dish soap, dish washer detergent, sponge, and kitchen towels. There was a free bag of coffee grinds sitting next to the coffee machine, which I enjoyed every morning. The staff was extremely friendly and provided excellent service. The room service even included loading and running our dirty dishes in the dish washer while we were relaxing by the pool! The grounds are beyond imaginable, with a lazy river that you can float down, aqua loungers, a slide, many hot tubs, and waterfalls. Duke's Restaurant and an organic market offer delicious food. The smaller gym we went to was clean and up-to-date (and there's an even bigger gym in the other building that we didn't even go to!). The resort is located in front of a beautiful beach, and is close to all of the attractions in Lahaina and Kaanapali. We had some trouble finding the entrance to the resort because the sign is set back from the main road, but we managed to figure it out. All in all, an incredible place that made my vacation unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Best place along Ka'anapali beach”
Reviews.Author: DaddyVIN
Reviews.Content: Spacious rooms, high end, new construction condos yet service like any of the finest resorts. This is a great place for families.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for young children & alternative to small luxury hotel room or time shares”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel92679
Reviews.Content: With 2 small kids, we've outgrown a standard hotel room, so friends recommended Honua Kai (HK). On past trips to Maui, we've stayed up the road at the Ritz Carlton, or Four Seasons in Wailea. Coming from those 2 properties, we had high expectations for HK. Instead of paying $400-500 for a standard room at the Ritz, or FS, we got a beautiful 2 BR with lanai at HK, which was exactly what we needed. The pools, common areas, rooms are all up to par with the other 2 hotels mentioned. The service isn't bad, but since it's not primarily a full-service hotel, you're a little more "on your own" in terms of getting your own pool towels, setting it on a chair, or cleaning up your condo day-to-day. On the flip side, you now have a huge condo with a full kitchen and nice balcony, so it worked well for us. The restaurant, Duke's is great, but not for 7 nights in a row, so we went to some other local places, all about 5 min away. Duke's does offer poolside service for food & drinks, so this was wonderful and convenient! HK is perfect for families with small children, but I think honeymooners, or families with teenage kids would find it a little boring and lacking some of the "busy-ness" of a larger 5-star resort. I guess all things being equal, we would love to have a $1000 suite at the FS or Ritz, or 2 joining rooms (again, about $1000/nt) instead of HK, but for less than 1/2 of the price, this is a WONDERFUL alternative and I did not feel anything was really missing. I did not feel that spending more than twice the amount for equal accomodations at the Ritz or FS would have made our vacation "twice" as good, so I would recommend HK for families with small kids in lieu of the luxury hotels. Hands down, I would return to HK in the 2BR/2BA again instead of a single room at any luxury hotel, or a time share property

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Clean, Top-Notch Maui Condo is a MUST STAY!”
Reviews.Author: alohaLa
Reviews.Content: Honua Kai condominium complex was a wonderful place to stay on our visit to Maui last week. The facilities are extremely clean with breathtaking views. The staff are extremely friendly and hospitable. We really enjoyed having Duke's Restaurant directly on the premises. The organic restaurant/market in the lobby was wonderful. We really enjoyed the smoothies and breakfast burrito! The beach is accessible and quiet. The grounds are a tropical oasis! We are looking forward to our next stay.....Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Great place minus a few quirks”
Reviews.Author: AHM
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent place for people travelling with children who would like to have some amenities similar to home. We (extended family of 9) reserved this as part of a package via AAA. 1) Location: North Kanapali Beach. 10 min drive to Lahaina. This area is very windy and this year apparently has been windier than usual. Close to everything but not walking distance. 2) Buildings are new and well kept. There are two of them called H and K.This is really not a resort in the full sense. It is more of a condo-residence with some amenities of a hotel. There is front desk and a valet/bell and a minimarket in the building. But not a full service resort which was fine by us. 3) The entire place and even the pools were never busy/crowded. There was never a problem finding chairs by pool. We even met a family who moved out of Westin b/c of overcrowdedness. There is one pool that is not as big as some megapools you see at major resorts but was good for kids since it ranged from 3-4 feet at most. There were other minipools and some waterfalls etc spread further in the grounds between the two buildings. So there was never a problem of overcrowding. 4) Because of the building's design, most rooms face each other across a wide garden area with views of ocean from the balcony. The closer you were to the ocean, the more ocean you saw. Only certain units have uninterrupted views from inside. 5) we had rented via Honua Kai itself via AAA Travel as part of package. So our units came with housekeeping BUT in contrast to hotel style housekeeping, it was very limited at Honua Kai. They only tidied beds and took garbage out. Linens were changed every 3 days. No real cleaning such as vacuuming or wiping the counters in bathrooms or any adiditional cleaning. They are upfront about it. So that was a let down. A 5$ tip per day helped a bit but it was not spotless as you'd expect. (quirk 1) 6) Kitchens in the units are fully equipped with high end Bosch appliances which require a college degree to figure out the details. Plates and silverware and othe knickknacks were available too. Oddly enough, if you ran out of coffee: it would not get replaced for free. $5 charge (quirk 2) 7) Staff very friendly. Concierge, as with other places, lose interest in you if you are not buying something from them. (quirk 3) 8) Extra $25 per day for resort fee which covered discounted pool/beach equipment; wifi; parking etc. You'd think they won't charge that in this economy to promote a new hotel but they did. (quirk 4) 9) last quirk was that eventhough we had requested nearby rooms, they did not pre-arrange that (in contrast to our experience at Hilton Royal Palms in Myrtle Beach) Overall, I would have rated this place a 5 had it not been for these small but definitely annoying quirks. For a upscale place, you'd expect more.

Reviews.Title: “Honua Kai (Hokulani #514) was the best vacation of my life”
Reviews.Author: the_real_fonzy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I rented the Trinhâ€™s Honua Kai condo (Hokulani #514) for our honeymoon from August 12th to August 20th 2010. It was our first time to Maui and we regret nothing about renting this condo. We were blown with away every aspect of the condo and resort. The Honua Kai is a first class resort with all the amenities of a 5 star hotel. The 4 pools (all the reviews I read said 3 pools but I counted 4) were never crowded and we never had a problem finding open lounge chairs. There is an on-site restaurant. Dukes Beach House was nice and they also provide the poolside service. I also enjoyed the water slide even though my wife said I was too old for it. The beach right in front of the Honua Kai is beautiful; although we spent most of our time by the pool. Great restaurants and shopping are just a short drive away. The Whalers Village is about a 30 minute brisk walk or a $10 cab ride. I suggest the latter; especially in the dark. The condo itself was immaculate with everything we needed and the bed was so comfortable. It had all the comforts of home; stainless steel appliances, washer, dryer, cable HD TV, Wi-Fi, stand-up shower, Jacuzzi, double sinks, pool and beach accessories. I would like to extend a special thank you to the Trinhâ€™s for letting us rent their condo. There was an open line of communication through-out the rental process and while we were there. We canâ€™t wait until we go back. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, great pools, amazing rooms...highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: LosAngeles2007
Reviews.Content: Wow...Honua Kai...how do I miss thee? We truly can't wait to go back. We stayed in #742 (rented through VRBO - Jacki Motto and got a great deal) which is a 2 bedroom, 1 bath. The 2nd bedroom is technically a den but with doors enclosing it which worked great for our teen. The living room has a sofa sleeper which was used by our 3 year old and it was actually rather comfy. The main bedroom had a king size bed which was super comfortable and the pillows were awesome! The kitchen was fully stocked and we even cooked a few times. The kitchen/fridge was very helpful to have with children. The bathroom was AMAZING -- separate bath/shower, double sink, super large, etc. I loved having a washer and dryer in the room. The balcony was large and spacious with a large table to eat on and lounge chairs. The view from the balcony was just amazing. To your left, an amazing view of the beach and to your right a great view of the mountains; we saw rainbows daily on the mountain side. Just amazing! We ate at Duke's a number of times and their food inside is better than outside (when you go you will understand what I mean - can't remember what exactly they call it). Their mixed drinks were okay, could have been a bit stronger but they were acceptable. It's great that Duke's has pool service during the day too! When we were at the condo, it was definitely not at capacity. This made our stay super pleasant; no overcrowding like the condos just down the road that we saw on our walks. So I want to address a few things that I've read in previous reviews. First, the smell from the sewage plant. We were on the property for 7 nights and not once did we smell anything while on the property. As we drove out to the main highway, it did smell funky but NEVER while on property. We hung out at the pools and beaches daily and never smelled anything. Granted, it was windy so that may have helped push the smell elsewhere but I can attest to the fact that we never smelled anything while on property. Secondly, I read something about the property being dirty. No way! This place was immaculate. I saw people cleaning windows, vacuuming, fluffing pillows, etc. and never saw one piece of trash on the ground anywhere. They have an amazing pond with koi fish that my 3 year old loved. Lastly, the cleaning service / daily maid. If you rent from a private owner you will not get this daily maid service. Be aware of where you are renting from so that you know what to expect. You will get your maid service if you rent directly from HK and not from an individual or property management company. If you rent directly from HK you will pay a premium and you will get your maid service. We paid hundreds of dollars less by renting from an individual and I dealt with no maid service (not a big deal since we are rather clean people anyway). Yes, the front desk is for those that rent directly from HK but I felt we were treated no differently by anyone on property. Any issues I had I was asked to deal directly with the property manager that introduced to me upon check in. Bottom line, if you want to save $$ and I mean big $$$ rent from VRBO or a property management company. Our contract was clear on what we got and what we didn't get. I have to add the pools were AMAZING! We loved the water slide and the lazy river as well as the kids section of the pool. We had the most beautiful time in Maui and this condo complex completely impressed our family. We can't wait to go back. Thank you Honua Kai and Thank you Jacki for a great condo and great rental experience!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: joan6891
Reviews.Content: Beautiful!! Pool area and beach area great for kids, and adultss. Very clean, lots of chairs by pool, never had a problem getting one. Great lava flows at Duke's poolside service. Can't say enough about this place. The beach right by the pool is beautiful, and ther were humpback whales, right there. It is great.

Reviews.Title: “Hold on to your hats....expect to be Amazed”
Reviews.Author: OhanaVac
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Nikta's unit #622 for 1 week as part of our family vacation. I speak very highly of Nikta as she treats you like Ohana. The 2 bedroom / 2 bath with 3 flat screens TVâ€™s and fully equipped kitchen (Bosch appliance) was perfect for a family with hungry children. Make a run to Costco (next to Kahului airport), Safeway, or Times Supermarket to pick up groceries and BBQ right by the pool area. Once you open the front door, there were "special" treats surrounding the unit, from the fresh fruit in the refrigerator (a pineapple carved to perfection), to a bowl of island chocolate mac nuts and coffee, luxury soaps awaits you in the bathroom, to a closet full of beach gear. No need to purchase any boogie boards, beach chairs, ice cooler, umbrella, or buckets for building sand castles. She thought of everything to bring to the beach, such a wonderful gem. The property has beautifully appointed amenities, 3 large "fresh water" pools with a water slide, waterfall, and a lazy river pool. All the pools were about 4 feet high so perfect for novice swimmers. Duke's restaurant is a few feet away from the pool with ocean view. Some of our favorite restaurants were Roy's Grill Mahana, Cafe O'Lei & Koiso sushi (reservations needed 3 days in advance) in Kihei. Overall, the BEST property in Kaanapali, the beaches up North were the best for snorkeling, boogie boarding, and relaxing. Go early or later in the afternoon to the beaches as parking was pretty tough...sometimes just off the roadside. I recommend D.T. Fleming, Slaughterhouse, and Honolua Bay beaches â€“ you will not be disappointed and bring an underwater camera to capture pictures of the beautiful fishes. If you decide to drive the Road to Hana, go early in the morning, it takes at least 6-8 hours for the drive to & back. Make sure you stop of the Halfway to Hana Banana bread stop, it was so yummy. The only issue we had was the wind, it was a pain when you are relaxing poolside and you have to worry about everything blowing away, luckily the sun umbrellas are secured to the concrete. Mahalo to Nikta for making our family vacation a rememberable one, we would definitely come back for a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: N2Travelling
Reviews.Content: Great location, beautiful grounds, extremely nice condos. We have been to Maui about 14 times, and this is by far the best place we have stayed.

Reviews.Title: “SUCH a mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: Canada78
Reviews.Content: This is the Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde of condo properties. It has many good aspects but even more problematic ones. Firstly, it is marketed as a luxury resort property but it is in fact a condo complex. It doesn't offer the amenities of a resort and definitely doesn't have the feel of a resort. It felt more like a newer airport hotel (i.e. Hampton Inn, Holiday Inn Express) in that yes there is a fitness center, multiple pools, a restaurant, etc, but they bear little resemblance to what you see on the website and they're not on par with what you would find at a true luxury property. This property is strictly a do it yourself place. The fitness center is very small and not staffed, there are unending numbers of pools, tiled with beautiful glass mosaic tiles, but they are falling into disrepair quickly (many tiles missing, very filthy water and bugs galore floating in the hot tubs). The major reason this hotel is not meeting it's potential is due to management in my opinion. The place is gorgeous at first glance because everything is new, yet the signs of deterioration are evident everywhere. The grounds are lush and sprawling, but there is garbage floating around all over, and the pools, common areas and rooms are dirty. After a six night stay in a one bedroom ocean view suite, this is what we came away with: Room: The best part of this property. The room was well laid out and appointed. Beautiful kitchen with granite counters, double sinks, glass mosaic tile backsplash, Bosch appliances. Completely equipped and functional for cooking- all dishes, cutlery, pots & pans, toaster, blender, measuring cups, bottle & can openers, scissors, salad spinner, cutting boards etc provided and new. Small washer & dryer and full sized fridge and dishwasher. Hotel provides powdered dishwashing & laundry detergent daily. Doing laundry is a bit of a hassle because the detergent and the machines do not work well. We had to wash some items multiple times to get them clean and the dryers are impossible, taking as many as 4 cycles to get items dry. Youâ€™ll be better off buying your own detergent locally. Ample seating and flat screens in both living room and bedroom, lots of channels. Good size dining table. Separate shower and tub and double sinks in the spacious bathroom. Rooms are not well lit however and the bathroom gets no natural light. Our particular unit had very dirty carpet. There are blu ray players in the rooms but thereâ€™s no dvd library at the hotel, you can rent from the Red Box at Times grocery one block away. Ocean view rooms actually look directly at other units, the ocean view is actually just a partial one. Because the units are dimly lit itâ€™s hard to see into other units so the privacy is maintained in spite of this. We paid 63$/ night to upgrade from a resort view to so called ocean view. Resort view is of the west Maui mountains and is nice during the day, but at night (when you are more likely to be on your balcony) all you can see is the parking lot/ highway. The balconies are large and a great place to relax in the evenings, complete with screens hat span the length of the unit. Amenities: A very overpriced â€œgourmet marketâ€� is located in the lobby. It actually does have a great range of stuff so if you check in late as we did you can at least stock up on what youâ€™ll need for the night. You can also order sandwiches & small snacks there. They have a very full selection of wines & beer. Be aware that you will pay 3-6 dollars for bottled drinks that are 1-2 $ at the grocery store. They have a wide variety of sundries so if you have no problem paying more than you can find everything you need there. For example, we saw they had swim diapers in all sizes for 22$- we bought ours locally for 14$. We bought combs, hydrogen peroxide & band-aids, and tin drink bottles there. Fitness center is lacking as described above. Restaurant is great as far as food & ambiance, and the only place you will find decent service within the resort. Tiki torches surround it and itâ€™s the focal point of the resort at nighttime. Ample seating but itâ€™s very busy. Hard to get a reservation but easy to get in as a walk in. It seems to function independently from the hotel. Internet is fast and included in the 25$ a day additional resort fee. Good self parking with the use of your room key. Underground and outdoor lots available. Location: On the northern part of Kaâ€™anapali Beach. It would be more convenient to stay somewhere more central in my opinion. Good supermarket one block west. Itâ€™s very windy here and the lobby creates a crazy wind tunnel. This is annoying if you want to eat or read outside, but enjoyable if you are out in the hot sun. There is a walkway you can follow that will take you all the way to Whalerâ€™s Village. Someone on here stated that itâ€™s a 20 min walk, but Iâ€™d say only if you jog it. I walked it with my son, who, granted is under 3, but it took us an hour. We took the bus back. Itâ€™s 1$ per person, and lets you off one block west of the resort so you have to backtrack, it took 5-10 mins walking with my son to get back from the bus stop. Kaâ€™anapali itself is pretty old school. Lahaina is interesting at nighttime. Next time I would rather stay in Wailea. Kids particulars: The pools are great for kids of all ages. Very difficult to find programming on tv for young kids. There are windows that open in the bedrooms that are at toddler eye level and are of some concern. We noticed a room called the â€˜family fun clubâ€™ which was not explained to us and we didnâ€™t ever see anyone come or go from there, nor did we formally check it out. The beach isnâ€™t great for little ones, itâ€™s a bit too wavy & deep and full of coral. The beach near the Sheraton is much better. Pools: Heated and lots to choose from, most from 3-4 ft in depth with 2-3 areas that are toddler friendly/very shallow. Kept at a perfect temperature, you get relief from the sunâ€™s heat but it never feels cold. At least 3 hot tubs, all are quite dirty. Ample seating, there is never a fight for lounge chairs. If you want the covered seats you have to pay for it. The loungers are also all very noticeably stained with suntan lotion. There are 2 towel cabanas where you exchange towel cards for towels daily, they also sell water wings & floaties and suntan lotion, sunglasses etc. The signage says the pool hours are from 6 am -10 pm but we were asked to leave when we tried to go in the pool at 7 am, and told that they donâ€™t open until 8 am. The childrenâ€™s pool area is marketed as a â€œsand bottomedâ€� pool but the floor is actually covered in rocks and itâ€™s a little tender on the feet. Service: This is the biggest problem with this property. We arrived an hour early (3 pm) to check in and were told our room wasnâ€™t ready. We were told we would be called on our cell phone when it was ready. We returned at 8 pm without having been called, and were escorted to the wrong room. We were traveling with our 2 year old son and had reserved a one bedroom butwere given a hotel style room without a separate bedroom. We then had to wait for a new room to be readied. We ended up switching rooms one more time, the next day and the room we settled in was a very noticeably smaller than our first (second) room. I called the front desk to inquire and they vaguely said that the room sizes vary within the same category from 700 to 920 square feet, and our new one was only 700. That is a huge difference so I suggest finding out the specifics when you book. The staff here are mostly hesitant to resolve issues., you will have to figure it out on your own. Housekeeping is NON EXISTANT. I want to emphasize that during our weeklong stay stay, our room was not cleaned even one time. We called several times to have the room cleaned and were always met with indifference. They would occasionally leave more detergent in our room and bags to change our own garbage. We even left a note one day specifically asking if we could have our counters and tables wiped down and our carpets vacuumed but found the note gone and nothing had been done when we returned after a long day out. You must do everything for yourself at this place so donâ€™t mistake it for a hotel and expect to be served at any time. No pool attendants, long waits at the understaffed front desk, etc. Nothing is executed well or promptly. All of the phone extensions are hard to get through to, we were met with many, many answering machines, from the restaurant, to housekeeping to the front desk to the concierge. The concierge was extremely helpful when they were actually present. Grounds: Large, but very dirty. This was a big disappointment. The common spaces and hallways and elevators are filthy, the walls are scratched and stained and the carpets are unacceptable. Everything got filthier as the week went on and I saw garbage and mess accumulate in places over the week and it was never removed. This place is so new it should be in much better shape than it is. Overall I would not return and cannot recommend this property just based on value. For the price (and we usually stay at places that are double the price of this place) there just isnâ€™t enough substance.

Reviews.Title: “Great place. Beach a littlelacking.”
Reviews.Author: Fishboy100
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in July. Property is very large, but managable. Pools are nice and clean, as are the hot tubs. Wasn't too busy, so quite nice. Very nice 2 bedroom condo we were in. Partial Ocean View room. But, certainly enough view of the ocean for us. Really nice. Nice, large patio with fully opening windows. Air Conditioning is set to recognize when the windows are open, and then shut down (for obvious reasons). But, if it messes up, the thermostat is a little tough to figure out. Had to call staff up at least once to figure it out. Carpets in our particular unit were very well worn. Including some lifting in spots. Appliances really nice. Daily maid service is nice. But, not terribly thorough. Didn't really sweep or vacuum all that well. Washer and dryer were very slow to finish. Not sure if this was just us not knowing how to use it. Or, if there was something wrong. Not a big deal. Bathrooms very nice and spacious. Walking distance to good shopping for the condo (i.e. food). Probably the only real complaint, would be the beach. Fairly steep drop off and decent size waves during our visit. Didn't really use it at all for safety concerns. Drove to a number of beaches on the island. Best one we found for the family, was the "Baby Beach" in Lahaina. Kind of odd/strange access point at the cemetary. But, once on the beach, very nice, calm water. A bit pricy in Maui. But, didn't really strike me as being that much different than most other touristy places we've been. Dukes Restaurant at the property is very nice and not as expensive as some of the restaurants nearby. Certainly well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Without a doubt, the best accommodations in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: David122364
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at this outstanding resort. Everything about our stay was fantastic from the hotel staff to the beautiful resort grounds to the excellent central location. The two bedroom two bath condo was perfect for our family of four but could easily accommodate 6 or more. The resort has multiple pools to enjoy and very easy access to the beach. We stopped at Costco near the airport and picked up a week's worth of supplies and used the resort's bar-b-ques nearly every night. No need to pick up the usual condiments and sundries as our unit was fully stocked! We stayed in unit number HK 622 which is privately owned and the owners' property manager, Nikta, was awesome. She answered all of our questions and had a wonderful basket of fresh fruit and other local treats waiting for us at the condo. And, upon my request Nikta prepared a very beautiful wine and cheese basket as my special gift to my wife!! If you plan on traveling to Maui you must contact NIkta at www.uniktavacations.com. You will not regret it and Nikta will make your vacation as special as ours!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing. Amazing service, location, dining, rooms. This hotel has it all!”
Reviews.Author: Smd4664
Reviews.Content: My family and I came for our yearly Hawaiian vacation, and this year we decided on Maui. We chose to rent a condo this year, for it saves money on meals, gives more space, and it makes for a better overall trip when you're not lacking sleep the next day because of being squeezed in a double bed with your sister and practically against the bed of your parents the night before. The service, from the minute we walked in the door, was friendly and welcoming. And genuinely friendly and welcoming. The Honua Kai is new, 7-stories, and has the features of a hotel and the rooms of a condo. (i.e. - room service, housekeeping, etc.) It is right on the beach, about a 10 minute drive from Lahaina, and it's restaurant, "Duke's" was delicious. Our room had a full size, fully-stocked kitchen, a living room with plentiful seating and a large flat-screen TV and a dining table, 2 bedrooms each with a flat-screen TV (the same size as the living room's) and a spacious bathroom, a washer and dryer, and a very large lanai (balcony). The hotel is quiet, and there are 3 pools with a slide. Also, the grounds are extremely well-kept. (Well, I need to keep this brief, but honestly, I could keep going about the luxury this hotel has to offer!) If you are traveling to Maui, I would recommend the Honua Kai 100%! Have a great trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Place...Not a Smoke-Free Property”
Reviews.Author: BaxterGoodBoy
Reviews.Content: Let me first say that overall my husband I really enjoyed the Honua Kai and would recommend it (with reservations) for its beautiful grounds, upscale rooms and decent dining options. However, if superior service is a major consideration for you, one of the more established resorts on Maui might prove to be a better option. We did a lot of research for our trip and selected the Honua Kai based on reviews, photos and value. We rented our unit 423 through an off-site property manager (Kaanapali Beach Rentals) instead of directly through the resort which did result in a great price, but also in a lack of service. We loved the room and the view, but we had an issue with the guests in the unit below us smoking on their patio during our weeklong stay. (They didnâ€™t even attempt to hide it and could be easily seen from the courtyard as they were only on the third floor.) Unfortunately, we couldn't enjoy our own patio at times and--even worse--had to close our sliding doors to avoid the smell coming into our room when the smokers were out. Now, we're not prudes when it comes to smoking, but since the resort is billed as "smoke-free" we really didn't expect to have to deal with the problem daily. (It was especially bad in the mornings when we wanted to either sleep in with the windows open or sit on the patio and enjoy our coffee. The smoking started daily at about 6:30 a.m.) Although the staff at the front desk initially told us they'd take care of the issue, nothing ever changed during our stay. Once, our call was transferred to "Security" but our message was never returned. Another time we called the front desk we were told that they couldn't help us because we didn't rent our unit through the resort directly. Huh?? The property manager we rented through was also of no help--they said they'd speak to the guest, but either they never did so or they were ignored. We were very disappointed in the response from both the resort and the property manager and consequently will reconsider staying at the Honua Kai in the future. That being said, the positive features of the resort marginally outweighed the lack of service regarding the smoking issue. The pools, Dukes restaurant and on-site market made the Honua Kai a definite cut above the standard Maui condo rentals in the price range. One note about the sewage smell mentioned in other reviews--we did not find it to be a problem at all. We were in a courtyard-facing room and never once experienced the smell in our room. However, we did smell sewage at times during our travels through Maui in general--but nothing specific to the Honua Kai.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property - do not book through Maui Vacations.com or Chase 'n Rainbows”
Reviews.Author: Annielovesboats
Reviews.Content: This is a gorgeous property, and the rooms are exquisite. However, if your room is in the even-numbered teens, such as ours was (218), your "partial ocean view with view of the 'beautiful' grounds'" will include a large dirty, dusty construction site, complete with orange barricades, bulldozers, trucks kicking up dust (which will cover your lanai furniture). Do not even think you are going to use your lanai. Also, if you open the awesome removable wall doors to use your lanai, your AC will shut off, requiring a "reset." You can't have AC going and also use your lanai. "Jenna" at "Maui Vacations.com" described the place very well, but later claimed she had informed us of the "field" we would be seeing from our room. The room was then booked by Jenna, through "Chase 'n Rainbows." When I called Chase 'n Rainbows to report I'd been misled about my view, they asked if I'd requested an email with a photo of my room's view. We were stuck with the terrible view. From the even-numbered teens, south side of the building, the ocean "view" is somewhere off in the distance, past the construction site and barricades. If you are staying anywhere in Honua Kai but the south side, we highly recommend this gorgeous place. Multiple pools, hot tubs, beautiful grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RicksFormula
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week at the Honua Kai and had a blast. We rented direct from an owner on VRBO and stayed in a 2 bedroom 2 bath inside corner unit #539. These are the units in the interior of the buildings that protrude out from the surrounding units for a direct ocean view. I would highly recommend them as the ocean view was far better in person than any of the pics posted and the lanai's are over 300 sq. ft. We were in the Konea Tower and while it was only about 1/3 full at any given time, we enjoyed the less crowded feel and ease of access to the pools and other amenaties. The units are off the chart as far as cleanliness, newness and the high quality of everything used in their construction. We have been to Maui a number of times and our jaws dropped when we walked in, it is head and shoulders above anything in it's price range or above it's price range as well. The pools were very nice and never over crowded, plenty of chairs and cabanas available just about any time of the day and there were plenty of hot tubs scattered thru out the 3 pools. Our condo was stocked with snorkel gear, boogie boards, beach chairs, games, coolers, beach bags, pretty much anything you could need for a day at the beach. The parking garage is $10 a day and we parked right next to the elevator that went straight up to our unit, so it was very well thought out as well as very secure with card key access. The beach out front is very nice and not crowded at all, decent snorkeling and boogie boarding though we liked nearby D. T. Fleming beach best for boogie boarding and next door to it was Honulua beach for great snorkeling. We walked each morning on the boardwalk down to black rock which was a nice 3 miles round trip. Duke's was about a 1 minute walk from our door and we loved having breakfast there almost every morning and several dinners there as well. Never had anything but good service and great food. I would highly recommend the Honua Kai to anyone wanting to stay in west Maui. We plan to go back again very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to stay in Maui”
Reviews.Author: MEGADAN
Reviews.Content: I wish I had written my review earlier so that I could remember all of the details. We stayed in July for 10 days. Our party of four consisted of DH, DS(19), DD(16). We had been to Maui before and stayed in Kaanapali Beach. I was worried about staying in North Kaanapali but it turns out that the beach is less crowded, has more sand and the snokeling is better than at Black Rock. We loved the area. The Honua Kai is located in a section that seems to have more condos. You have the Westin Villas to one side and another complex on the other side. The two towers are closer to each other than I thought, the pools area actually joins them. There is a supermarket called Times just outside the gates of the parking lot. We had done shopping at Safeway on the way in from the airport but found that the Times had better prices. This was a great place for lunch because they had fresh sushi and sandwiches daily. Our Unit was a 2-bedroom unit on the 5th Floor of the Konea Tower. We were in the inner courtyard and had a spectacular view of the ocean, pool and the inner courtyard just underneath our balcony. The view was spectacular. I had stressed over the room location and had even switched rooms twice but once you are at the resort you realize that the place is beautiful and every view has something to offer. I would even say that the mountain parking lot views were striking. The only downside would be at night, since the front of the hotel and obviously the mountains are not lit. The inner courtyard rooms had lovely night time views of the lit pools and tiki torches surrounding the pool area. Our unit was furnished like any luxury unit. Beautiful furnishings and impeccably clean. We rented from an Owner and did not opt for the daily housekeeping. We did not need it at all. We had a vacuum in the unit and the place was immaculate to begin with. We loved Honua Kai so much that when we return we will be returning there. It was peaceful, beautiful and luxurious. Here are my top 5 recommendations: #1 Stay at Honua Kai- wonderful place for families that need the extra room #2 Shop at Times-best prices #3 Eat at Dukes-good views and good food #4 Eat at Leilanis- Best meal we had. Better than Hula Grill #5 Do a Luau- We did the one at the Hyatt because Royal Lahaina was booked and the Hyatt Luau was great. Book it early #6 Do the Road to Hana and be sure to leave early so you can enjoy all the stops. #7 Enjoy the Pineapples- they were supersweet! #8 Explore the whole Island- It is a safe and lovely island to explore #9 Watch the sunset. The sunset from the Honua Kai beach is spectacular. #10 Be warned that the walk from the Honua Kai to Whalers Village on the beachwalk will take you 50 minutes. We did it and it was exhausting!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort- I would go back in a heartbeat.”
Reviews.Author: NYtravelgirl33
Reviews.Content: After a lot of research I finally decided to stay at the Honua Kai. I was SO happy that I did. This place was gorgeous. The rooms were very pretty and very clean. They each come with a full size fully stocked kitchen, a washer and dryer and an updated roomy bathroom. The resort itself had beautiful grounds and 3 awesome pools. Although it is a beach front resort the beach was a little rocky and I didnt find it to be that great for swimming. The resort offers outdoor BBQ pits for their guests to use. We found a fish market directly across the street which had the freshest fish and they would marinade it for us. We would call in our order in the moring and pick everything up around dinner time. We would cook out at and enjoy our food on the beach or around the pool. It was fantastic!!!! The resort is close to all. My only complaint was that we didnt stay on the ocean side and it got a little noisy in the morning. But once we closed the blinds and turned the air and celing fans on it was ok. Duke's restaurant is on property . We ate lunch their one afternoon and the food was very good. I didnt think the prices were to high either. All in all we truly enjoyed our stay at the Honua Kai.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort, can't wait to come back”
Reviews.Author: michaelc16
Reviews.Content: Stayed 8 nights and came with 8 people with one being my 14 month daughter. Resort was awesome, we had a 2 and 1 bedroom condo. Plenty of room. Beds very comfortable and enjoyed the separate shower and bath tubs. Love the big flat screens. Only negative would be that warm water ran out too quickly if you have a couple of people taking showers back to back. Pool area was nice as it never felt crowded and was baby friendly with several sections to my daughter could sit in the water. Walked by several resorts and noticed how crowded the pools areas were and made me love my location even more. The restaurant called Duke's is a great place for any meal. The pancakes are to die for. Ate several meals and for where its located not a bad price either. Get you free Hula Pie with two entrees. Beach outside the resort was beautiful. Located on North Kaanapali. Lots of Coral to go snorkeling right of the beach. The North side of Kaanapalli is a lot quieter than the south but just as beautiful. Just depends on needs. Can't wait to come back

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic property - excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: pgsanjay
Reviews.Content: We were two families in a three bedroom unit. We rented directly from the property management company on site. We got a unit one removed from the ocean - with a fantastic ocean view. The unit came outfitted with great appliances, a very very good entertainment system and very comfortable furniture. It was also quite spacious and elegant. It came with its own washer and drier (which were slow and somewhat loud, but still a big plus). We loved the easy access to the pool and the beach. No throngs of people crowded into small sections around the pool. It would have been nice to have an easier policy on pool towels, but I understand why they have cards to keep track of them. No biggie. We didn't go to Duke's, the restaurant on the site, but enjoyed cooking out on the grill by the pool. The conveniently located supermarket just down the street got a lot of business from us. We liked this place enough to try and change our reservations elsewhere. Compared to our experience at Ho Olei, in Wailea, this was better by miles.

Reviews.Title: “great resort for families with young children”
Reviews.Author: wkgmama
Reviews.Content: BOTTOM LINE: if you are traveling with wee ones, they will love the pool. you will love the central location, lack of crowds, easy self-parking, restaurant and little market. you might complain about the inexperienced/inattentive staff and you may fantasize about staying at a more intimate place with more charm and character, but when you see the smile on your 6 year old's face as she is flying down the waterslide or your 2 year old's face in the sandy 18" pool, you will have no regrets. all in all, i'm very glad we stayed here but will probably try another place next time. BOOKING TIPS booking here can be a bit confusing, and it might be helpful for prospective guests to know that the suites fall into one of three categories. - owned and managed by Honua Kai (high standards and full service, but they seem to offer fewest deals) - owned by a private owner and managed by Honua Kai (high standards/service and good deals) - owned by a private owner and managed by a private owner or other manager (some have high standards but others don't seem to, but you may find best deals here) many of the other reviews said the deals were to be found via VRBO, so that's where I looked. but there was some risk, because some of the non-Honua Kai managed properties didn't appear to have the same standard of furnishings and decor. i ended up calling about 10 different places and ended up booking a privately-owned suite through Honua Kai and got a good deal for a great ocean front suite. also make sure you ask for a map of where the suite is situated - one property manager said we were getting an oceanfront suite, but on the map, it was clearly on the side of the building and she said, "well, if you go out on the patio and put your head around the corner, then you can see the ocean!" that might qualify for oceanview, but not oceanfront! PROS we traveled with 3 families and stayed in a 3BR suite. we were all very happy when we swung open the doors to suite #729. to my relief, it looked exactly as the hotel photos pictured, down to the sheets, dining table and sofas. it was very spacious and well appointed and they didn't spare any expense when building this resort. the retracting glass doors/wall wow-ed everyone in our party. the AV was wired in every room so we could play our iPod music in every room if we wanted to. the details like the Hawaiian Soap Factory laundry detergent was awesome. the pools were fabulous and the beach was great. there's a different pool to suit everyone's needs. we loved the stroll up and down the coast and ended up using the beach in front of the Westin resort more often than the Honua Kai beach because the kids could see gorgeous fish from the shallow waters without even snorkeling - unlike in front of Honua Kai during our stay. we also noticed that the Westin was much more crowded than Honua Kai and we felt fortunate (also obvious from the 70% - 80% empty parking lot). Duke's and Aina's Market are great, if not a little overpriced, but isn't everything on the island? the location is also a short drive to Whalers Cove where there are a few nice waterfront restaurants. CONS the place feels a bit sterile. it lacks character and if it weren't for the gorgeous ocean view and location, you'd be hard-pressed to know you were in Hawaii at all. we poked our heads into the Hawaiian-owned hotel nearby, the Kaanapali Beach Hotel, and that place, in contrast, exuded Hawaii, with women making leis in the lobby, though it might not be as modern and luxurious as Honua Kai. the staff seem new and inexperienced. when we arrived, there was no valet to take our car or take our bags. a member of our party needed to fax something out and receive a FedEx package and that was very difficult. another member of our party asked the concierge for dining recommendations and all she knew was Dukes, the on-site restaurant. the whole towelcard system is really annoying. it's not fun to have to keep track of everyone's towels when you're on vacation. at one point, we turned in our 4 towel cards for 4 towels to use by the pool. my husband returned to the room with 1 towel while i was in the water. i went back to our chaises and all our towels were gone. i assumed he had taken all 4 of them, but he hadn't. when i went to the front desk to ask for more towel cards, they wanted to charge me $25 for each one. i explained and the woman said she'd do us the favor of giving us more towel cards, but "only this one time."

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: lrm44
Reviews.Content: Honua Kai gives the best of a resort with condo living. Our two bdrm condo was gorgeous, spacious, and modern with an incredible ability to open up to the outside with a wrap around lanai. I LOVED sitting out here. You can rent through the resort or through individual owners of the condos. Duke's, the resort's beach side restaurant, had good food and service with an amazing view of the ocean. We also recommend stopping by the concierge. She was very helpful in booking us for zip lines, helicopter tour, and biking down the volcano. All great activities. Since we had the kitchen there is a Safeway close by to stock up. When you arrive in Maui right by the airport is a Costco, Kmart, and Wal-Mart for all the things you may need at a good price. Overall, wonderful place, great family vacation and stunning ocean scenery. Maui people are very friendly and welcoming!!! Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful resort, would happily return in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: Mama2Tonys
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 5 days at the beautiful Honua Kai resort. Traveling with me was my husband, our 6YO and my MIL. We had a 2 BR oceanview in the Hokulani tower. Our unit was managed by the hotel (Intrawest) and we booked directly through the hotel. As such, we did receive daily maid service -- new towels, beds made, vacuuming, dishwasher loaded, etc. One of the reasons I sought out renting directly through the hotel was for the daily maid service, which we did get. Also, the hotel was in fact negotiable on the rate (they have to check with the owner first), so just ask. The resort, the unit, the grounds, the pools -- everything was immaculate. This resort is absolutely stunningly gorgeous. Our unit was very clean, our beds were very comfortable, and this unit had everything we needed in it. There was a stackable, front loading washer/dryer in the unit tucked away in it's own utility closet. It's not quite a full size machine, but it did handle decent sized loads and the hotel supplied us with detergent. The kitchen was fully stocked with glassware, dishes, utensils and gadgets. There was a toaster, a blender, a coffee maker (for which the hotel gave us 2 bags of Kona coffee, filters, sugar packets and instant creamers), all of the appliances were stainless steel high end appliances. The dishwasher (detergent was also supplied by the hotel) was the quietest one I've ever heard and I now have dishwasher envy. Our unit was a corner unit on an upper floor. The lanai was L shaped and wrapped around the living room. We had an amazing view of the ocean from it. While it wasn't classified as an oceanfront room, it most definitely was. The lanai was fully furnished with 3 chairs with ottomons and a large table with 4 chairs. We spent a good deal of time on our lanai enjoying the view. Also, the doors fold open completely, so you get that open air feeling in the unit itself. It was so nice!! The bathrooms were clean, huge and accommodating. We had 2 in our unit, and both had double sinks and large showers. A large soaking tub was also in the master bathroom. The towels were clean, very soft and plush. The beds were soft, the pillows were comfortable and the linens on the bed were soft and high end. Large closets, 2 nightstands with additional drawers and a large dresser in each BR. Each bedroom had a large flat screen, as did the living room which also had a dvd player. An in-room safe was in one of the BR closets as well. We found all the staff to be very polite, friendly and helpful. In our building, the front desk was staffed 24 hours a day and everyone we encountered greeted us by name. The concierge was helpful and responsive - she made all of our dinner reservations, tour arrangements and made suggestions as to where we should take our son snorkeling. I have nothing negative to say about this resort at all, we were truly happy with the location, the facility, the amenities -- all of it, we absolutely loved it here! I do have to comment on "the odor problem," as previous reviewers commented on it. Never once during our entire stay did any of us ever catch a whiff of anything even remotely resembling a sewage smell. We visited all 3 pools at different times of the day, nothing. We spent a ton of time on our lanai at different times of the day, nothing. MIL is a smoker, I went with her downstairs, out to the front of the building (where there is a designated smoking area) and again, nothing. I'm not discounting others' experiences, I'm just saying that we never once encountered any odor problem at all, and I was looking for it because I had read about it here. The wind wasn't that big of deal either. Yes it was windy, sometimes it was gusty, but you're visiting a resort on a tropical island that is directly on the ocean and also basically at the foot of the mountains -- it's going to be a bit windy folks! It was nothing that ruined our trip -- quite the contrary! I think the breezes were a nice buffer for the very warm July sun and probably allowed us to stay out in direct sunlight for longer periods of time each day that we would have had there not been a breeze. Don't let the wind scare you off. We have traveled extensively throughout the Carribbean and found this resort to be among the very best that we've ever stayed. It's absolutely lovely, my family thoroughly enjoyed this resort and wouldn't hesitate to return. It was an absolute pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Really beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: jamipablo
Reviews.Content: We just got back from staying a week at the Honua Kai Resort. We have three kids ages, 5, 4, and 2. We stayed in a one bedroom unit overlooking the dormant construction site next door. We booked through the Honua Kai vacation rentals on VRBO. We were originally going to book straight through VRBO, but had heard that the service was different if you booked through a private owner. So we called Honua Kai and talked to someone in their property management office and booked a private unit through them. She told us that we would receive the same accomodations cleaning, charging priveleges, fancy soaps, wireless internet, etc. as booking through the hotel and the amount was over a 100 dollars less a night. Well, it wasn't the same, as stated in previous reviews, the maid service really lacked. The never cleaned the dishes, unloaded the dishwasher, vacuumed or mopped. We walked into the place with a stain on the tile floor. There were no L'Occitane bathroom soaps/shampoos at all. However, the service in every other part of the hotel was awesome. The valet/parking guy James was awesome...he always asked where we were going and gave suggestions. He helped us out all the time. Also, the market on site is great, however, it is all healthy food. For those late night cravings, there is not a lot to get. It is wonderful having a washer/dryer combo in the room so you don't come home with lots of dirty laundry, however, they were hard to figure out how to use and there wasn't any manuals. Duke's Beach House on the property is great. Good food, dinner is overpriced, but you can also go at dinner, but eat on the lunch menu. Maui pie is awesome! Pools are by far the best we've seen. Perfect for little ones! The only downside is the cabana waiters don't start until 12 noon and that can be a pain while on vacation and wanting a cold beverage. The lanais off the rooms are the best on the island. We walked all down the boardwalk and the lanais off the other hotels are hilarious compared to the Honua Kai. The beds are so comfortable too...great mattresses! Our kids shared the pull out couch which was plenty big for the three of them. I am extremely picky about hotels, but even with the lack of maid service, we did receive new linens each day....I would definitely stay there again. I really think it is just a new hotel and they are still finding their groove. There isn't anything run down about the hotel. Paint is still new, furniture not scraped up and floors pretty clean. People describe an odor from a sewage plant, we NEVER smelled a thing and it was COMPLETELY windy our entire trip. I have a strong sense of smell and I was completely worried about booking this hotel based on previous reviews stating the strong smell....again, I NEVER smelled anything. Honua Kai is a great place if you are traveling with kids, especially little ones. Their pools start at 3 feet which is great with little ones. The water slide is fantastic too, although the attendants that are in charge of it don't really do a good job of timing out the kids, a few accidents because of two kids going down too close together. We thought about staying in Wailea, but we ended up going down there for a day trip. The wind was a little more calm, but it's a sleepy little area. Much more to do in Kaanapali/Lahaina area. Would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay. We stayed for...”
Reviews.Author: Shanedennis
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay. We stayed for 10 days starting the end of June. We booked a room through vrbo and couldn't have been happier. As stated earlier there is little difference between booking direct or with the hotel. The only thing we couldn't do was use the keiki club. The pools are superb. We went as a party of 7, 4 adults and 3 kids. We stayed in a three bedroom ocean view room. The market was good for little odds and ends. Across the road is a times supermarket. The boardwalk is great. The beach was ok. We taught the kids to snorkel right in front of the resort, which was excellent. All in all it was excellent holiday and we felt like millionaires in these plush digs.

Reviews.Title: “Great place some minor draw backs”
Reviews.Author: kosfam
Reviews.Content: OK - so we have 2 kids 9 & 8, have stayed all over the world with them - and know hotels and resorts and what to expect very well...we rented a ground level unit due to the kids right in front of the pool directly through the owner..owners will negotiate on rates, the hotel team won't. there is no difference service wise ( what service there is) if you go direct or through the hotel - so save money go direct. The pool, grounds and units are amazing,..it's still a quiet place since it is new and all the units have not been sold..you can't beet the space and value that is for sure...DUKE's restaurant is on the grounds, food is OK - breakfast good, lunch good value, dinner WAY overpriced and not that good, You never see the hotel staff at all and its somewhat of a ghost time in the new tower which we were in. the spa is NOT open, the store in this tower is NOT open, there is no valet parking there is just a huge empty lobby run by a phone on a desk where a person would normally work...We were going to buy a unit here BUT there is ONE MAJOR issue..the "Reclaimation" station is across the street which the agent assured me you don't smell but guess what...for a week vacation you can deal with the wind shift and the poop smell but to own one...not a chance you are gettimg millions of $$$ from me to smell poop every week! Beach , excellent...NO MATTER where you stay in Maui do not waste money going on snorkle trips...the reefs are not in great shape...and you see the same fish right off the beach as you do on the trip..nothing any different i promise you..I have been coming here for 20 years...rent your gear swim out and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful”
Reviews.Author: suefromballarat
Reviews.Content: we booked our condo through VRBO, and had a very enjoyable stay in unit 515. This was a very spacious ocean view and resort view 2 bedroom condo. we watched amazing sunsets from our balcony. we had several contacts with the owner patty, who made sure everything was to our liking. she even phoned us when we arrived, which was so nice. Everything she told us was exactly right, even down to the beautiful view from our balcony and windows. We appreciated all the little personal touches when booking private. this resort is so lovely and never feels crowded. we walked up past another resort and found it to be very busy and loud compared to ours. we did the road to Hana tour which as fantastic. We snorkled at molikini, napilli bay and Black rock. we had a beautiful meal at the plantation house at Kapalula golf course. ask for a rail seat and watch the beautiful sunset. We will definately return to such a beautiful and well maintained resort.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: LakeIsland
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Honua Kai Resort for our honeymoon. We were rather disappointed when we arrived as honeymooners and were simply greeted with a "Congratulations." Nothing further was offered - room upgrade, etc. Although our 1 bdrm suite was new, clean and comfortable. The fire alarm proceeded to go off 3 times during our stay - twice in the morning and once at 3am! Again the staff offered nothing for this inconvenience. The hotel cleaning was hit and miss - sometimes ran through the dishwasher - sometimes didn't. They never restocked any of the supplies aside from the detergent. This hotel has no character and is trying to be something more than it is. I also wouldn't recommend the location - you can smell the sewage treatment plant and I found this location to be the windiest, rainiest of the entire island. Definitely won't be staying here during my next visit to Maui. It simply wasn't worth the money. And I'm sure we could have stayed elsewhere where being a honeymooner would have been celebrated rather than dismissed.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally Beautiful Resort on a Great Beach”
Reviews.Author: SavvyDesigner
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Maui for 1 week in May and this resort really made the difference. We were placed in the new 2nd tower of the resort and since peak season was just over, it was a really calm peaceful retreat. We were placed on the 2nd FL with a partial ocean view our room was kitty corner from the lobby and initially we were concerned about noise from crowds hanging outside the lobby at night. But it really was not a problem at all. We literally felt like we had the resort to ourselves. We saw more workers there than guests. They really take care of the grounds there. The room service was spotty, one day we had an excellent maid who unloaded our clean dishes from the dishwasher and reloaded the dishwasher with dirty dishes and cleaned them for us. She also made our bed, cleaned the bathroom, replaced our bath towels and gave us extra dishwasher detergent. The next day it must've been a different maid because she didn't do anything, didn't make our bed, didn't clean the bathroom, she only took out the garbage from under our sink. That was the only displeasure on the whole trip. Both times we left a small tip on the coffee table but they never took it. The daily resort fee must cover their tip, go figure. Everything in the unit was new. The appliances were barely used, large refrigerator with icemaker, dishwasher microwave, and the best part was the washer dryer. Great for a beach vacation. Everything from the appliances, furniture, linens, pots & pans were high end and name brand. I'm name dropping now - stainless steel bosch appliances, cuisinart toaster, cuisinart pots & pans, andrew morgan bed throws, fleetwood furniture, nanowall foldable doors for the lanai. The unit was a really good deal for the price we paid. The view from the lanai is priceless, you can see the beach and the ocean. The resort pools are well maintained and they even have a slide at one of the pools. Its fun even for an adult. Oh, and they also have a few outdoor grilling area that you can grill your own food up till later in the evening. The resort is a short walk to Kaanapali Beach, and I have to say that after trekking all over the island, that Kaanapali Beach is the most beautiful, calm and ideal beach on the island - and its right in our backyard! This would be the only place that I would stay if I ever come back to Maui. And west Maui is definitely better than South Maui if you are looking for a quiet low key vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful condo, excellent view, great location.”
Reviews.Author: ms95
Reviews.Content: I rented #209, a 2 bedroom condo, through Kaanapali Vacation Rentals for June 20-25th. I went with four family members and was very pleased upon entering the condo. It was a beautiful corner space with a very large patio. It accomodated us well. Bedrooms were large as well as the bathrooms. It was very close to one of the pools and Dukes. Kaanapli vacation rentals were very kind and helpful while we were there. There is a grocery store close by as well as numerous restaurants. Front street was about 10-15 minutes away by car. We loved our time here and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!!”
Reviews.Author: butteco
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous time at Honua Kai. We stayed in the Konea Tower on the mountain side of the building and we loved it. Our room was a very large 1 bedroom and it was perfect for our family of 4 (a 5 year old and a 15 month old). We walked up and down the beach walk. We took the free shuttle and the $1 bus. We shopped at the Times Market (which was way overpriced) and we ate dinner at Hula Grill, Leilani's, Cheeseburger in Paradise and Duke's (all very good meals). We snorkeled at Black Rock (saw sea turtles), played on the beach in several locations along the beach walk, went to Baby Beach in Lahaina, shopped & watched the free hula shows in Whaler's Village, and spent many hours at the Honua Kai pool-up and down the waterslide, of course! The only complaining we did was when we had to come home!!! We can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: BigRed639
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our Honeymoon. We stayed in the Ohana ocean view suite, which was perfect for a couple. While researching for our trip, Honua Kai had the best price for an ocean view room, and I couldn't have been happier with my choice. During our stay there were not many other visitors. In the mornings we had the pool and beach virtually to ourselves. Please, do not waste your money at the Aina market by the lobby. We spent over $30 on a lunch that was OK at best. Duke's was awesome, with great food and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us â€” We will return”
Reviews.Author: OnOurList
Reviews.Content: This whole-ownership condominium property offers some units for rent directly through owners at vrbodotcom and the Honua Kai website. We chose to rent directly from an owner for a lower nightly fee. There are studio, one-, two- and three-bedroom units that vary in size from about 600 to 2300 interior sq. ft. There are also a few larger units of about 2700 sq. ft. and a few penthouses. Most of the three-bedroom units have direct ocean views. Some of the inner courtyard two-bedroom units also have direct ocean views from the living areas in the unit. Other two- and one-bedroom units have ocean views from their lanais. Some of the units are on east side of the building and only have mountain views. Check the interactive floorplans on the Honua Kai website. A construction site immediately adjacent to the south side of the Hokulani tower is scheduled to become another Westin property. This is the newest condominium property built in Kaanapali in the last 25 years and it is very well done. The location allows easy access to the large and uncrowded north Kaanapali beach with great sunset views toward the islands of Lanai and Molokai. Honua Kai is the last resort on North Kaanapali beach with direct access to the boardwalk that connects Westin timeshare properties and other resorts north of the Sheraton Hotel at Black Rock. Honua Kai has two large u-shaped buildingsâ€”Hokulani and Konea towersâ€”each with different entrances, lobbies, amenities and decors shared by guests and residents. The Spa is yet to be opened in the Konea tower but will be easily accessible from either tower. There are multiple pools on the grounds with a more formal pool in front of the Hokulani tower and more playful pools with slides and waterfalls in front of the Konea tower. The pools are located near the beach with large lawn areas for other outdoor activities. There is an activities center near the pools for pool flotation devices, boogie boards, fresh towels and other options. Partially covered cabana chairs and fully covered gazebos around the pool areas are available for daily rental. Duke's restaurant is located in front of the two towers and offers good quality breakfast, lunch and dinner menus. A future fine dining restaurant is planned for the Konea tower. There is a gourmet market in the Hokulani tower with a smaller express version in the Konea tower. The units are furnished with very comfortable king-sized beds and linens, complete kitchens including Bosch appliances (Viking brand in the premium ocean-front units) dishes and utensils, stacked small washer/condensation-dryer units (longer dry times than traditional vented models), granite countertops, big screen TVs and more. The three-bedroom units have one king-sized bed that can be separated into two twin-sized beds. The lanais are separated from the interiors by retractable glass walls with optional screens. Opening the glass walls creates the indoor-outdoor living environment that is so pleasant in Hawaii. The finishes include granite countertops, solid wood doors, halogen lighting, ceiling fans and comfortable contemporary fabrics. There is a bellman to help with luggage upon arrival. Parking is conveniently located under the building with key card access (daily fee paid directly to the resort). The front desk and housekeeping services are available to units that are part of the Honua Kai rental pool. The property is conveniently located between Kapalua and Lahaina. To locate the Hokulani tower at Honua Kai Resort, drive past the entrances to the Kaanapali Beach Resort until you reach Kai Malina Parkway and turn left at the light. The Konea tower can also be reached from Kai Malina Parkway, but it is more convenient to keep driving along the highway to the next light past Kai Malina Parkway. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible vacation spot on Maui”
Reviews.Author: ADAMDERRICK
Reviews.Content: Great value and absolutely beatiful rooms, we stayed in a one-bedroom with a full kitchen, in unit laundry, and a huge lanai facing the mountain behind the hotel. The hotel was insanely clean, everything was working and in tip top shape. We ate many breakfasts at Dukes, which I thought was very reasonable for on the ocean eating ( we travelled in April and saw whales from our dining table...they were about 150-200 yards away from us.) We spent about $25 a day for two at Dukes for a very filling delicious breakfast. Resort is in a great location, especially if you like to venture north or south, which we did every day. Kapalua and Lahaina are just minutes away...and we used the nice boardwalk to walk to whalers village to shop ( about 2 miles each way..bring good sneakers) Pool was clean and very nicely laid out. Ocean and beach were as well. Easy to park, valet service was nice and trustworthy, bell hops were speedy and respectful of our property. The market in the hotel was great, had delicious ceviche made fresh that day. Gift prices were very reasonable, we bought a bunch of bamboo kitchen knick-knacks, and they were about 20% less expensive there than in the shops of Lahaina or even the local farmers markets that hondles that stuff. The trip was so amazing that my wife and I are planning to nix our 2-3 continental vacations a year ( mexico, vegas, florida)...to come back to the Honua Kai every year. Found the overall value a 10 out of 10, for what we paid and for the accomadations, I thought it was the best value around. We will be back for sure. ( and eventually we are going to move to Maui....it is paradise). You wont be disappointed with this hotel and service, a rare gem.... Check out the beautiful rainbow picture from our lanai.....even when it rains in Maui...it is beautiful..... Cheers and as they say in Hawaii...Mahalo Adam from Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Great complex and rooms but not so clean.”
Reviews.Author: emiw15
Reviews.Content: I had stayed in a 2 bedroom partial oceanview booked thru the complex. We were amazed by the complex and location. The room was great facing the garden on th 1st floor. The minor/major issue was fruit fly problems. The room was infested. There were lots of dead flies on the window cell an in lighting. Also there were spider webs on the ceiling fan. Definitely request a room on the upper level. When we had called the front desk for a new room but was told that it was due to the plants and may not be any better. Bottomline not so helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A great find!”
Reviews.Author: KristinO
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Honua Kai for 4 nights, and were just thrilled with the place. We were in the newest building unit in an Ohana suite. The place was immaculately clean - everything is brand new, so it felt especially clean. The pool and grounds are just beautiful, and the beach is actually quite nice, although not so much for swimming, which was fine with us given how great the pools were. Loved the flexibility of having a kitchen for breakfasts and lunches, and these kitchens really are quite well supplied. There wasn't anything we needed that wasn't there. We also really enjoyed dinner at Dukes, and it doesn't get more convenient!! I also loved taking morning walks along the boardwalk that runs almost all the way down to Black Rock (which you can get to then by the beach). (And, you walk by the Westin Villas, which looked nice, but a lot more crowded.) My only complaint is that given how low the occupancy is right now, they don't always have full staff around, and we weren't able to get someone from housekeeping one afternoon. But, on the whole, I would highly recommend this place, especially now while everything is still brand new and it's not crowded at all. We didn't want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Honua Kai vs the Hyatt resort at Kaanapali.”
Reviews.Author: maui_again_please
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went there to celebrate my 50th birthday. I get tripadvisor emails that alert when flights are cheapest and used that to guide a less expensive trip because we had visited Maui 4 other times in the last 7 years and I know how expensive it can be. I checked all sorts of sources to find a great deal and I found a RARE deal for a 4 star resort this time to be AAA travel and they use Pleasant Holidays. And since I was trying to do it on a low budget, I booked the Special Resort View Ohana room. We stayed for 7 nights. Due to it being sooo reasonable I set my expectations very low on the room view and I expected a mountain or parking lot view for the price. I was sooo happy to find they had upgraded us to a partial ocean view room located at the inside back corner on the 3rd floor of the Hokulani tower. This was located on the same side as the Aina Market store and that made it very convenient for groceries we forgot to get at the bigger grocery store on the way from the airport. We had always stayed at the Hyatt in the past and this was our first condo-style resort stay. I've got to say that we kept staying at the Hyatt because we loved the comfy beds and ocean/water sounds at night and their adult pool with waterfalls is right next to the beach. The Honua Kai met this expectation as well plus the doors open all the way up at the lanai giving a very open air feeling and it made the room feel even larger. It had a very nice fully equipped kitchen that made cooking breakfast very fun, but we ate breakfast at Dukes the 3rd day and loved their breakfast sooo much we didn't cook it again (great omlets and banana mac nut pancakes). I am one of those folks that often goes out for lattes but the drip coffee supplied was sooo good in the room that I made it almost every day and I even found a little creamer cup in the unit that I filled with my half and half. It was very windy the first several days of our trip but very nice the last few days. My parents and sister were staying at a resort near black rock in Kaanapali beach area and it was very windy there too. Last few days were perfect though (no wind) so we went snorkeling at the beach in front of Honua Kai and it was very nice. As well, the pool was great. Cutie pie (Ryan) from Dukes was serving us drinks at the pool on our first windy day and he quickly replaced a few of the drinks that got away at no charge. We also loved the pupu at Dukes (crispy coconut shrimp, crab and macnut wontons, and mango BBQ ribs) and the Mai tais were great as well as dinner one evening plus they have a happy hour menu from 3 to 5pm with $5 mai tai's and discount beers. One night we took our good bottle of wine down to the edge of the koi pond as it was very romantic there with the tiki torches lit. What else can I say, I love Maui and I loved this resort. Oh and we found no unpleasant odors on windy days and on calm days. Plus the hotel staff was fantastic, the parking convenient and valet quick and friendly. And they allowed my parents and sister to enjoy the pool with us with free parking tokens supplied to them by Dukes. Perfect for families. I still prefer the Hyatt pool due to the adult-only side with the new pool-side bar for adult only/romantic trips and the hammocks by the beach but I gotta say, I love the Honua Kai condo-style rooms better than the Hyatt rooms and I loved Dukes drink prices.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but.......................”
Reviews.Author: wrnandwonderful
Reviews.Content: We had booked our trip at Honua Kai through our travel agent. Unfortunately, using a travel agent ultimately means you end up booking the room using the management group that mans the front desk and generally runs the resort. First off, this was a trip we had booked to celebrate my 50th b-day as well as my son and husbands birthdays (all are within 8 days of each other!) After much deliberation and reading all the glowing reviews on tripadvisor, we decided to book a 2 bedroom with a partial ocean view. When we booked a few months before, I made a request to have a room with a pool view realizing that, although we may not be getting a dead on ocean view......we would at least have the ambience of a water view. What we ended up with was one of the biggest dissapointments of our vacation. After being handed the keys to a back corner suite with a view of the ocean to the side of the lanai (when you leaned over the railing) and a full on view of a grassy field with a noisy highway (nothing like the sound of cars and semi-trucks to say your on vacation....right?).......we went back to the desk and asked for other options. The next was a room on the inner court on the ground level. Big lanai, a barely there view of the ocean on your tippy toes over the overgrown foliage in the garden next to the lanai. It also had the added benefit of giving anyone walking by a full on view of our resort experience. I tried one more time with the front desk, thinking maybe the third time would be a charm. They handed me the keys to another suite and said that this was our last option. It was on the same side as the first unit but a little further up to the front of the building with a slightly better view of the water. So we walked in, went out to the lanai and well......I felt my eyes well up. The wind was whipping around and we got the distinct scent of sewage wafting up to meet us upon our entrance outside. We still had a view of the pasture with the main highway noise. At this point we gave up. I tredged back to the front desk and asked for the keys to the unit on the inner court first floor. At least we would be somewhat protected from the winds and the scent of sewage (or so we thought.) We asked to be kept on a waiting list for a unit that met our request when we booked months earlier. That was the last time I had any contact with the front desk. They never got back to us (I think our request was probably tossed in the garbage after we left the lobby.) First off, this unit does not have a viable view of anything other than the other guests walking past the lanai and a grassy courtyard. Great for people watching, but if I wanted to people watch I would have booked a trip to New York. I felt as though the big $$$$ we spent to book this unit was a huge rip off. My husband thought that this unit was probably not a sold unit. In other words, no comforts of home. No condiments (come on.....at least some salt and pepper), no foil, plastic wrap, nothing. The money we had hoped to save by cooking a few meals in the unit was never seen.
