We ended up at the grocery store across the street and by the time we payed the bill, we could have easily eaten out and saved ourselves the money, as well as the headache of trying to make up for the lack of even the basics for cooking a meal. After reading the reviews here on tripadvisor by people who had units much better equiped than ours, it seemed viable that indeed, we were probably in a unit the resort owned and hadn't sold yet. Maybe I'm wrong, but after thinking about it, it made sense that they might push you into one of these unowned units. It would stand to reason that the potential for the management company to make more money with one of these units might sway them to push a customer into occupancy. Regardless, it was such a bummer to come to the realization that the money we spent a night in this unit was what we would leave Hawaii with........the feeling we were taken. I do think Honua Kai is a lovely resort. The three pools are nice, none however are deeper than 5ft. No diving here, but they are refreshing none the less. You will not completely escape the smell of the sewage plant across the highway. Many times, as we sunbathed at the pools, we would catch the scent of sewage. The other thing that has to be mentioned was something I only briefly touched on. THE WIND!!!!! It dominated our trip. The trade winds here are crazy and while I do not believe it is a problem everyday of the year here, it certainly should be considered when you are trying to plan your vacation. It was a constant source of irritation. You couldn't go anywhere on the grounds without having to contend with the wind. It blew our clothing on our lanai out onto the the grassy courtyard, it toppeled over our cocktails at the pools, it made reading at the pool a challenge as well. Lastly, housekeeping needs to step it up. I felt the need to sanitize when I looked around and realized there were fingerprints and smudges on every surface. From the cocktail tables to the faucets in the restrooms. They leave a message that all the units are lightly cleaned everyday and on the third day the rooms are given a deeper cleaning. While they were really good about refreshing towels and making our beds, I can say without a doubt there was never a deep cleaning during our stay and many times I simply took it upon myself to take care of the deeper cleaning. At least what I could, given the lack of cleaning products. The nice thing though was that the resort was definately at a low occupancy. One need only walk around to see that this was not a crowded place. Most of the rooms on the inner courtyard were not occupied (adding to our ire) and there were many times we could go to the pool and only a handful of people would be lounging around. You could easily find a chair that wasn't surrounded by people and feel like you were by yourself. All in all I would say that Honua Kai resort is indeed a beautiful facility. The scent of sewage wasn't always there so I might have been able to overlook it if our overall experience hadn't been one of regret about our suite. Take my advise........go thru the owners of these condos. Absolutely, there should be no surprise as to what you are buying for your money and hindsight being 20/20, I now realize I could of spent a whole lot less and gotten a better unit overall. The owners will give you a much more precise description of the unit and what the view entails. I also think there is more of an incentive for the owner to make sure your experience is a good one too. There are even a few privately owned companies on the island that advertise some of the owner owned condos for rent. But, vrbo really seems to have the best of the best and is a more reputable avenue to deal with owners directly. As I said before, my experience was definately skewed by my attempts to have an experience that lived up to what the resort claims. Being at the mercy of the management company to live up to those expectations was disappointing. If I ever go back it will be armed with the knowledge that I do not need to be led by a faceless entity deciding how my experience will evolve. Next time, if there is a next time, it will be with the knowledge that I have other options. You do too! Good luck!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: RosiePalms85
Reviews.Content: Our suite was fantastic. It had everything we needed, from snorkeling gear to condiments. The staff were all friendly and helpful, and the grounds are well tended. Lovely pools and the ocean is just a few steps away. I would highly recommend this resort, and will be coming back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional NEW Resort. Better than ALL of the rest!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lynnieee
Reviews.Content: O.K. so here's the deal. This is the newest hotel built on West Maui in over 20 years. It is new, sleek and hasn't been over touristed (if you know what I mean). There are studios, one, two and three bedroom suites. These are not your typical hotel rooms. The beds all have white duvets and nice white linens. No flowery bed spreads. Yea. I would recommend that you reserve a one or two bedroom depending upon your needs and number of people traveling with you. Flat screen t.v.'s in every room. Seperate bathtub/shower. Full kitchen completely outfitted with all cooking equipment. Great Viking BBQ's outside near the pool. Great gyms. Duke's Restaurant in front of Resort on the beach!! I promise....that you will love this Resort and the prices are introductory and exceptional. The beach is not crowded and great for snorkling. There are great reefs right in front of the property. Beautiful Koi pond and public area's with 4 pools. I wud recommend requesting a room facing the ocean. Go for the one bedroom, minimum (sleeps 4 easily with fold out queen sofabed in livingroom). The 2 bedroom can sleep 6 easily with 2 full bathrooms. Or, if it's just 2 of you the studio is better than any other hotel room anywhere on Maui. Just try to get one with a view. Dukes is fun, great food for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Great nightly entertainment too. There is a beach walk that you can take all of the way to Whalers Village. Only drawback is that the Spa is not complete. But, you can spend your spa time at the pool sliding down the water slide. Or stroll next door to the spa at the Westin. Coming from a couple who travel extensively we feel that this was a REAL FIND. Have fun. Aloha!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place”
Reviews.Author: colton_10
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a week at the new Honua Kai resort on Maui. From the check in experience to the grounds the place was impeccable. The staff was always friendly and very helpful. The bed was the best bed I have every slept on. We enjoyed dinner at Dukes and long walks on the beach. The units are extremely large and way better then staying in an older dated condo or a hotel room. We will be going back as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Unit 514 at Honua Kai - Great place, great trip”
Reviews.Author: JKatlanta
Reviews.Content: We just got back from an 8-night stay in unit 514 at Honua Kai Resort. This is a great one-bedroom condo, and was perfect for us celebrating our 25th anniversary. The owners have made sure that everything was included in this condo, from the two big flat-screen TV's to great bed linens to the L'Occitane products in the bathroom, as well as secure underground parking. Free WiFi is included, and they even sent us a big welcome basket loaded with fruits, nuts, etc., thanking us for spending our Silver Anniversary at their condo. They've also loaded up their storage area with beach chairs, boogie boards, etc. All very thoughtful. The condo looks out on both the ocean and the West Maui Mountains. We came here to do a little sightseeing and to chill out, and we were successful with both. The resort, including pool and grounds, is gorgeous. We ate at Duke's, an open-air restaurant on the beach, several times while we were there - great food, and even better MaiTai's. The on-site concierge, Kimmee, is extremely helpful. She helped us plan a helicopter tour (pricey but worth every penny) and encouraged us to take a sunset cruise since the humpback whales were still there (saw a TON of them on the cruise). She was also able to print out our boarding passes for our trip home. We had rented a convertible for the trip, so spent some time cruising all around Maui. There is some spectacular ocean scenery going north towards Kapalua. We passed on driving to Hana since it eats up an entire day, but we saw a lot of waterfalls and scenery on the helicopter tour that we would never have seen otherwise. Lahaina was loaded with shops and art galleries, so we spent a fair amount of time there. We took in the Feast at LeLe luau as well - front row tables for couples - and that was a lot of fun. The only downside was our flight - Atlanta to Maui is a long way. We booked first-class tickets using frequent flier miles almost 11 months before the trip, so that helped a lot. We would make this trip again in a heartbeat, and wouldn't hesitate to stay in the same unit. The Trinh's have made this unit a wonderful place to stay (there's a little picture of their family on the kitchen counter), and I don't think you'd find a much better location just a few miles north of Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “New Resort, Great Pools, Luxury Condo makes for the Best Vacation Ever!”
Reviews.Author: martri24
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a seven night stay at The Honua Kai on Kaanapali Beach and can easily say that it was the best vacation ever! For my 40th birthday and our kids' Spring Break, we wanted to visit Maui and stay at a beachfront resort with plenty of amenities (fun pools, mainly) for our two boys, ages 2 and 8. After months of research on tripadvisor, we wanted to stay at Honua Kai since it was brand new and had great reviews. Being north of Black Rock also made it more appealing since there are mainly vacation condos (and not hotels), making the beaches and pools seem less crowded than at the mega-resorts. We first tried booking through Intrawest, the rental management company, but they only had "Mountain-view" units that also overlooked the parking lot and main road. Their condos in the courtyard were nice, but more than we could afford to spend. Instead, we found a owner on homeaway.com at $250 per night for a one-bedroom Oceanview condo. We stayed in unit #514 of the Hokulani Building, its on the fifth floor and had great views of the Pacific Ocean and West Maui mountains. It had very nice furniture, a beautiful kitchen with Bosch appliances and granite countertops, a large bathroom with two sinks (you'll need it for four people), a washer and dryer, two LCD TVs, and a big lanai to relax and enjoy breakfast. The owners were very nice and accommodating throughout the whole rental process. They stocked the condo with beach towels, boogie boards and beach chairs so that we didn't have to buy them while we were there. They also had movies, games and a pack and play for our two year-old. These were extra conveniences that we couldn't find at hotels. That side of the resort is next to an empty lot that was to be the third phase of the Westin Kaanapali Villas. They finished the foundation and won't start up again for another couple of years, according to the staff. I guess the timeshare market has cooled down a bit with the rest of the real estate. It was nice and quiet, and we had a lot of sunlight in the condo. You can also see a lot more of the Ocean and the entire island of Lanai in the distance. The other condos in the courtyard overlooks the pools and nice landscaping, but they really are in a "fishbowl" as another review mentioned. The lanais face each other, so its not as private. The staff at Honua Kai were very nice. We got to know everyone from the bellhop, front desk, Kimmie (the concierge), and the waiters at the pools. Its hard not to be friendly when you live on Maui! We would eat lunch at the Aina Gourmet Market near the Lobby. They have great sandwiches and gelato at reasonable prices. There is even a recreational office near the pools where you can rent or buy snorkeling gear, sunscreen, or set up a whale-watching excursion. The three pools were amazing and each had their own flair. The one at our building was more relaxed, with an infinity-edge looking into the Ocean. The kids' pool had a waterslide, grotto, sand area, and some shallow spots for the younger kids to play at. The third pool was more of a lazy-river type with bridges and lush landscaping. There were also spas at every pool. With the resort of this size, it never felt crowded. I know that people are still closing escrow in the newer Konea Tower, maybe that has something to do with it. There are also Viking grills near the pools that you can use, and they were always cleaned by the staff. It was nice to swim all day, cook your dinner, eat it poolside and watch the sunset. The beach in front of Honua Kai was nice. There are coral reefs as you enter the water, which is great snorkeling but you must pack your sport sandals to protect your feet. The water was fine, and we even saw a couple of whales out in the distance. You don't want to miss Duke's Maui restaurant. We ate there four times during our stay, three for breakfast and one for dinner. Great food, friendly service, comfortable atmosphere, and reasonable prices. The Hula Pie truly lives up to its reputation! We got to see Henry Kapono, a famous Hawaiian musician, performing there on Friday night with the sunsetting behind him. It was our last night in Maui and a great way to end our vacation. We're looking forward to coming back to Honua Kai soon!

Reviews.Title: “The Most Amazing Resort on Maui!!”
Reviews.Author: beachgal1
Reviews.Content: We just enjoyed our first stay at the newly constructed Honua Kai Resort. We have been travelling to Maui for years and this place is clearly the best on the island. The lobby and grounds were so beautiful. We stayed in a 2bd/2ba unit that had a lot of space. The Condos are wonderfully furnished and they had every appliance and cooking utensil that we needed for our extended stay. The beds were really comfortable. Our kids LOVED the pools and waterslide it was a real treat to have Dukes deliver yummy drinks and food to our poolside lounge chairs. We enjoyed the walks along the beach boardwalk to the Whalers Village and the snorkeling too. We worked with an individual owner through VRBO and our experience was wonderful. ...definitely the way to go. They provided many extras such as beachchairs, boogie boards and toys for the kiddos. Our experience with the staff and lifeguards were great. We really enjoy the "condo vacation" experience and Honua Kai is clearly the BEST on Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Because its new, its nice.”
Reviews.Author: travelingwithmer
Reviews.Content: It's a beautiful property with everything you could want in a condo. The rooms are nicely sized and the kitchens have everything we needed. However, it is not a resort and spa. There is no room service, housekeeping consists of emptying the trash and providing towels if you want them. The beds are only made when the sheets are changed once every three days. The spa isn't open yet. We stayed in the newer tower and it was very quiet. None of the rooms next to us were occupied. Our room faced the pools so leaving the balcony doors open occassionally meant some noise, but at least from our room we never had the odor of the wastewater treatment plant across the way. We could smell the treatment plant when walking between the towers. The pools were very nice and maintained and the staff at the towel stands were friendly. As others have mentioned, the beach is rocky. We went to other beaches for playing in waves. It was extremely windy for much of our trip. I don't know how common that is for April, but it was windy in other parts of the island too, not just near the condo. Duke's was great. The food and service were consistantly good. The fitness center on the property was well equipped and clean. The free internet access worked fine. There is a Times Supermarket in walking distance that was very convenient. I didn't like the mattress on our bed. I'm a light sleeper and every time my spouse moved the whole bed shook - it reminded me of our old waterbed! So to sum it up, I won't be going back to the Honua Kai because there are places in Hawaii with nicer beaches and better beds. But if you're a heavy sleeper and are more into the pools than the beach, this place is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot, great resort and great weather”
Reviews.Author: CoryGLee
Reviews.Content: The resort and room was beautiful. The room was very large compared to normal suites. The beds are very comfortable. The bathrooms are first class. Full gourmet kitchen with high end appliances. We had great weather. The pools (3 in total) are perfect for kids and adults. Dukes is a great pool side restaurant. Great Beach walk in front of resort that connects to Whalers shopping center. Lots of golf courses in the area. I look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a Real Hotel but a Condo with housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: CinemaDP
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not really a hotel. There is a front desk and a concierge, a nice general store and a restaurant but the feeling is that of an apt. complex. This is great if you have small kids and need a kitchen not great if you have teenagers or want the excitement of a hotel. It is always windy with sunshowers. It is on the side of the island that has perfect weather for growing sugarcane not vacation. Just south of the hotel in true Lahaina it would always be sunny, dry and no wind. As the locals say it is north of the wind line.

Reviews.Title: “North beach Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Mauifan125
Reviews.Content: Our family of four got cozy in Studio 423 for nine nights. We are familiar with the area so getting there was no problem. We booked through a private property amanager so our only experience with the front desk was to purchase the parking permit at $10/day. Since we were not charged the lamentable "resort fee" common with these resorts, we did not expect any extra services or use of thinigs like the spa or business room. Our unit had WiFi in it so no worries. There is an internet room in the post office at the strip mall out on the highway. The grounds are excellent and pristine. The staff extremely friendly and welcoming. Every one from housekeeping through pool attendants would say hello...following the "10 foot rule". We had fairly windy weather. Large breakers on shore for boogie boarding. We would walk closer down to the Westin (300 yards) for some calmer snorkeliing. Polarized sunglasses can show you where the rocks are. We had a terrific dinner at Duke's, right on the property. Reasonable priced all thinigs considered (if you ignore the $9.00 Mai Tais). Lots of families there. Our building seemed to be about 30% occupied based on lighting at night. We were told the newer building was a morgue. Best to go soon while supply and demand keeps rates down.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, great condo, pool marginal for teenagers but awesome for kids, windy part of the Island”
Reviews.Author: PackersFanCleveland
Reviews.Content: This is day 2 of 4 days at Honua Kai and I am writing this from the living room table in my spacious two bedroom condo. I am not the owner of the condo so I have not axe to grind (or polish as it may be) but I also can't say enough about how nice the accomodations are. My condo is a corner unit on the 6th floor of the Konea tower (brand new) and we face north / east so we have a nice view of Molokai and Lanai as well as other condo buildings up the beach and the West Maui mountains. I would suggest that when you book your condo here you should be cautious as to where your room is as some will provide considerably more / less privacy and better or worse views. Would not suggest any of the ground floor units as there is almost zero privacy. As for my room (Konea Tower unit 634) it is awesome. 45 foot long lanai/porch with window walls that open up completely to living room, master bedroom and kitchen. Two Thumbs Up!!! Full size kitchen with Bosch appliances, beatiful bathrooms totally decked out. Granite countertops everywhere. NICE! As for the pool: my kids are 13 and 14 and the pool seems more oriented to younger kids or adults that want to lay in the sun all day. I watched several young kids run from pool to pool to lazy river to water slide to water grotto and back again all day. They had a blast. Even though this is prime Easter vacation season the pool was not crazy crowded. Lots of amenities that you would find at a regular hotel. As for the draw-backs I would say that the beach here is not very deep especially when tide is high (full moon during our trip). However, we snorkeled right from our beach and saw tons of great coral, fish, sea urchins, etc. Also, it is fairly windy here although it seems that the island is exceptionally windy right now so possibly just an anomally. But it was windy at our hotel and calm elsewhere south on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience Would Definitely Return.”
Reviews.Author: Peanut51
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 8 day at the Honua kai Resort and Spa for our 25th wedding anniversary in a studio room with ocean view. We had a fantastic view facing directly out at the quiet pool and beach could see wales from our room! We booked our condo thru a third party, not directly with the Honua Kai Property managers, this save a good deal of money. While we did not receive daily room cleaning and make up we were fine as we keep things orderly anyway. The studio was new with a great kitchen and all the amenities, including dishes, cookware, bedding, towels (Bath and Beach). Appliances were top notch, furniture was clean and comfortable, bed was great as well. Toiletries were provided. I would defiantly recommend this property. My wife and I are not big nightlife people so the low key, quite and laid back atmosphere of the resort fit us perfectly. Because the property is a condo type property there is not a high density of guest for its size. If fact my wife and I rarely saw anyone in the elevators and only and handful of guest at the pools and beach. This made it feel secluded and romantic. Dukeâ€™s restaurant is an added pleasure, great fish and drinks. The main dining room is pricey but the food is very good. The bar menu is more reasonable with great selection for a lighter casual meal. Great place to have a beer and watch the sunset!!! Location was great as well. Kaanapali beach with all the resorts, shops and restaurants is just a 20 minute walk down the beach walk. Some nice snorkeling spots are just a 5 minute walk. You can also do a beach scuba dive from this location as well. Lots of sea life included turtles and Humuhumunukunukuapaa. Couple visits you donâ€™t want to miss while on Maui. The road to Hanaâ€¦. Fantastic!!! Just get a guide first and scope out the sites you want to see. Snorkeling at mile marker 14 on State Highway 30 (the one that goes through Lahaina), beach is not much but it is easy to get into the water, lots of fish, the coral is only about 2 to 3 feet below the surface and you can swim out 50+ yards. The Gazebo restaurant for breakfast at Napili Bay. And if you are looking for a great scuba dive shop I would recommend New Horizons, great fun. Lahaina is just a 10 minute drive. I would definitely recommend the Honua Kai Resort and Spa for a great Relaxed Holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly a great condo, but didn't work out for us.”
Reviews.Author: Nat022
Reviews.Content: The trip started out great, we were all having a great time. The condo is well furnished and the hotel has a nice lobby. The pools are great for kids as they are heated. A few days after we arrived we got a norwalk type bug and things went downhill from there. Since we got sick I have heard that it is going around Maui, so be careful if you come here. If you rent a unit directly from an owner be prepared to be pretty much ignored by the hotel front desk. They will not help you with anything. Any and all requests had to go through the property owner including room cleaning, towels, pretty much anything you can think of. If you say you are 3rd party they won't even let you use the computers at the business center. Which apparently you can only print boarding passes with. The spa was advertised to be open but wasn't. The weather is also not as good at the north end of the beach so we often had rain either in the morning or afternoon. It was also very very windy. The beach in front of the hotel was pretty rough and not really a place for kids to play. But the pool more than made up for that. All in all, a disappointing vacation but mostly because we got sick. This place had potential but the unwillingness of the front desk staff to help made it not a place I want to return to. Next time we will check out another beach!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel stay in Maui - Barefoot elegance”
Reviews.Author: Wowtravels
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here at the beginning of our Maui vacation and had a wonderful time. We loved this beautiful resort. It was a great stay, from the time we walked into the luxurious yet comfortable lobby - with gleaming floors, cosy lounge nooks, fresh flowers, staff by your side and a beautiful Koi pond, we felt like we have stepped into paradise. Everything was perfect and it's well worth the hefty price tag to stay here. The suite we had was functional, roomy and had a very homey feel. Kimmy, the hotelâ€™s concierge was extremely helpful, gracious and welcomed our family to Maui with opened arms. It was my favourite hotel we stayed in all of Maui (and we stayed in 4 other hotels), which says allot about the quality of this place. The pool and beach areas where relaxing and never crowded unlike so many other resorts. The hotelâ€™s market and Dukeâ€™s restaurant where great places to dine. We had the best Lava Flow drinks at Dukeâ€™s. Just some things to keep in mind if you stay here and some travel tips: â€¢ If you book a resort-view suite, make sure to ask for the south-east side and a high floor (as for now, there are no construction going on) and you should be able to see part of the ocean if you have a room above the 4th floor. If you donâ€™t like street noise, donâ€™t bother to book a resort-view suite, as you will get this no matter where your room is located. So, if you donâ€™t like street noise, pay up and get an ocean-view suite. â€¢ The hotelâ€™s spa isnâ€™t opened yet but I'm sure it will be a great place, it was to bad we couldnâ€™t try it out yet (it should be opened in mid-April, 2010) â€¢ In the Canary Mall, (about 4 stop lights south of the resort) Safeway is a great place to buy groceries, wine, beer, liquor etc. â€¢ Go to the Old Lahaina Luau, itâ€™s lots of fun and is a great way to learn about Hawaiiâ€™s culture â€¢ Take the scenic drive up the Kapalua trail, past the Ritz-Carlton, itâ€™s well worth it â€¢ Try out the islandâ€™s banana bread and the shave ice, itâ€™s a great treat. â€¢ Take the road trip to Hana, itâ€™s so worth it but make sure to stay overnight at Hotel Hana, as you will need this after the drive. â€¢ On the way to Hana, stop in Paia, a great chic little town with neat shops and places to dine at Happy travels. We had a wonderful trip to Maui and have a little of Hawaii in our soul.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: hollylew
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about the Honua Kai! It is in walking distance of other hotels, restaurants, and shops, but it has a much more quiet, private feel than the big name hotels down the beach. The condos are exceptional. We stayed in the 3-bedroom, which also includes a good sized living room, kitchen, and a dining area that seats 8. The kitchen appliances were all Viking. The lanai held another dining table and comfy chairs, and the whole wall of the living room is a glass panel that opens to the lanai. We had a fabulous view of the ocean and the swimming pools, and at night the tiki torches all lit up. The outdoor areas are also great, with a nice, wide sandy beach and great pools. Because it's not overly crowded you don't have to get up at the crack of dawn to get a lounge chair by the pool or to rent one on the beach. The restaurant, Duke's, is open to the ocean and the food is excellent. We had breakfast, lunch, and dinner there, and really enjoyed all three. The service at the Honua Kai was also excellent, and all of the employees very nice. I would highly recommend the Honua Kai!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: scwilly
Reviews.Content: We stayed 8 nights and had a wonderful time. We were upgraded to a 2 bedroom (traveling with our adult daughter). The rooms are exceptionally well furnished ... top of the line appliances in the kitchen complete with washer and dryer. Maid service was excellent, daily bed service, dishwasher and laundry soap provided in abundance. Sheets not changed daily but often enough and lots of extra towels. We ate breakfast in, lots of families used the gas BBQs on the property. Quite a resort experience like none other we have experienced. The location is great, right on a quiet beach and at present a distance away from the other resorts in the area. This made the beach much quieter than others we walked passed. Recommended for families or not. It was a great experience

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Relaxing Stay!”
Reviews.Author: TheRfamily
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, with our two daughters 18 and 15 spent 11 days at the Honua Kai Resort and Spa, partial view. We had a fantastic view facing directly out at the quiet pool and beach!!! Just Beautiful!! Lovely condo with all the luxuries of home! The condo's are new! With all top notch bedding appliances, washer, dryer, safe, TV, bath, large shower, lots of towels, don't bring any from home, we didn't. Toiletries, laundry detergent, kitchen, soaps, paper towels in adequate supply. Bedding was changed everyday. I suggest room service do a thorough daily polish of the Kitchen and bath counter tops, and a light washing of the floor. (They do provide a mop and pail in the broom closet.) We are neat and tidy travelers. "When I'm on holidays and stay in an awesome place like this, I want to be pampered, and do not want to wash floors.") Other than that, we enjoyed our wonderful stay at the Honua Kai Resort & Spa. We will return, and will highly recommend your Condos to all our family and friends. We have friends who are arriving next week. We booked with Expedia, where we found the best deal. We felt the $25 resort fee covered the parking of our rental Jeep, awesome pools and decks, and the numerous beach towels. However, many other guests have mentioned the fee was steep. Most hotels charge this much for daily parking. Maybe Honua Kai should re-look the fee if guests are not using full services (Parking/Towels?) We enjoy good family dinners, and I prepared most of our awesome Hawaiian ingredients meals in. There is an awesome fish shop, and produce shop less than three blocks away. One block away is Times market, I would compare to a great Save on Foods. Look no more further, the Meat, Produce and Fruit are awesome!!! We went out to dinner at Dukes Restaurant on our first night. Unfortunately only two of our four meals were delicious. The Risotto, and Ravioli were very good, however they should really take the Chicken & Mahi Mahi off the menu. PERIOD! The Ice Cream Dessert is Awesome! Everyday we drove approximately 10 minutes and spent our mornings and early afternoons at the Beautiful, D.T. Flemming Beach Park, rated as the Best Beach in America in 2006!, Great Beach, waves, and peace, why go anywhere else? After having a light lunch back at the condo we spend our entire afternoon at the onsite pool decks, awesome sun chairs, great pools, and incredible beach whale views. The Concierge was great, we booked the VIP Hyatt Luau, beautiful show, awesome meal. Our daughters even had pictures taken with the handsome young dancers that came out to meet everyone at the end of the show. The Concierge also booked our daughters surfing lessons at Royal Hawaiian Surf Co. The girls are awesome swimmers, so they were up and surfing the waves real quick with the excellent instructor. We watched and took pictures close by. Whalers Village Shopping Mall is close by, a quick walk or drive. We did a bit of shopping here, and also picked up sun tan lotion, and Chocolate gifts at the ABC Store. We spent a lot of time on Front Street, great shopping, Best Shaved Ice, Ululani's Hawaiian Shave Ice, see David and his staff, very friendly customer service!!! Ono's Gelato has the Best Italian Ice Cream!, (friendly gentlemen service.) We ate another dinner out at the Hard Rock Cafe, great food atmosphere, and service! We ventured out to Kihei for some quick good deals, on chain's and gifts. Our daughter's favourite Mall, Queen Kaâ€™ahumanu Centre where they found "Forever 21!" Great shopping even with no big sale. The Best Coffee, Visit the MauiGrown Coffee Company Store and sample the famous Maui Mokka tm and other varieties of coffee grown by MauiGrown Coffee. The MauiGrown Coffee Company Store offers both green coffee and roasted coffee as well as coffee from other parts of Maui and Kona coffee. They are located in Lahaina at 277 Lahainaluna Road next to the famous Lahaina Smokestack. We brought a few lbs home for us and family. I would definitely recommend the Honua Kai Resort and Spa for the Best Relaxed Holiday in Maui, Safe, Quiet, Clean, Comfort, and Quality! Thanks you so much!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely what we were looking for and more”
Reviews.Author: toga12
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and kids stayed at Honua Kia room 545 and could not have asked for a better and more comfortable location.While enjoying the beautiful ocean views from the oversized lanai we watched the whales and the surfers right in front of the hotels beach.The famous Dukes restaurant and bar was literally steps away and we never had any problem getting chairs right at the pool.Kids had a great time in the pools , waterslide and beach. I will recommend this location and look forward to coming back as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience at Honua Kai!”
Reviews.Author: JTea
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Honua Kai in February 2010, in room 929, which is a 3 bedroom unit. Beautiful lobby, room, and view. The resort has one main pool, one lazy river-type of pool, a couple of kids areas, and a medium-sized water slide. There is one restaurant, Dukes, which was pretty good, but there are better restaurants elsewhere in Kaanapali and Lahaina. Great location along the beach walk, but a bit away from the busier Kaanapali (Honua Kai is in North Kaanapali). We had great views of the ocean - lots of whale watching in the early morning and evening. I would absolutely love to stay at the Honua Kai again, if we could get a similar rate ($450 a night for the 3-bedroom unit, which is about half-price). Booked through vrbo.com.

Reviews.Title: “This is a must stay place”
Reviews.Author: mrlac
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip through Orbitz and were originally booked at another hotel. But due to Orbitz' incompetence, and that of the other hotel, we were transferred to the Honua Kai. WHAT AN UPGRADE! This hotel was excellent in every way, shape, and form. Beautiful rooms with all the amenities (granite counter tops, stainless steel appliances, large bathroom, etc.), great views, HDTVs, wireless access, and we never heard any sounds from above, below, or next door. The staff was beyond helpful and engaging, taking care of any question that we had. The pool area was great for families and for couples alike...hot tubs, slides, waterfalls. The beach was just a few steps away from the pool area and felt very private, which is hard to do in the Kaanapali/Lahaina area. Plus, there's a Duke's located on the property. And for anyone that knows about Duke's, you'll know what a bonus that is. The location is about as good as you can expect in Maui. It's a 10-15 minute drive to Lahaina, which is where most people spend their evenings. It's also a 20 minute drive away from Kapalua, which is one of the most scenic places you can see on Maui. I would stay at the Honua Kai many times over and would recommend it to anyone who is looking at staying in the north beach area of Kaanapali.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous! Luxury feel. Great Service.”
Reviews.Author: gourmand916
Reviews.Content: One of the most beautiful properties -- can't imagine a nicer condo/room in Maui. All top-notch decor, kitchen, amenities. Service hit all the right marks, and the concierge was very helpful. We'll definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “\awesome resort !!!”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravelmd
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying at the newest resort on Maui. Wow !!! we were all impressed by all the pools, waterslide and great beach. We stayed in the newest building Konea and had a 1 bedroom and den which was great for the kids. This is truly an amazing resort for families. Fantastic kids club and all the amenities of home !! Check out unit 308 Konea

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort on a mediocre beach”
Reviews.Author: kwickly
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 weeks at Honua Kai (Hokulani Bldg) and had a great time. It is an ideal place for families because of the waterslide and family pool. The resort was not busy when we visited, but the new building had only just opened and had very few people staying in it. The units are big and beautifully decorated. Duke's restaurant is reasonable and family friendly. It is a perfect location to take nice walks along the north kaanapali boardwalk and the Times supermarket is only a 10 minute walk away. The main drawback here is the beach. There is coral all the way up to the point where the sand meets the waves. I was not comfortable swimming here and wouldn't let my kids play in the waves. This means that we were driving south to the Eldorado beach or over to the Whaler's village side. I missed not being able to jump in the water first thing in the morning. The setting is great for whale watching and for spending relaxing time with family. It is a new resort and there are definitely things that need tweaking. I had a big fall on some slippery pool deck on the day after we arrived. We saw numerous other people wipe out on on the pool deck. It was new and hadn't been roughed up yet, I guess. When I fell, I had been carrying my son and, luckily, he was not hurt. I was banged up with some bruises and scrapes and couldn't walk well for a few days. The management sent a few different staff members to my room to take pictures and make sure I filled out a report (to clear them of responsibility) but not one person seemed concerned for my well-being. We had to ask 3 times to have ice brought over to me after the fall. I didn't even see a first aid kit or first-aid attendant at all. I imagine this will be a serious concern for them in the future if they don't get themselves sorted out on the safety front. All in all though, a great vacation. I love Maui and will likely look for a place with a nicer beach next time.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort feel/Condo amenities with stellar pool and beach!”
Reviews.Author: mjpdOregon
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our stay at the Honua Kai. I wasn't sure if it would feel like a resort or a condo- but it was the best of both! The grounds and the lobby are beautiful, with an island feel to everything. The beach in front of the hotel was perfect for the kids to play and for swimming or snorkling. If you go to the very south end of the beach at the hotel, there is a great place to enter for snorkling. I got to swim with a sea turtle- truly amazing. Duke's, the restaurant on the property, was sooo good. And you get to watch the whales migrate while you are eating. Really friendly staff too. They also have a little coffee/snack shop in the lobby. The rooms were top of the line in everyway. No complaints at all. I slept like a baby. Comfy beds! It was nice having a washer/dryer in the unit too. The pools- lots of them- were so much fun for the kids. Lazy river, waterslide, 3ft kid pool, large adult pool, too many hot tubs to count, and a sandy bottom pool for the little kids. Just a tip- don't sit in the cabanas if you haven't rented them... We had ordered lunch poolside from Duke's, it was very windy and my little kids got got in one so they could eat. Someone was sent over to kick them out (even though the resort was very slow and I never saw one being rented). We will go back again next year - this place was awesome. Take your coffee down to the beach in the morning and watch the ocean- what a great way to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “Our Honeymoon in Unit #514”
Reviews.Author: Mtm2131
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Honua Kai unit #514 for our Honeymoon and we are SO glad that we did!! The resort was great! It was beautiful, quiet, somewhat secluded, but still very close to everything. All of the staff there were very nice and helpful. They restaurant was not finished yet and still under construction while we were there, but we never heard a thing. We lay by the pool one day and could hear it,but that was it. I loved the fact that it did not feel like a hotel. The beach in front of the resort was pretty empty so it felt like our own private beach.It was the perfect honeymoon spot! Even more impressive was the room. It was beautiful, spacious (for the 2 of us), had amazing views, a bigger bathroom than my masterbath back home and that bed...it seriously, felt like a cloud!! All of the little touches just really made us feel welcome. The Trinh's are the nicest people. They really went out of their way to work with us and to ensure that we had a great time. You will NOT find a better deal on a nicer room. (especially one that is so spacious and has a washer and dryer!) I literally can not think of anything that could have made it better. (Except for staying longer! :) We would like to thank the Trinh's for helping to make our Honeymoon everything we hoped it would be!

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Staff Couldn't Have Been Nicer...”
Reviews.Author: Roozalicious
Reviews.Content: Honua Kai has to be one of the best condo/resorts on Maui for families with young kids. And their Manager's Special Rates make it a great deal for the incredibly expensive "Upper West Side" of Maui. The grounds and pools are lovely. Our condo unit was beautifully furnished, and the kitchen had everything you could want--including a washer/dryer! Their brand-new, on-the-beach restaurant, Duke's, served good food, reasonably priced, though its wait staff seemed somewhat inexperienced, needing to be reminded to bring cutlery, napkins, condiments, etc.. Unfortunately, the beach directly in front of the resort isn't good for swimming, because the reef is too close to the water's edge, making it difficult to get in the ocean. And the elegant formal pool was often filled with screaming kids--not conducive to relaxation. There is another "family fun" pool, with a nifty waterslide and play areas, but most parents seemed to prefer the main pool area which had umbrellas for shade. Because of that, I don't recommend Honua Kai as a serene tropical getaway for adults without children.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: falcon01
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are just finishing our stay at the Honua Kai Resort and Spa. We had a great time and loved everything about the resort. The suites were clean and spacious and the staff was outstanding. We are already making plans for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “One week wasn't long enough”
Reviews.Author: travgalincal
Reviews.Content: First of all, we (my husband and I) got a great deal on a one-bedroom unit. We booked through VRBO, and the unit we booked was managed by the onsite management company. We had a "partial ocean view" room. From the room itself, there was no ocean view (just the other building), but from the balcony, there was a partial view. The one-bedroom unit was very nice, new and clean. No complaints there. The housekeeping service skipped us on our first day, so I made sure to call on the other days to let them know when we were going out. The room was cleaned on those days. The grounds are lovely, and the pools were very nice. The lazy river pool hadn't opened as of January 30th, but it looked nice as well. We ate at Dukes a couple of times and ordered poolside service for lunch one day. The food from Dukes was good, and the proximity to the beach was great. The sandy beach was nice, but the ocean was pretty rough and was very rocky underfoot. We did love snorkeling right in front of the resort though. I did notice the smell of the sewage treatment facility across the street on a couple of evenings when the wind had died down. Fortunately, it only happened on two nights, and we just closed our doors and ran the a/c those nights. If you're looking for a condo unit with some resort amenities, I think you will be happy with Honua Kai. If you're looking for a full-service resort, you may be a bit underwhelmed. But all in all, it was a great place. I wish I were still there!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: IsisBritishColumbia
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Our two bedroomed apartment was fabulous, clean and incredibly well-equipped. The apartment had a very efficient air conditioning system, but even with the balcony doors open, the room remained cool and airy. One thing I really noticed was how quiet the hotel was. Once the windows were closed, you couldn't hear a sound from outside and I never heard any noise from the adjacent apartments. The ocean was a little rougher than other spots for snorkeling, but we still managed to snorkel and swim in it. We could see whales from the very quiet beach. Contrary to other comments, the pool and hot tub were always clean. I also liked the gas BBQ's for the guest to use by the pool area. The restaurant on site (Dukes) has a casual dining area, and a more formal restaurant. We had meals at both and they were great, with a kids menu available at both. The cafe in the foyer serves delicious coffee and pastries. I would definitely recommend Honua Kai - hope you have a great holiday!

Reviews.Title: “All "Depends" on the Pool Issue if we would go back......”
Reviews.Author: angelfishVancouver
Reviews.Content: We just got back and loved our room, although the view looked out onto another building and was dark all day as our side didn't get any sunlight in 444. We loved the beach walk, and the lay out of the lobby. The pool was a big problem! There are 2 pool areas, one for kids, and one for adults. The adult pools, including the hot tubs were full of babies in diapers which gagged us out, and in fact, prior to our visit the entire pool was drained as a baby left a surprise in the pool......and I don't mean an O Henry bar ......I brought this baby diaper issue up to several of the staff''s attention, with the same response of....you are not the only one complaining about this, yet we can't really do anything. YUK......I've stayed in many resorts and never encountered this. My husband said he'd pack his Depends if we stay there again. The staff needs to get assertive about this issue.....hence my rating of 2 for cleanliness.....the room however was lovely. The beach out front is too rough for snorkelling, walk down towards the other resorts as it's a little calmer down there. Maui is full of natural abundance and you can sit on the beach and watch the whales off in the distance......bring little binoculars if you have them.

Reviews.Title: “Resort View's- mean looking at the carpark & renovations”
Reviews.Author: mimz40
Reviews.Content: It was our first time visiting Maui, we arrived after a long flight. At reception, were told that they had no booking for us?? Very strange, as we had a confirmation number. Anyway four hours later, they checked us into a room. The rooms are all very new, as the hotel is only about a year old. They are very modern, with everything you need. When we opened the blinds to the balcony, we were very dissappointed with the view from our balcony. It was looking over the carpark and main road. We had purchased a `resort view room', and assumed that it would be looking onto other resort buildings - not the carpark & construction. After much talking with the staff, we were told this is what you get for `a resort view'. As you can imagine we were not happy, they were willing to upgrade us for an extra cost of course. (see my photos, so you not what to expect) Other then the view from our room, the actual resort was beautiful. We would walk to the `Whaler's Village', , about a 20 minute walk. The pools and `Duke's restaurant were great for all the family. Just remember that on top of the ` room charge' per night, there is an extra tax for accommadation/ general/cleaning fees of $67 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: MAO2010
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Maui and stayed at Honua Kai for our honeymoon. We booked the Ohana Ocean View through Continental Vacations and we got upgraded to a 2 bedroom ocean view by suprise upon arrival. The room was perfect! It had a full kitchen with all stainless steel Bosch appliances and granite countertops, large LG flat screen tvs in each room including a blue ray disc player, and a huge deck. Each room had doors that opened fully to the deck - it cooled the room down enough to not need any A/C (not to mention that each room was on it's own A/C zone) The $25/day resort fee covered wi-fi, coffee, soap for the washer & dishwasher, garage parking, etc. The hotel used biodegradeable trash bags and had recycle bins at all the exits. We spent a lot of time watching the whales from our deck and relaxing by the multiple pools. We ate at Duke's one night and had the best meal of our trip - the Mahi Mahi was amazing!! We were never bothered by any noise from the neighbors. Despite the previous reviewer - our hot water worked perfectly. The hotel is a "U" shape, so you will see the neighbors across the resort - but that was insignificant to us. There was a stalled construction site to the south of the resort, so pay attention to where your room is booked.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother staying here if you want a true vacation”
Reviews.Author: monduras
Reviews.Content: I have no idea how anyone could rate this hotel above a three star rating, we traveled here on honeymoon based on the good reviews we read, but it was a pretty bad mistake. This hotel seems too new... along with the staff... do not expect anything beyond amateur service. In summary, our stay was ruined by the fact that we could not take a hot BATH even after being transferred to different rooms - creating a large waste of time during our once in a lifetime event. We are so disappointed. Specifically, let me start by saying that we stayed in the OCEAN view room, we paid for ocean view but instead of the ocean you get to see other people's rooms with a bit of the ocean as an aside. The design of the hotel is such that NONE of the rooms have a pure ocean view except for very few rooms on the corners. I would not recommend anyone stay here that wants a worry free get-away experience. Almost everything you have to do yourself. the daily housekeeping only replaces towels and throws out the trash. For the price of the rooms, I would expect that they would at least do the bed daily as well, but sorry no can do. Finally, these rooms all have very bad water heaters. we stayed in a room that had a nice bathroom with a bathtub and shower. You would think that you should be able to take a bath, but not so as after just 5 minutes the water becomes less hot until almost cold. We had them transfer us to a different room, but SAME problem there too -- you would think that they would have checked this before having us pack and relocate. We went back to the old room because that one was actually bigger - so they transferred us to a smaller room with the same problem - BAD SERVICE. Save yourself the headache and stay at any other hotel but this one.

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic place to spend Christmas”
Reviews.Author: dusko2
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2 bedroom suite with partial ocean view. Our son (30) joined my wife and me. The place was really spacious and well equipped. Just perfect for Christmas. We spent a lot of time by the pool and enjoyed the drinks delivery. The reaturant had only been open a week but service was great and the food good. The barbeques in the common area gave us the chance to cook and eat some great local food. Must mention the Concierge who was outstanding. There is still more construction to be done at some point so take care when you book that you know where in the development you will be located. If I had to mention a negative we perhaps had some confusion about the timing of room cleaning and missed some services. Didn't ruin the vacation however. We booked through Pleasure Vacations and everything was handled well but as a tip we met people who negotiated rooms directly with the property and got some price breaks at the last minute.

Reviews.Title: “Honua Kai exceeded all expectations -- best value in Kaanapali - all around luxury”
Reviews.Author: hawaiilover12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Honua Kai the week after Christmas and the resort exceeded our expectations on all criteria. Having recently opened up their additional pools, waterslide, Duke's restaurant, the resort has everything you need with the exception of an on-site spa (which is coming mid-2010). The architecture of the resort, the building construction and many other technical aspects of the resort are all finished at the highest level -- far surpassing the Westin Villas, updated Marriott suites, and other updated versions of the many 25yr old+ properties in Kaanapali. Some of this might be more subtle than the extreme luxury that is more easily appreciated. The kitchens are all fully equipped with high-end stainless steel Bosch (quiet) appliances, granite counters, glass-tile backsplash, full glassware, placesettings, pots/pans and all utensils needed to produce a gourmet meal at this gourmet resort. The living rooms and bedrooms are all appointed with high-end furniture, large flat screen LCD's with HDTV (and premium movie channels) and a Blu-Ray DVD in the living room with I-pod docking station/system. The bedrooms have extremely comfortable king-size beds with high-end linens. All of the bathrooms have double-vanities with granite, separate soaking tub and large glass-enclosed showers. All units are equipped with unique "nanadoors" which fully open to blend the indoor and outdoor -- for the larger units (we stayed in a 2 bedroom) with large lanais, this translates to having an open window space that can go 20-30 feet long. The multiple pools are great (infinity pool, family pool, lazy pools) each with 2 hot tubs and the recently opened family pool that comes with a waterslide, waterfalls (and enclosed caves), a sandy area for real little ones and natural stone-enclosed hot tubs all with high-pressure jets and beautiful views to the ocean. Dukes restaurant is on-property and just opened a week before we arrived and produces a good-quality breakfast, lunch and dinner with full pool food and tropical drinks service -- nothing is spared in providing the luxury hotel experience in this condo resort. If you want to grill your own fish or steaks for dinner, there are many Viking grills with marble counters (We grill at home all the time and have never experienced grills this nice -- not to mention my grill at home doesn't come equipped with direct ocean views). Great swimming at Honua Kai beach with snorkeling (and scuba) -- top snorkeling at Blackrock a 15 minute walk down the boardwalk -- a boardwalk that goes all the way from Honua Kai to Whalers Village shopping down to the Hyatt. I've saved the best for last: the service/staff without exception were great! This applies to the bell staff, the front desk, the concierge, the pool staff, all the way to the engineering and landscaping staff -- they must have all gone through great customer service training because everyone seemed focused on making sure the customer experience was unparalleled. This almost brand new resort is firing on all cylinders! One of the most amazing things is that you can stay at Honua Kai by renting from owners at vrbo.com at prices less than the much older, lesser quality properties/resorts on the island. If you want a condominium experience with the amenities of a Four Seasons, Grand Hyatt and pay the same as the much older condos without any amenities in Kaanapali, you cannot go wrong here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort, a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: HabsFan33
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in the beginning of December. Rooms are nice with granite kitchen tops and stainless appliances. Helpful that they had washer/dryer in the room although I had a hard time using it and no manuals provided. Grounds were very nice with excellent pools and easy beach access. Staff were friendly but did take some effort to contact housekeeping for extra stuff. Very nice experience but not sure if it was worth what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, Close to Surf.”
Reviews.Author: Surfersdesk
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week mid December at the Honua Kai Resort. We were able to get cheap rates off VRBO.com though the hotel for $150 per night which was outstanding. Everything at this hotel is top of the line. The pools and hot tubs were always the perfect temperature and the staff made our stay very comfortable. The surf on North Kaanapali Beach can pick up, and it did on our last day which was awesome. They were all right handers, and every break had at least 8 people on it. There are lots of other breaks in either direction from the hotel, you just need to do a little searching.

Reviews.Title: “A great resort certainly worth more more!”
Reviews.Author: lovemycab
Reviews.Content: We have taken the family to Maui before. However, this time we didn't know we could get airfare using Miles until late September. We booked the airfare and had no place to stay. With 3 kids, a kitchen is a must so no hotel options. After struggling to find any availability at the various resorts with condo's, we took the risk and booked a 2 bedroom condo at Honua Kai. Once we got there, everyone was impressed and quite please we did. The rooms were fantastic! All new appliances, granite counters, very comfortable beds, etc. The location is right in Kaanapali so you are close to everything. Dukes recently opened for a nice option near the pool or ocean. They have a nice market in the resort (Aina). This market had high end sandwiches, drinks, wine, organic foods. Lot's of Whole Foods type of items and all reasonable (for Maui). Staff was great. From front desk to valet. All of the conceige's were very nice and quite helpful. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to spend Christmas”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiHappy60
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, on the advice of our travel agent, spent the week of Christmas at the wonderful Honua Kai. We had a Ohana (studio) ocean view unit. The property is new and beautifully landscaped. Our room was wonderful. Very comfortable bed, nice kitchen with granite counters, Bosch appliances, etc. Full size Bosch washer/dryer. Our lanai was a good size and we spent most of our time out there. The staff are all very helpful and friendly. We loved having Duke's restaurant right on the property. They have a small fitness room. Better to walk on the boardwalk which goes about 6 miles. They have a great deli on the ground floor which was was perfect. There are a few minor negatives about the property. But I think if you know about it, they're easily avoided. They nickel and dime you to death. You pay a daily $25 resort fee. That was fine as it includes valet parking, etc. But if you go to the pool and you want a cushion on your very hard chair, that's an extra $10 a day, per chair. If you want to have a chair at the beach that's also another $10 a day, per chair. The chairs were not comfortable and supposedly had an attachment that would block the sun, but they were all broken. So if we go back, we'll stop and buy some beach chairs and an umbrella. And at 5pm they take up the cushions and chairs. No exceptions. Also, when you check in, they have you take chits for how many beach towels you're going to use during your stay. You can change them out every day, but you need to make sure you turn in the exact amount of towels at the end of your stay so you don't get charged $25 a towel. I found that incredibly annoying. I was always having to make sure we had 4 towels. At the end of your stay you turn them in and they pool person gives you chits back for your towels that you turn in when you're checking out. It was annoying and unnecessary. Who wants to go on vacation and worry about the number of towels you're using. They don't have a computer available to use. They used the excuse that they had just opened, but they've been open for almost a year. So bring your computer if you need to use one. Hopefully not. The concierge did handle the 24 hour airline advance check-in. We had an incredible experience whale watching with the Pacific Whale Foundation. We highly recommend them. We loved eating at Mala's in Lahaina. Right on the water and the food is fabulous. Order the brussel sprouts. No kidding, really do. They are amazing. I would recommend Honua Kai, just be prepared for a few minor annoyances. But you'll be thrilled with this beautiful property, great service and wonderful location.

Reviews.Title: “unbelievable”
Reviews.Author: Londonrevue
Reviews.Content: This resort is absolutely gorgeous. All the amenities you could ask for, and given that there is some construction nearby (stalled at the moment) available at a seriously cut-rate for what it is. It was amazing - marble counters, stainless appliances, wonderfully plush bed, nana doors to patio - seriously, don't look anywhere else. The staff were amazing as well - we forgot our coats and they were neatly stashed for us to pick up two days later.

Reviews.Title: “The photos do it justice.”
Reviews.Author: kare13bear
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful resort! It really does look just like the photos! The bell-hop staff was top-notch and super friendly. Lovely pool, great beach, incredible rooms.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: Nawlins66
Reviews.Content: If you ever have the opportunity to come stay @ Honua Kai, grab it fast. This resort has only been open a few months and it's restaurant only opened a week ago. The accommodation is of a very high quality. We have a 1 bedroom condo on the 4th floor looking over the courtyard, with views to the pool and ocean beyond from our lanai. The view is simply spectacular. The staff have been unfailingly courteous, friendly , welcoming and helpful. There is a full kitchen, laundry alcove and comfortable sofa bed in the lounge area as well as the master bedroom and full two way bathroom. There is nothing here to even consider complaining about. How often is that the case? Downstairs is the Aiina Gourmet deli with a great selection of foods, wines and miscellaneous items. If you can be here on a Tuesday, do not miss their fish taco's a real gourmet delight @ $4.00 each. The only slight drawback, is that unless you have a car, you will be spending a good amount on taxi fares to get around. Forget the shuttles and buses, none leave from here or drop off on the highway out front of the resort. The second building is complete and due for opening shortly, only landscaping remains to be finished. What a gem of a place. Also recommend the luau at the Westin ; it was fantastic especially if you pay a little extra for the premium seating.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVED this place!”
Reviews.Author: SarahDallas222
Reviews.Content: I loved the Honua Kai. It had everything we needed for the first part of our stay in Maui. It's a great location at the North end of Kaanapali, with the boardwalk connecting you to everything. I loved waking up and running on the boardwalk, having drinks by the pool, and the market/cafe downstairs is fabulous. Healthy eating options along with the usual beach fare. The construction on the restaurant by the pool was almost finished when we stayed there - it didn't bother us a bit. I also really liked the size of the rooms - we had a huge one bedroom condo. Big room, huge bathroom and then a combined kitchen/living area. We also had a nice lanai (unfortunately overlooking some construction next door, but you could still see the beach and the shoreline). I would definitely recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Ultimate location & luxury!”
Reviews.Author: StylishNature
Reviews.Content: The location of this property was the best for my needs! The north side of Kaanapali beach is within walking distance of all the major activities on south Kaanapali, but without being in the middle of all the hustle and buslte... it felt safer and quieter and Maui-ier! The boardwalk connecting HonuaKai to south Kaanapali beach as well as the shops to the north was PERFECT! and I was able to get my daily walks in, with some beautiful scenery! The rooms are ideal... high end materials, granite, etc, and all the conveniences of having a full kitchen in each unit! And the price, with deep discounts for online booking... cannot be beat! The staff was fantastic... and the scuba trip I was referred to, Extended Horizons, was top notch! Which only added to my impression that this property is about quality experiences! Thanks Kimmy!

Reviews.Title: “Great luxury at great prices (for now).”
Reviews.Author: trinishaq
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel on Expedia for a great price. Got a one bedroom oceanview. When we got there we were automatically upgraded without us even knowing to a 2 bedroom oceanview. Room: The layout was great and everything was pretty much brand new. The bed was king sized and was very comfortable. There was a kitchen with all appliances, even a blender and a salad spinner. They do supply you with a few packets of dishwasher detergent, laundry detergent, dish soap and some fabric softener (Bounce). There is also a washer and dryer which is very handy. The lanai was spacious and we had a great ocean view. Basic housekeeping (taking out trash, making beds and replacing towels) was done everyday. However a better cleaning (cleaning floors and bathroom) was only done every third or fourth day. Pool: The pool was great for us as the deepest part of the pool was 4ft as we had a 22 month old with us. There was also an area of the pool which was only 1/2 ft deep so great for her to walk in. It was pretty much empty most of the time we were there. Beach: It was good for the most part, however it was not good for young kids as the tide was very strong and could easily pull them in. When you walk further up the beach there are calmer areas. Tip if you are travelling with very young ones, Baby Beach in Lahaina is great as there are no waves at all and the water is very calm. Aina Gourmet Market.: We ate there a lot and the prices were reasonable (e.g. burger with choice of side salad for $10). The food was great! Construction: The second building is mostly done. There was construction on the beachside restaurant and there was some noise by the pool during the day (right next to pool) but nothing too much and it never bothered us. Never heard anything from our room, however if you are in a garden view room you may hear a little bit but again nothing too much. Fees: There was a $25 daily resort fee which included parking, valet, wireless internet etc. Other: We had a late flight out 10pm at night and checkout time was 11 am. Travelling with a toddler we knew we had to do something with that much wait time so we got a Day Room for $125 and you can stay as late in the day as you will like. This was a regular one bedroom garden view suite which was fine as we just needed it for the day. That was great as our little one got her afternoon nap. Overall, a great resort which will only get better when completed. I know the prices will not be as good next time around but may be worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “hawaiian luxery at its finest”
Reviews.Author: trimomma
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a ten day vacation at the Honua Kai and it was spectacular to say the least. The entire staff was awesome and very accomodating with a special shout out to Kimmy the concierge, she was never wrong on a suggestion and helped make our vacation memorable, and to Mona our wonderful poolside bartender who makes the best drinks on the island, mahalo. The pool was great, especially the 1/2 foot deep wading pool, it was perfect for the kids! The beach outside was wonderful with a great corral reef to snorkel around. If youre looking for a more sandy water area, just walk a little ways towards black rock and youre good to go. The grounds were immaculate and felt very tropical to me, with the open air lobby looking out over the pool and the ocean with palm trees swaying in the trade winds and tiki torches blazing at dusk. To whoever said it wasnt hawaiian enough, its too bad you live in a climate so close to hawaii and cant appreciate this beautiful hotel, perhaps a different destination next time. I cannot recommend this hotel enough, it is perfect for folks with families or singles. Oh and a word on construction, Dukes was being built right next to the pool area and you could hear a small bit of noise every once in awhile but I barely noticed the construction, they were very quiet. And Dukes shoud be finished very shortly as with the rest of the Hotel. bottom line construction was not a problem at all. I guess my only complaint would be that the pool was a bit cold and wished they had the heater on a little higher, but when all is said and done, who cares, youre in paradise!

Reviews.Title: “If you like a luxurious peaceful environment for a reasonable price, stay here !!”
Reviews.Author: sidney7474
Reviews.Content: We stayed at four hotels during our Hawaii vacation, this one is far and away the best! Exquisite rooms and furnishings, FULL kitchens, large balconies, washer/Dryer. Beautiful grounds, fabulous deli/sundry store on grounds. There is a great boardwalk between the pool and the beach. The service here is exceptional. they are friendly, helpful and some even remembered our names. Jake was especially helpful and nice. Hands down we would stay here again and recommend to all of our friends. A couple of notes, there are no pay per view movies or room service, niether was big deal to us, but this may bother some people.

Reviews.Title: “Like never leaving Orange County, California! We should have stayed home!”
Reviews.Author: winetravels
Reviews.Content: I know everyone loves this hotel and it was nicely appointed and beautiful if you are looking for that type of hawaiian vacation. We were looking for more of the "hawaiian island" vacation not Maui goes LA or Newport Beach! I guess our attitude should have been checked at the door because we wanted to go to Kaui but it was sold out due to the short time period that we planned our vacation and Maui was on sale...so we headed to Maui. Now this isn't our first time there but our last visit was 8 years ago and it has definitely been built up over the last 8 years! Of course from my first time to visit Maui in 1989 it has changed dramatically and become like a Hawaiian Beverly Hills or Newport Beach. We do like Kona, Kauai and Oahu much better since it still has the island feeling although Kauai has lost a little of this over the last few years. The staff at the hotel was great we had several problems and they addressed it immediately â€“ so they were incredible. I had reserved an ocean view and most of the rooms are partial ocean views but sold as ocean view. So I was shown another room that had a great view of the ocean but looked over a lot with unfinished construction and dirt which was all over the patio because of it being a high wind area â€“ so the dirt would blow into the hotel room during high winds which is most of the time on the north part of the island due to the valley. On the second night our air conditioner went out (this is a brand new hotel/condo!). Oh and if they tell you that you donâ€™t need air conditioner then they are lying because it is hot in September! Even though they wanted to move us at 1030 at night we stayed and moved into a fantastic upgrade 2 bedroom condo the next morning â€“ this one had an ocean view. So again the staff was incredible and addressed problems immediately. The hotel is shaped in a â€œUâ€� so all rooms face each other and you can see into the other rooms â€“ especially at night. The only rooms with true ocean views are the 3 bedroom suites at the end â€“ there are no ocean front rooms. My husband and I could not figure out why someone would design the hotel this way since they have plenty of property (and spent a great deal of money on the dÃ©cor) and all of the other hotels in the area are curved to where they face the ocean and certainly do not face other rooms. So when this hotel does become busy (it is new and still under construction) there will be little privacy. The rooms are fantastic again and are high end from appliances to bedding. So we were very comfortable and felt like we had never left Orange County â€“ in fact next time we will just book a room in Newport Beach, Malibu or Santa Monica â€“ have the same effect without the flight! Overall the staff and accommodations were great but we were looking for more of a tropical feel to get away from where we live now. So if you are looking for a California get away in Hawaii then this place and island is for you!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time, can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: winelovinlady
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Honua Kai for 6 nights, and rented one of the one bedroom suites from the VRBO website from someone who owns room 514. It was spectacular...our room faced the ocean...not the side where the new honua kai building is being finished...the opposite side, where it faces a slab of concrete where another hotel will be someday, but currently there is no construction. The location of Honua Kai is great, 7 minutes to Lahaina and to Kapalua. The room itself was awesome, the bed was sooo comfortable and it was relaxing to be able to hang out in the room, one person could be taking a nap in the bedroom, the other could be taking in the view or watching tv. The pool was never too busy since the hotel was pretty empty. Loved the Aina store on the main floor, I got Gelato there several times and coffee. We loved our time here, and would definitely recommend for anyone to check out the VRBO website...great deals from people who own the units and are trying to rent them out, our transaction went very smoothly. The hotel staff brought our bags to our room and told us where we should park underground to be closest to the elevator that would bring us closest to our room.

Reviews.Title: “definetely will return”
Reviews.Author: CathieHenderson_Nv
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant when I made our reservation since this was a new complex with a great intro rate and existing construction. The facilities are wonderful and well appointed. Our 1 bedroom accomodations had everything you could want. The appliances were top of the line. The bed was incredibly comfortable and the outdoor lanai was spacious and the sliding doors opened to allow the outside in. Although there was construction the noise was minimal. The beach and pool were empty and we were there over the July 4th holiday. The staff was friendly and helpful. The store in the lobby was a true treat with excellent food and drinks. They also provided pool service. Next time I would think of bringing my grown children and their families and renting a larger room. I agree with other reviewers who know that as the resort becomes crowded it may lose its ambiance of an excellent vacation destination on Maui

Reviews.Title: “Will be an awesome complex”
Reviews.Author: OrangeCounty4Pack
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful stay at the Honua Kai. This complex will truly be amazing once it is completed. First the positives. The rooms are gorgeous with granite counter tops, stainless steel appliances, and other amenities of a 5 star hotel. The location is also great and we felt like we had a private beach as there were only a couple of people there. If you walk 5 minutes down the beach path to the Westin Villas it is packed. The people who worked there are extremely nice and helpful. The current negatives (which should be fixed once the second tower is opened) is there is moderate construction noise which starts early (7 AM). Some days you could not hear a thing and other days there was significant noise with a lot of work vehicles there. There is only one pool which (although beautiful) is just a pool. We had the luxury of having friends stay at the Westin Villas at the same time and the Westin was packed (to crowded for my liking) but they had a pirate pool with waterslides which the kids loved. The Honua Kai has plans to have a kids pool and water park in the second phase. The other negative is there is no restaurant at the current time. Other comments: My parents got a room at the Honua Kai direct while we rented through an owner on VRBO. There were pros and cons to each of these. Renting direct was more expensive but you got daily made service and other amenities (shampoo, laundry detergent, etc.) you'd find in a hotel. They also got complimentary towels at the pool and free parking items which we had to pay extra for. They also were shown several rooms and got to choose which one they liked best. Our room through the owner was cheaper and had things such as spices, coffee filters, other cooking items as well as full sized beach towels and other things you'd associate with a condo. Additionally, our key got demagnetized while we were out (were told this happens if you keep it to close to your cellphone) and we could not get security at the complex to let us into the room (where we had other keys). We had to sit around until the offsight condo manager drove over and let us into the room. Overall: A great place to stay and will be awesome (and more expensive) once the second phase is complete.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found - redefines excellence at Kaanapali”
Reviews.Author: MauiWowii
Reviews.Content: Honua Kai is an incredible and new resort in north Kaanapali. It redefines the standard that our family previously felt was held by the Kaanapali Alii.The resort combines beautiful rooms that can be extended and integrated with a glass partition Lanai through fold out floor to ceiling windows. We stayed in a 3 bedroom that had Viking appliances with beautiful granite countertops. The landscaping that has been done is beautiful. We enjoyed the brand new equipment in the fitness center. The staff was friendly and accomodating. Construction of the neighboring tower was not noticeable as most of it has moved indoors. A restaurant is scheduled to open in several months. We walked and drove to the adjacent Star Market. Lahaina Farms is several miles away for more gourmet ingredients.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: Goldens18
