Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to Maui. We stayed at Honua Kai for the entire week, and what a gem of a place! The room was always promptly cleaned and the service was always very responsive. We had a minor issue with the water heater, and it was fixed in no time. The grounds were also nice kept. It's quiet; not too many people yet. They're still building the rest of the resort. It's in a great location...North Kaanapali. Close to Lahaina, golf courses, etc. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Take a chance on this new luxury resort with heavenly rooms”
Reviews.Author: DallasCouple27
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased that we booked here. We had been planning a trip to Maui (3rd to the islands) for some time. I first read about the Honua Kai in the New York Times in January. It did not disappoint except for one little location issue. I booked an Ohana Oceanview room directly from the resort for a six night stay. The photos the resort has on flickr were very helpful and accurrate. We were very happy with the room. The building that we stayed in is fully open with a small cafe/gourmet store, a small but adequate fitness room, and one pool (two more under construction). The major construction of building #2 is complete, so no major construction noise...they are just working on the interiors. We actually forgot that there was a construction zone near by. The room was amazing and very luxurious, and we might have been the first to stay in it. The Ohana room is large with tile, marble and all the appliances you could need, including a front-loading stackable washer and dryer. This room is great for couples, or families with one small child (there is a pull out sofa bed that looked great.) The main bed was very comfortable. You can order breakfast and lunch items from the 'Aina store in the lobby, but we went off property to some great little restraunts for all our meals. We essentially followed the dining recommendations from "Maui Revealed," and those recommendations were very accurate. The beach at the resort is very calm, which is nice since the pool was a let down. It's great if you have kids, but very shallow and not very big (which should change once the other two pools open up). There are some reefs and rocks at most points on the beach in front of the resort, but it is great for snorkling. I snorkled all the way down to the Westin Kaanapali Villas and saw some sea turtles. Great walking beach, too. It is just up from the Black Rock and Main Kaanapali resort area, so it is close to many things to do. The service from the concierge, front desk and bell staff was excellent. Tim at the front desk was especially helpful. Our only problem was that housekeeping would NOT replace the most basic items. Nightly, we had to call down for shampoo and soap, as well as toilet paper and kleenex when we ran out of those. Within minutes of us raising this issue with the front desk, the items were always delivered and apology provided. So, no major issue, but it was odd and got annoying after the third+ time. The only real caveat is the odor from the West Maui Water Treatment plant. Let me start by saying that you can't smell anything while in the resort, i.e. in the lobby or in the pool / main courtyard. However, you can clearly smell it in the parking lot. It's a trade-off and something to consider. We might stay elsewhere if we return, but we didn't mind it too much while there, nor was it a major issue. We drove by all the other major Maui resort areas, Kapalua, Kaanapali, Wailea, and stayed in Wailea for our last three nights. Wailea was the best resort area in our opinion, but its hard to be unhappy in any of them. This is a great resort to use as a base from which to explore all the wonders of Maui. Book here with confidence and enjoy the great resort and wonderful staff.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC! All my expectations were exceeded.”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer08
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing stay at the Honua Kai, all of our expectations were exceeded. The hotel is stunning. The beach is closer than it appears in the website photos, you can hear the waves crash on the beach from the rooms. The landscaping is lovely, including a koi pond that is surrounded by beautiful patio seating. The pool is large and there are two hot tubs which are open until 10pm (at night the tiki torches surround the pool and gounds). I loved the location, it is an easy 20 minute walk to Black Rock along a direct boardwalk & paths. The beach in front of the Honua Kai is pristine and there are very few people who hang out there. If you walk 50 towards Kaanapali you can enter the ocean on the sand and swim. Otherwise, there are low rocks and reefs right in front that make it difficult to swim without a snorkel mask. However, the snorkeling is really good. I would recommend bringing your own snorkel set or renting a set for a week from the Maui Dive Shop (many locations inc. Whalers Village) as the Honua Kai rental rates were way too high. The staff were so friendly, especially the greeters who stand outside the lobby. Everyone was so nice and happy. There is a small but very adequate gym and a kids area. Our room was a 2 bed/2 bath with a large patio. The furnishings and decor are modern & beautiful, the kitchen was gourmet and made eating-in a treat, and I haven't slept on such a comfortable bed in ages. I actually took a photo of the mattress label so that I could buy one when I got home! We had no problem with the construction noise but we did have a room looking into the center of the hotel & pool.. the rooms that face the second phase directly (on the outside North side) would not be great right now. We had such a great experience at Honua Kai that we will return this year and are considering purchasing a unit in the second phase. I wish the large gym and spa, which are in the second phase, were open but we look forward to experiencing them in the future. I should mention that although there is free wireless internet in all the rooms, there is no business centre to print and fax.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Luxury at its finest!”
Reviews.Author: David5Vancouver
Reviews.Content: Staying at Honua Kai over spring break with my large family (5 kids). Did not know what to expect when we arrived but boy were we surprised. Luxurious finishings everywhere!We stayed in the 3 bedrooms and its big like a house. Stayed in Unit 429 which ovrlooks the ocean and we can see the whales right from our Lanai. The unit itself is the height of tasteful decor and great taste. from appliances to furniture and bedding (especially the beds, which are to die for) the planners here did it right for those that want to really enjoy the insides as much as the maui landscapes. The beach is beautiful and we are just down the strip from the Westin Resort . The Honua Kai benefits from great privacy and the peace and quiet here is wonderful. While the second towere is still being worked on, the noise is totally unnoticeable and once finished this will truly be the best spot in maui, bar none. Well done and I would definitely return here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this new resort plus Fantastic view of breaching whales from deck”
Reviews.Author: GAWyma
Reviews.Content: This place is brand new and the rooms are amazing. The Balcony doors fold open to make the patio part of the room which is a great advantage especially if you like to see the breaching whales while enjoynig a glass of chardonay from the privacy of your own suite! Amazing snorkelling right in fornt of the resort too. I would go back any day.

HotelInfo.Name: Honua Kai Resort & Spa
HotelInfo.Address: 130 Kai Malina Parkway, Lahaina, Maui, HI 96761
